text: In 2012, SITHS was ranked #1 on the New York Post's list of the city's best high schools, #77 in the nation on U.S. News & World Report's list of Best High Schools, and #23 on their list of the nation's top schools in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM).

title: Staten Island Catapult
text: The Staten Island Catapult is a 2005 documentary about a disgruntled commuter and his proposal to build a catapult that launches individuals from Staten Island to Downtown Manhattan in 5 minutes.

title: Staten Island Catapult
text: The film was written and directed by independent filmmaker Gregorio Smith.

title: St. George, Staten Island
text: St. George is a neighborhood on the northeastern tip of Staten Island in New York City, where the Kill Van Kull enters Upper New York Bay.

title: St. George, Staten Island
text: It is the most densely developed neighborhood on Staten Island, and the location of the administrative center for the borough and for the coterminous Richmond County.

title: St. George, Staten Island
text: The Staten Island terminal of the Staten Island Ferry is located here, as well as the northern terminus of the Staten Island Railway.

title: St. George, Staten Island
text: St. George is bordered on the south by the neighborhood of Tompkinsville and on the west by the neighborhood of New Brighton.

title: Staten Island
text: Staten Island is one of the five boroughs of New York City in the U.S. state of New York.

title: Staten Island
text: In the southwest of the city, Staten Island is the southernmost part of both the city and state of New York, with Conference House Park at the southern tip of the island and the state.

title: Staten Island
text: The borough is separated from New Jersey by the Arthur Kill and the Kill Van Kull, and from the rest of New York by New York Bay.

title: Staten Island
text: With a 2016 Census-estimated population of 476,015, Staten Island is the least populated of the boroughs but is the third-largest in area at 58 sqmi .

title: Staten Island
text: Staten Island is the only borough of New York with a non-Hispanic White majority.

title: Brian C. Bialiy
text: Brian C. Bialiy worked on and appeared in the award-winning documentary The Staten Island Catapult.

title: Brian C. Bialiy
text: Starring as the Angry White Man, Brian poignantly portrays a disgruntled and confounded commuter confronted by the 'latest' in cross-borough transportation.

title: College of Staten Island Baseball Complex
text: College of Staten Island Baseball Complex is a stadium in Staten Island, New York.

title: College of Staten Island Baseball Complex
text: It is primarily used for baseball and was the home of Staten Island Yankees before they moved to Richmond County Bank Ballpark in 2001.

title: College of Staten Island Baseball Complex
text: The ballpark had a capacity of 2,500 people and opened in 1999.

title: College of Staten Island Baseball Complex
text: It currently hosts the College of Staten Island Dolphins baseball team.

title: Staten Island Economic Development Corporation
text: Staten Island Economic Development Corporation (SIEDC) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that serves as a lead advocate for economic development of Staten Island's economy.

title: Staten Island Economic Development Corporation
text: The organization is responsible for over $900 million in new investments, the creation of over 12,500 jobs, the development of over 6,000 acres of vacant industrial land by providing assistance to developers and companies implementing projects in the borough, while at the same time serving the smallest entrepreneur and small business owner with tailored financing, procurement, and real estate assistance.

title: Staten Island Economic Development Corporation
text: Every year approximately 3,000 businesses and individuals are assisted by the SIEDC through financing assistance, tax incentives, job training and technology assistance.

title: Staten Island Economic Development Corporation
text: Since its establishment, SIEDC has organized and planned yearly community events to benefit the public at no cost, such as the SIEDC Annual Business Conference, the Staten Island Green and Clean Festival, and the Staten Island Health and Wellness Expo.

title: Staten Island Economic Development Corporation
text: Cesar J. Claro serves as the President & CEO of the organization.

title: One Perfect Day (Lydia Denker song)
text: "One Perfect Day" is a song written by Phillip Buckle, David Hobson, and Paul van Dyk and recorded by Australian singer Lydia Denker as the theme to the 2004 film "One Perfect Day" (2004).

title: One Perfect Day (Lydia Denker song)
text: Produced by Sam Melamed, the song is a pop rock love song.

title: One Perfect Day (Lydia Denker song)
text: It was released as a CD single and maxi single on 16 February 2004 (see 2004 in music) and was the only song released from the soundtrack.

title: Naruto: Shippuden (season 21)
text: The episodes for the twenty-first and final season of the anime series "" are based on Part II for Masashi Kishimoto's manga series.

title: Naruto: Shippuden (season 21)
text: While the first four episodes deal with the childhood of some main characters, the rest of season covers the events of Sasuke's Story: Sunrise (サスケ真伝 来光篇 , Sasuke Shinden Raikō-hen ) , Naruto: Shikamaru's Story — A Cloud Drifting in the Silent Dark (NARUTO-ナルト- シカマル秘伝 闇の黙に浮ぶ雲 , Naruto: Shikamaru Hiden — Yami no Shijima ni Ukabu Kumo ) , and Naruto: Konoha's Story - A Perfect Day For a Wedding (NARUTO-ナルト- 木ノ葉秘伝 祝言日和, Konoha Hiden: Shūgenbiyori ) .

title: Naruto: Shippuden (season 21)
text: The episodes are directed by Hayato Date, and produced by Studio Pierrot and TV Tokyo.

title: A Perfect Day (song)
text: "A Perfect Day" (first line: "When you come to the end of a perfect day") is a parlor song written by Carrie Jacobs-Bond (1862–1946) in 1909 at the Mission Inn, Riverside, California.

title: A Perfect Day (song)
text: Jacobs-Bond wrote the lyrics after watching the sun set over Mount Rubidoux from her 4th-floor room.

title: A Perfect Day (song)
text: She came up with the tune three months later while touring the Mojave Desert.

title: A Perfect Day (song)
text: For many years the Mission Inn played "A Perfect Day" on its carillon at the end of each day.

title: New Scandinavian Cooking
text: New Scandinavian Cooking is a Scandinavian cooking show which, over the course of ten seasons, was hosted by Andreas Viestad, Tina Nordström, and Claus Meyer, produced by the Norwegian production company Tellus Works in collaboration with American Public Television (APT).

title: New Scandinavian Cooking
text: A sequel series titled Perfect Day continued with the original hosts in rotation, with the cast addition of Sara La Fountain.

title: New Scandinavian Cooking
text: It is also broadcast on channels such as AFC.

title: Making Today a Perfect Day
text: "Making Today a Perfect Day" is a song from the 2015 Walt Disney Animation Studios computer-animated short film "Frozen Fever", with music and lyrics by Kristen Anderson-Lopez and Robert Lopez and performed throughout most of the short.

title: Making Today a Perfect Day
text: It was released as a single in the United States on March 12, 2015.

title: Walk on the Wild Side (Lou Reed song)
text: "Walk on the Wild Side" is a song by Lou Reed from his second solo album, "Transformer" (1972).

title: Walk on the Wild Side (Lou Reed song)
text: It was produced by David Bowie and Mick Ronson, and released as a double A-side with "Perfect Day".

title: Walk on the Wild Side (Lou Reed song)
text: The song received wide radio coverage, despite its touching on taboo topics such as transsexuality, drugs, male prostitution, and oral sex.

title: Walk on the Wild Side (Lou Reed song)
text: In the United States, RCA released the single using an edited version of the song without the reference to oral sex.

title: Perfect Day (Cascada album)
text: Perfect Day is the second studio album released by German Eurodance group Cascada.

title: Perfect Day (Cascada album)
text: The entire album was produced by the group's two DJs, Yanou and DJ Manian.

title: Perfect Day (Cascada album)
text: Like its predecessor, the album is comprised heavily of uptempo Eurodance tracks, many of which are cover songs.

title: Perfect Day (Cascada album)
text: This album, however, features covers of songs from the early 2000s of the rock and country genres, with the exception of Because the Night (originally released by Patti Smith) which was released in 1978.

title: Perfect Day (Cascada album)
text: Two edited tracks, "Endless Summer" and "I Will Believe It" that were previously recorded under the "Siria" name are also featured.

title: Perfect Day (Cascada album)
text: Musically, the album is composed of Eurodance tracks with euphoric trance-style synths, drum programmings with a tempo over 140 beats per minute, and Europop lyrics.

title: Perfect Day (Cascada album)
text: Lyrically, the albums is composed of love, partying and romance.

title: A Young Girl in 1941 with No Waist at All
text: "A Young Girl in 1941 with No Waist at All" is a short story by J. D. Salinger, published in "Mademoiselle" in May 1947.

title: A Young Girl in 1941 with No Waist at All
text: The story has not been published in any anthology.

title: A Young Girl in 1941 with No Waist at All
text: It is of literary interest today largely because the character of Ray is seen as an early version of the character Seymour from Salinger's better known work "A Perfect Day for Bananafish".

title: Perfect Day (Jim Jones song)
text: "Perfect Day" is a song by American hip hop recording artist Jim Jones released as the lead single from his fifth studio album "Capo".

title: Perfect Day (Jim Jones song)
text: The song features American rappers-producers Chink Santana and LOGiC, and was produced by the latter.

title: Perfect Day (Jim Jones song)
text: The song was released as a digital download on December 7, 2010.

title: Shaggy Dog Story (TV)
text: Shaggy Dog Story is a charity programme for Children in Need, put together by the BBC in 1999 as a sequel to the previous year's "Future Generations" video (featuring children's programmes), and the great success of 1997's "Perfect Day" charity single.

title: Shaggy Dog Story (TV)
text: It was first shown on 27 December 1999.

title: Black Clover
text: Black Clover (Japanese: ブラッククローバー , Hepburn: Burakku Kurōbā ) is a Japanese fantasy "shōnen" manga series written and illustrated by Yūki Tabata.

title: Black Clover
text: The series is published in Shueisha's "Weekly Shōnen Jump" magazine in Japan, and Viz Media is publishing it in their "Weekly Shonen Jump" digital anthology magazine in the United States.

title: Black Clover
text: The story centers around a young boy named Asta, seemingly born without any magic power, something that is unknown in the world he lives in.

title: Black Clover
text: With his ambition, newfound abilities, and friends, he aims to be the Wizard king.

title: Black Clover
text: An original video animation produced by Xebec had its first trailer released on November 27, 2016, while an anime television series adaptation by Pierrot to premiere on October 3, 2017.

title: Kyosuke Usuta
text: Kyosuke Usuta (うすた 京介 , Usuta Kyōsuke , born May 25, 1974 in Kōshi, Kumamoto) is a Japanese manga artist.

title: Kyosuke Usuta
text: His best known works are "" which was published in "Weekly Shonen Jump" from 1995 to 1997 and which was adapted into a 48-episode anime series produced by Madhouse; and "Pyu to Fuku!

title: Kyosuke Usuta
text: Jaguar" which was also serialized in "Weekly Shonen Jump" between 2000 and 2010, adapted into an anime film and a live action movie in 2008.

title: Shonen Jump (magazine)
text: Shonen Jump, officially stylized SHONEN JUMP and abbreviated SJ, is a "shōnen" manga anthology published in North America by Viz Media.

title: Shonen Jump (magazine)
text: It debuted in November 2002 with the first issue having a January 2003 cover date.

title: Shonen Jump (magazine)
text: Based on Shueisha's popular Japanese magazine "Weekly Shōnen Jump", "Shonen Jump" is retooled for English readers and the American audience, including changing it from a weekly publication to a monthly one.

title: Shonen Jump (magazine)
text: It features serialized chapters from four manga series, and articles on Japanese language and culture, as well as manga, anime, video games, and figurines.

title: Shonen Jump (magazine)
text: Prior to the magazine's launch, Viz launched an extensive marketing campaign to promote it and help it succeed where previous manga anthologies published in North America had failed.

title: Shonen Jump (magazine)
text: Shueisha purchased an equity interest in Viz to help fund the venture, and Cartoon Network, Suncoast, and Diamond Distributors became promotional partners in the magazine.

title: Weekly Shonen Jump (American magazine)
text: Weekly Shonen Jump is a digital "shōnen" manga anthology published in North America by Viz Media, and the successor to their monthly print anthology "Shonen Jump".

title: Weekly Shonen Jump (American magazine)
text: It began serialization on January 30, 2012 as Weekly Shonen Jump Alpha (officially stylized as "Weekly SHONEN JUMP αlpha" or "Weekly SHONEN JUMP Alpha"), with two free preview issues released in the buildup to its launch.

title: Weekly Shonen Jump (American magazine)
text: Based on Shueisha's popular Japanese magazine "Weekly Shōnen Jump", "Weekly Shonen Jump" is an attempt to provide English readers with easily accessible, affordable, and officially licensed editions of the latest installments of popular "Shōnen Jump" manga soon after their release in Japan, as an alternative to popular bootleg scanlation services.

title: Nisekoi
text: Nisekoi (ニセコイ , lit.

title: Nisekoi
text: "Fake Love") , released in English as Nisekoi: False Love, is a Japanese romantic comedy manga series written and illustrated by Naoshi Komi.

title: Nisekoi
text: "Nisekoi" was first published as a one-shot manga in Shueisha's seasonal "Jump NEXT!

title: Nisekoi
text: " magazine before being serialized in "Weekly Shōnen Jump".

title: Nisekoi
text: Since November 26, 2012, "Nisekoi" has been published in English in Viz Media's digital magazine, "Weekly Shonen Jump".

title: Nisekoi
text: As of October 2016, the series has been compiled in 25 "tankōbon" volumes in Japan, and is also being released in English in digital and print volumes by Viz Media.

title: Nisekoi
text: The manga has inspired a novel series, titled "Nisekoi: Urabana", written by Hajime Tanaka and published by Shueisha.

title: Nisekoi
text: There have been two volumes published, on June 4 and December 28, 2013.

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: The "Naruto" manga is written by Masashi Kishimoto and is published by Shueisha in the "Weekly Shōnen Jump" magazine, in twenty-page installments.

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: The first chapter of "Naruto" was published in the issue 43 from 1999, continuing to more than seven hundred chapters in all.

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: The "Naruto" manga is serialized in North America by Viz Media in their manga anthology magazine "Shonen Jump", with the first chapter of the English adaptation published in the January 2003 issue.

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: The "Naruto" manga is split in two parts to divide the storyline; the first part, Part I, covers the first two hundred thirty-eight chapters of the series.

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: Part II of the "Naruto" storyline begins at the two hundred forty-fifth chapter, and takes place two and a half years after the end of Part I.

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: The six chapters between Part I and Part II form a gaiden taking place before the regular storyline, called the "Kakashi Chronicles" (カカシ外伝 , "Kakashi gaiden" ) .

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: An anime adaptation of the series, produced by Studio Pierrot and TV Tokyo, was aired on TV Tokyo, with the first episode shown on October 3, 2002.

title: List of Naruto chapters (Part I)
text: The last episode of the "Naruto" anime aired on February 8, 2007, with the anime adaptation of Part II, known as "", to replace it.

title: Cross Manage
text: Cross Manage (クロス・マネジ Kurosu Maneji) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by KAITO.

title: Cross Manage
text: Cross Manage was originally published as a one-shot in "Weekly Shōnen Jump" before beginning serialization in the magazine on September 17, 2012, and ending on July 22, 2013.

title: Cross Manage
text: The series is also published in North America in English through Viz Media's digital manga anthology, "Weekly Shonen Jump".

title: Rosario + Vampire
text: Rosario + Vampire (ロザリオとバンパイア , Rozario to Banpaia , literally « rosary and vampire ») is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Akihisa Ikeda.

title: Rosario + Vampire
text: The story revolves around Tsukune Aono, a boy who inadvertently enrolls in a boarding school for monsters.

title: Rosario + Vampire
text: He quickly befriends Moka Akashiya, a vampire who soon develops an obsession with his blood, and later meets other monster girls who soon take a romantic liking to him.

title: Rosario + Vampire
text: The manga was serialized in "Monthly Shonen Jump" starting with the August 2004 issue, and ending with the June 2007 issue.

title: Rosario + Vampire
text: A bonus chapter was published in "Weekly Shonen Jump" in September 2007.

title: Rosario + Vampire
text: Ten tankōbon volumes were compiled and released from October 2004 to October 2007.

title: List of Psyren chapters
text: The chapters of the Japanese manga series Psyren are written and illustrated by Toshiaki Iwashiro.

title: List of Psyren chapters
text: It is published in Japan by Shueisha, and has been serialized in the shōnen manga magazine "Weekly Shōnen Jump" since the 3 December 2007 issue.

title: List of Psyren chapters
text: Publication is completed, with serial chapters having been collected into six tankōbon volumes as of June 2009.

title: List of Psyren chapters
text: The series is about the adventures of a high school student named Ageha Yoshina, who learns to develop his psychic abilities after being transported to a world named Psyren.

title: List of Psyren chapters
text: On October 04, 2011, the first volume of Psyren was released in the US by Viz Media's Shonen Jump.

title: List of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo chapters
text: This is a list of chapters for the Japanese manga series "Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo" and the spinoff series "Shinsetsu Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo", both written and illustrated by Yoshio Sawai and serialized in "Weekly Shonen Jump".

title: List of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo chapters
text: The series was licensed for an English-language release in the United States and Canada by Viz Media, who chose to release a single stand alone released an interlude in the series.

title: List of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo chapters
text: The volume was released under their "SJ Advanced" label on November 8, 2005.

title: List of Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo chapters
text: The next American release of "Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo" would begin serialization in "Shonen Jump" in July 2007 with chapter 110, with Viz then releasing the Japanese volume 11 as volume 1 under Viz's normal Shonen Jump imprint.

title: Musée Henri-Mathieu
text: Musée Henri-Mathieu is a museum in Vosges, France.

title: Musée Henri-Mathieu
text: It is located in the former Bruyères Synagogue which was built with funding from a sponsor, Daniel Osiris, for the Jewish community of Bruyères.

title: Musée Henri-Mathieu
text: The museum now houses a collection of Folk Art.

title: Musée Henri-Mathieu
text: It also includes works by Jean Lurcat, an artist born in Bruyeres.

title: Conexus Arts Centre
text: The Conexus Arts Centre, known from 1970 till 2006 (and still largely known) as the Saskatchewan Centre of the Arts, is a theatre complex located within Wascana Centre in Regina, Saskatchewan, which largely replaces former theatres downtown and Darke Hall on the original campus of Regina College, also in Wascana Centre but north of Wascana Lake.

title: Conexus Arts Centre
text: Naming of the Venue as Conexus Arts Centre was possible through a Partner/Sponsor Agreement with the Conexus Credit Union.

title: The O2 Arena
text: The O2 Arena (temporarily the sponsor-neutral "North Greenwich Arena", during the 2012 Summer Olympics and 2012 Summer Paralympics), is a multi-purpose indoor arena located in the centre of The O2 entertainment complex on the Greenwich Peninsula in south-east London.

title: The O2 Arena
text: The arena was built under the former Millennium Dome, a large dome-shaped building built to house an exhibition celebrating the turn of the third millennium; as the dome-shaped structure still stands over the arena, "The Dome" remains a name in common usage for the venue.

title: The O2 Arena
text: The arena, as well as the total O2 complex, is named after its primary sponsor, the telecommunications company O.

title: 1 Wall Street Court
text: 1 Wall Street Court in the Financial District of Manhattan, also known as The Beaver Building and The Cocoa Exchange (as the former home of the New York Cocoa Exchange) is a triangular-shaped building reminiscent of the Flatiron Building.

title: 1 Wall Street Court
text: The building, designed by Clinton and Russell and completed in 1904, is located at the intersection of Wall Street, Pearl Street, and Beaver Street.

title: Kellogg's
text: The Kellogg Company (also Kellogg's, Kellogg, and Kellogg's of Battle Creek) is an American multinational food manufacturing company headquartered in Battle Creek, Michigan, United States.

title: Kellogg's
text: Kellogg's produces cereal and convenience foods, including cookies, crackers, toaster pastries, cereal bars, fruit-flavored snacks, frozen waffles, and vegetarian foods.

title: Kellogg's
text: The company's brands include Froot Loops, Apple Jacks, Corn Flakes, Frosted Flakes, Rice Krispies, Special K, Cocoa Krispies, Keebler, Pringles, Pop-Tarts, Kashi, Cheez-It, Eggo, Nutri-Grain, Morningstar Farms, and many more.

title: Kellogg's
text: Kellogg's stated purpose is "Nourishing families so they can flourish and thrive."

title: Cocoa Krispies
text: Cocoa Krispies, Choco Krispis, Choco Krispies, Coco Pops, or Choco Pops is a breakfast cereal produced by Kellogg's, coming both as a boxed cereal and as a snack bar with a 'dried milk' covered bottom, to make the cereal with milk tradition portable.

title: Cocoa Krispies
text: It is a cocoa flavored version of Rice Krispies.

title: Cocoa Krispies
text: Containing a substance imitating milk chocolate, the cereal can turn milk "chocolatey."

title: Superman: Tower of Power
text: Superman: Tower of Power is a drop tower ride currently located at three Six Flags parks, and a former installment at Kentucky Kingdom.

title: Wisconsin Center
text: The Wisconsin Center (formerly Midwest Express Center, Midwest Airlines Center, Frontier Airlines Center and Delta Center) is a convention and exhibition center located in downtown Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

title: Wisconsin Center
text: The center is part of a greater complex of buildings which includes the UW–Milwaukee Panther Arena and the Milwaukee Theatre, and was a replacement for the former Great Hall portion of the MECCA Complex.

title: Wisconsin Center
text: Up until July 1, 2013, the building was named after its sponsor Delta Air Lines when Delta purchased naming rights to the facility in August 2012.

title: Wisconsin Center
text: Delta later terminated its naming rights at the center on June 30, 2013 and the facility was officially renamed to "Wisconsin Center" on July 1, 2013.

title: Vodafone Events Centre
text: Vodafone Events Centre (originally the TelstraClear Pacific Events Centre) is a multi-purpose event centre located in Manukau, Auckland, New Zealand (suburb of the former Manukau City), with an indoor arena, theatre and meeting halls hosting community, cultural and sports events, concerts and plays, exhibits, trade shows and expos, corporate functions, meetings, weddings and other special events.

title: Vodafone Events Centre
text: The event centre has cost an estimated NZ$ 48.7 million, of which somewhat less than half came from Manukau City Council.

title: Vodafone Events Centre
text: The naming rights sponsor was TelstraClear.

title: Vodafone Events Centre
text: but after it was purchased by Vodafone New Zealand, the center was subsequently renamed.

title: This Is the Life (2008 film)
text: This is the Life is a 2008 documentary film directed by Ava DuVernay, which chronicles the alternative hip hop movement that flourished in 1990s Los Angeles and its legendary center, the Good Life Cafe.

title: Middle of Nowhere (2012 film)
text: Middle of Nowhere is a 2012 independent feature film written and directed by Ava DuVernay and starring Emayatzy Corinealdi, David Oyelowo, Omari Hardwick and Lorraine Toussaint.

title: Middle of Nowhere (2012 film)
text: The film was the winner of the Directing Award for U.S. Dramatic Film at the 2012 Sundance Film Festival.

title: Emayatzy Corinealdi
text: Emayatzy Evett Corinealdi ( ; born January 14, 1980) is an American actress.

title: Emayatzy Corinealdi
text: She is best known for her leading role in the Ava DuVernay film "Middle of Nowhere" (2012).

title: Robert Glasper
text: Robert Glasper (born April 6, 1978, in Houston, Texas) is an American pianist and record producer.

title: Robert Glasper
text: He has been nominated for 6 Grammys, has won 3 Grammy Awards and is currently nominated for an Emmy Award.

title: Robert Glasper
text: His 2012 album "Black Radio" won the Grammy Award for Best R&B Album at the 55th Grammy Awards.

title: Robert Glasper
text: His 2014 album "Black Radio 2" won the Grammy Award for Best Traditional R&B Performance at the 56th Grammy Awards.

title: Robert Glasper
text: The song "These Walls" from Kendrick Lamar's album "To Pimp A Butterfly" won Best Rap/Sung Collaboration at the 57th Grammy Awards, on which Glasper plays keys.

title: Robert Glasper
text: The soundtrack for the film "Miles Ahead" won Best Soundtrack Compilation at the 58th Grammy Awards, for which Glasper was a producer.

title: Robert Glasper
text: The song "Letter To The Free", written with Common, is nominated for an Emmy Award for Best Original Song in the Ava Duvernay documentary film "13th" (Netflix) at the 2017 Emmys.

title: I Will Follow (film)
text: I Will Follow is a 2010 American independent drama film written, produced and directed by Ava DuVernay, starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield, Beverly Todd, Omari Hardwick, Michole White, Dijon Talton, Royale Watkins, Damone Roberts, Tracie Thoms and Blair Underwood.

title: ♯JusticeForFlint
text: Initiated by "Creed" director Ryan Coogler and "Selma" director Ava DuVernay, the free public event was held at the Whiting Auditorium in Flint, Michigan.

title: ♯JusticeForFlint
text: Hosted by comedian Hannibal Buress, it featured singers Janelle Monáe and Ledisi, as well as actor-activists Jesse Williams and Jussie Smollett, amongst others.

title: ♯JusticeForFlint
text: Surprising star guest was "King of Motown" Stevie Wonder, who teamed up with Monáe for "Hell You Talkin' Bout", a protest song she had written for the people of Flint.

title: Takeshi Fukunaga
text: Takeshi Fukunaga is a Japanese filmmaker based in New York.

title: Takeshi Fukunaga
text: His first feature film, "Out of My Hand" (2015) premiered in the Panorama section at the 65th Berlin International Film Festival and won the Top Prize at the 2015 Los Angeles Film Festival.

title: Takeshi Fukunaga
text: The film was later released worldwide through Ava DuVernay’s distribution company, ARRAY.

title: Takeshi Fukunaga
text: Takeshi was nominated for the John Cassavetes Award at the 2016 Independent Spirit Awards.

title: Takeshi Fukunaga
text: In 2017, he was selected for The Residence by Cannes Film Festival's Cinéfondation to develop his second feature film.

title: Spencer Averick
text: Spencer Averick is an American film editor and producer.

title: Spencer Averick
text: Best known for his work an editor on critically acclaimed films "Middle of Nowhere" (2012), "Selma" (2014) and for producing 2016 acclaimed documentary "13th" for which he received Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature nominations at 89th Academy Awards, that he shared with director Ava DuVernay and co-producer Howard Barish.

title: Howard Barish
text: Howard Barish is an Oscar nominated, Emmy award winning producer and director known for his producing partnership with acclaimed director, writer Ava DuVernay.

title: Howard Barish
text: Their most recognized project to date, "13TH", is a 2016 American documentary from Netflix directed by DuVernay.

title: Howard Barish
text: Centered on race in the United States criminal justice system, the critically lauded film is titled after the Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, which outlawed slavery (unless as punishment for a crime).

title: Howard Barish
text: It argues that slavery is being effectively perpetuated through mass incarceration.

title: Selma (film)
text: Selma is a 2014 American historical drama film directed by Ava DuVernay and written by Paul Webb.

title: Selma (film)
text: It is based on the 1965 Selma to Montgomery voting rights marches led by James Bevel, Hosea Williams, Martin Luther King, Jr. and John Lewis.

title: Selma (film)
text: The film stars actors David Oyelowo as King, Tom Wilkinson as President Lyndon B. Johnson, Tim Roth as George Wallace, Carmen Ejogo as Coretta Scott King and Common as Bevel.

title: Encore (Eminem album)
text: Encore (stylized as ƎNCORE) is the fifth studio album by American rapper Eminem.

title: Encore (Eminem album)
text: It was released by Aftermath Entertainment, Shady Records, and Interscope Records.

title: Encore (Eminem album)
text: Its release was set for November 16, 2004, but was moved up to November 12 (coincidentally, exactly eight years to the day since his debut album, "Infinite", was released) after the album was leaked to the Internet.

title: Encore (Eminem album)
text: "Encore" sold 710,000 copies in its first three days, and went on to sell over 1.5 million copies in its first two weeks of release in the United States, certified quadruple-platinum that mid-December.

title: Encore (Eminem album)
text: Nine months after its release, worldwide sales of the album stood at 11 million copies.

title: Encore (Eminem album)
text: By December 2016, the album had sold over 5 million copies in the United States and more than 23 million copies worldwide.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: Canadian singer Nelly Furtado has released six studio albums, twenty singles, one video album, one live album, two compilation albums, three extended plays, and twenty-three music videos.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: Furtado released her debut album "Whoa, Nelly!

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: " in 2000 and it became a commercial success selling 9 million copies worldwide.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: It has been certified multi Platinum in countries such as Canada, United States, Australia and New Zealand.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: The album spawned four singles including the successful top 10 hits; "I'm Like a Bird" and "Turn Off the Light".

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: In 2003 she released her second album "Folklore", while the album did not match the success of her previous album in such markets as the US and Australia, it did however become a success in several European countries.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: "Folklore" has sold 3 million copies worldwide.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: The album produced two European top 10 hits; "Powerless (Say What You Want)" and "Força", while "Try" peaked inside the top 10 in Canada.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: Furtado's third album "Loose" (2006) became her best selling album of career with 12 million copies sold worldwide.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: It also reached number one on the album chart of nine countries and was certified multi Platinum in several countries such as Canada, UK, Australia, Germany, Switzerland, Austria and New Zeeland.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: The album spawned four successful number one singles; "Promiscuous", "Maneater", "Say It Right" and "All Good Things (Come to an End)".

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: "Loose" was one of the best selling albums of 2006–2007 and is twenty-second best-selling album of the 2000s.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: She released her first Spanish language album "Mi Plan" in 2009 which became a success in Europe and on the Latin charts.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: The lead single "Manos al Aire" became a European top 10 hit and also topped the "Billboard" Hot Latin Songs chart, making Furtado the first North American singer to reach number one on that chart with an original Spanish song.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: "Mi Plan" has been certified Platinum (Latin) in the US.

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: In 2010 she released a remix album "Mi Plan Remixes" and her first greatest hits "The Best of Nelly Furtado".

title: Nelly Furtado discography
text: Furtado released her fifth album "The Spirit Indestructible" in 2012, followed by "The Ride" in 2017.

title: MTV Video Music Award for Best New Artist
text: The MTV Video Music Award for Best New Artist have been given out since the first annual MTV Video Music Awards in 1984.

title: MTV Video Music Award for Best New Artist
text: From then to 2006, the award was named Best New Artist in a Video.

title: MTV Video Music Award for Best New Artist
text: In 2007 its name was changed to Best New Artist, as the category underwent a format change to award the artist's body of work for the full year rather than a specific video.

title: MTV Video Music Award for Best New Artist
text: For the 2008 ceremony, though, while the award retained its 2007 name, it returned to the format of awarding a specific video rather than the artist's full body of work.

title: MTV Video Music Award for Best New Artist
text: The category was later renamed Artist to Watch through 2013 to 2015 while still keeping the format of an award going to a certain video.

title: The Button-Down Mind of Bob Newhart
text: The Button-Down Mind of Bob Newhart is a 1960 live album by comedian Bob Newhart.

title: The Button-Down Mind of Bob Newhart
text: Recorded at the Tidelands Club in Houston, Texas, the debut album by Newhart was number one on the "Billboard" pop album chart and won Album of the Year at the 1961 Grammy Awards, where Newhart was named Best New Artist.

title: The Button-Down Mind of Bob Newhart
text: It was the first comedy album to win Album of the Year and the only time a comedian had won Best New Artist.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: The Foundation is the first major-label studio album by American country music band Zac Brown Band.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: It was released on November 18, 2008.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: Originally slated for release on the Home Grown label and Big Picture Records, the album is distributed by Atlantic Nashville in association with those two labels.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: The financing for the album was provided by Atlanta, GA entrepreneur Braden Copeland through his investment company Braden Copeland Ventures, LLC.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: On December 2, 2009, the album was nominated for the Grammy Award for Best Country Album.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: and also earned the band the Grammy Award for Best New Artist on January 31.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: The album also has been nominated for the 2010 Academy of Country Music Awards "Album of the Year" award.

title: The Foundation (Zac Brown Band album)
text: As of September 2015, the album has sold 3.4 million copies in the US.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003 was the 15th anniversary of the awards.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: the show was hosted by Mexican presenters Marco Antonio Regil and Adal Ramones.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: Juanes, Thalía, Marc Anthony, Pilar Montenegro, Sin Bandera, Banda el Recodo and other Latin music greats gave electrifying performances.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: In the show, there was 36 awards winners with 135 nominations.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: In Pop genre, Awards was given for : Album of the Year, Best Male Artist, Best Female Artist, Best Group or duo, Best New Artist and Song of the Year.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: In Rock Genre : Best Rock Album and Best rock Performer of the Year.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: In Tropical genre : Best Tropical Album of the Year, Best Tropical Male Artist, Best Tropical Female Artist, Best Tropical Group or Duo of the Year, Best Tropical New Artist, Tropical Song of the Year, Best Merengue Performance, Best Salsa Performance and Best Traditional Performance.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: Juanes was the biggest winner of night, took home four awards Best Pop Male Artist, Best Music Video, Best Rock Performance, and Pop Song of the Year .

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: In the Regional Mexican, Pilar Montenegro took three awards for Regional Mexican Song of the Year, Pop Song of the Year ("Quitame Ese Hombre"), and for Best Regional Mexican Female Artist.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: In the tropical genre, Celia Cruz took home with four great awards of the night for Best Salsa Performance, Best Tropical Female Artist, Best Tropical Song of the year and Tropical Album of the Year.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: At the night, the greatest performance was a medley of top Latin hits from the last 15 years, performed by the artists that made them famous, including Vikki Carr, Son by Four, Los Ilegales, La Mafia, Luis Enrique, Wilfrido Vargas and Olga Tañón.

title: Premio Lo Nuestro 2003
text: There was a great tribute to Celia Cruz by the world-famous salsa group "Fania All-Stars", of which Cruz was a member during the 1970s, reunited for an exclusive performance that rocked the house.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: The highest-selling albums and EPs in the United States are ranked in the "Billboard" 200, published by "Billboard" magazine.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: The data are compiled by Nielsen Soundscan based on each album's weekly physical and digital sales.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: 25 acts achieved number one albums during this year with artist such as Nelly and Shania Twain who had their albums debut at number one on the chart.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Rapper Eminem's "The Eminem Show" is the best selling album of 2002 selling over approximately 7.6 million copies by the end of the year.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: It is also the longest running album of 2002 spending six non-consecutive weeks the chart and was known for its first full week of sales debut of 1.322 million copies which Nielsen SoundScan scanned as the sixth largest sales of all time in its first week.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Its debut of 1.322 million copies has still not been matched by any album today since except for Taylor Swift's album "1989", which opened with first week sales of 1.279 million copies.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: The band Creed continued its eight week long run on the chart but is credited as the longest running album 2001.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Jennifer Lopez earned her second number one album on the charts with "", which became the highest first week sales of a remix album at the time.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: R&B artist Ashanti earned her first number one album with her self-titled debut album "Ashanti", which opened up with first week sales of 503,000 copies in its first week alone.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Puff Daddy earned his first number one album since "No Way Out" back in 1997.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Rapper Jay-Z earned his fifth chart topper with "", which opened up with first week sales of 545,000 copies alone.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Heavy metal band Disturbed earned its first number one album on the chart with "Believe", which opened up with first week sales of 284,000 copies alone.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Country music singer Shania Twain's album "Up!

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: " opened up with a huge first week sales of 857,000 copies in its first week alone, giving her the recognition of the highest first week sales of her career and second highest of the year, only behind Eminem's "The Eminem Show" and at the time the fastest selling solo female album ever.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Nelly's album "Nellyville" opened up with his highest first week sales of his career which logged on with huge sales of 714,000 copies in its first week alone, which beat his sales of his debut album "Country Grammar", which opened up with first week sales of 235,000 copies.

title: List of Billboard 200 number-one albums of 2002
text: Country singer Alan Jackson album "Drive" gave him his first number one album on the chart and opened up with first week sales of 211,000 copies alone.

title: SAIC-GM-Wuling
text: SAIC-GM-Wuling Automobile (上汽通用五菱汽车股份有限公司 and abbreviated as SGMW) is a joint venture between SAIC Motor, General Motors, and Liuzhou Wuling Motors Co Ltd. Based in Liuzhou, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, in southwestern China, it makes commercial and consumer vehicles sold in China under the Wuling and Baojun marques, respectively.

title: SAIC-GM-Wuling
text: A major mass-volume producer in the Chinese interior, in 2011 SGMW sold 1,286,000 vehicles in China, 1,445,000 in 2012, and aims to sell 2 million cars annually.

title: SAIC-GM-Wuling
text: Its offerings range in price from US$5,000 to US$10,000.

title: Japan Record Award for Best New Artist
text: The Japan Record Award for Best New Artist (最優秀新人賞 ) is awarded annually.

title: Japan Record Award for Best New Artist
text: Until the 10th Japan Record Awards it was called New Artist Award, since 11th — Best New Artist Award.

title: Japan Record Award for Best New Artist
text: At present all nominees for the Best New Artist Award are awarded the New Artist Award.

title: Every End of the Day
text: "Every End of the Day" () is a song by South Korean singer-songwriter and actress IU.

title: Every End of the Day
text: It was released as a CD single, titled "Spring of a Twenty Year Old" ().

title: Every End of the Day
text: The single has a double A-side hit singles, "Peach" and "Every End of the Day" which was also released digitally, consists of three tracks in total, one of which was composed by IU.

title: Every End of the Day
text: It is the singer's first Korean-language release since the full-length album, "Last Fantasy", that was released six months prior.

title: Every End of the Day
text: The latter topped "Billboard" Korea K-Pop Hot 100 for four consecutive weeks, making it IU's second number-one hit on the chart after "You and I".

title: Every End of the Day
text: The single has sold over 34,400 copies in South Korea as of 2013.

title: Denis Latin
text: Denis Latin is a Croatian television host born on 14 February 1966 in Šibenik.

title: Jim Puplava
text: James Joseph Puplava (born 1950) is an investment analyst and Internet radio show host born in Gary, Indiana.

title: Jim Puplava
text: He is the founder, president & CEO of the Puplava Financial Services (PFS) Inc. group, and Puplava Securities Inc.

title: Jim Puplava
text: He is also chief author and host for the "Financial Sense Newshour".

title: Jim Puplava
text: His companies manage $400 million for more than 825 clients (as of December 31, 2012).

title: Jim Puplava
text: Puplava's website at financialsense.com was named a "supersite for alternative investing" by The Globe and Mail, Canada's largest-circulation national newspaper.

title: Dayna Hart
text: Dayna Hart is an American actress, model and television host born in New York City, who is also the founder of the Give & Get Non-profit organization.

title: Dayna Hart
text: Hart made her on air debut back in 2008 on several morning talk shows and covered the White House Correspondents Association Dinner in 2008 and 2009.

title: Dayna Hart
text: In 2012, she made her big screen debut starring opposite Isaiah Washington and Vivica A. Fox in the indie film Doctor Bello.

title: Jason Byrne (comedian)
text: Jason Byrne ( ; born 25 February 1972) is an Irish comedian and radio host born in Ballinteer, Dublin.

title: Jason Byrne (comedian)
text: In August 2008, he made his twelfth Edinburgh Fringe Festival.

title: Jason Byrne (comedian)
text: Byrne previously presented a mid-morning radio show on Phantom FM as well as a comedy panel show called "The Byrne Ultimatum" on RTÉ Two.

title: Ew!
text: "Ew!"

title: Ew!
text: is a song by American television host and comedian Jimmy Fallon, featuring American rapper will.i.am.

title: Ew!
text: The song is based on a sketch from "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon", in which Fallon and guests play teenage girls constantly disgusted by things around them.

title: Susan Stafford
text: Susan Stafford (born Susanna Gail Carney January 27, 1942) is an American former model, actress and television host.

title: Susan Stafford
text: She was the original hostess of the American game show "Wheel of Fortune" from January 6, 1975 until she left on October 22, 1982.

title: Susan Stafford
text: She returned briefly to "Wheel of Fortune" in 1986 to substitute for Vanna White.

title: Val Kahl
text: Val Kahl (born Valérie Kahl) is a French television host, radio host, journalist, and producer.

title: Val Kahl
text: She is known in France as the winner of the Reality Television competition show "Le Grand Casting de la Télé" on NRJ12 network in 2010, a Reality TV Show looking for their next television host.

title: Zhu Xun
text: Zhu Xun (, born September 7, 1973) is a Chinese television host.

title: Zhu Xun
text: Born in Suzhou, Zhu began her career as a television host in 1987, when she was a teenager.

title: Zhu Xun
text: She was the host of the "Our Generation" program ().

title: Zhu Xun
text: In 1988 she appeared in the film "Rocking Youth" ().

title: Zhu Xun
text: In 1992 she paused her television work to go to university at Asia University in Japan, studying management.

title: Zhu Xun
text: Thereafter she remained in Japan and became a host with Japanese television station NHK.

title: Zhu Xun
text: She then appeared in the television show "Bounce Ko Gals", "Three Giant Dragons", and "Shanghainese in Tokyo".

title: Zhu Xun
text: In 1998 she wrote her MBA thesis on "Media Market Strategy in the 21st Century".

title: Zhu Xun
text: She later returned to China.

title: Zhu Xun
text: She has hosted the 2009, 2011, 2015, and 2016 editions of the CCTV New Year's Gala.

title: Mat Dan
text: Mat Dan (born Daniel Tyler, 1990) is an adventurer and host born from England and lived in Malaysia since 2009.

title: Mat Dan
text: He first settled in Malaysia after his adventures to Kapas Island.

title: Mat Dan
text: He also converted to Islam and adopted the name Kareef Daniel Abdullah.

title: Mat Dan
text: He is known for his eloquence speaking Terengganu dialect pretty well.

title: Mat Dan
text: Now, he is better known in the TV show about his adventures with his friends entitled Haramain Backpackers - Trans Siberian.

title: Erika Moulet
text: Erika Moulet is a French journalist and television host born in 1982 in Nancy (Meurthe-et-Moselle).

title: M180 motorway
text: The M180 is a short but major (25 mi ) motorway in England from junction 5 on the M18 motorway in the Metropolitan Borough of Doncaster to a point close to Humberside Airport some 10 mi from the port of Immingham and 14 mi from the port of Grimsby and the east coast and provides access for major routes to Cleethorpes, Grimsby, Hull (via the Humber Bridge), Immingham, Lincoln, Scunthorpe, Humberside Airport and the Killingholme Oil Refineries; Humber Oil Refinery and Lindsey Oil Refinery.

title: M180 motorway
text: The road forms part of the unsigned Euroroute E22 and is the main route along the south bank of the Humber Estuary.

title: M180 motorway
text: At 25 miles long it is the longest motorway in the United Kingdom to carry a three digit number.

title: Kingdom of Northumbria
text: The Kingdom of Northumbria ( ; Old English: "Norþhymbra rīce" , "kingdom of the Northumbrians") was a medieval Anglian kingdom in what is now northern England and south-east Scotland, which subsequently became an earldom in a unified English kingdom.

title: Kingdom of Northumbria
text: The name reflects the approximate southern limit to the kingdom's territory, the Humber estuary.

title: Essex dialect
text: The Essex dialect is a rapidly disappearing dialect similar to some forms of East Anglian English and is now mainly confined to the north and the east of Essex.

title: Essex dialect
text: It shares vast similarities with both Suffolk and Norfolk dialects, with its own peculiarities.

title: Essex dialect
text: With rapid urbanisation in the twentieth century as well as the impact of the London overspill, Estuary English, a milder form of the London accent predominant largely along the Thames Estuary and thus the name, has become common, mainly in the southern portion of the county.

title: Essex dialect
text: As a result of the growing London influence, the usage of rural accents everywhere and the rural Essex dialect is now normally, but not always, confined to older generations in some of the areas affected and the dialect itself stands in a vulnerable state in those affected parts of the county.

title: Essex dialect
text: Elsewhere in Essex, the dialect and rural accent continues.

title: Northumbrian dialect
text: Northumbrian was a dialect of Old English spoken in the Anglian Kingdom of Northumbria.

title: Northumbrian dialect
text: Together with Mercian, Kentish and West Saxon, it forms one of the sub-categories of Old English devised and employed by modern scholars.

title: Cumbrian dialect
text: The Cumbrian dialect is a local Northern English dialect in decline, spoken in Cumbria (including historic Cumberland and Westmorland) and surrounding northern England, not to be confused with the area's extinct Celtic language, Cumbric.

title: Cumbrian dialect
text: Most of the parts of Cumbria have a more North-East English sound to them.

title: Cumbrian dialect
text: Whilst clearly being a Northern English accent, it shares much vocabulary with Scots.

title: Cumbrian dialect
text: A "Cumbrian Dictionary of Dialect, Tradition and Folklore" by William Rollinson exists, as well a more contemporary and lighthearted "Cumbrian Dictionary and Phrase Book".

title: Humberside
text: Humberside was a non-metropolitan and ceremonial county in Northern England from 1 April 1974 until 1 April 1996.

title: Humberside
text: It was composed of land from either side of the Humber Estuary, created from portions of East Riding of Yorkshire, West Riding of Yorkshire, and the district of Lindsey, Lincolnshire.

title: Humberside
text: The county council's headquarters was County Hall at Beverley, inherited from the East Riding, and its largest settlement and only city was Kingston upon Hull.

title: Humberside
text: The county stretched from Wold Newton in its northern tip to a different Wold Newton at its most southern point.

title: Humberside
text: The county still has a limited existence in the form of the Hull and Humber Ports city region.

title: Humber Forts
text: The Humber Forts are two large fortifications in the mouth of the Humber estuary in northern England: Haile Sand Fort ( ) and Bull Sand Fort ( ).

title: Humber Warhawks
text: The Humber Warhawks are a British American football team based in Hull, East Riding of Yorkshire who play in the BAFA NFC South 2.

title: Humber Warhawks
text: The club represent the counties of East Yorkshire and North East Lincolnshire by taking their name from the Humber Estuary that flows between the two counties and the Humber Bridge which connects them.

title: Humber Warhawks
text: The club were formed in 2014 when the Kingston Warhawks merged with fellow associate team the Grimsby Scorpions.

title: Humber Warhawks
text: They were later granted official BAFA status and debuted in the 2015 season.

title: South Ferriby
text: South Ferriby is a village in North Lincolnshire, England.

title: South Ferriby
text: It is situated on the south bank of the Humber Estuary and 3 mi west from the Humber Bridge.

title: South Ferriby
text: North Ferriby is directly opposite on the Estuary’s north bank.

title: South Ferriby
text: Village population was 651 in 2011.

title: Humberhead Levels
text: The Humberhead Levels is a national character area covering a large expanse of flat, low-lying land towards the western end of the Humber estuary in northern England.

title: Humberhead Levels
text: The levels occupy the former Glacial Lake Humber, an area bounded to the east by the Yorkshire Wolds and the northern Lincolnshire Edge, a limestone escarpment, and to the west by the southern part of the Yorkshire magnesian limestone ridge.

title: Humberhead Levels
text: In the north the levels merge into the slightly more undulating Vale of York close to the Escrick glacial moraine, and to the south merge into the Trent Vale.

title: John Logan (pioneer)
text: John Logan (1747July 1807) was a pioneer and politician from the U.S. state of Virginia and later, Kentucky.

title: John Logan (pioneer)
text: He participated in Lord Dunmore's War in 1774, serving under his brother, Benjamin.

title: John Logan (pioneer)
text: After moving to Kentucky County, Virginia, he took part in several expeditions against the Shawnee, including some led by Daniel Boone, John Bowman, and George Rogers Clark.

title: John Logan (pioneer)
text: After Kentucky County was split into three counties, Logan represented his home county, Lincoln in the Virginia House of Delegates and at several of the conventions that effected the separation of Virginia from Kentucky.

title: Lake Louisvilla, Louisville
text: Lake Louisvilla is a neighborhood partially located in Louisville, Kentucky.

title: Lake Louisvilla, Louisville
text: It is located between Westport Road in Louisville and KY 22 in Oldham County.

title: Lake Louisvilla, Louisville
text: Lake Louisvilla was developed in the 1920s as a summer resort for people living in the city of Louisville.

title: Lake Louisvilla, Louisville
text: The state of Kentucky drained the lake in the late 1980s due to safety concerns regarding the stability of a dam.

title: Casey County, Kentucky
text: Casey County is a county located in the U.S. Commonwealth of Kentucky.

title: Casey County, Kentucky
text: As of the 2010 census, the population was 15,955.

title: Casey County, Kentucky
text: Its county seat is Liberty.

title: Casey County, Kentucky
text: The county was formed in 1806 from the western part of Lincoln County and named for Colonel William Casey, a pioneer settler who moved his family to Kentucky in 1779.

title: Casey County, Kentucky
text: It is the only Kentucky county entirely in the Knobs region.

title: Casey County, Kentucky
text: Casey County is home to annual Casey County Apple Festival, and is a prohibition or dry county.

title: Casey County, Kentucky
text: It is considered part of the Appalachian region of Kentucky.

title: Oldham County, Kentucky
text: Oldham County is a county located in the commonwealth of Kentucky.

title: Oldham County, Kentucky
text: As of the 2010 census, the population was 60,316.

title: Oldham County, Kentucky
text: Its county seat is La Grange.

title: Oldham County, Kentucky
text: The county is named for Colonel William Oldham.

title: Oldham County, Kentucky
text: Oldham County was a prohibition or completely dry county until January 2005 as the result of a 2004 'moist' vote, permitting sales of alcohol in restaurants that seat at least 100 patrons in which 70%+ of total revenue is derived from sales of food.

title: Oldham County, Kentucky
text: After a vote in late 2015; Oldham county has become a completely wet county.

title: John Bowman (pioneer)
text: Col. John (Johannes) Bowman (17 December 1738 – May 4, 1784) was an 18th-century American pioneer, colonial militia officer and sheriff, the first appointed in Lincoln County, Kentucky.

title: John Bowman (pioneer)
text: In 1781 he also presided as a justice of the peace over the first county court held in Kentucky.

title: John Bowman (pioneer)
text: The first county-lieutenant and military governor of Kentucky County during the American Revolutionary War, Col. Bowman also, served in the American Revolution, many times, second in command to General George Rogers Clark, during the Illinois Campaign, which, at the time, doubled the size of the United States.

title: Tara Conner
text: Tara Elizabeth Conner (born December 18, 1985) is an American actress, model, advocate and beauty queen who was crowned Miss USA 2006 and has also competed in the Miss Teen USA and Miss Universe pageants.

title: Tara Conner
text: Apart from her role as Miss USA, Conner has been employed as a model.

title: Tara Conner
text: She was a featured model on the HDNet series "Bikini Destinations" in 2004, posing in Lake Tahoe.

title: Tara Conner
text: She has also held the titles Miss Kentucky Teen USA 2002, Miss Kentucky County Fair 2004, and Miss Kentucky USA 2006.

title: Battle of Blue Licks
text: The Battle of Blue Licks, fought on August 19, 1782, was one of the last battles of the American Revolutionary War.

title: Battle of Blue Licks
text: The battle occurred ten months after Lord Cornwallis's famous surrender at Yorktown, which had effectively ended the war in the east.

title: Battle of Blue Licks
text: On a hill next to the Licking River in what is now Robertson County, Kentucky (but was then in Kentucky County, Virginia), a force of about 50 American and Canadian Loyalists along with 300 American Indians ambushed and routed 182 Kentucky militiamen.

title: Battle of Blue Licks
text: It was the last victory for the Loyalists and Natives during the frontier war.

title: Kentucky County, Virginia
text: Kentucky County (then alternately spelled Kentucke County) was formed by the Commonwealth of Virginia by dividing Fincastle County into three new counties: Kentucky, Washington, and Montgomery, effective December 31, 1776.

title: Kentucky County, Virginia
text: During the three and one-half years of Kentucky County's existence, its seat of government was Harrodstown (then also known as Oldtown, later renamed Harrodsburg).

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The Westervelt massacre, also known as the Westerfield massacre, was an indigenous attack on a caravan of Dutch frontier settlers that occurred during the American Revolutionary War around 3:00 am on June 27, 1780 in Kentucky County, Virginia, the present day state of Kentucky.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: It remains one of the largest massacres in Kentucky state history.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The settlers were traveling southeast from Low Dutch Station to Harrod's Town.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The settler relocation was in part a reaction to British Captain Henry Bird's invasion of Kentucky.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The area immediately east of Low Dutch Station had been overrun with British allied Indians.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: Harrod's Town was fortified and a move south would lead the settlers away from Captain Bird's invading army from the north.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The caravan was ambushed in a surprise attack, during the night, after a day's travel of twelve miles.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The exact location of the massacre is not definitively known.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: However, it is likely to have occurred at Floyd's Fork and Broad Run.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The caravan was formed by Jacobus Westervelt and consisted of forty-one settlers from ten different families.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: Ten of the seventeen settlers killed were members of the Westervelt family.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The victims included men, women, and children.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The Indians responsible for the massacre were allied to the British and received ₤5 for each victim's scalp cut off and returned to the British authorities.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The Indians were thus awarded ₤85 by the British for massacring the Dutch settlers.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: The Westervelt Massacre had a chilling effect on the region.

title: Westervelt massacre
text: A number of settlers from Low Dutch Station joined Colonel George Rogers Clark's militia after the massacre.

title: Benjamin Logan
text: Benjamin Logan (c.1742 – December 11, 1802) was an American pioneer, soldier, and politician from Shelby County, Kentucky.

title: Benjamin Logan
text: As colonel of the Kentucky County, Virginia militia during the American Revolutionary War, he was second-in-command of all the militia in Kentucky.

title: Benjamin Logan
text: He was also a leader in Kentucky's efforts to become a state.

title: Benjamin Logan
text: His brother, John Logan, was the first state treasurer of Kentucky.

title: Affiliated Managers Group
text: Affiliated Managers Group Inc. is an American international investment management company headquartered in Massachusetts that owns stakes in a number of boutique asset management, hedge fund, and specialized private equity firms.

title: Crystal River Energy Complex
text: The Crystal River Energy Complex consists of five power-generating plants on a 4,700 acre (1,900 hectare) site near the mouth of the Crystal River in Citrus County, Florida.

title: Crystal River Energy Complex
text: Crystal River 1, 2, 4, and 5 are fossil fuel power plants, while Crystal River 3 is the sole nuclear power plant on the site.

title: Crystal River Energy Complex
text: The complex was developed in the early 1960s by the Florida Power Corporation and sold to Progress Energy Inc in 2000.

title: Crystal River Energy Complex
text: Following Progress Energy's merger with Duke Energy in 2012, the facility is owned and operated by Duke Energy.

title: Darrell Crate
text: Darrell W. Crate (born 1967) is an American investor, private equity manager, and philanthropist.

title: Darrell Crate
text: He served as the chief financial officer of Affiliated Managers Group.

title: Darrell Crate
text: He is currently a managing principal of Easterly Capital, a private equity firm in Beverly, Massachusetts he founded in 2009.

title: East Tennessee Natural Gas Pipeline
text: East Tennessee Natural Gas Pipeline is a natural gas pipeline that brings gas from eastern Tennessee to Virginia and North Carolina.

title: East Tennessee Natural Gas Pipeline
text: It was formerly owned by Duke Energy, but is now owned by Duke Energy's spin-off business Spectra Energy.

title: East Tennessee Natural Gas Pipeline
text: Its FERC code is 2.

title: Gulfstream Natural Gas Pipeline
text: Gulfstream Natural Gas Pipeline is a natural gas pipeline that brings gas from Mississippi and Alabama, underwater across the Gulf of Mexico, to Florida.

title: Gulfstream Natural Gas Pipeline
text: It was owned by Duke Energy, but is now owned by Duke Energy's spin-off company Spectra Energy.

title: Gulfstream Natural Gas Pipeline
text: Its FERC code is 183.

title: Duke Energy Florida
text: Duke Energy Florida, formerly Florida Power, was the generation, transmission, and distribution sector of Florida Progress Corporation.

title: Duke Energy Florida
text: The company distributed power over much of central and north Florida.

title: Duke Energy Florida
text: Florida Progress merged with Carolina Power & Light in 2000 to form Progress Energy.

title: Duke Energy Florida
text: Progress Energy merged with Duke Energy in 2012.

title: Duke Energy Florida
text: Today the Florida operations operate as Duke Energy Florida.

title: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline
text: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline is a proposed natural gas pipeline to run from central Alabama through southwest Georgia to Orange County.

title: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline
text: A minority stake in the venture is owned by NextEra Energy and Duke Energy.

title: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline
text: The pipeline has been being planned since before 2011.

title: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline
text: In July 2013 it was announced that Florida Power & Light Company (FPL) jointly awarded its parent corporation, NextEra Energy and Spectra Energy the bid to build the pipeline.

title: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline
text: In May 2015, Duke Energy bought an interest in the venture.

title: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline
text: Construction began in September 2016.

title: Sabal Trail Transmission Pipeline
text: The pipeline is currently scheduled to be in service by June 2017.

title: Progress Energy Inc
text: Progress Energy, headquartered in Raleigh, North Carolina, is a subsidiary of Duke Energy and prior to its merger with Duke Energy was a Fortune 500 energy company with more than 21,000 megawatts of generation capacity and $9 billion in annual revenues.

title: Progress Energy Inc
text: Progress Energy includes two major electric utilities that serve approximately 3.1 million customers in the Carolinas and Florida.

title: Progress Energy Inc
text: As an independent company, the last chairman and CEO of Progress Energy was William D. Johnson; his predecessor was Robert McGehee, who died on October 9, 2007 at the age of 64 of a stroke while on a business trip to London.

title: Sean Healey
text: Sean Michael Healey (born 1961) is the chairman and chief executive officer of Affiliated Managers Group, Inc. (NYSE: AMG), a global asset management firm whose affiliates in aggregate managed approximately $638 billion as of March 31, 2015.

title: Crescent Communities
text: In 1939, Duke Power (now Duke Energy) established a forestry department to manage company land not used for power generation.

title: Crescent Communities
text: In 1963 this department became the company South Carolina Land and Timber.

title: Crescent Communities
text: As the holdings expanded to include land in North Carolina, the organization was renamed Crescent Land and Timber in 1969.

title: Crescent Communities
text: Some of the original land was sold to Crescent Land and Timber by the Singer Corporation.

title: Crescent Communities
text: In the mid-1980s the company was renamed Crescent Resources as it began to actively develop residential communities.

title: Crescent Communities
text: Crescent Resources began work on its first commercial development, Coliseum Centre, in 1990.

title: Crescent Communities
text: As of 1991, Crescent Resources managed 270,000 acres of land.

title: Crescent Communities
text: Holdings included part of what became Lake James State Park, which it later sold to the state of North Carolina.

title: Crescent Communities
text: Crescent Resources became a separate entity from Duke Energy in 2006 with Duke Energy selling its 49% stake to Morgan Stanley.

title: Crescent Communities
text: Crescent Resources filed for bankruptcy in 2009 and has emerged from it separated from the utility company.

title: Crescent Communities
text: The company aimed to rebrand itself, renaming itself "Crescent Communities" in 2013.

title: Notorious (The Saturdays song)

text: The line up consisted of Frankie Bridge, Una Healy, Rochelle Humes, Mollie King and Vanessa White.

text: Written by Alexander Kronlund and Lukas Hilbert with production from Hilbert and James Reynolds, the song was released as the collection's lead single on 8 August 2010 as a digital download and on 9 August as a CD single.

text: It features an electropop production, incorporating elements of synthpop.

title: Missing You (The Saturdays song)
text: The group described the song as "an updated version of their sound" and was fun to record and experiment with.

text: "Missing You is more out-there than that rest of

title: Vanessa White
text: Vanessa Karen White (born 30 October 1989) is an English singer-songwriter, dancer and actress.

title: Vanessa White
text: She rose to fame in 2008 as a member of British-Irish girl group The Saturdays, signed to Fascination and Polydor Records.

title: Vanessa White
text: The group have achieved substantial success with numerous top-ten hits as well as a number one single.

title: Vanessa White
text: She is the youngest member of the group.

title: List of Girls Aloud concert tours
text: British-Irish girl group Girls Aloud have embarked on six concert tours of the United Kingdom and Ireland, five of which were in arena-sized venues.

title: Higher (The Saturdays song)
text: "Higher" is a song performed by British-Irish girl group The Saturdays taken from their debut extended play, "Headlines!

title: Higher (The Saturdays song)
text: Written by Ina Wroldsen and co-written & produced by Arnthor Birgisson, the song confirmed to be the EP's second single when it was released on 1 November 2010 by Fascination Records.

title: Higher (The Saturdays song)
text: In preparation for its release, the single was remixed to feature new vocals from American rapper Flo Rida after the rapper's single "Club Can't Handle Me" beat the group's previous single "Missing You" to number one; it was the second time they had lost the position to Flo Rida.

title: Higher (The Saturdays song)
text: Rochelle Wiseman jokingly said that the group would never get a number one until they collaborated with him.

title: Forever Is Over
text: "Forever Is Over" is a single by British-Irish girl group The Saturdays.

title: Forever Is Over
text: The track was released by digital download on 3 October 2009, and CD single the following day.

title: Forever Is Over
text: The song was written by, Louis Biancaniello, Kahmarl Gordon, Sam Watters, James Bourne and produced by The Runaways.

title: Forever Is Over
text: It was released as the lead single from the group's second studio album "Wordshaker".

title: On Your Radar
text: On Your Radar is the third studio album by British-Irish girl group The Saturdays.

title: On Your Radar
text: The album was released 21 November 2011 under Fascination Records.

title: On Your Radar
text: The album was recorded in Los Angeles and London.

title: On Your Radar
text: Steve Mac, who has been instrumental in the production of the band's previous albums, serves as a major collaborator.

title: On Your Radar
text: Additional producers and songwriters include Lucas Secon, Taio Cruz, Labrinth, Tracklacers, Space Cowboy, Brian Higgins and Lucie Silvas.

title: Headlines!
text: Headlines!

title: Headlines!
text: is the debut EP by British-Irish girl group The Saturdays.

title: Headlines!
text: It was released in Ireland on 13 August 2010 and in the United Kingdom on 16 August 2010 by Fascination Records.

title: Headlines!
text: The collection includes previous singles "Forever Is Over" and "Ego" as well as a remix of "One Shot" from "Wordshaker" and five new songs recorded in 2010.

title: Headlines!
text: One of these is a cover of the song "Died in Your Eyes", originally from Kristinia DeBarge's 2009 album "Exposed".

title: Headlines!
text: The album was preceded by the release of the lead single "Missing You" on 5 August 2010.

title: Headlines!
text: It became the group's seventh top-ten hit when it peaked at number three in the UK and number six in Ireland.

title: Issues (The Saturdays song)

title: Issues (The Saturdays song)
text: "Issues" was officially released on 5 January 2009 in the United Kingdom.

title: Issues (The Saturdays song)
text: The single gained to mixed reviews from pop music critics.

title: Rockin' All Over the World
text: "Rockin' All Over the World" is a rock song written by John Fogerty, formerly of Creedence Clearwater Revival.

title: Rockin' All Over the World
text: It made its debut on Fogerty's second solo album (see "John Fogerty") in 1975.

title: Rockin' All Over the World
text: It was also released as a single, spending six weeks in the US top 40, peaking at #27. "

title: Rockin' All Over the World
text: Rolling Stone" critic Dave Marsh considered the song a good choice for the album's lead single, although he claimed that it was "little more than the formulaic CCR sound with the title repeated over and over, like a chant."

title: Rockin' All Over the World
text: Status Quo recorded their own, heavier arrangement of Fogerty's song for their 1977 album "Rockin' All Over the World".

title: Duke Tumatoe
text: Duke Tumatoe, born William “Bill" Severen Fiorio in 1947, is an American blues guitarist, vocalist and songwriter.

title: Duke Tumatoe
text: He has gigged with Muddy Waters, Bo Diddley, B.B. King, Willie Dixon, Buddy Guy, John Fogerty and George Thorogood.

title: Duke Tumatoe
text: He was a founding member of arena-rock giants REO Speedwagon.

title: Duke Tumatoe
text: He has released fifteen albums as the bandleader of Duke Tumatoe & The All-Star Frogs and Duke Tumatoe & The Power Trio.

title: Duke Tumatoe
text: His 1988 live album " I Like My Job" was produced by John Fogerty.

title: Duke Tumatoe
text: He typically plays more than 200 dates per year.

title: Centerfield (song)
text: "Centerfield" is the title track from John Fogerty's album "Centerfield", Fogerty's first solo album after a nine-year hiatus.

title: Centerfield (song)
text: Originally the b-side of the album's second single, "Rock And Roll Girls" (#16 US, Spring 1985), the song is now commonly played at baseball games across the United States.

title: Centerfield (song)
text: Along with "Take Me Out To The Ball Game," it is one of the best-known baseball songs."

title: Centerfield (song)
text: In 2010, Fogerty became the only musician to be celebrated at the Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony when "Centerfield" was honored by the National Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: The Blue Ridge Rangers Rides Again
text: The Blue Ridge Rangers Rides Again is the eighth solo studio album by American roots rock singer-songwriter and guitarist John Fogerty, first released on August 25, 2009, on Fogerty's own label, Fortunate Son Records and distributed by Verve Forecast Records.

title: The Blue Ridge Rangers Rides Again
text: The apparent grammatical error in the title of the album (the verb should be conjugated 'ride,' not 'rides') is a play on the fact that the original Blue Ridge Rangers (on the 1973 album "The Blue Ridge Rangers") consisted entirely of Fogerty singing all the vocals and playing all the instruments by himself.

title: The Long Road Home
text: The Long Road Home: The Ultimate John Fogerty/Creedence Collection is a compilation album by American roots rock singer-songwriter John Fogerty, released on November 1, 2005, by Fantasy Records.

title: The Long Road Home
text: It compiles songs from Fogerty's solo career and his band Creedence Clearwater Revival.

title: The Long Road Home
text: The title refers to Fogerty's return to Fantasy Records, after a lengthy stint with Warner Bros.

title: The Long Road Home
text: Records and a brief stint with DreamWorks Records.

title: John Frederick Fogerty
text: John Frederick Fogerty {'1': ", '2': ", '3': 'ARIBA', '4': "} (1863–1938), was an Irish architect and engineer active in mid- to late-19th-century Limerick, London, Shropshire, Bournemouth, Pretoria, and Zambia.

title: John Frederick Fogerty
text: Born in Limerick, he was the son of architect William Fogerty, grandson of architect and engineer John Fogerty (engineer), and nephew of engineer and novelist Joseph Fogerty.

title: John Frederick Fogerty
text: He earned a bachelor's degree in engineering from Queen's College, Cork in 1883, and attended the South Kensington Art School the year later.

title: John Frederick Fogerty
text: He was articled to Sir Thomas Drew.

title: John Frederick Fogerty
text: In 1889, he established his office at Wellington, Shropshire, and entered into partnership with Reginald George Pinder in Bournemouth in 1893, later amalgamating Pearce & Parnell of Bournemouth in 1902.

title: John Frederick Fogerty
text: He emigrated to South Africa in 1914 and enlisted at the outbreak of the First World War, serving time in South Africa, the Isle of Wight, Palestine, and Poona, India.

title: John Frederick Fogerty
text: During the interwar period, he worked as an engineer in Pretoria's Public Works Department, before becoming borough surveyor in Lusaka, Zambia, in 1926, where he died in 1938.

title: John Fogerty (album)
text: John Fogerty is the second solo studio album by former Creedence Clearwater Revival vocalist/guitarist John Fogerty, released in 1975.

title: John Fogerty (album)
text: It was released by Asylum Records in the United States and Fantasy Records internationally.

title: John Fogerty (album)
text: As with the Creedence Clearwater Revival records, the album consists of a mix of originals and cover songs.

title: John Fogerty (album)
text: Although the album is eponymously titled, Fogerty himself refers to it as "Old Shep"; Shep was the name of his dog, who appears on the cover with him.

title: John Fogerty (engineer)
text: John Fogerty was an Irish millwright, architect, builder, and civil engineer, active in early to mid-19th-century Limerick.

title: John Fogerty (engineer)
text: He was the brother of Joseph Fogerty, Sr. and the father of engineer and novelist Joseph Fogerty of London, architect William Fogerty of Dublin, and grandfather of architect John Frederick Fogerty.

title: John Fogerty (engineer)
text: He retired as an architect sometime between 1870 and 1879.

title: Joseph Fogerty Sr.
text: Joseph Fogerty Sr. was an Irish builder and architect active in nineteenth-century Limerick.

title: Joseph Fogerty Sr.
text: Born in Limerick into a family of builders, he was the father of Robert Fogerty and George J. Fogerty; brother of John Fogerty (engineer), uncle of engineer and novelist Joseph Fogerty of London and architect William Fogerty of Dublin, and great uncle of architect John Frederick Fogerty.

title: Joseph Fogerty Sr.
text: He designed and built the Theatre Royal, Limerick, Henry Street.

title: Joseph Fogerty Sr.
text: From the 1870s until his death, he was partners with his son Robert in the firm Joseph Fogerty & Son.

title: Almost Saturday Night
text: "Almost Saturday Night" is a song written by John Fogerty and first released on his 1975 album "John Fogerty".

title: Almost Saturday Night
text: It was released as a single and reached #78.

title: Almost Saturday Night
