text: It was also covered by a number of artists, including Dave Edmunds, who also released it as a single to more success, Gene Clark, Ricky Nelson, The Searchers and The Georgia Satellites.

title: 1929–30 British Home Championship
text: The 1929-30 British Home Championship was an edition of the annual international football tournament played between the British Home Nations.

title: 1929–30 British Home Championship
text: 1930 was the year in which the tournament finally gained a serious rival as the premier international football competition, with the inception of the 1930 FIFA World Cup, held in Uruguay.

title: 1929–30 British Home Championship
text: The Home Nations were not however members of FIFA due to disputes over the growing professionalism in continental and South American football.

title: 1929–30 British Home Championship
text: As a result, they were not able to attend and indicated that even if they were invited they would have no interest in attending, deeming foreign opposition too weak for serious contest.

title: 1929–30 British Home Championship
text: It is interesting to speculate what would have happened had the Home Nations entered the tournament, especially as the tide of world football was changing against Britain.

title: 1929–30 British Home Championship
text: The England team, which dominated the 1930 championship, had lost to Spain the year before in the first defeat by a foreign football team, and in the same year they only managed draws with Germany and Austria.

title: 1929–30 British Home Championship
text: The Scottish side, which had won most of the previous ten championships, was likewise unprepared, only playing its first game outside the British Isles in 1929, and being heavily defeated on tour in 1931 by both the Austrians and the Italians.

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: EAFF E-1 Football Championship, known as the East Asian Football Championship from 2003 to 2010, and the EAFF East Asian Cup for the 2013 and 2015 editions, is a men's international football competition in East Asia for member nations of the East Asian Football Federation (EAFF).

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: Before the EAFF was founded in 2002, the Dynasty Cup was held between the East Asian top four teams, and was regarded as the unofficial East Asian Championship.

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: There is a separate competition for both men (first held in 2003) and women (first held in 2005).

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: There was also a combined points competition in 2005, where the results of the men's and women's teams are added together (not including qualifiers).

title: Gambia women's national football team
text: The Gambia women's national football team represents the Gambia in international football competition.

title: Gambia women's national football team
text: The team, however, has not competed in a match recognised by FIFA, the sport's international governing body, despite that organised women's football has been played in the country since 1998.

title: Gambia women's national football team
text: The Gambia has two youth teams, an under-17 side that has competed in FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup qualifiers, and an under-19 side that withdrew from regional qualifiers for an under-19 World Cup.

title: Gambia women's national football team
text: The development of a national team faces challenges similar to those across Africa, although the national football association has four staff members focusing on women's football.

title: Liu Ailing
text: Liu Ailing (; born June 2, 1967) is a Chinese former footballer who played for the China national team at the 1991, 1995 and 1999 editions of the FIFA Women's World Cup.

title: Liu Ailing
text: She won a silver medal at the 1996 Atlanta Olympics and participated at the 2000 Sydney Olympics.

title: Liu Ailing
text: A playmaking midfielder, she played professional club football in Japan and the United States.

title: Women's Nordic Football Championship
text: Women's Nordic Football Championship was an international football competition contested by the women's national football teams of the Nordic countries.

title: Women's Nordic Football Championship
text: The tournament was held annually between 1974 and 1982.

title: Women's Nordic Football Championship
text: Finland, Denmark and Sweden competed from the start, Norway joined the tournament in 1978.

title: Women's Nordic Football Championship
text: Iceland and Faroe Islands did not take part at the competition.

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship (women)
text: EAFF E-1 Football Championship is an international football competition in East Asia for national teams of the East Asian Football Federation (EAFF).

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship (women)
text: The competition between women's national teams is held alongside men's competition.

title: 2016 COTIF Tournament
text: The 2016 L'Alcúdia International Football Tournament is a football competition which took place in July and August 2016.

title: 2016 COTIF Tournament
text: The 2016 edition was the first to feature only international youth teams.

title: 2016 COTIF Tournament
text: Previous editions have contained a mix of national selections and club selections.

title: Togo women's national football team
text: The Togo women's national football team (French: "Équipe du Togo féminine de football" ) represents the Togolese Republic in women's international football competition since 2006.

title: Togo women's national football team
text: Togo is managed by the Fédération Togolaise de Football (FTF), the governing body of football in Togo.

title: Togo women's national football team
text: The team only played five FIFA-recognised matches, all in 2006.

title: Togo women's national football team
text: Their current manager is Paul Zoungbede.

title: Togo women's national football team
text: Togo's home stadium is the Stade de Kégué, located in Lomé.

title: Geri Donnelly
text: Geraldine "Geri" Donnelly (born 30 November 1965) is a Canadian former soccer player.

title: Geri Donnelly
text: A midfielder, she represented Canada at the 1995 and 1999 editions of the FIFA Women's World Cup and was named Canadian Player of the Year in 1996 and 1999.

title: Geri Donnelly
text: Donnelly was part of the Canadian squad who won the 1998 CONCACAF Women's Championship.

title: Geri Donnelly
text: She was selected as a member of the Canadian Soccer Hall of Fame in 2014.

title: FIFA Women's World Cup
text: The FIFA Women's World Cup is an international football competition contested by the senior women's national teams of the members of "Fédération Internationale de Football Association" (FIFA), the sport's global governing body.

title: FIFA Women's World Cup
text: The competition has been held every four years since 1991, when the inaugural tournament, then called the Women's World Championship, was held in China.

title: Richard Honaker
text: Richard Henderson Honaker (born March 10, 1951) is a lawyer in Rock Springs, Wyoming who was nominated on March 19, 2007, by U.S. President George W. Bush to serve as one of three U.S. District Judges for the District of Wyoming.

title: Richard Honaker
text: The nomination was given the highest "well qualified" rating by the judicial evaluation committee of the American Bar Association.

title: Richard Honaker
text: Honaker was initially recommended to Bush by U.S. Senator Craig L. Thomas of Wyoming, who died some three months later.

title: Richard Honaker
text: Honaker had co-chaired Thomas' reelection campaign in 2006 in Rock Springs.

title: Richard Honaker
text: Honaker never obtained a Senate vote on his confirmation.

title: Richard Honaker
text: The succession of Barack Obama to the presidency ended his candidacy.

title: Richard Honaker
text: Had he been confirmed, Honaker would have succeeded Judge Clarence A. Brimmer in Cheyenne.

title: Richard Honaker
text: Nancy D. Freudenthal was subsequently nominated and confirmed to the seat.

title: Ambulanse
text: Ambulance (Original title: "Ambulanse") is a collection of short stories by the Norwegian author Johan Harstad, published in 2002.

title: Ambulanse
text: The collection contains eleven short stories, all connected to each other.

title: Ambulanse
text: The main character in one of the stories shows up as an 'extra' in the next, and several stories are told from different angles.

title: Ambulanse
text: The overall link between the short stories is an ambulance driving through an unnamed city.

title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find and Other Stories
text: A Good Man Is Hard to Find and Other Stories (published in England as The Artificial Nigger and Other Tales) is a collection of short stories by American author Flannery O'Connor.

title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find and Other Stories
text: The collection was first published in 1955.

title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find and Other Stories
text: The subjects of the short stories range from baptism ("The River") to serial killers ("A Good Man Is Hard to Find") to human greed and exploitation ("The Life You Save May Be Your Own").

title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find and Other Stories
text: The majority of the stories include jarring violent scenes that make the characters undergo a spiritual change.

title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find and Other Stories
text: The short stories commonly have tones of Catholicism related to life and death scenarios.

title: A Good Man Is Hard to Find and Other Stories
text: For instance, in the story "A Good Man Is Hard To Find" the villain states, "She would have been a good woman if it had been somebody there to shoot her every minute of her life."

title: Richard Marsh (author)
text: Richard Marsh (12 October 1857 – 9 August 1915) was the pseudonym of the English author born Richard Bernard Heldmann.

title: Richard Marsh (author)
text: A best-selling and prolific author of the late 19th century and the Edwardian period, Marsh is best known now for his supernatural thriller novel "The Beetle", which was published the same year as Bram Stoker's "Dracula" (1897), and was initially even more popular.

title: Richard Marsh (author)
text: "The Beetle" remained in print until 1960.

title: Richard Marsh (author)
text: Marsh produced nearly 80 volumes of fiction and numerous short stories, in genres including horror, crime, romance and humour.

title: Richard Marsh (author)
text: Many of these have been republished recently, beginning with "The Beetle" in 2004.

title: Richard Marsh (author)
text: Marsh's grandson Robert Aickman was a notable writer of short "strange stories".

title: J. J. Syvrud
text: J. J. Syvrud (born May 10, 1977) is a former American football linebacker who played one season with the New York Jets of the National Football League.

title: J. J. Syvrud
text: He was drafted by the New York Jets in the seventh round of the 1999 NFL Draft.

title: J. J. Syvrud
text: He played college football at Jamestown College and attended Rock Springs High School in Rock Springs, Wyoming.

title: The Rest of the Robots
text: The Rest of the Robots is a collection of eight short stories and two full-length novels by American writer Isaac Asimov, published in 1964.

title: The Rest of the Robots
text: The stories, centred on positronic robots, are all part of the "Robot" series, most of which take place in the "Foundation" universe.

title: The Rest of the Robots
text: Another collection of short stories about robots, "I, Robot", was re-published in the previous year, which is why Asimov chose to title the collection as "The Rest of the Robots".

title: The Rest of the Robots
text: None of the short stories in this collection were in "I, Robot", however all of them were later included in "The Complete Robot", and both novels about Elijah Baley were also published separately.

title: Vacuum Diagrams
text: Vacuum Diagrams is a collection of science fiction short stories by British writer Stephen Baxter.

title: Vacuum Diagrams
text: The collection connects the novels of the Xeelee Sequence and also shows the history of mankind in the Xeelee universe, and ultimately the universe.

title: Vacuum Diagrams
text: While each short story in the collection is self-contained, the stories are presented as being contained in the context of the first story, "Eve", about a man (seemingly Jack Raoul from the portion of the timeline concerned with the silver ghosts) who is forced to witness the events in the short stories by a god-like being.

title: Vacuum Diagrams
text: "Eve" acts as a structure for the short stories, with an introduction at the beginning of "Vacuum Diagrams", short scenes occurring between each "era" (with "Eve" character explaining and introducing the next section), and an ending that wraps up the plot for the "Eve" story itself.

title: Vacuum Diagrams
text: "Vacuum Diagrams" won the Philip K. Dick Award in 1999.

title: Rock Springs (short story collection)
text: Rock Springs is a collection of short stories by author Richard Ford, published in 1987 and largely dealing with dysfunctional mothers and fathers and their effects on young male narrators.

title: Mai Al-Nakib
text: Mai Al-Nakib is author of "The Hidden Light of Objects", a collection of linked short stories published by Bloomsbury in 2014.

title: Mai Al-Nakib
text: The collection won the Edinburgh International Book Festival's 2014 First Book Award, the first collection of short stories to win.

title: Mai Al-Nakib
text: Her short stories have appeared in "Ninth Letter""," "The First Line", and the anthology "Novel of the World""."

title: Mai Al-Nakib
text: Two of her stories received honorable mention in "Glimmer Train" competitions.

title: Mai Al-Nakib
text: "The Hidden Light of Objects" is her first collection of short stories.

title: Richard Ford
text: Richard Ford (born February 16, 1944) is an American novelist and short story writer.

title: Richard Ford
text: His best-known works are the novel "The Sportswriter" and its sequels, "Independence Day", "The Lay of the Land" and "Let Me Be Frank With You", and the short story collection "Rock Springs", which contains several widely anthologized stories.

title: Folie à Deux (album)
text: Folie à Deux ( ; French for "A Madness Shared by Two") is the fourth studio album by American rock band Fall Out Boy.

title: Folie à Deux (album)
text: Produced by Neal Avron, the album was recorded from July to September 2008 at The Pass Studios and The Casita in Hollywood, California.

title: Folie à Deux (album)
text: As the follow-up to the band's commercially successful 2007 effort "Infinity on High", it was released by Island Records on December 16, 2008, after the original November 4 release was postponed to avoid conflicts with the United States presidential election.

title: Folie à Deux (album)
text: Like the band's two previous releases, "Folie à Deux" was musically composed by lead vocalist and guitarist Patrick Stump, with lyrics penned by bassist Pete Wentz.

title: Folie à Deux (album)
text: In regard to the writing process, the band considered "Folie à Deux" to be the band's most collaborative record at the time.

title: I Don't Care (Fall Out Boy song)
text: "I Don't Care" is a song by American rock band Fall Out Boy and the lead single from the group's fourth studio album "Folie à Deux" in 2008.

title: I Don't Care (Fall Out Boy song)
text: It was first available for listening on the band's website and mozes.com on September 3, 2008.

title: I Don't Care (Fall Out Boy song)
text: The song impacted radio on September 16.

title: I Don't Care (Fall Out Boy song)
text: It is its album's best known song, being certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA), denoting shipments of one million units, with over 500,000 sales in its first four months alone.

title: I Don't Care (Fall Out Boy song)
text: In the United States, the song reached No. 21 on the "Billboard" Hot 100, placing lower than the No. 2 lead single, "This Ain't a Scene, It's an Arms Race", of the band's previous 2007 album "Infinity on High".

title: I Don't Care (Fall Out Boy song)
text: It received radio play at Modern Rock and Pop stations, charting at No. 21 on "Billboard"'s Hot Modern Rock Tracks and No. 22 on Pop Songs.

title: Welcome to the New Administration
text: Welcome to the New Administration was a viral campaign and mixtape launched by Fall Out Boy bass guitarist Pete Wentz on August 18, 2008 to promote what is now known to be the group's fourth studio album, "Folie à Deux".

title: Welcome to the New Administration
text: The mixtape was made available to stream and download on November 4, 2008, containing snippets and demos from Fall Out Boy as well as various Decaydance artists.

title: America's Suitehearts
text: "America's Suitehearts" is a song by American rock band Fall Out Boy and the second single taken from their fourth studio album, "Folie à Deux" (2008).

title: America's Suitehearts
text: Initially released to iTunes in promotion before the album's release, "America's Suitehearts" was later serviced to radio on January 20, 2009.

title: America's Suitehearts
text: A demo/snippet titled "America's Sweethearts" was included on the band's mixtape, "Welcome to the New Administration", as part of their viral campaign in promotion of their record.

title: America's Suitehearts
text: The music video was unveiled at 3PM on January 1, 2009 on The N.

title: America's Suitehearts
text: Bassist/lyricist Pete Wentz commented that the song was about society's fixation with celebrities.

title: America's Suitehearts
text: The music was composed by vocalist/guitarist Patrick Stump.

title: Daughtry (album)
text: Daughtry is the self-titled debut studio album by American rock band Daughtry, the band formed and fronted by "American Idol" fifth season finalist Chris Daughtry.

title: Daughtry (album)
text: It was released on November 21, 2006, by RCA Records.

title: Daughtry (album)
text: The album is the fastest selling debut rock album in Soundscan history and the band's best-selling album.

title: What a Catch, Donnie
text: "What a Catch, Donnie" is Fall Out Boy's second digital download single and third radio single from their fourth studio album "Folie à Deux" (2008).

title: What a Catch, Donnie
text: It was first released as part of the buildup to the new album on iTunes on October 14, 2008 and charted on the US and Canadian singles charts.

title: What a Catch, Donnie
text: The track features numerous musicians performing cameo appearances in the song, singing lines from past Fall Out Boy songs.

title: What a Catch, Donnie
text: Bassist/lyricist Pete Wentz has said that he wrote the song to remind himself of vocalist/guitarist Patrick Stump.

title: What a Catch, Donnie
text: Musically it is one of the band's very few ballads.

title: What a Catch, Donnie
text: Fall Out Boy played the song live on "Late Night with Jimmy Fallon".

title: Weezer discography
text: The discography of Weezer, an American rock band, consists of 10 studio albums, two compilation albums, one video album, six extended plays, twenty-eight singles and twenty-four music videos. Weezer's self-titled debut studio album, often referred to as "The Blue Album", was released in May 1994 through DGC Records.

title: Weezer discography
text: The album was a huge commercial success, peaking at number 16 on the US "Billboard" 200 and spawning the singles "Undone – The Sweater Song" and "Buddy Holly", both of which were responsible for launching Weezer into mainstream success with the aid of music videos directed by Spike Jonze.

title: Weezer discography
text: It has sold 3.3 million copies in the United States and has been certified triple platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA), becoming the band's best selling album to date.

title: Weezer discography
text: Following the success of their debut album, Weezer took a break from touring for the Christmas holidays.

title: Weezer discography
text: Lead singer Rivers Cuomo began piecing together demo material for Weezer's second studio album.

title: Weezer discography
text: Cuomo's original concept for the album was a space-themed rock opera, "Songs from the Black Hole".

title: Weezer discography
text: Ultimately, the "Songs from the Black Hole" album concept was dropped; the band, however, continued to utilize songs from these sessions into work for their second studio album. "

title: Weezer discography
text: Pinkerton" was released as the band's second studio album in September 1996.

title: Weezer discography
text: Peaking at number 19 on the "Billboard" 200, it was considered a critical and commercial failure at the time of its release, selling far less than its triple platinum predecessor.

title: Weezer discography
text: However, in the years following its release, it has seen much critical and commercial championing.

title: Believers Never Die Tour Part Deux
text: The Believers Never Die Tour Part Deux was a two-month concert tour headlined by American rock band Fall Out Boy in 2009 to support the release of their 2008 album "Folie à Deux".

title: Believers Never Die Tour Part Deux
text: Starting on April 3 and finishing on May 17, the opening acts were Cobra Starship, All Time Low, Metro Station, and Hey Monday.

title: Believers Never Die Tour Part Deux
text: 50 Cent played select dates on the tour as well, replacing Metro Station.

title: Believers Never Die Tour Part Deux
text: The tour's name was based on Fall Out Boy's 2004 Believers Never Die tour.

title: Believers Never Die Tour Part Deux
text: This was Fall Out Boy's final headlining tour before going on hiatus in late 2009, and their "Believers Never Die - Greatest Hits" album shares the same name.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: The Steve Miller Band is an American rock band formed in 1966 in San Francisco, California.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: The band is led by Steve Miller on guitar and lead vocals.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: It is best known today for a string of (mainly) mid-1970s hit singles that are staples of classic rock radio, as well as several earlier acid rock albums.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: Miller left his first band to move to San Francisco and form the Steve Miller Blues Band.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: Shortly after Harvey Kornspan negotiated the band’s landmark contract with Capitol Records in 1967, the band shortened its name to the Steve Miller Band.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: In February 1968, the band recorded its debut album, "Children of the Future".

title: Steve Miller Band
text: It went on to produce the albums "Sailor", "Brave New World", "Your Saving Grace", "Number 5", "Rock Love" and more.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: The band's "Greatest Hits 1974–78", released in 1978, sold over 13 million copies.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: The band continued to produce more albums and in 2014 toured with the rock band Journey.

title: Steve Miller Band
text: In 2016, Steve Miller was inducted as a solo artist in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

title: Headfirst Slide into Cooperstown on a Bad Bet
text: "Headfirst Slide into Cooperstown on a Bad Bet" is a song by the American rock band Fall Out Boy from their fourth studio album "Folie à Deux" (2008).

title: Headfirst Slide into Cooperstown on a Bad Bet
text: It was initially released as a digital single as part of the buildup to the new album on iTunes on October 7, 2008.

title: Headfirst Slide into Cooperstown on a Bad Bet
text: The song impacted United States modern rock radio on June 15, 2009.

title: Dostoevsky and Parricide
text: "Dostoevsky and Parricide" (German: "Dostojewski und die Vatertötung" ) is an introductory article contributed by Sigmund Freud to a scholarly collection on "The Brothers Karamazov" by Fyodor Dostoyevsky.

title: Dostoevsky and Parricide
text: The collection was published in 1928.

title: Dostoevsky and Parricide
text: The article argues that it is no coincidence that some of the greatest works of world literature - including "Oedipus Rex", "Hamlet", as well as "The Brothers Karamazov" – all concern parricide, which in Dostoevsky's case Freud links to his epilepsy.

title: Critical approaches to Hamlet
text: From its premiere at the turn of the 17th century, "Hamlet" has remained Shakespeare's best-known, most-imitated, and most-analyzed play.

title: Critical approaches to Hamlet
text: The character of Hamlet played a critical role in Sigmund Freud's explanation of the Oedipus complex and thus influenced modern psychology.

title: Critical approaches to Hamlet
text: Even within the narrower field of literature, the play's influence has been strong.

title: Critical approaches to Hamlet
text: As Foakes writes, "No other character's name in Shakespeare's plays, and few in literature, have come to embody an attitude to life  and been converted into a noun in this way."

title: The Assault on Truth
text: The Assault on Truth: Freud's Suppression of the Seduction Theory is a book by Jeffrey Moussaieff Masson, in which the author argues that Sigmund Freud deliberately suppressed his early hypothesis, known as the seduction theory, that hysteria is caused by sexual abuse during infancy, because he refused to believe that children are the victims of sexual violence and abuse within their own families.

title: The Assault on Truth
text: Masson reached this conclusion while he had access to some of Freud's unpublished letters as projects director of the Sigmund Freud Archives.

title: The Assault on Truth
text: "The Assault on Truth" was first published in 1984, and several revised editions have since been published.

title: Peter Swales (historian)
text: Peter J. Swales (born 1948) is a Welsh "guerilla historian of psychoanalysis", and former assistant to the Rolling Stones, who has written essays and letters about Sigmund Freud.

title: Peter Swales (historian)
text: A 1998 article in The New Republic magazine noted his "...remarkable detective work over the last 25 years, revealing the true identities of several early patients of Freud's who had been known only by their pseudonyms."

title: Peter Swales (historian)
text: He is one of three men (the others are Freud Archives director Kurt R. Eissler and psychoanalyst Jeffrey Masson) whose machinations are described in the 1984 book In The Freud Archives, which originated as two articles in The New Yorker magazine that provoked Masson to file an unsuccessful $10 million libel suit against the magazine and its writer Janet Malcolm.

title: The Interpretation of Dreams
text: The Interpretation of Dreams (German: "Die Traumdeutung" ) is a 1899 book by psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud, in which the author introduces his theory of the unconscious with respect to dream interpretation, and discusses what would later become the theory of the Oedipus complex.

title: The Interpretation of Dreams
text: Freud revised the book at least eight times and, in the third edition, added an extensive section which treated dream symbolism very literally, following the influence of Wilhelm Stekel.

title: The Interpretation of Dreams
text: Freud said of this work, "Insight such as this falls to one's lot but once in a lifetime."

title: The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud
text: The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud is a biography of Sigmund Freud by Ernest Jones.

title: The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud
text: The most famous and influential biography of Freud, "The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud" was originally published in three volumes (first volume 1953, second volume 1955, third volume 1957); a one-volume edition abridged by literary critics Lionel Trilling and Steven Marcus followed in 1961.

title: The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud
text: When first published, "The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud" was acclaimed, and sales exceeded expectations.

title: The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud
text: Although his biography has retained its status as a classic, Jones has been criticized for presenting an overly favorable image of Freud.

title: Oedipus Rex
text: Oedipus Rex, also known by its Greek title, Oedipus Tyrannus (Ancient Greek: Οἰδίπους Τύραννος IPA: ), or Oedipus the King, is an Athenian tragedy by Sophocles that was first performed around 429 BC.

title: Oedipus Rex
text: Originally, to the ancient Greeks, the title was simply "Oedipus" ("Οἰδίπους"), as it is referred to by Aristotle in the "Poetics".

title: Oedipus Rex
text: It is thought to have been renamed "Oedipus Tyrannus" to distinguish it from "Oedipus at Colonus".

title: Oedipus Rex
text: In antiquity, the term “tyrant” referred to a ruler, but it did not necessarily have a negative connotation.

title: Why Freud Was Wrong
text: Why Freud Was Wrong: Sin, Science and Psychoanalysis (1995; second edition 1996; third edition 2005) is a book by Richard Webster, in which the author provided a critique of Sigmund Freud and psychoanalysis.

title: Why Freud Was Wrong
text: Webster argued that Freud became a kind of Messiah and that psychoanalysis is a pseudo-science and a disguised continuation of the Judaeo-Christian tradition.

title: Why Freud Was Wrong
text: Webster endorsed Gilbert Ryle's arguments against mentalist philosophies in "The Concept of Mind" (1949); he also criticized many other authors for their treatment of Freud and psychoanalysis.

title: Why Freud Was Wrong
text: The book for which Webster may be best remembered, "Why Freud Was Wrong" has been called "brilliant" and "definitive", but has also been criticized for shortcomings of scholarship and argument.

title: Why Freud Was Wrong
text: "Why Freud Was Wrong" formed part of the "Freud wars", an ongoing controversy around psychoanalysis.

title: Freud: A Life for Our Time
text: Freud: A Life for Our Time is a 1988 biography of Sigmund Freud, the founder of psychoanalysis, by the historian Peter Gay.

title: Freud: A Life for Our Time
text: The work is based partly on new material that has become available since the publication of Ernest Jones' "The Life and Work of Sigmund Freud" (1953).

title: Freud: A Life for Our Time
text: The book has been praised, but has also been criticized by several authors skeptical of psychoanalysis.

title: Freud and Philosophy
text: Freud and Philosophy: An Essay on Interpretation (French: "De l'interprétation.

title: Freud and Philosophy
text: Essai sur Sigmund Freud" ) is a 1965 book about Sigmund Freud by the philosopher Paul Ricœur.

title: Freud and Philosophy
text: Sometimes grouped with works such as Jürgen Habermas's "Knowledge and Human Interests" (1968), "Freud and Philosophy" has received praise, but critics have argued Ricœur provides a mistaken interpretation of Freud.

title: The Bite in the Apple
text: The Bite in the Apple: A Memoir of My Life with Steve Jobs is by Chrisann Brennan.

title: The Bite in the Apple
text: Brennan is an American painter, Steve Jobs' high school girlfriend, an early employee of Apple Inc. before it went public, and the mother of Jobs' first child Lisa Brennan-Jobs.

title: The Bite in the Apple
text: "The Bite in the Apple" was released on October 29, 2013.

title: Katherine Waterston
text: Katherine Boyer Waterston (born March 3, 1980) is an American actress.

title: Katherine Waterston
text: She made her feature film debut in "Michael Clayton" (2007).

title: Katherine Waterston
text: She then had supporting roles in films including "Robot & Frank," "Being Flynn" (both 2012) and "The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Her" (2013) before her supporting role as Shasta Fay Hepworth in Paul Thomas Anderson's "Inherent Vice" (2014).

title: Katherine Waterston
text: In 2015, she portrayed Chrisann Brennan in "Steve Jobs".

title: Katherine Waterston
text: She had starring roles in the Harry Potter prequel, "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them" (2016), and "" (2017), a prequel to Ridley Scott's 1979 film "Alien".

title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)
text: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them is a 2016 fantasy film directed by David Yates.

title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)
text: It is a prequel to the "Harry Potter" film series, and it was produced and written by J. K. Rowling in her screenwriting debut, and inspired by her 2001 book of the same name.

title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)
text: The film stars Eddie Redmayne as Newt Scamander, with Katherine Waterston, Dan Fogler, Alison Sudol, Ezra Miller, Samantha Morton, Jon Voight, Carmen Ejogo, Ron Perlman and Colin Farrell in supporting roles.

title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)
text: It is the first installment in the "Fantastic Beasts" series, and the ninth overall in J. K. Rowling's Wizarding World, the franchise that began with the "Harry Potter" films.

title: Logan Lucky
text: Logan Lucky is a 2017 American heist comedy film directed by Steven Soderbergh, based on an original script written by unknown newcomer Rebecca Blunt.

title: Logan Lucky
text: Soderbergh came out of retirement to direct the film and to distribute it independently through his own company Fingerprint Releasing.

title: Logan Lucky
text: The film features an ensemble cast consisting of Channing Tatum, Adam Driver, Riley Keough, Daniel Craig, Seth MacFarlane, Katie Holmes, Hilary Swank, Katherine Waterston and Sebastian Stan, and follows the unlucky Logan family who plan to rob the Charlotte Motor Speedway, and try to avoid getting caught by the FBI.

title: Chrisann Brennan
text: Chrisann Brennan (born September 29, 1954) is an American painter and writer who wrote the autobiography "The Bite in the Apple" about her relationship with Apple co-founder Steve Jobs.

title: Chrisann Brennan
text: She has one child, Lisa Brennan-Jobs.

title: Alien: Covenant
text: Alien: Covenant is a 2017 science fiction horror film directed by Ridley Scott, and written by John Logan and Dante Harper, with a story by Michael Green and Jack Paglen.

title: Alien: Covenant
text: The film is a sequel to "Prometheus" (2012), the second installment in the "Alien" prequel series and the sixth installment overall in the "Alien" film series, as well as the third directed by Scott.

title: Alien: Covenant
text: The film stars Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston, Billy Crudup, Danny McBride and Demián Bichir, and follows the crew of a colony ship that lands on an uncharted planet and makes a terrifying discovery.

title: The Current War
text: The Current War is a 2017 American biographical historical film directed by Alfonso Gomez-Rejon and written by Michael Mitnick.

title: The Current War
text: The film stars Benedict Cumberbatch, Michael Shannon, Nicholas Hoult, Tom Holland, Katherine Waterston, and Tuppence Middleton, and depicts the War of Currents between Thomas Edison and George Westinghouse.

title: Manhattan Romance
text: Manhattan Romance is a 2015 American romantic comedy film directed and written by Tom O'Brien.

title: Manhattan Romance
text: The film stars Gaby Hoffmann, Katherine Waterston, Zach Grenier, Caitlin FitzGerald and Louis Cancelmi.

title: Lisa Brennan-Jobs
text: Lisa Nicole Brennan-Jobs (born Lisa Nicole Brennan; May 17, 1978) is an American writer.

title: Lisa Brennan-Jobs
text: She is the daughter of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs and Chrisann Brennan.

title: Lisa Brennan-Jobs
text: For several years, Jobs denied paternity, which led to a legal case and various media reports in the early days of Apple; they eventually reconciled.

title: Lisa Brennan-Jobs
text: Brennan-Jobs later worked as a journalist and magazine writer.

title: Inherent Vice (film)
text: Inherent Vice is a 2014 American neo-noir comedy-drama film.

title: Inherent Vice (film)
text: The seventh feature film directed by Paul Thomas Anderson, "Inherent Vice" was adapted by Anderson from the novel of the same name by Thomas Pynchon; the cast includes Joaquin Phoenix, Josh Brolin, Owen Wilson, Katherine Waterston, Eric Roberts, Reese Witherspoon, Benicio del Toro, Jena Malone, Joanna Newsom, Jeannie Berlin, Maya Rudolph, Michael K. Williams and Martin Short.

title: Inherent Vice (film)
text: As with its source material, the storyline revolves around Larry "Doc" Sportello, a stoner hippie and PI in 1970, as he becomes embroiled in the Los Angeles criminal underworld while investigating three cases interrelated by the disappearance of his ex-girlfriend and her wealthy boyfriend.

title: Hubert Gagnon
text: Hubert Gagnon is an actor in the Canadian province of Quebec.

title: Hubert Gagnon
text: He is best known as the voice of Homer Simpson in the Quebec version of "The Simpsons", the voice of Mel Gibson in many movies, and also the character Picabo on the québécois TV show Les Oraliens.

title: Hubert Gagnon
text: He also dubbed the character Vernon Dursley in the famous Harry Potter films.

title: Hubert Gagnon
text: He was also the voice of Optimus Prime in the Quebec dubbing of the original "Transformers" cartoon, but for the 2007 film, he was replaced by Guy Nadon, who had coincidentally portrayed Sideshow Bob alongside Gagnon in the québécois dubbed version of The Simpsons.

title: Citizen Joe
text: "Citizen Joe" is the fifteenth episode for season eight of the Canadian-American military science fiction television series "Stargate SG-1".

title: Citizen Joe
text: The episode features known voice actor Dan Castellaneta, who voices Homer Simpson in "The Simpsons".

title: Citizen Joe
text: The episode was written by executive producer Robert C. Cooper, the episode was directed by Andy Mikita.

title: Citizen Joe
text: The episode received a below average Nielsen household rating and received no syndication rating to compare.

title: Citizen Joe
text: The episode got strong reviews from major media publishers worldwide.

title: Ned Flanders
text: Nedward "Ned" Flanders, Jr. is a recurring fictional character in the animated television series "The Simpsons".

title: Ned Flanders
text: He is voiced by Harry Shearer, and first appeared in the series premiere episode "Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire".

title: Ned Flanders
text: He is the good-natured, cheery next-door neighbor to the Simpson family and is generally loathed by Homer Simpson.

title: Ned Flanders
text: A devout Evangelical Christian with an annoyingly perfect family, he is among the friendliest and most compassionate of Springfield's residents and is generally considered a pillar of the Springfield community.

title: Santa's Little Helper
text: Santa's Little Helper is a recurring character in the American animated television series "The Simpsons".

title: Santa's Little Helper
text: He is the pet greyhound of the Simpson family.

title: Santa's Little Helper
text: The dog was introduced in the first episode of the show, the 1989 Christmas special "Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire", in which his owner abandons him for finishing last in a greyhound race.

title: Santa's Little Helper
text: Homer Simpson and his son Bart, who are at the race track in hope of winning some money for Christmas presents, see this and decide to adopt the dog.

title: Homer to the Max
text: "Homer to the Max" is the thirteenth episode of "The Simpsons"<nowiki>'</nowiki> tenth season.

title: Homer to the Max
text: It originally aired on the Fox network in the United States on February 7, 1999.

title: Homer to the Max
text: In the episode, Homer discovers that a new television show, "Police Cops", has a hero also named Homer Simpson.

title: Homer to the Max
text: He is delighted with the positive attention he receives because of his name, but when the television character is rewritten from a hero to a bumbling idiot, he is mocked and taunted, so he changes his name to "Max Power" to rid himself of the negative attention.

title: Homer to the Max
text: Max gains new friends, and is forced into a protest to prevent a forest from being knocked down.

title: Homer to the Max
text: In the end, he changes his name back to Homer Simpson.

title: Patty and Selma
text: Patty and Selma Bouvier ( ) are fictional characters in the American animated sitcom "The Simpsons".

title: Patty and Selma
text: They are identical twins (but with different hairstyles) and are both voiced by Julie Kavner.

title: Patty and Selma
text: They are Marge Simpson's older twin sisters, who both work at the Springfield Department of Motor Vehicles, and possess a strong dislike for their brother-in-law, Homer Simpson.

title: Patty and Selma
text: Selma is the elder by two minutes, and longs for male companionship while her sister, Patty, is a lesbian.

title: Patty and Selma
text: Kavner voices them as characters who "suck the life out of everything".

title: Patty and Selma
text: Patty and Selma first appeared on the first ever aired Simpsons episode "Simpsons Roasting On An Open Fire", which aired on December 17, 1989.

title: Do the Bartman
text: "Do the Bartman" is a song from the 1990 "Simpsons" album "The Simpsons Sing the Blues".

title: Do the Bartman
text: It was performed by "The Simpsons" cast member Nancy Cartwright (the voice of Bart Simpson), with backing vocals from Michael Jackson, alongside additional vocals from Dan Castellaneta (voice of Homer Simpson).

title: Do the Bartman
text: It was produced and written by American recording artist Bryan Loren, and released as a single on November 20, 1990.

title: Dan Castellaneta
text: Daniel Louis Castellaneta ( ; born October 29, 1957) is an American actor, voice actor, comedian and screenwriter.

title: Dan Castellaneta
text: Noted for his long-running role as Homer Simpson on the animated television series "The Simpsons", he also voices many other characters for the show, including Abraham "Grampa" Simpson, Barney Gumble, Krusty the Clown, Sideshow Mel, Groundskeeper Willie, Mayor Quimby and Hans Moleman.

title: Grampa Simpson
text: Abraham Jedediah Simpson II, often known as Grampa, is a fictional character in the animated television series "The Simpsons".

title: Grampa Simpson
text: He made his first appearance in the episode entitled "Grampa and the Kids", a Simpsons short on "The Tracey Ullman Show".

title: Grampa Simpson
text: Voiced by Dan Castellaneta, he is the father of Homer Simpson and the grandfather of Bart, Lisa and Maggie Simpson.

title: Grampa Simpson
text: In the 1000th issue of "Entertainment Weekly", Grampa was selected as the Grandpa for "The Perfect TV Family".

title: Damon Dark
text: Damon Dark is an independent public access TV series and web series from Australia about a heroic and obsessive investigator of UFO incidents and other strange cases, created by Australian writer, actor and film maker Adrian Sherlock.

title: Damon Dark
text: Damon James Dark became a dedicated alien investigator after a close encounter during his teenage years.

title: Damon Dark
text: He is associated with both the secret service and friendly aliens, including a character called Vincent Kosmos (an alien time traveller) and Trans-Dimensional Control (an alien law enforcement agency).

title: Damon Dark
text: The character of Damon Dark has appeared in a 5-week TV series on Community TV 31 in Melbourne Australia, a self-published novel ("Biodome") on Amazon's createspace platform and a long running web series on YouTube.

title: Damon Dark
text: He has also been involved in related web series "Young Damon Dark" and "Vincent Kosmos."

title: Damon Dark
text: He has also been the focus of a one actor stage drama.

title: Damon Dark
text: The character of Damon Dark has been played by Adrian Sherlock, Bruce Hughes, Aiden Sherlock and Jack Knoll.

title: Damon Dark
text: Damon Dark is a loner, dresses in black, has a huge experience of aliens and their technology.

title: Damon Dark
text: Damon is characterized by his high intelligence, idealistic moral outlook and wry sense of humor.

title: Damon Dark
text: His best friend in the series is the long-suffering Gary Sutton, played by actor Robert Trott.

title: Damon Dark
text: Damon Dark began in 1999, with a five-part weekly series on Melbourne's Community TV 31, (although the pilot was shot in 1996 and the show had been in development since 1990) following a screening of a 65-minute version of the story "Maddox" at the 57th World Science Fiction Convention (Aussiecon Three) held in Melbourne.

title: Damon Dark
text: The series was later revived as a YouTube webseries which inspired several related webseries, including "The Young Damon Dark Adventures" in which the character is played as a teenager, and Vincent Kosmos, (created by and starring Chris Heaven, , an Italian actor and musician, about a renegade alien character who is a friend of Damon.

title: Flashing Lights (Kanye West song)
text: "Flashing Lights" is a song by American hip-hop artist Kanye West.

title: Flashing Lights (Kanye West song)
text: It features Detroit R&B singer Dwele and contains background vocals from Australian singer Connie Mitchell.

title: Flashing Lights (Kanye West song)
text: West co-wrote and co-produced the song with Eric Hudson and released it on November 22, 2007 as the fourth single for his third studio album, "Graduation".

title: Flashing Lights (Kanye West song)
text: The single's cover art was designed by Japanese pop artist, Takashi Murakami.

title: Flashing Lights (Kanye West song)
text: The single received acclaim from music critics and is cited as one of the best songs on "Graduation".

title: Power (Kanye West song)
text: "Power" (often stylized as "POWER") is a song by American hip hop recording artist Kanye West, released as the lead single from his fifth studio album, "My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy" (2010).

title: Power (Kanye West song)
text: The song features additional vocals by soul singer Dwele and is co-produced by West and Symbolyc One.

title: Power (Kanye West song)
text: It is built around samples of "21st Century Schizoid Man" by King Crimson, "Afromerica" by Continent Number 6, and "It's Your Thing" by Cold Grits.

title: Power (Kanye West song)
text: After having recorded it in Hawaii, West reported that he spent 5000 hours composing "Power".

title: Power (Kanye West song)
text: In its lyrics, West comments about the United States and his critics.

title: Power (Kanye West song)
text: Its chorus features an abrasive vocal-riff.

title: The People (Common song)
text: "The People" is a song by American rapper Common, released as the second single of his seventh studio album "Finding Forever".

title: The People (Common song)
text: It made its first appearance on Kanye West's "Can't Tell Me Nothing" mixtape.

title: The People (Common song)
text: The song features production by West and contains background vocals provided by soul singer Dwele.

title: The People (Common song)
text: The original version of the song had Common singing the hook by himself, but this was later replaced with Dwele singing the hook.

title: The People (Common song)
text: It contains samples of "We Almost Lost Detroit" by Gil Scott-Heron as well as vocal samples of "Long Red" by Mountain (the latter of which was sampled on Wouldn't Get Far featuring West).

title: The People (Common song)
text: This action was part of West's intention to pay tribute to J Dilla through the production style expressed within the album.

title: 808s & Heartbreak
text: 808s & Heartbreak is the fourth studio album by American rapper Kanye West.

title: 808s & Heartbreak
text: It was released on November 24, 2008, by Roc-A-Fella Records.

title: 808s & Heartbreak
text: West recorded the album during September and October 2008 at Glenwood Studios in Burbank, California and Avex Recording Studio in Honolulu, Hawaii, with the help of producers No I.D., Jeff Bhasker and others.

title: The College Dropout
text: The College Dropout is the debut studio album by American rapper Kanye West.

title: The College Dropout
text: It was released on February 10, 2004, through Roc-A-Fella Records.

title: The College Dropout
text: It was recorded over a period of four years, beginning in 1999.

title: The College Dropout
text: Prior to the album's release, West had received praise for his production work for artists such as Jay-Z and Talib Kweli, but faced difficulty being accepted as a recording artist in his own right by figures in the music industry.

title: The College Dropout
text: Nonetheless intent on pursuing a solo career, it was several years before West finally received a record deal from Roc-A-Fella Records.

title: Watch the Throne
text: Watch the Throne is a collaborative studio album by American rappers Jay-Z and Kanye West, released on August 8, 2011, by Roc-A-Fella Records, Roc Nation, and Def Jam Recordings.

title: Watch the Throne
text: Before the album, Jay-Z and West had collaborated on their respective singles and with West as a producer on Jay-Z's work.

title: Watch the Throne
text: As longtime friends, they originally sought out to record a five-song EP together, but the project eventually evolved into a full-length album.

title: Watch the Throne
text: Recording sessions took place at various locations and began in November 2010.

title: Watch the Throne
text: Production on the album was led by West himself, alongside a variety of high-profile record producers including Mike Dean, Swizz Beatz, Sak Pase, Jeff Bhasker, The Neptunes and Q-Tip.

title: PRhyme
text: PRhyme is the debut studio album by American hip hop duo PRhyme, consisting of Royce da 5'9" and DJ Premier.

title: PRhyme
text: The album was released on December 9, 2014, through their own record label PRhyme Records.

title: PRhyme
text: The album features guest appearances from rappers Killer Mike, Jay Electronica, Common, Ab-Soul, Schoolboy Q, Slaughterhouse, Mac Miller and soul singer Dwele.

title: PRhyme
text: "PRhyme" features production by DJ Premier, as well as samples from psychedelic soul composer and producer Adrian Younge.

title: PRhyme
text: The album was supported by the single "Courtesy".

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: Hip Hop Since 1978 (HHS78) was a management and production company based in New York City.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: It was started by Gee Roberson and Kyambo "Hip-Hop" Joshua.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: HHS78 has been involved in the daily operations of Roc-A-Fella Records since the label's inception in the early '90s.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: HHS78 originally signed Kanye West to their production and management company in 1998, and negotiated his signing to Roc-A-Fella Records.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: Hip Hop Since 1978's first official project was West's 2004 album, "The College Dropout".

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: In January 2007, they partnered with Bryant Entertainment.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: As a result, they managed the careers of Lil Wayne, Drake and Nicki Minaj (who were signed to Young Money/Cash Money Records).

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: In January 2009, Kyambo Joshua and Columbia Records parted ways.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: Most recently, HHS78 has signed Young Jeezy onto their management firm.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: As of 2014, the agency no longer exists.

title: Hip Hop Since 1978
text: That same year, Kyambo Joshua joined the A&R department at Def Jam Recordings (along with record producer No I.D.), while Gee Roberson has launched two of his own management agencies, The Blueprint Group and Maverick Management.

title: Graduation (album)
text: Graduation is the third studio album by American rapper Kanye West.

title: Graduation (album)
text: It was released on September 11, 2007, through Roc-A-Fella Records.

title: Graduation (album)
text: Recording sessions for the album took place during 2005 to 2007 at Chung King Studios, Sony Music Studios in New York City, at Chalice Studios and The Record Plant in Los Angeles.

title: Graduation (album)
text: It was primarily produced by West himself, with contributions from DJ Toomp, as well as Mike Dean, Nottz, Brian "All Day" Miller, Eric Hudson, Warryn Campbell, Gee Roberson, Plain Pat and Jon Brion.

title: Graduation (album)
text: It features guest contributions from artists, including Mos Def, Dwele, T-Pain, Lil Wayne, DJ Premier and Chris Martin of Coldplay.

title: Graduation (album)
text: The album's cover artwork was designed by Japanese contemporary artist Takashi Murakami.

title: Late Registration
text: Late Registration is the second studio album by American rapper Kanye West.

title: Late Registration
text: It was released on August 30, 2005, through Roc-A-Fella Records.

title: Late Registration
text: It was recorded over the course of a year in sessions held across studios in New York City and Hollywood, with West collaborating with American record producer and composer Jon Brion.

title: Late Registration
text: The album features guest contributions from Adam Levine, Lupe Fiasco, Jamie Foxx, Common, Jay-Z, Brandy, and Nas, among others.

title: Late Registration
text: Its production was notably more lush and elaborate than West's 2004 debut album "The College Dropout", as he utilized intricate sampling methods and string orchestration with Brion.

title: Late Registration
text: West's lyrics explore both personal and political themes, including poverty, drug trafficking, racism, healthcare, and the blood diamond trade.

title: Enrique Grau
text: Enrique Grau (December 18, 1920 – April 1, 2004) was a Colombian artist, renowned for his depictions of Amerindian and Afro-Colombian figures.

title: Enrique Grau
text: He was a member of the triumvirate of key Colombian artists of the 20th century which included Fernando Botero and Alejandro Obregón.

title: Lionel S. Reiss
text: Lionel S. Reiss (1894–1986) was a Polish-American Jewish painter born in Jaroslaw, Poland, and grew up on the Lower East Side of Manhattan where he studied commercial art.

title: Lionel S. Reiss
text: His family had moved to the United States in 1898 when he was four years old.

title: Lionel S. Reiss
text: As immigrants to the United States, Reiss’ parents joined the ranks of other Eastern European Jews who were fleeing their native countries at the start of the 20th century.

title: Lionel S. Reiss
text: Lionel Reiss' family settled on New York’s Lower East Side neighborhood and Reiss himself spent the majority of his life in the city.

title: Lionel S. Reiss
text: Reiss worked as a commercial artist for newspapers, publishers, and a motion picture company.

title: Lionel S. Reiss
text: Eventually he became art director for Paramount Studios and is credited to be the creator of the Leo the Lion logo of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios.

title: Conchita Badía
text: Concepció Badia Millàs (14 November 1897 – 2 May 1975) (known by her stage name as Conchita Badía or Conxita Badia) was a Spanish soprano and pianist.

title: Conchita Badía
text: Admired for her spontaneity, expressiveness, and clear diction, she was considered one of the greatest interpreters of 20th century Catalan, Spanish and Latin American art song.

title: Conchita Badía
text: She premiered many works in that genre, including those by Enrique Granados, Manuel de Falla, Frederic Mompou, Alberto Ginastera, and Enric Morera, several of which had been specially written for her voice.

title: Conchita Badía
text: The main part of the collection of Badia's sound recordings, scores, letters and pictures is preserved in the Biblioteca de Catalunya.

title: Conchita Badía
text: In one of the letters, Pablo Casals wrote: "Everything I've written for a soprano voice has been thinking about you.

title: Conchita Badía
text: Therefore, every one is yours."

title: Pack Up Your Troubles (1939 film)
text: Pack Up Your Troubles is a 1939 American comedy film directed by H. Bruce Humberstone and written by Lou Breslow and Owen Francis.

title: Pack Up Your Troubles (1939 film)
text: The film stars Jane Withers, The Ritz Brothers, Lynn Bari, Joseph Schildkraut, Stanley Fields, Fritz Leiber and Lionel Royce.

title: Pack Up Your Troubles (1939 film)
text: The film was released on October 20, 1939, by 20th Century Fox.

title: Carreras Cigarette Factory
text: The Carreras Cigarette Factory is a large art deco building in Camden, London in the United Kingdom.

title: Carreras Cigarette Factory
text: It is noted as a striking example of early 20th Century Egyptian Revival architecture.

title: Carreras Cigarette Factory
text: The building was erected in 1926-28 by the Carreras Tobacco Company owned by the Russian-Jewish inventor and philanthropist Bernhard Baron on the communal garden area of Mornington Crescent, to a design by architects M.E and O.H Collins and A.G Porri.

title: Carreras Cigarette Factory
text: It is 550 feet (168 metres) long, and is mainly white,

title: Manuel Quiroga (violinist)
text: Manuel Quiroga (15 April 189219 April 1961) was a noted Galician violinist of the early 20th Century, whose career was cut short by a traffic accident in New York in 1937.

title: Manuel Quiroga (violinist)
text: He was repeatedly billed by music critics as "the finest successor of Pablo de Sarasate", and he is sometimes referred to as "Sarasate's spiritual heir".

title: Manuel Quiroga (violinist)
text: Enrique Granados, Eugène Ysaÿe and other composers dedicated compositions to him.

title: Manuel Quiroga (violinist)
text: The greatest violinists of the time – Ysaÿe, Fritz Kreisler, George Enescu, Mischa Elman and Jascha Heifetz – as well as composers such as Igor Stravinsky and Jean Sibelius, held Quiroga's artistry in great regard.

title: Manuel Quiroga (violinist)
text: Guilhermina Suggia, the Portuguese cellist (and one-time companion of Pablo Casals), described his playing of Tartini's "Devil's Trill Sonata" as "marvellous and flawless".

title: Enrique Banchs
text: Enrique Banchs (1888 – 1968) was an Argentine poet.

title: Enrique Banchs
text: He published all his work in the space of four years at the beginning of the 20th century, then lay dormant until his death.

title: Enrique Banchs
text: In his four works, "Las barcas" (1907), "El libro de los elogios" (1908), "El cascabel del halcón" (1909) and "La urna" (1911).

title: Enrique Banchs
text: Banchs cultivated an ephemeral, classicistic style drawing inspiration from the Siglo de Oro.

title: Enrique Banchs
text: His final work was composed in sonnets, a form which had already been almost completely abandoned by that time.

title: Enrique Banchs
text: Banchs published nothing during the final fifty years of his life, but he remained a part of the Argentine literary scene, and a member of the Argentine Academy of Letters.

title: Enrique Banchs
text: He was friend of Carlos Alberto Leumann.

title: John Darby (Dean of Chester)
text: John Lionel Darby (20 November 1831 – 5 November 1919) was Dean of Chester in the last decades of the 19th century and the first two of the 20th

title: Manuel de Falla
text: Manuel de Falla y Matheu (] , 23 November 187614 November 1946) was a Spanish composer.

title: Manuel de Falla
text: Along with Isaac Albéniz and Enrique Granados, he was one of Spain's most important musicians of the first half of the 20th century.

title: Manuel de Falla
text: His image was on Spain's 1970 100-pesetas banknote.

title: Enrique Echeverría
text: Enrique Echeverría Vázquez (19231972) was a Mexican painter, part of the Generación de la Ruptura and early member of the Salón de la Plástica Mexicana.

title: Enrique Echeverría
text: He was one of a number of painters who broke away from the established painting figurative style in Mexico in the mid 20th century to experiment with abstractionism and other modern movements in painting from Europe.

title: Enrique Echeverría
text: Although his career was followed by other artists and critics, he died in the early 1970s when painters of his generation were only beginning to receive widespread recognition for their work.

title: Enrique Echeverría
text: While meriting two major exhibits at the Palacio de Bellas Artes in Mexico City, one just after his death and a retrospective thirty years later in 2003, he and his work are not well known among younger Mexican painters.

title: Dian Lake
text: Dianchi Lake (Chinese: 滇池 , "Diānchí"), also known as Lake Dian and Kunming Lake (昆明湖 , "Kūnmínghú"), is a large lake located on the Yunnan-Guizhou Plateau close to Kunming, Yunnan, in southern China.

title: Dian Lake
text: Its nickname is the "Sparkling Pearl Embedded in a Highland" and it was the model for the Kunming Lake in the Summer Palace in Beijing.

title: Dian Lake
text: Its name is the source of Yunnan's Chinese abbreviation 滇 .

title: Kunming
text: Kunming ( ; ) is the capital of and largest city in Yunnan Province, Southwest China.

title: Kunming
text: Known as Yunnan-Fu (云南府 , "Yúnnánfǔ") until the 1920s, today it is a prefecture-level city and the political, economic, communications and cultural centre of the province as well as the seat of the provincial government.

title: Kunming
text: Kunming is also called the Spring city due to its weather.

title: Kunming
text: The headquarters of many of Yunnan's large businesses are in Kunming.

title: Kunming
text: It was important during World War II as a Chinese military center, American air base, and transport terminus for the Burma Road.

title: Kunming
text: Located in the middle of the Yunnan–Guizhou Plateau, Kunming is located at an altitude of 1900 m above sea level and at a latitude just north of the Tropic of Cancer.

title: Kunming
text: Kunming has as of 2014 a population of 6,626,000 with an urban population of 4,575,000, and is located at the northern edge of the large Lake Dian, surrounded by temples and lake-and-limestone hill landscapes.

title: Xin Zhui
text: Xin Zhui (; died 163 BC), also known as Lady Dai or Marquise of Dai, was the wife of Li Cang (利蒼 ), the Marquis of Dai, during the Han dynasty (206 BC – 220 AD).

title: Xin Zhui
text: She gained fame more than 2,000 years after her death, when her tomb was discovered inside a hill known as Mawangdui, in Changsha, Hunan, China.

title: Xin Zhui
text: After opening the tomb, workers discovered her exceptionally preserved remains alongside hundreds of valuable artifacts and documents.

title: Xin Zhui
text: Her body and belongings are currently under the care of the Hunan Provincial Museum, which has allowed occasional international exhibits.

title: Kunming Museum
text: Kunming City Museum (昆明市博物馆) is a history museum in Kunming City, Yunnan, China.

title: Kunming Museum
text: Smaller than the Yunnan Provincial Museum, Its most notable exhibit is about the history of the city.

title: Kunming Museum
text: Other features include a dinosaur exhibit and a rotating exhibition space that holds anything from history to art exhibitions.

title: Dali–Ruili Railway
text: The Dali–Ruili Railway or Darui Railway (), is a single-track electrified railroad under construction in Yunnan Province of Southwest China.

title: Dali–Ruili Railway
text: The line is slated to run 336.39 km from Dali in central Yunnan to Ruili in southwestern Yunnan on the border with Myanmar.

title: Dali–Ruili Railway
text: The line traverses rugged terrain, and bridges and tunnels will account for 75% of the total track length, including a 36-km tunnel through the Gaoligong Mountains.

title: Dali–Ruili Railway
text: Construction began in May 2011 and is scheduled to take six years.

title: Dali–Ruili Railway
text: Cities and towns along route include Dali, Yangbi Yi Autonomous County, Yongping County, Baoshan, Mang City (also known as Mangshi or Dehong) and Ruili.

title: Yunnan Provincial Museum
text: Yunnan Provincial Museum () is located in Kunming, on Guangfu Road.

title: Yunnan Provincial Museum
text: It houses an exhibition centered on Yunnan's ethnic minorities, as well as a collection of artifacts from tomb excavations at Jinning on the southern rim of Lake Dian.

title: Yangzong Lake
text: Yangzonghai Lake () (given on some maps as Yangzong Sea, though it is fresh water) is located between Yiliang County, Chenggong District and Chengjiang County, 45 kilometers east of Kunming City in Yunnan Province, China.

title: Yangzong Lake
text: About 30,000 people rely on the Lake as their drinking water.

title: Yangzong Lake
text: Yangzonghai Lake is noted for its underwater springs and is one of several scenic areas in Yunnan province, which is known for its biodiversity.

title: Yangzong Lake
text: The lake is a popular resort destination for people living in the nearby provincial capital of Kunming, which itself borders Dianchi Lake, one of China's biggest freshwater lakes but also one of its most polluted.

title: Karel Dežman
text: Karel Dežman, also known as Dragotin Dežman and Karl Deschmann (3 January 1821 – 11 March 1889), was a Carniolan liberal politician and natural scientist.

title: Karel Dežman
text: He was one of the most prominent personalities of the political, cultural, and scientific developments in the 19th-century Duchy of Carniola.

title: Karel Dežman
text: He is considered one of the fathers of modern archeology in what is today Slovenia.

title: Karel Dežman
text: He also made important contributions in botany, zoology, mineralogy, geology and mineralogy.

title: Karel Dežman
text: He was the first director of the Provincial Museum of Carniola, now the National Museum of Slovenia.

title: Karel Dežman
text: Due to his switch from Slovene liberal nationalism to Austrian centralism and pro-German cultural stances, he became a symbol of national renegadism.

title: Luang Namtha Museum
text: Luang Namtha Museum, also Louang Namtha Provincial Museum, is a museum in Luang Namtha, Laos.

title: Luang Namtha Museum
text: Largely an anthropological museum, it contains numerous items related to local people such as ethnic clothing, Khamu bronze drums, textiles, ceramics, tools, household utensils, hand-crafted weapons, and Buddhism-related items.

title: Flores Island Marine Provincial Park
text: Flores Island Marine Provincial Park, also known as Flores Island Provincial Park, is a provincial park in British Columbia, Canada, located on the island of the same name in the central Clayoquot Sound region of the West Coast of Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada.

title: Flores Island Marine Provincial Park
text: The park contains 7113 ha.

title: Flores Island Marine Provincial Park
text: and was created on July 13, 1995 as part of the Clayoqout Land-Use Decision.

title: Flores Island Marine Provincial Park
text: Gibson Marine Provincial Park, which was created in 1967, adjoins it to the southeast.

title: Flores Island Marine Provincial Park
text: Sulphur Passage Provincial Park is off the northeast coast of Flores Island, surrounding Obstruction Island.

title: B2K
text: B2K was an American R&B boy band that was active from 1998 to 2004.

title: B2K
text: In 1998, the group was formed by American record producer Chris Stokes.

title: B2K
text: They released their self-titled debut album on March 12, 2002.

title: B2K
text: The album peaked at #2 on the "Billboard" 200 and #1 on the U.S. Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs albums chart.

title: Breaking News (Shinee song)
text: "Breaking News" is a song performed by South Korean R&B boy group Shinee.

title: Breaking News (Shinee song)
text: It was included as a track in their second Japanese studio album "Boys Meet U", released on June 26, 2013.

title: Breaking News (Shinee song)
text: The song was also chosen as the lead promotional single from the album.

title: Under the Blue Moon
text: Under the Blue Moon is the fifth studio album by American R&B boy band New Edition by MCA on November 24, 1986.

title: Under the Blue Moon
text: Their fourth album and third with MCA and first album after New Edition member Bobby Brown was voted out of the group, the group was going through a transitional phase during this period.

title: Under the Blue Moon
text: It is their only album as a quartet.

title: Under the Blue Moon
text: The album reached number 43 on the "Billboard" 200, and number 18 on the R&B albums chart.

title: Under the Blue Moon
text: It was later certified gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA).

title: Imajin
text: Imajin is an American R&B boy band that is known for their hit "Shorty (You Keep Playing With My Mind)" featuring Keith Murray.

title: Imajin
text: The group also made a version of this song with (rapper) Mr. Cheeks of the rap group The Lost Boyz.

title: Imajin
text: This single peaked at number 25 on the "Billboard" Hot 100, number 20 on Billboard's Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart and number 22 in the UK Singles Chart in 1998.

title: Imajin
text: The band was originally put together by record producer Bert Price and inspired by past boy bands such as Jackson 5, New Edition, Hi-Five, Immature, and Mint Condition.

title: Imajin
text: Original credited band members included Jamal Hampton (who was later replaced by Tony Royster, Jr.), Talib Kareem, Olamide Faison, and John Fitch.

title: Imajin
text: Faison is the younger brother of Donald Faison of the television series "Scrubs".

title: Imajin
text: Imajin credited themselves to being a true boy band and are different because each member played an instrument.

title: Imajin
text: Jamal Hampton and Tony Royster played the drums, Talib Kareem the keyboard, and Olamide Faison played the guitar while John Fitch played the bass guitar.

title: Imajin
text: After the first album, the group split and John and Olamide made a duo called JizLams.

title: Imajin
text: During the hiatus, Talib continued to produce songs for various artists such as Solange Knowles.

title: Imajin
text: Jamal Hampton changed his name to J Star while pursuing a solo career.

title: Imajin
text: The group continues to produce and sing music together as "Imajin".

title: We Got It (album)
text: We Got It is the third album by R&B boy band Immature that was released on December 5, 1995.

title: We Got It (album)
text: The album featured singles "We Got It" (which sampled Chocolate Milk's 1978 soul hit "Girl Callin'"), "Please Don't Go", "Lover's Groove" and "Feel the Funk" (which also appeared on the soundtrack for the film "Dangerous Minds").

title: The Journey (Immature album)
text: The Journey is the fourth album by R&B boy band Immature, released on September 23, 1997 on MCA Records.

title: The Journey (Immature album)
text: It peaked at #92 on the "The Billboard 200" chart and at #20 on the Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums chart.

title: The Journey (Immature album)
text: This will be the last album under the name, Immature before moving to their fifth album in 1999 as IMx.

title: Omarion
text: Omari Ishmael Grandberry (born November 12, 1984, known by his stage name Omarion) is an American singer, songwriter, rapper, actor and dancer.

title: Omarion
text: He is best known as being the lead singer of the American R&B boy band B2K; the group achieved success with singles like "Bump, Bump, Bump", "Uh Huh", and "Girlfriend", which all reached success on the "Billboard" Hot 100.

title: Omarion
text: After the group's disbandment, Omarion released his debut solo album, "O" (2005), which debuted atop the "Billboard" 200 and received a Grammy Award nomination for Best Contemporary R&B Album at the 48th Grammy Awards.

title: Omarion
text: His second solo album, "21" (2006), contained his second highest-charting single to date, "Ice Box", which reached the top 20 on the "Billboard" Hot 100.

title: Omarion
text: His third solo album, "Ollusion" (2010), was released on January 12, 2010, with the lead single, "I Get It In".

title: Omarion
text: His fourth solo album, "Sex Playlist" (2014), spawned the single, "Post to Be", which was certified 3x platinum and reached number 13 on the Hot 100 chart in May 2015, and became his highest charting single to date.

title: Raz-B
text: De'Mario Monte Thornton (born June 13, 1985), known as Raz-B, is an American, singer and actor.

title: Raz-B
text: who was a founding member of R&B boy band B2K.

title: B Boy Baby
text: "B Boy Baby" is a song written by Phil Spector, Ellie Greenwich, Jeff Barry Craig Klepto Tucker, Peter Celik and Angela Hunte.

title: B Boy Baby
text: It features uncredited vocals by singer Amy Winehouse and was produced by Salaam Remi for Mutya Buena's debut album, "Real Girl", being released as the fourth and final single from the album.

title: Dr. Freeze
text: Elliot Straite, also known by his pseudonym Dr. Freeze, is a singer, songwriter and record producer.

title: Dr. Freeze
text: His songs are mostly in new jack swing style.

title: Dr. Freeze
text: He has, for example, written and produced the hit song "I Wanna Sex You Up" by R&B boy band Color Me Badd and co-written and co-produced "Break of Dawn" for Michael Jackson's #1 album "Invincible".

title: Dhar iron pillar
text: The Dhar iron pillar is a now-fragmented iron column located in the Dhar town of Madhya Pradesh, India.

title: Dhar iron pillar
text: The exact origins of the pillar are unknown, but according to the local tradition, it was a victory column erected by the 11th century Paramara king Bhoja.

title: Pestsäule, Vienna
text: The Pestsäule (English: Plague Column ) or Dreifaltigkeitssäule (English: Trinity Column ) is a Holy Trinity column located on the Graben, a street in the inner city of Vienna, Austria.

title: Pestsäule, Vienna
text: Erected after the Great Plague epidemic in 1679, the Baroque memorial is one of the most well-known and prominent sculptural pieces of art in the city.

title: Colonna di San Zanobi, Florence
text: The Column of Saint Zanobi (it:Colonna di San Zanobi) is a monumental marble column, surmounted by a cross above a crown of fire, located just north of the Bapstistery of San Giovanni in Florence, Italy.

title: San Jacinto Monument
text: The San Jacinto Monument is a 567.31 ft column located on the Houston Ship Channel in unincorporated Harris County, Texas, United States, near the city of Houston.

title: San Jacinto Monument
text: The monument is topped with a 220-ton star that commemorates the site of the Battle of San Jacinto, the decisive battle of the Texas Revolution.

title: San Jacinto Monument
text: The monument, constructed between 1936 and 1939 and dedicated on April 21, 1939, is the world's tallest masonry column and is part of the San Jacinto Battleground State Historic Site.

title: San Jacinto Monument
text: By comparison, the Washington Monument is 554.612 ft tall, but remains the tallest stone monument in the world.

title: San Jacinto Monument
text: The column is an octagonal shaft topped with a 34 ft Lone Star – the symbol of Texas.

title: San Jacinto Monument
text: Visitors can take an elevator to the monument's observation deck for a view of Houston and the Battleship Texas (see USS "Texas" ).

title: Column of the Vicariate
text: The Column of the Vicariate or Colonna della Vicaria was a simple white marble column on a pedestal that formerly stood outside the Castel Capuano along Via dei Tribunali in Naples, Italy.

title: Column of the Vicariate
text: It was used by the government first as a place for punishment of debtors.

title: Alexander II Column in Odessa
text: Alexander II Column, also known as Alexander's column or Monument to Alexander II of Russia, is a triumphal column located in Shevchenko, Odessa and is commemorated to the visit of Russian Emperor Alexander II the city of Odessa in 1875.

title: Column of Phocas
text: The Column of Phocas (Italian: "Colonna di Foca" ) is a Roman monumental column in the Roman Forum of Rome, Italy.

title: Column of Phocas
text: Erected before the Rostra and dedicated or rededicated in honour of the Eastern Roman Emperor Phocas on August 1, 608, it was the last addition made to the "Forum Romanum".

title: Column of Phocas
text: The fluted Corinthian column stands 13.6 m (44 ft) tall on its cubical white marble socle.

title: Column of Phocas
text: On stylistic grounds, the column seems to have been made in the 2nd century for an unknown structure, and then recycled for the present monument.

title: Column of Phocas
text: Likewise, the socle was recycled from its original use supporting a statue dedicated to Diocletian; the former inscription was chiselled away to provide a space for the later text.

title: Piazza Colonna
text: Piazza Colonna is a piazza at the center of the Rione of Colonna in the historic heart of Rome, Italy.

title: Piazza Colonna
text: It is named for the marble Column of Marcus Aurelius, which has stood there since AD 193.

title: Piazza Colonna
text: The bronze statue of Saint Paul that crowns the column was placed in 1589, by order of Pope Sixtus V.

title: Piazza Colonna
text: The Roman Via Lata (now the Via del Corso) runs through the piazza's eastern end, from south to north.

title: Berlin Peace Column
text: The Peace Column (German: Friedenssäule) is a column located in Mehringplatz in Berlin, Germany.

title: Berlin Peace Column
text: Designed by Christian Gottlieb Cantian and erected in 1843, the 19-meter column is topped with a brass status of Victoria, goddess of victory, designed by Christian Daniel Rauch.

title: Berlin Peace Column
text: In 1876, allegories of the four victorious allies of ] (or Belle Alliance in Prussian historiography) were added, and in 1879 two more sculptures followed: "The Peace" by Albert Wolff and "Clio", writing the history of the Wars of Liberation (Befreiungskriege) by .

title: Colonna dell'Abbondanza, Florence
text: The Colonna dell'Abbondanza is a monumental column located in the Piazza della Repubblica in Florence, region of Tuscany, Italy.

title: Ingerophrynus gollum
text: Ingerophrynus gollum (Gollum's toad) is a species of true toad.

title: Ingerophrynus gollum
text: It has only been recorded from Endau-Rompin National Park, Johor, in closed-canopy lowland forests in the early evening following brief periods of afternoon precipitation.

title: Ingerophrynus gollum
text: It is called "gollum" with reference of the eponymous character of The Lord of the Rings by J. R. R. Tolkien.

title: The Burning Red
text: The Burning Red is the third album by the American groove metal band Machine Head.

title: The Burning Red
text: It is the band's second best selling album in the US, selling as many copies in three years as "Burn My Eyes" sold in almost eight years (1994–2002) .

title: The Burning Red
text: The album has sold over 134,000 copies in the US and it was certified silver in 2011 by the BPI for sales of 60,000 in the UK.

title: Gollum
text: Gollum is a fictional character from J. R. R. Tolkien's legendarium.

title: Gollum
text: He was introduced in the 1937 fantasy novel "The Hobbit", and became an important supporting character in its sequel, "The Lord of the Rings".

title: Gollum
text: Gollum was a Stoor Hobbit of the River-folk, who lived near the Gladden Fields.

title: Gollum
text: Originally known as Sméagol, he was corrupted by the One Ring and later named Gollum after his habit of making "a horrible swallowing noise in his throat".

title: From Unknown Worlds
text: From Unknown Worlds is an anthology of fantasy fiction short stories edited by John W. Campbell, Jr. and illustrated by Edd Cartier, the first of a number of anthologies drawing their contents from the classic magazine "Unknown" of the 1930s-40s.

title: From Unknown Worlds
text: It was first published in magazine format by American company Street & Smith in 1948; the publication was an attempt to determine if there was a market for a revived "Unknown".

title: From Unknown Worlds
text: Street & Smith printed 300,000 copies, against the advice of John Campbell, but although it sold better than the original, too many copies were returned for the publisher to be willing to revive the magazine.

title: From Unknown Worlds
