title: Australian Transformation and Innovation Centre
text: It is used to put concepts into action by developing and demonstrating new technological capabilities and engineering solutions.

title: Australian Transformation and Innovation Centre
text: The ATIC works with its customers to capture their ideas and then translate these into concept demonstrators.

title: Australian Transformation and Innovation Centre
text: The ATIC was officially opened on 15 March 2006 by the then Minister for Defence The Honourable Dr Brendan Nelson, MP.

title: Royal Bahamas Defence Force
text: The Royal Bahamas Defence Force (RBDF) is the navy of The Bahamas.

title: Royal Bahamas Defence Force
text: Since The Bahamas does not have an army or an air force, its navy composes the entirety of its armed forces.

title: Royal Bahamas Defence Force
text: Under The Defence Act, the Royal Bahamas Defence Force has been mandated to defend The Bahamas, protect its territorial integrity, patrol its waters, provide assistance in times of disaster, maintain order in conjunction with the law enforcement agencies of The Bahamas, and carry out any such duties as determined by the National Security Council.

title: Royal Bahamas Defence Force
text: The Defence Force is also a member of Caricom's Regional Security Task Force.

title: Royal Bahamas Defence Force
text: The task force has seen action in the United Nations mandate in Haiti 1994.

title: Royal Australian Navy Heritage Centre
text: The Royal Australian Navy Heritage Centre is the maritime museum of the Royal Australian Navy.

title: Royal Australian Navy Heritage Centre
text: The centre opened on 4 October 2005 and is located within the Public Access Area on the northern end of the Garden Island naval base in Sydney.

title: Mohammad Anwar Mohammad Nor
text: Admiral Tan Sri Dato' Sri Mohd Anwar bin Haji Mohd Nor, is the Chief of Defence Force, Malaysia.

title: Mohammad Anwar Mohammad Nor
text: He is the first Chief of Defence Force to be appointed from the Royal Malaysian Navy.

title: Mohammad Anwar Mohammad Nor
text: For over five decades previously, the Chief of the Defence Force had traditionally been a 4-star General from the Royal Malaysian Army.

title: Mohammad Anwar Mohammad Nor
text: Anwar broke the tradition by being appointed the first Navy Admiral to be promoted to Chief of Defence Force.

title: Orbis Pictus (film)
text: Orbis Pictus is a 1997 Slovak film, starring Dorota Nvotová, Marián Labuda, Božidara Turzonovová, Július Satinský, Emília Vášáryová and František Kovár .

title: Orbis Pictus (film)
text: The film, directed by Martin Šulík, won Special Award of the Jury at the International Filmfestival Mannheim-Heidelberg in Baden-Württemberg, Germany as the Best Film in 1997.

title: Orbis Pictus (film)
text: The film was selected as the Slovak entry for the Best Foreign Language Film at the 70th Academy Awards, but was not accepted as a nominee.

title: Gorontalo
text: Gorontalo (Hulontalo) is a Province in Northern Sulawesi Island, Indonesia.

title: Gorontalo
text: (The namesake city is also the capital of the province) As a province, Gorontalo was officially created on December 5, 2000.

title: Gorontalo
text: Historically it is well-known as a center of the spread of Islam in Eastern Indonesia.

title: Gorontalo
text: Besides, classical Gorontalese fine art and culture are unique such as Karawo, Upiya Karanji (Songkok Gorontalo) or nickname "Peci Gusdur" (Gusdur being The 4th President of Indonesia), and poetry.

title: Gorontalo
text: (Gorontalo City is also known as "The Land Under Medina's Porch").

title: Gorontalo
text: Gorontalo province is located on the peninsula (Gorontalo Peninsula) on the northern part of Sulawesi, located in the western part of the province of North Sulawesi.

title: Gorontalo
text: The total area of the province is 12435 km2 with a population of 1, 133, 237(2016), with population density of 88 inhabitants / km2.

title: Gorontalo
text: Gorontalo is mainly inhabited by several groups consisting of various Pohala'a (Family), among them Pohala'a Gorontalo (Ethnic Hulontalo), Pohala'a Suwawa (Ethnic Suwawa/Tuwawa), Pohala'a Limboto (Ethnic Limutu).

title: Gorontalo
text: Pohala'a Bolango (Ethnic Bulango/Bolango) and Pohala'a Atinggola (Ethnic Atinggola) are also categorized into Gorontalo tribes (also known as Hulontalo, Gorontalese or Gorontaloan).

title: Gorontalo
text: It is believed that the spread of Gorantalese Diasphora has reached five times the current population in Gorontalo and are now scattered throughout Indonesia and other countries .

title: Centro de Congresos Queretaro
text: Centro de Congresos Queretaro is a multipurpose convention center and indoor arena located in Queretaro, Queretaro.

title: Centro de Congresos Queretaro
text: It was started in 2007 and finished after a two year pause of the construction, in 2011, due to the continued growth of both the city and the state.

title: Centro de Congresos Queretaro
text: Prior to the completion of the Centro de Congresos, the Auditorio Josefa Ortiz de Dominguez was the largest indoor venue in Queretaro.

title: Centro de Congresos Queretaro
text: However, that arena had been built in 1985, when Queretaro's population was less than half its current population.

title: Centro de Congresos Queretaro
text: The growth of Queretaro's population eventually escalated to the point that a venue with a much larger capacity was needed, resulting in this venue.

title: Július Satinský
text: Július Satinský (20 August 1941 in Bratislava – 29 December 2002 in Bratislava) was a Slovak actor, comedian, singer, showman and writer.

title: Július Satinský
text: He is mostly remembered in Slovakia as member of the legendary comedian duo Milan Lasica - Július Satinský, however his scope of interest was wide.

title: Sabaa Al Bour
text: Saab Al Bour or Sabaa Al Bour is a small urban city located approximately 18 miles north west of the city of Baghdad, and is located in Taji District of the Baghdad Governorate.

title: Sabaa Al Bour
text: In 2003 the population of Saab Al Bour was approximately 120,000.

title: Sabaa Al Bour
text: Current population estimates for Saab Al Bour are as high as 254,000.

title: Qinyang
text: Qinyang () is a county-level city in Henan province, People's Republic of China.

title: Qinyang
text: It is administered by the prefecture-level city Jiaozuo.

title: Qinyang
text: The current population of Qinyang is estimated at 470,000.

title: Qinyang
text: In 1999, the population stood at 444,480.

title: Chernivtsi
text: Chernivtsi (Ukrainian: Чернівці́ , "Černivci " ] ; see also ) is a city in western Ukraine, situated on the upper course of the River Prut.

title: Chernivtsi
text: Chernivtsi is the administrative center of Chernivtsi Oblast (province) – the northern, Ukrainian part of the historical region of Bukovina.

title: Chernivtsi
text: Administratively, Chernivtsi is a city of oblast significance.

title: Chernivtsi
text: At the time of the 2001 Ukrainian Census, the population of the city was 240,600.

title: Chernivtsi
text: Current population: (2015 est.)

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: Orlinda is a city in Robertson County, Tennessee.

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: The population was 594 at the 2000 census, at which time it was a town; the community became a city in February 2001.

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: The City of Orlinda conducted its own, independent census 2007.

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: The results of that census were submitted to the State of Tennessee which conducted a review and random sample before officially certifying the results, which it did in May, 2007.

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: The 2010 U.S. Census results list Orlinda's current population at 859.

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: The Mayor of Orlinda is Ricky Stark, and the City Manager is Kevin Breeding.

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: Orlinda is also the hometown of upcoming rappers DJ Carter, The Jacob Thompson, and Mista Stack.

title: Orlinda, Tennessee
text: Carter and Jacob gained local fame when they "released" their first single, When Its Dark Out.

title: Biratnagar
text: Biratnagar (Devanāgarī: विराटनगर) is a metropolitan city of Nepal.

title: Biratnagar
text: According to the 2011 census, the city ranks fourth in population.

title: Biratnagar
text: It ranks second in population density after Kathmandu.

title: Biratnagar
text: Biratnagar is the industrial capital of Nepal and has a total area of 40.108 mi2 (103.88 km2).

title: Biratnagar
text: Its geographical location is 26°28'60"N 87°16'60"E.

title: Biratnagar
text: The city is located in Morang District in the Kosi Zone of the eastern Terai region of Nepal.

title: Biratnagar
text: It lies 399 km east of Nepal's capital, Kathmandu, and 6 km north of the border of the Indian state of Bihar.

title: Biratnagar
text: It lies in the Province No. 1, as per the new Constitution of Nepal 2015.

title: Biratnagar
text: It was declared as a Metropolitan city on 22nd of May, 2017 along with Birgunj.

title: Biratnagar
text: The city is upgraded to metropolis by adding Tankisinuwari and Jahada-3 making the total population to reach 240,000 from current population of 214,000.

title: Pune district
text: Pune (District) is situated in Maharashtra state of India.

title: Pune district
text: Pune city is the district headquarters.

title: Pune district
text: In the most recent census on 2011, the total population of the district was 9,426,959, making it the fourth most populous district in India (out of 640).

title: Pune district
text: Urban population comprises 58.08% of the total population.

title: Pune district
text: The current population of Pune urban agglomerate is over 5 million.

title: Bull Hill
text: Bull Hill, also known as Mount Taurus, is a mountain north of the village of Cold Spring on the Hudson River in Putnam County in the State of New York.

title: Bull Hill
text: It is part of the river-straddling range known as the Hudson Highlands.

title: Bull Hill
text: The original name came after a bull that used to terrorize the mountain was chased by indignant inhabitants.

title: Bull Hill
text: A hunting party drove the bull over the hill.

title: Bull Hill
text: In an attempt to flee the mountaineers, the bull plunged out into space and fell down.

title: Bull Hill
text: Its broken and shapeless mass on the rocks was memorialized in the name of the mountain the bull used to haunt.

title: Garrison, New York
text: Garrison is a hamlet in Putnam County, New York, United States.

title: Garrison, New York
text: It is part of the town of Philipstown, on the east side of the Hudson River, across from the United States Military Academy at West Point.

title: Garrison, New York
text: The Garrison Metro-North Railroad station serves the town.

title: Garrison, New York
text: Garrison (a.k.a. Garrison's Landing) was named after 2nd Lieutenant Isaac Garrison who held a property lot on the Hudson River across from West Point and conducted a ferry service across the Hudson River between the two hamlets.

title: Garrison, New York
text: Isaac and his son Beverly Garrison fought in the Battle of Fort Montgomery in 1777, were captured by the British and later set free.

title: Wilkinson Memorial Trail
text: The Wilkinson Memorial Trail is a public footpath in the Hudson Highlands region of the U.S. state of New York.

title: Wilkinson Memorial Trail
text: It generally follows the Dutchess–Putnam county line along the latter's northwest corner, from the banks of the Hudson River near Breakneck Ridge to North HIghland, just south of the county line in Philipstown.

title: Wilkinson Memorial Trail
text: At 9.5 mi in length it is the longest trail in the Hudson Highlands State Park system; although parts of the trail are on other public and private parcels in the area.

title: Hudson Highlands State Park
text: Hudson Highlands State Park is a non-contiguous state park in the U.S. state of New York, located on the east side of the Hudson River.

title: Hudson Highlands State Park
text: The park runs from Peekskill in Westchester County, through Putnam County, to Beacon in Dutchess County, in the eastern section of the Hudson Highlands.

title: Cold Spring, New York
text: Cold Spring is a village in the town of Philipstown in Putnam County, New York, United States.

title: Cold Spring, New York
text: The population was 1,983 at the 2010 census.

title: Cold Spring, New York
text: It borders the smaller village of Nelsonville and Garrison.

title: Cold Spring, New York
text: The central area of the village is on the National Register of Historic Places as the Cold Spring Historic District due to its many well-preserved 19th-century buildings, constructed to accommodate workers at the nearby West Point Foundry (itself a Registered Historic Place today).

title: Cold Spring, New York
text: The town is the birthplace of General Gouverneur K. Warren, who was an important figure in the Union Army during the Civil War.

title: Cold Spring, New York
text: The village, located in the Hudson Highlands, sits at the deepest point of the Hudson River, directly across from West Point.

title: Cold Spring, New York
text: Cold Spring serves as a weekend getaway for many residents of New York City.

title: Hudson River Valley Greenway
text: The Hudson River Valley Greenway is a system of parks, trails, kayak/canoe routes, etc. along New York's Hudson River, and the organization that serves to promote and preserve them.

title: Hudson River Valley Greenway
text: The Greenway system includes the Hudson Valley Rail Trail.

title: Hudson River Valley Greenway
text: Fourteen counties are in the Greenway area.

title: Hudson River Valley Greenway
text: Dutchess County, Putnam County, and Westchester County are in the Hudson River Valley Greenway Compact Area.

title: New York State Route 121
text: New York State Route 121 (NY 121) is a north–south state highway in the Hudson Valley of New York, United States.

title: New York State Route 121
text: It begins in northern Westchester County at an intersection with NY 22 in Bedford and extends for 15.56 mi to a junction with U.S. Route 6 and U.S. Route 202 (US 6 and US 202) east of the village of Brewster in Putnam County.

title: New York State Route 121
text: As the route heads north, it briefly overlaps with NY 35 and NY 116 in Westchester County and connects to Interstate 84 (I-84) in Putnam County.

title: New York State Route 121
text: NY 121 was assigned as part of the 1930 renumbering of state highways in New York.

title: Breakneck Brook
text: Breakneck Brook, sometimes Breakneck Valley Brook, is a 2.8 km tributary of the Hudson River located entirely in the Putnam County town of Philipstown, New York, United States.

title: Breakneck Brook
text: It rises at Surprise Lake and flows southwest towards the Hudson from there, mostly through Hudson Highlands State Park.

title: Breakneck Brook
text: The name comes from Breakneck Ridge to its north.

title: Cortland Condit House
text: The Cortland Condit House is a historic house located on Center Street in Putnam, Putnam County, Illinois.

title: Cortland Condit House
text: The house was built in 1849-50 by Cortland Condit, a farmer who came to Putnam County from New York in 1836.

title: Cortland Condit House
text: Condit founded the community of Putnam, which was originally named Condit in his honor.

title: Cortland Condit House
text: The Greek Revival house is the oldest brick building in Senachwine Township.

title: Cortland Condit House
text: The house's front entrance features a portico with square columns and gingerbread-style decoration, while the rear entrance has a brick archway.

title: Cortland Condit House
text: The house's windows are all six-over-six, as is common in Greek Revival homes.

title: Cortland Condit House
text: The gable roof features an entablature with cornice returns below its eaves.

title: Jones Point, New York
text: Jones Point is a hamlet located in the town of Stony Point in Rockland County in the state of New York, United States.

title: Jones Point, New York
text: Located north of Tomkins Cove; east of Bear Mountain State Park; south of Iona Island; and west of the Hudson River.

title: Jones Point, New York
text: It is directly across the Hudson River from the city of Peekskill and lies at the foot of Dunderberg Mountain.

title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow
text: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow is a stealth video game developed and published by Ubisoft Shanghai, while Ubisoft Montreal, developer of the original "Splinter Cell", was working on "".

title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow
text: "Pandora Tomorrow" is the second game in the "Splinter Cell" series endorsed by writer Tom Clancy.

title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow
text: The game follows the covert activities of Sam Fisher, an agent working for a black-ops branch of the National Security Agency (NSA) called "Third Echelon".

title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow
text: Sam Fisher is voiced by Michael Ironside, Dennis Haysbert voices the character Irving Lambert, Fisher's boss, making this the only time he is not voiced by Don Jordan.

title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow
text: Lalo Schifrin provides the theme music for the game.

title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow
text: A remastered high-definition version of "Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Pandora Tomorrow" was announced for the PlayStation Network for the PlayStation 3 on December 20, 2010.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Safe House
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers or Net Force Explorers is a series of young adult novels created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik as a spin-off of the military fiction series Tom Clancy's Net Force.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Deathworld
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers or Net Force Explorers is a series of young adult novels created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik as a spin-off of the military fiction series Tom Clancy's Net Force.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Gameprey
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers or Net Force Explorers is a series of young adult novels created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik as a spin-off of the military fiction series Tom Clancy's Net Force.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Cold Case
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Cold Case is a young adult novel by Bill McCay that is the fifteenth book in the series Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik.

title: Sam Fisher (Splinter Cell)
text: Samuel "Sam" Fisher is a fictional character and the protagonist of the "Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell" series of video games developed by Ubisoft as well as a series of tie-in novels endorsed by Tom Clancy.

title: Sam Fisher (Splinter Cell)
text: His full name is first seen in "Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell", the first game of the series, when he was using the computer in the V-22 Osprey to encrypt his home call.

title: Sam Fisher (Splinter Cell)
text: Fisher was originally voiced by veteran actor Michael Ironside in the first five installments of the series.

title: Sam Fisher (Splinter Cell)
text: In 2013, Eric Johnson assumed the voice and physical role in "".

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Private Lives
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers or Net Force Explorers is a series of young adult novels created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik as a spin-off of the military fiction series Tom Clancy's Net Force.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Death Match
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers or Net Force Explorers is a series of young adult novels created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik as a spin-off of the military fiction series Tom Clancy's Net Force.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: High Wire
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers or Net Force Explorers is a series of young adult novels created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik as a spin-off of the military fiction series Tom Clancy's Net Force.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers: Duel Identity
text: Tom Clancy's Net Force Explorers or Net Force Explorers is a series of young adult novels created by Tom Clancy and Steve Pieczenik as a spin-off of the military fiction series Tom Clancy's Net Force.

title: Fruit salad
text: Fruit salad is a dish consisting of various kinds of fruit, sometimes served in a liquid, either in their own juices or a syrup.

title: Fruit salad
text: When served as an appetizer or as a dessert, a fruit salad is sometimes known as a fruit cocktail or fruit cup.

title: Fruit salad
text: In different forms fruit salad can be served as an appetizer, a side-salad, or a dessert.

title: Salad bar
text: A salad bar is a buffet-style table or counter at a restaurant or food market on which salad components are provided for customers to assemble their own salad plates.

title: Salad bar
text: Most salad bars provide lettuce, chopped tomatoes, assorted raw, sliced vegetables (such as cucumbers, carrots, celery, olives and green or red bell peppers), dried bread croutons, bacon bits, shredded cheese, and various types of salad dressing.

title: Salad bar
text: Some salad bars also have additional food items such as cooked cold meats, (turkey, chicken, ham, or tuna), cooked beans (e.g., chick peas, garbanzo beans or kidney beans), boiled eggs, cottage cheese, cold pasta salads, tortilla chips, bread rolls, soup, and fresh cut fruit slices.

title: Crataegus submollis
text: Crataegus submollis, known as the northern downy hawthorn, northern red haw, Quebec hawthorn, or hairy cockspurthorn, is a species of hawthorn that grows to about 7 m in height and typically carries large crops of red fruit.

title: Wheat salad
text: Wheat salad (Arabic: سلطة قمح‎ ‎ ), is a salad of Arab salads, it typically of wheat, corn, tomatoes, carrots, cucumber pickles, lemon, parsley, olive oil and salt.

title: Pandanus conoideus
text: Pandanus conoideus is a plant in the pandan family.

title: Pandanus conoideus
text: Its fruit is eaten in Papua, Indonesia.

title: Pandanus conoideus
text: Papuans call them "kuansu".

title: Pandanus conoideus
text: Indonesians call them "buah merah" ("red fruit").

title: Pandanus conoideus
text: The fruit is typically prepared by splitting it, wrapping it in leaves, and cooking it in an earth oven.

title: Candle salad
text: Candle salad is a vintage fruit salad that was popular in America during the 1920s through 1960s.

title: Candle salad
text: The salad is typically composed of lettuce, pineapple, banana, cherry, and either mayonnaise or, according to some recipes, cottage cheese.

title: Candle salad
text: Whipped cream may also be used.

title: Candle salad
text: The process is as follows: First arrange a few leaves of lettuce on a plate or decorative napkin.

title: Candle salad
text: This forms the salad's base.

title: Candle salad
text: Then stack pineapple rings on top of the lettuce, providing a niche for inserting one whole (or more often half) peeled banana.

title: Candle salad
text: For garnish the banana is topped with choice of cream and a cherry.

title: Wheat allergy
text: Wheat allergy is an allergy which typically presents itself as a food allergy, but can also be a contact allergy resulting from occupational exposure to wheat.

title: Wheat allergy
text: Like all allergies, wheat allergy involves immunoglobulin E and mast cell response.

title: Wheat allergy
text: Typically the allergy is limited to the seed storage proteins of wheat, some reactions are restricted to wheat proteins, while others can react across many varieties of seeds and other plant tissues.

title: Wheat allergy
text: Wheat allergy may be a misnomer since there are many allergenic components in wheat, for example serine protease inhibitors, glutelins and prolamins and different responses are often attributed to different proteins.

title: Wheat allergy
text: Twenty-seven potential wheat allergens have been successfully identified.

title: Wheat allergy
text: The most severe response is exercise/aspirin induced anaphylaxis attributed to one omega gliadin that is a relative of the protein that causes celiac disease.

title: Wheat allergy
text: Other more common symptoms include nausea, urticaria, atopy.

title: Wheat allergy
text: Gluten sensitivity is not usually classified as a wheat allergy.

title: Jello salad
text: Jell-O salad (also called gelatin salad, jelly salad, congealed salad, or molded salad) is a salad made with flavored gelatin, fruit, and sometimes grated carrots or more rarely, other vegetables.

title: Jello salad
text: Other ingredients may include cottage cheese, cream cheese, marshmallows, nuts, or pretzels.

title: Jello salad
text: These salads were popular in the 1960s.

title: Bean salad
text: Bean salad is a common cold salad composed of various cooked beans -- (green beans, yellow wax beans, garbanzos (chick peas), kidney beans -- and typically fresh onions, peppers or other vegetables, tossed in a vinaigrette, characteristically sweetened with sugar.

title: Bean salad
text: Bean salad can be prepared as a pickled dish.

title: Bean salad
text: It is common in some parts of the United States to refer to this sort of salad by the number of different beans it contains; e.g., "Three Bean Salad" or "Four Bean Salad."

title: Bean salad
text: The generic term, "Bean Salad," can also be used to refer to completely unrelated dishes, including variants with such starches as barley, pasta noodles or rice.

title: Crataegus pinnatifida
text: Crataegus pinnatifida, also known as mountain hawthorn, Chinese haw, Chinese hawthorn or Chinese hawberry, refers to a small to medium-sized tree, as well as the fruit of the tree.

title: Crataegus pinnatifida
text: The fruit is bright red, 1.5 in in diameter.

title: Crataegus pinnatifida
text: In Chinese, the fruit is called "shānzhā" (Chinese: 山楂, literally meaning "mountain hawthorn") or "da hong guo" (大红果, literally meaning "big red fruit").

title: Contagion (film)
text: Contagion is a 2011 U.S. medical thriller-disaster film directed by Steven Soderbergh.

title: Contagion (film)
text: The film features an ensemble cast that includes Marion Cotillard, Bryan Cranston, Matt Damon, Laurence Fishburne, Jude Law, Gwyneth Paltrow, Kate Winslet, and Jennifer Ehle.

title: Contagion (film)
text: The plot of "Contagion" documents the spread of a virus transmitted by fomites, attempts by medical researchers and public health officials to identify and contain the disease, the loss of social order in a pandemic, and finally the introduction of a vaccine to halt its spread.

title: Contagion (film)
text: To follow several interacting plot lines, the film makes use of the multi-narrative "hyperlink cinema" style, popularized in several of Soderbergh's films.

title: And Everything Is Going Fine
text: And Everything Is Going Fine is a 2010 documentary film directed by Steven Soderbergh about the life of monologist Spalding Gray.

title: And Everything Is Going Fine
text: It premiered on January 23, 2010 at the Slamdance Film Festival and was screened at the 2010 SXSW Film Festival and the 2010 Maryland Film Festival.

title: And Everything Is Going Fine
text: Soderbergh had earlier directed Gray's filmed monologue, "Gray's Anatomy".

title: The Knick
text: The Knick is an American television drama series on Cinemax created by Jack Amiel and Michael Begler and directed by Steven Soderbergh.

title: The Knick
text: The series follows Dr. John W. Thackery (Clive Owen) and the staff at a fictionalized version of the Knickerbocker Hospital (the "Knick") in New York during the early twentieth century.

title: The Knick
text: Amiel and Begler write the majority of the episodes and are executive producers.

title: The Knick
text: Owen, Soderbergh, Gregory Jacobs, and Michael Sugar (Anonymous Content) are also executive producers.

title: The Knick
text: Steven Katz is the supervising producer and also writer, Michael Polaire is the producer and David Kirchner is the associate producer.

title: Mark Whitacre
text: Mark Edward Whitacre (born May 1, 1957) came to public attention in 1995 when, as president of the BioProducts Division at Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) based in Decatur, Illinois, he was the highest-level corporate executive in U.S. history to become a Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) whistleblower.

title: Mark Whitacre
text: For three years (1992–95), Whitacre acted as an informant for the FBI, which was investigating ADM for price fixing.

title: Bubble (film)
text: Bubble is a 2005 American drama film directed by Steven Soderbergh about three low-paid doll factory workers, one of whom is murdered.

title: Bubble (film)
text: Soderbergh also shot and edited the film under the pseudonyms Peter Andrews and Mary Ann Bernard, taken from his father's given names and his mother's maiden name, respectively.

title: Bubble (film)
text: The film was shot on high-definition video.

title: Logan Lucky
text: Logan Lucky is a 2017 American heist comedy film directed by Steven Soderbergh, based on an original script written by unknown newcomer Rebecca Blunt.

title: Logan Lucky
text: Soderbergh came out of retirement to direct the film and to distribute it independently through his own company Fingerprint Releasing.

title: Logan Lucky
text: The film features an ensemble cast consisting of Channing Tatum, Adam Driver, Riley Keough, Daniel Craig, Seth MacFarlane, Katie Holmes, Hilary Swank, Katherine Waterston and Sebastian Stan, and follows the unlucky Logan family who plan to rob the Charlotte Motor Speedway, and try to avoid getting caught by the FBI.

title: Out of Sight
text: Out of Sight is a 1998 American crime comedy film directed by Steven Soderbergh and written by Scott Frank, adapted from Elmore Leonard's novel of the same name.

title: Out of Sight
text: The first of several collaborations between Soderbergh and actor George Clooney, it was released on June 26, 1998.

title: Gray's Anatomy (film)
text: Gray's Anatomy is an 80-minute film directed by Steven Soderbergh in 1996 involving a dramatized monologue by actor/writer Spalding Gray.

title: Gray's Anatomy (film)
text: The title is taken from the classic human anatomy textbook, "Gray's Anatomy", originally written by Henry Gray in 1858.

title: Gray's Anatomy (film)
text: It was shot in ten days in late January 1996 during a break Soderbergh had from post-production on his previous film, "Schizopolis".

title: Schizopolis
text: Schizopolis (also known as Steven Soderbergh's Schizopolis) is a 1996 experimental comedy film with a non-linear narrative directed by Steven Soderbergh.

title: The Informant!
text: The Informant!

title: The Informant!
text: is a 2009 American biographical-comedy-crime film directed by Steven Soderbergh.

title: The Informant!
text: Written by Scott Z. Burns, the film stars Matt Damon as the titular informant named Mark Whitacre, as well as Scott Bakula, Joel McHale and Melanie Lynskey.

title: The Informant!
text: It depicts Whitacre's involvement as a whistle blower in the lysine price-fixing conspiracy of the mid-1990s as described in the 2000 nonfiction book "The Informant", by journalist Kurt Eichenwald.

title: Small Town Boy (song)
text: "Small Town Boy" is a song recorded by American country music artist Dustin Lynch.

title: Small Town Boy (song)
text: It was released to country radio on February 17, 2017 as the second single from his third studio album, "Current Mood".

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: Kill the Lights is the fifth studio album by American country music artist Luke Bryan.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: It was released on August 7, 2015, by Capitol Nashville.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: The album's lead single, "Kick the Dust Up", was released to country radio on May 19, 2015. "

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: Strip It Down" was released as the second single from the album on August 4, 2015.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: The album's third single, "Home Alone Tonight", was released to country radio on November 23, 2015.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: The album's fourth single, "Huntin', Fishin' and Lovin' Every Day" released to country radio on March 14, 2016.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: The album's fifth single, "Move" released to country radio on July 25, 2016.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: All five singles reached number one on the "Billboard" Country Airplay chart, making Bryan the first country music artist ever to have five number one singles from two albums apiece.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: In November 2016, the album's sixth and final single, "Fast", was sent to country radio.

title: Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)
text: With "Fast" also reaching number one in April 2017, Bryan became the first artist in the chart's history to achieve six number one singles from one album.

title: Adam Craig (singer-songwriter)
text: Adam Craig is an American country music singer-songwriter from Tenino, Washington.

title: Adam Craig (singer-songwriter)
text: Craig has made a name for himself since moving to Nashville, Tennessee in September 2004, as a songwriter.

title: Adam Craig (singer-songwriter)
text: In March 2011 he signed to Sony/ATV Music Publishing, and has co-penned songs including Parmalee's "Close Your Eyes", Jason Aldean's "Church Pew or Bar Stool", Dustin Lynch's "World to Me", and Love and Theft's "Whiskey on My Breath".

title: Adam Craig (singer-songwriter)
text: Now signed to Stoney Creek Records, Craig has released his self-titled debut EP, and his debut single to country radio called "Reckon", written by Randy Montana, Derek George and Jeremy Stover.

title: Mind Reader (Dustin Lynch song)
text: "Mind Reader" is a song recorded by American country music artist Dustin Lynch.

title: Mind Reader (Dustin Lynch song)
text: It was released to country radio on September 28, 2015 as the third single from his second studio album "Where It's At" (2014).

title: Mind Reader (Dustin Lynch song)
text: The song was written by Rhett Akins and Ben Hayslip.

title: Mind Reader (Dustin Lynch song)
text: It received mixed reviews from critics divided over the production and lyrics.

title: Where It's At (Yep, Yep)
text: "Where It's At (Yep, Yep)" (also known as "Where It's At" in its short title) is a song recorded by American country music artist Dustin Lynch.

title: Where It's At (Yep, Yep)
text: It was released in March 2014 as the first single from his second studio album.

title: Where It's At (Yep, Yep)
text: The album, "Where It's At", was released on September 9, 2014.

title: Where It's At (Yep, Yep)
text: The song was written by Cary Barlowe, Zach Crowell and Matt Jenkins.

title: Where It's At (Yep, Yep)
text: The song garnered positive reviews from critics who praised its upbeat instrumentals and Lynch's vocal performance.

title: Current Mood
text: Current Mood is the third studio album by American country music singer Dustin Lynch.

title: Current Mood
text: It was released on September 8, 2017, via Broken Bow Records.

title: Current Mood
text: The album includes the singles "Seein' Red" and "Small Town Boy", which have both reached number one on the Country Airplay chart.

title: Cowboys and Angels (Dustin Lynch song)
text: "Cowboys and Angels" is a song recorded by American country music artist Dustin Lynch.

title: Cowboys and Angels (Dustin Lynch song)
text: It was released in January 2012 as the first single from his self-titled debut album.

title: Cowboys and Angels (Dustin Lynch song)
text: Lynch co-wrote the song with Josh Leo and Tim Nichols.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: Where It's At is the second studio album by American country music artist Dustin Lynch.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: It was released on September 9, 2014 by Broken Bow Records.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: Mickey Jack Cones produced 12 of the 15 songs with Brett Beavers and Luke Wooten co-producing 3 of the 15.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: Lynch co-wrote five of the album's fifteen tracks.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: The album's first single, "Where It's At (Yep, Yep)", was released to country radio on March 31, 2014 and became his first number one single on the Country Airplay chart.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: The album's second single, "Hell of a Night", was released to country radio on November 3, 2014.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: and became his second number one single on the Country Airplay chart.

title: Where It's At (album)
text: The album's third single, "Mind Reader", was released to country radio on September 28, 2015, and became his third number one single on the Country Airplay chart.

title: Seein' Red (Dustin Lynch song)
text: "Seein' Red" is a song recorded by American country music artist Dustin Lynch.

title: Seein' Red (Dustin Lynch song)
text: It was released to country radio on July 11, 2016 as the lead single from his third studio album, "Current Mood".

title: Seein' Red (Dustin Lynch song)
text: The song was written by Kurt Allison, Steve Bogard, Tully Kennedy and Jason Sever.

title: Dustin Lynch (album)
text: Dustin Lynch is the debut studio album by American country music artist Dustin Lynch.

title: Dustin Lynch (album)
text: It was released on August 21, 2012 by Broken Bow Records.

title: Dustin Lynch (album)
text: Lynch wrote or co-wrote ten of the album's thirteen tracks, including the first single, "Cowboys and Angels".

title: Dustin Lynch (album)
text: The album's second single, "She Cranks My Tractor", was released to country radio on November 19, 2012.

title: Dustin Lynch (album)
text: The album has sold 100,000 copies as of December 2012.

title: Dustin Lynch (album)
text: The album's third single, "Wild in Your Smile", was released to country radio on May 27, 2013.

title: The Zoo Story
text: The Zoo Story is a one-act play by American playwright Edward Albee.

title: The Zoo Story
text: His first play, it was written in 1958 and completed in just three weeks.

title: The Zoo Story
text: The play explores themes of isolation, loneliness, miscommunication as anathematization, social disparity and dehumanization in a commercial world.

title: The Zoo Story
text: Now, professional theatre companies can only produce "The Zoo Story" as a part of "Edward Albee's at Home at the Zoo" (originally titled "Peter and Jerry").

title: Edward F. Albee Foundation
text: The Edward F. Albee Foundation was started by its namesake, playwright Edward Albee, in 1967, after revenue from his play Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?

title: Edward F. Albee Foundation
text: proved abundant.

title: Finding the Sun
text: Finding the Sun is a one-act play by American playwright Edward Albee.

title: Jack Gelber
text: Jack Gelber (April 12, 1932 – May 9, 2003) was an American playwright best known for his 1959 drama "The Connection", depicting the life of drug-addicted jazz musicians.

title: Jack Gelber
text: The first great success of the Living Theatre, the play was translated into five languages and produced in ten nations.

title: Jack Gelber
text: Gelber continued to work and write in New York, where he also taught writing, directing and drama as a professor, chiefly at Brooklyn College, City University of New York, where he created the MFA program in playwriting.

title: Jack Gelber
text: In 1999 he received the Edward Albee Last Frontier Playwright Award in recognition of his lifetime of achievements in theatre.

title: Reed A. Albee
text: Reed Adalbert Albee (8 September 1885 – 2 August 1961) was an American businessman.

title: Reed A. Albee
text: He is most noted as the adoptive father of the American playwright Edward Albee and for being a member of a prominent East Coast family who owned several theaters.

title: Oppenheimer Award
text: The Oppenheimer Award (also known as the Newsday George Oppenheimer Award or the Oppy) was named after the late playwright and Newsday drama critic George Oppenheimer.

title: Oppenheimer Award
text: It was awarded annually to the best New York debut production by an American playwright for a non-musical play.

title: Oppenheimer Award
text: The selection committee has included playwrights Edward Albee, Wendy Wasserstein, James Lapine, and Richard Greenberg.

title: Oppenheimer Award
text: The award carries a $5,000 cash prize.

title: Oppenheimer Award
text: The first award of $1,000, to the play Getting Out by Marsha Norman, was made in 1979, two years after Oppenheimer's death.

title: Oppenheimer Award
text: It was discontinued in 2007.

title: Steven Dietz
text: Steven Dietz (born June 23, 1958) is an American playwright.

title: Steven Dietz
text: With the exception of "Fiction", produced Off-Broadway by the Roundabout Theatre Company in 2004, the vast majority of Dietz's plays are produced in American regional theaters.

title: Steven Dietz
text: During the 2015-16 season, Dietz premiered three new plays: "Bloomsday" (American Theatre Critics Association Steinberg New Play Award Citation), "This Random World" (Humana Festival of New American Plays), and the thriller "On Clover Road" (National New Play Network rolling world premiere).

title: Steven Dietz
text: In 2010, Dietz was once again named one of the most produced playwrights in America (excluding Shakespeare), placing eighth on the list of the Top Ten Most Produced Playwrights in America, tied with Tennessee Williams and Edward Albee for number of productions.

title: Steven Dietz
text: Other recent plays include the black comedy, "Rancho Mirage", and the contemporary riff on Arthur Schnitzler's "Reigen" entitled "American la Ronde".

title: Steven Dietz
text: Dietz has taught in the MFA Playwriting and Directing programs at the University of Texas at Austin since 2006 .

title: Steven Dietz
text: In addition, he is a Dramatists Guild "Traveling Master", teaching workshops and master classes on playwriting and story-making around the U.S.

title: Three Tall Women
text: Three Tall Women is a play by Edward Albee, which won the 1994 Pulitzer Prize for Drama, Albee's third.

title: The American Dream (play)
text: The American Dream is an early, one-act play by American playwright Edward Albee.

title: Edward Albee's At Home at the Zoo
text: Edward Albee's At Home at the Zoo (formerly titled "Peter & Jerry") is a play by Edward Albee which adds a first act to his 1959 play "The Zoo Story".

title: Edward Albee's At Home at the Zoo
text: This first act, also called "Homelife", revolves around the marriage of Peter and Ann and ends with Peter leaving to go read a book in Central Park.

title: Mellon Institute of Industrial Research
text: Mellon Institute of Industrial Research, founded in 1913 by Andrew W. Mellon and Richard B. Mellon, merged with the Carnegie Institute of Technology in 1967 to form Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States.

title: Mellon Institute of Industrial Research
text: While it ceased to exist as a distinct institution, the landmark building bearing its name remains located at the corner of Fifth Avenue and Bellefield Avenue in Oakland, the city's university district.

title: Mellon Institute of Industrial Research
text: It is sited adjacent to The Carnegie Mellon Software Engineering Institute (SEI) and the University of Pittsburgh's Bellefield Hall and is across Bellefield Avenue from two other local landmarks: the University of Pittsburgh's Heinz Memorial Chapel and the Cathedral of Learning.

title: CUPS (CMU)
text: The Carnegie Mellon University Usable Privacy and Security Laboratory (CUPS) was established in the Spring of 2004 to bring together Carnegie Mellon University researchers working on a diverse set of projects related to understanding and improving the usability of privacy and security software and systems.

title: CUPS (CMU)
text: The privacy and security research community has become increasingly aware that usability problems severely impact the effectiveness of mechanisms designed to provide security and privacy in software systems.

title: CUPS (CMU)
text: Indeed, one of the four grand research challenges in information security and assurance identified by the Computing Research Association in 2003 is: "Give end-users security controls they can understand and privacy they can control for the dynamic, pervasive computing environments of the future."

title: CUPS (CMU)
text: This is the challenge that CUPS strives to address.

title: CUPS (CMU)
text: CUPS is affiliated with Carnegie Mellon CyLab and has members from the Engineering and Public Policy Department, the School of Computer Science, the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, the Heinz College, and the Department of Social and Decision Sciences.

title: Jeff Friedman
text: Jeff Friedman is an American poet and professor.

title: Jeff Friedman
text: He is the author of five books of poetry, "Black Threads", (Carnegie Mellon University Press, 2007), "Taking Down the Angel" (Carnegie Mellon University Press, 2003), "Scattering the Ashes" (selected in the open competition for the Carnegie Mellon University Press Poetry Series, 1998) and "The Record-Breaking Heat Wave" (BkMk Press-University of Missouri-Kansas City, 1986).

title: Jeff Friedman
text: His fifth book, "Working in Flour" is coming out soon on Carnegie Mellon University Press.

title: Mellon College of Science
text: The Mellon College of Science (MCS) at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA houses the Chemistry, Mathematical Sciences, Physics, and Biological Sciences departments.

title: Mellon College of Science
text: In addition, it oversees several interdisciplinary research centers.

title: Mellon College of Science
text: MCS also awards the Dickson Prize in Science.

title: Mellon College of Science
text: The college is named for the Mellon family, founders of the Mellon Institute of Industrial Research, a predecessor of Carnegie Mellon University.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: Venkatesan Guruswami (born 1976) is a computer scientist at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, United States.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: He did his schooling at Padma Seshadri Bala Bhavan in Chennai, India.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: He completed his undergraduate in Computer Science from IIT Madras and his doctorate from Massachusetts Institute of Technology under the supervision of Madhu Sudan in 2001 .

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: After receiving his PhD, he spent a year at UC Berkeley as a Miller Fellow, and then was a member of the faculty at the University of Washington from 2002 to 2009.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: His primary area of research is computer science, and in particular on error-correcting codes.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: Following 2007, he was on leave from University of Washington.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: During 2007-2008, he visited the Institute for Advanced Study as a Member of School of Mathematics.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: He also visited SCS at Carnegie Mellon University during 2008-09 as a Visiting Faculty.

title: Venkatesan Guruswami
text: In July 2009, he joined the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University as Associate Professor in the Computer Science Department.

title: Dzvinia Orlowsky
text: Dzvinia Orlowsky is a Ukrainian American poet, translator, editor, and professor.

title: Dzvinia Orlowsky
text: She is author of five poetry collections including "Convertible Night, Flurry of Stones" (Carnegie Mellon University Press, 2009) and her most recent, "Silvertone "(Carnegie Mellon University Press, 2013)" ."

title: Dzvinia Orlowsky
text: She is co-winner of the Sheila Motton Book Award.

title: Dzvinia Orlowsky
text: Her first collection, "A Handful of Bees", was reprinted in 2009 as a Carnegie Mellon University Classic Contemporary.

title: Lori L. Holt
text: Lori L. Holt is a Professor of Psychology at Carnegie Mellon University.

title: Lori L. Holt
text: She specializes in speech perception, focusing on how general perceptual and cognitive mechanisms contribute to speech perception and how speech can be used to broadly understand auditory cognition.

title: Lori L. Holt
text: In pursuit of these research areas, she employs human perceptual and learning paradigms as well as animal behavioral experiments and computational models.

title: Lori L. Holt
text: Holt received a B.S. in psychology from the University of Wisconsin–Madison in 1995 and a Ph.D. in cognitive psychology with a minor in neurophysiology from UW–Madison in 1999, and she has been employed at Carnegie Mellon University and has been a member of the Center for the Neural Basis of Cognition ever since.

title: Lori L. Holt
text: Holt is the director of the Speech Perception & Learning Laboratory at Carnegie Mellon University.

title: Lori L. Holt
text: She was one of two recipients of the Troland Research Awards in 2013.

title: Carnegie Mellon University in Qatar
text: Carnegie Mellon University in Qatar (Arabic: جامعة كارنيجي ميلون في قطر), is one of the branch campuses of Carnegie Mellon University, located in Doha, Qatar.

title: Carnegie Mellon University in Qatar
text: It is Carnegie Mellon's first undergraduate branch campus, is a member of the Qatar Foundation, and began graduating students in May 2008.

title: Gloriana St. Clair
text: Gloriana St. Clair (born 1939) is a pioneer in the field of academic librarianship, as well as a scholar of Norse Mythology and its relationship to the works of J.R.R. Tolkien.

title: Gloriana St. Clair
text: She is currently the Principal Investigator of the Olive Executable Archive as well as the official University Liaison to the Pittsburgh chapter of the Osher Lifelong Learning Institute at Carnegie Mellon University.

title: Gloriana St. Clair
text: She is Dean Emerita of Carnegie Mellon University Libraries (1998-2013).

title: Gloriana St. Clair
text: Before coming to Carnegie Mellon, St. Clair held leadership positions at several other universities.

title: Gloriana St. Clair
text: St. Clair attended the University of California, Berkeley, receiving a bachelor's degree in English in 1962 and a master's degree in library science in 1963.

title: David S. Touretzky
text: David S. Touretzky is a research professor in the Computer Science Department and the Center for the Neural Basis of Cognition at Carnegie Mellon University.

title: David S. Touretzky
text: He received a BA in Computer Science at Rutgers University in 1978, and earned a master's degree and a Ph.D. (1984) in Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University.

title: David S. Touretzky
text: Touretzky has worked as an Internet activist in favor of freedom of speech, especially what he perceives as abuse of the legal system by government and private authorities.

title: David S. Touretzky
text: He is a notable critic of Scientology.

title: Shanghai Grand Theatre
text: The Shanghai Grand Theatre () is one of the largest and best-equipped automatic stages in the world.

title: Shanghai Grand Theatre
text: Since the theatre opened on August 27, 1998, it has staged over 6,000 performances of operas, musicals, ballets, symphonies, chamber music concerts, spoken dramas and various Chinese operas.

title: Shanghai Grand Theatre
text: The site is located at the intersection of Central Boulevard and Huangpi Road South in the northern part of the People's Square in Huangpu District, Shanghai, China.

title: Shanghai Grand Theatre
text: It is the home of the Shanghai Opera House Company; however, the title "Shanghai Opera House" officially applies to only the performing company and not to the building.

title: Shanghai Grand Theatre
text: The Shanghai Grand Theatre is also the resident for other performing companies.

title: Mozarteum Argentino
text: The Mozarteum Argentino is a private, non-profit musical institution in Argentina.

title: Mozarteum Argentino
text: It is one of the most important musical institutions in the country and provides scholarships to some of Argentina's most able musicians.

title: Mozarteum Argentino
text: The Mozarteum Argentino was established in 1952 and also organizes concerts, often over 50 a year.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: Joseph Anderer is principal horn and a founding member of St. Luke’s Chamber Ensemble and the Orchestra of St. Luke's.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: He has also been a member of the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra’s horn section since 1984, serving as acting Principal Horn for season 1984-5 and has been Principal Horn since 2003-2004.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: Before joining the Met Orchestra, he was a frequent performer with the New York Philharmonic for fourteen seasons, and participated in many concerts, recordings and tours in the US, Europe, Asia, Australia and South America.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: He was also a member of the Boehm Quintette for many years, and premiered many works composed for that ensemble.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: As soloist, he has appeared with the Orchestra of St. Luke’s in Carnegie Hall including performing as soloist in the American premier of Benjamin Britten’s “Now Sleeps the Crimson Petal”, as well as at many festivals.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: He holds degrees from The Juilliard School, where he was a student of Ranier DeIntinis.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: Mr. Anderer is active in the recording studio, performing chamber music, operas, symphonic works, solo works, TV commercials and films along with performing in recitals with singers and other musicians.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: He has also appeared on albums by Dawn Upshaw, Billy Joel, Mandy Patinkin, Grover Washington, Jr., Marcus Roberts and Tony Bennett & k.d. lang.

title: Joseph Anderer
text: He has been the Horn Coach at the Verbier Festival for many years and is a member of the faculty at the Steinhardt School of New York University.

title: Impresario
text: An impresario (from the Italian "impresa", "an enterprise or undertaking") is a person who organizes and often finances concerts, plays, or operas, performing a role similar to that of an artist manager or a film or television producer.

title: Impresario
text: The term originated in the social and economic world of Italian opera, in which from the mid-18th century to the 1830s, the impresario was the key figure in the organization of a lyric season.

title: Impresario
text: The owners of the theatre, usually noble amateurs, charged the impresario with hiring a composer (until the 1850s operas were expected to be new) and the orchestra, singers, costumes and sets, all while assuming considerable financial risk.

title: Impresario
text: In 1786 Mozart satirized the stress and emotional mayhem in a single-act farce "Der Schauspieldirektor" ("The Impresario").

title: Impresario
text: Antonio Vivaldi was unusual in acting as both impresario and composer; in 1714 he managed seasons at Teatro San Angelo in Venice, where his opera "Orlando finto pazzo" was followed by numerous others.

title: Robert Nagy (tenor)
text: Robert Nagy (March 3, 1929 – November 7, 2008) was an American operatic tenor who had a lengthy and fruitful association with the Metropolitan Opera that lasted for three decades.

title: Robert Nagy (tenor)
text: His association with the Met began when he won the Metropolitan Opera National Council Auditions in 1956.

title: Robert Nagy (tenor)
text: He mostly portrayed comprimario roles at the Met where his most memorable early role was the Messenger in "Aida"; a role he sang 172 times for the company.

title: Robert Nagy (tenor)
text: He notably sang in the world premieres of two operas by Samuel Barber at the Met: "Vanessa" (1958) and "Antony and Cleopatra" (1966).

title: Robert Nagy (tenor)
text: He also sang in the company premieres of "Die Frau ohne Schatten" (1966), "Billy Budd" (1978) and "L'enfant et les sortilèges" (1981).

title: Robert Nagy (tenor)
text: Although Nagy specialized in supporting roles, he also portrayed several leading parts at the Met, among them Florestan in "Fidelio", Herodes in "Salome", and the Drum Major in "Wozzeck'.

title: Robert Nagy (tenor)
text: He remained on the Met roster through the end of the 1987–88 season, performing 1,187 performances with the Met during his thirty years with the company.

title: Financial plan
text: In general usage, a financial plan is a comprehensive evaluation of an individual's current pay and future financial state by using current known variables to predict future income, asset values and withdrawal plans.

title: Financial plan
text: This often includes a budget which organizes an individual's finances and sometimes includes a series of steps or specific goals for spending and saving in the future.

title: Financial plan
text: This plan allocates future income to various types of expenses, such as rent or utilities, and also reserves some income for short-term and long-term savings.

title: Financial plan
text: A financial plan is sometimes referred to as an investment plan, but in personal finance a financial plan can focus on other specific areas such as risk management, estates, college, or retirement.

title: Theater Erfurt
text: Theater Erfurt is the municipal theatre in Erfurt, the capital of Thuringia, Germany.

title: Theater Erfurt
text: The main stage is in a new building in the , completed in 2003.

title: Theater Erfurt
text: The theatre offers musical theatre and concerts, played by the .

title: Theater Erfurt
text: Ballet and plays are offered by guest performances.

title: Theater Erfurt
text: The company organizes the annual open air festival "".

title: Vanessa Bley
text: Vanessa Bley is a New York City and Los Angeles–based singer, composer, producer, and musician.

title: Vanessa Bley
text: She is daughter of jazz pianist Paul Bley and pioneer video artist Carol Goss.

title: Audra McDonald
text: Audra Ann McDonald (born July 3, 1970) is an American actress and singer.

title: Audra McDonald
text: She has appeared on the stage in both musicals and dramas such as "Ragtime", "A Raisin in the Sun" and "Porgy and Bess".

title: Audra McDonald
text: With her full lyric soprano voice, she maintains an active concert and recording career performing song cycles and operas as well as in concerts throughout the U.S.

title: Audra McDonald
text: She has won six Tony Awards, more performance wins than any other actor, and is the only person to win all four acting categories.

title: Audra McDonald
text: She starred as Dr. Naomi Bennett on the ABC television drama "Private Practice".

title: Freight forwarder
text: A freight forwarder, forwarder, or forwarding agent, also known as a non-vessel operating common carrier (NVOCC), is a person or company that organizes shipments for individuals or corporations to get goods from the manufacturer or producer to a market, customer or final point of distribution.

title: Freight forwarder
text: Forwarders contract with a carrier or often multiple carriers to move the goods.

title: Freight forwarder
text: A forwarder does not move the goods but acts as an expert in the logistics network.

title: Freight forwarder
text: These carriers can use a variety of shipping modes, including ships, airplanes, trucks, and railroads, and often multiple modes for a single shipment.

title: Freight forwarder
text: For example, the freight forwarder may arrange to have cargo moved from a plant to an airport by truck, flown to the destination city, then moved from the airport to a customer's building by another truck.

title: Thomas Ince: Hollywood's Independent Pioneer
text: Thomas Ince: Hollywood's Independent Pioneer is a biography of Thomas H. Ince, written by Brian Taves and published by University Press of Kentucky in 2012.

title: Thomas Ince: Hollywood's Independent Pioneer
text: Upon publication the book was positively reviewed by critics.

title: Thomas Ince: Hollywood's Independent Pioneer
text: Divided in 5 parts, the book provides information about Ince's life and his films, including their financial details.

title: Thomas Ince: Hollywood's Independent Pioneer
text: Taves rejects the idea that William Randolph Hearst was responsible for Ince's death.

title: John Ince (actor)
text: John Ince, also known as John E. Ince, (August 29, 1878 – April 10, 1947) was an American stage and motion pictures actor, a film director, and the eldest brother of Thomas H. Ince and Ralph Ince.

title: Elinor Kershaw
text: Elinor Kershaw, also known as Nell and Elinor K. Ince, (November 19, 1884 – September 12, 1971) was an American stage and motion-picture actress; wife of Hollywood Mogul Thomas H. Ince, and mother of actor Richard Ince and writer Thomas H. Ince, Jr.

title: Elinor Kershaw
text: Her older sister was the stage actress Willette Kershaw.

title: Elinor Kershaw
text: She built the Château Élysée as a luxury long-term residential apartment house for movie stars.

title: The Coward (1915 film)
text: The Coward is a 1915 American silent historical war drama film directed by Reginald Barker and produced by Thomas H. Ince.

title: The Coward (1915 film)
text: Ince also wrote the film's story and scenario with C. Gardner Sullivan.

title: The Coward (1915 film)
text: The film stars Frank Keenan and Charles Ray.

title: The Coward (1915 film)
text: John Gilbert also appears in an uncredited bit part.

title: The Coward (1915 film)
text: A copy of "The Coward" is preserved at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: The Deserter (1912 film)
text: The Deserter is a 1912 silent black-and-white two-reel Western film written and directed by Thomas H. Ince.

title: The Deserter (1912 film)
text: It was released March 15, 1912 and starred Francis Ford and Ethel Grandin.

title: The Deserter (1912 film)
text: The film was screened in December 2006 at the Museum of Modern Art in New York, as part of a retrospective on Thomas H. Ince.

title: The Deserter (1912 film)
text: The film is available at the Library of Congress.

title: Château Élysée
text: The Château Élysée is a former hotel located at 5930 Franklin Ave. in the Franklin Village section of Los Angeles, California.

title: Château Élysée
text: It was originally built as a luxury long-term residential apartment house for movie stars by Elinor K. Ince, widow of Thomas H. Ince, the highly successful pioneer silent filmmaker who died in 1924.

title: Château Élysée
text: Designed by eminent architect Arthur E. Harvey as a prominent seven-story replica of a 17th-century French-Normandy castle, it remains as the most impressive of several Hollywood chateaux built during the area's booming 1920s.

title: The Italian (1915 film)
text: The Italian is a 1915 American silent film feature which tells the story of an Italian gondolier who comes to the United States to make his fortune but instead winds up working as a shoeshiner and experiencing tragedy while living with his wife and child in a tenement on New York's Lower East Side.

title: The Italian (1915 film)
text: The film was produced by Thomas H. Ince, directed by Reginald Barker, and co-written by C. Gardner Sullivan and Ince.

title: The Italian (1915 film)
text: The film stars stage actor George Beban in the title role as the Italian immigrant, Pietro "Beppo" Donnetti.

title: The Italian (1915 film)
text: In 1991, this film was deemed "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant" by the United States Library of Congress and selected for preservation in the National Film Registry.

title: The Scourge of the Desert
text: The Scourge of the Desert (also known as Reformed Outlaw ) is a 1915 American silent short Western starring William S. Hart and Rhea Mitchell.

title: The Scourge of the Desert
text: It was billed as, "A Thrilling (Broncho) Romance of the Arizona Staked Plains."

title: The Scourge of the Desert
text: It was produced by Thomas H. Ince and written by C. Gardner Sullivan, Ince, and William H. Clifford.

title: Ralph Ince
text: Ralph Ince (January 16, 1887 – April 10, 1937) was an American pioneer film actor, director and screenwriter whose career began near the dawn of the silent film era.

title: Ralph Ince
text: Ralph Ince was the brother of John Ince and Thomas H. Ince.

title: Civilization (film)
text: Civilization is a 1916 American pacifist allegorical drama film produced by Thomas H. Ince, written by C. Gardner Sullivan, and directed by Ince, Reginald Barker and Raymond B. West.

title: Civilization (film)
text: The story involves a submarine commander who refuses to fire at a civilian ocean liner supposedly carrying ammunition for his country's enemies.

title: Civilization (film)
text: The film was a big-budget spectacle that was compared to both "Birth of a Nation" and the paintings of Jean-François Millet.

title: Civilization (film)
text: The film was a popular success and was credited by the Democratic National Committee with helping to re-elect Woodrow Wilson as the U.S. President in 1916.

title: Civilization (film)
text: The film was also one of the first to depict Jesus Christ as a character in a motion picture, leading some to criticize the depiction as in "poor taste."

title: Phlebodium
text: Phlebodium is a small genus of two to four species of ferns, native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas.

title: Phlebodium
text: The genus is closely related to "Polypodium", and the species were formerly included in that genus.

title: Tree fern
text: The tree ferns are the ferns that grow with a trunk elevating the fronds above ground level.

title: Tree fern
text: Most tree ferns are members of the "core tree ferns", belonging to the families Dicksoniaceae, Metaxyaceae, and Cibotiaceae in the order Cyatheales.

title: Tree fern
text: In addition to those families, many ferns in other groups may be considered tree ferns, such as several ferns in the family Osmundaceae, which can achieve short trunks under a metre tall, and particularly ferns in the genus "Cibotium", which can grow ten metres tall.

title: Tree fern
text: Fern species with short trunks in the genera "Blechnum, Calochleana, Cnemedaria, Culcita" (Europe's only tree fern), "Cystodium, Leptopteris, Lophosoria, Sadleria, Thyrsopteris" and "Todea" could also be considered tree ferns in a liberal interpretation of the term.

title: Sinopieris
text: Sinopieris is a genus of butterflies in the family Pieridae.

title: Sinopieris
text: The genus occurs in Nepal, Tibet, Yunnan, Gansu, Shaanxi and Sichuan.

title: Sinopieris
text: All six species were originally included in "Pieris".

title: Sinopieris
text: The two genera are distinguished by the venation in the apical area of the forewing.

title: Sinopieris
text: Most "Sinopieris" species have a suffused grey or blackish post-discal band whereas "Pieris" usually have a single (males) or a pair (females) of blackish post-discal spots on the forewings, and no trace of any spot or band on the hindwings.

title: Leptosporangiate fern
text: Leptosporangiate ferns are the largest group of living ferns, including some 11000 species worldwide.

title: Leptosporangiate fern
text: They constitute the subclass Polypodiidae, but are often considered to be the class Pteridopsida or Polypodiopsida, although other classifications assign them a different rank.

title: Leptosporangiate fern
text: The leptosporangiate ferns are one of the four major groups of ferns, with the other three being the Eusporangiate ferns comprising the marattioid ferns (Marattiidae, Marattiaceae), the horsetails (Equisetiidae, Equisetaceae), and whisk ferns and moonworts.

title: Stephanitis takeyai
text: The andromeda lace bug (Stephanitis takeyai) is a pest insect on plants of the genus "Pieris", especially "Pieris japonica", the Japanese andromeda.

title: Stephanitis takeyai
text: It originated in Japan with its host plant but has since been introduced to other areas of the globe.

title: Stephanitis takeyai
text: At least one "Pieris" species, "Pieris floribunda", is resistant to the bug.

title: Pieris floribunda
text: Pieris floribunda is a North American species of broadleaf evergreen shrub, a member of the fetterbush genus in the blueberry family (Ericaceae).

title: Pieris floribunda
text: It is commonly known in North America as mountain fetterbush or mountain andromeda.

title: Pieris floribunda
text: All parts of "Pieris floribunda" are poisonous if ingested.

title: Pieris floribunda
text: It is a rare plant to find in landscapes because it is difficult to propagate and it often does not adapt well to cultivation.

title: Pieris floribunda
text: However, there are a few specialty and native plant nurseries that sell some, overcoming the more difficult propagation.

title: Pieris floribunda
text: In landscapes it should be grown in full to part shade, out of windy locations, and have a good quality soil with lots of organic matter that is acid of pH 4.5 to 6.5

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: Lophosoria quadripinnata is a species of fern that, according to DNA molecular analysis, belongs to the Dicksoniaceae family, where it is placed in the genus "Lophosoria".

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: It is found in the Americas spanning from Cuba and Mexico to Chile.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: In Chile it is present in the area between Talca and Aysén including Juan Fernández Islands.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: In Argentina it grows only in the humid valleys of western Neuquén and Río Negro Province.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: Diamondleaf fern is a common name.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: In Spanish it is known as 'ampe' (from the Mapudungun añpe) or palmilla, but one has to remember that there are several species of ferns called "palmillas" that have larger or smaller fronds, and which grow in colder climates.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: It is a medium-sized plant, growing to about 4–5 feet (though 10–12 feet in a sheltered place at Arduaine Garden in Argyll, Scotland) and even though the rhizome does not grow a trunk, it is clearly related to the other tree ferns due to features that were apparently already present in their common ancestor, like 'pneumathodes', and the rhizome which changed from the dorsiventral symmetry typical of the other ferns, to a radial symmetry typical of tree ferns.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: Their large and multiple pinnate fronds, with the petiole raised adaxially, and the hairs on the rhizome and lower part of the petioles, also resemble those of tree ferns.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: To identify the species, use the position and characteristics of the spores found on the fertile fronds.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: The genus already existed in the Cretaceous Period in southern Gondwana according to fossil remains found in Antarctica.

title: Lophosoria quadripinnata
text: The species is well known as an ornamental plant.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: Pieris, the whites or garden whites, is a widespread now almost cosmopolitan genus of butterflies of the family Pieridae.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: The highest species diversity is in the Palearctic.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: Many species of this genus have caterpillars which feed on cabbage and other members of the Brassicaceae.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: The chemical basis of this association with a certain plant group has been studied for over 100 years, and is now known to occur via a number of biochemical adaptations to chemicals called glucosinolates in these plants.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: In contrast to most other insects, "Pieris" caterpillars are able to detoxify these chemicals, and have become so specialised that they will not eat any food without glucosinolates.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: The "Pieris" females, in turn, check for the presence of glucosinolates before laying eggs on a plant.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: The crop-damaging species have spread from Eurasia to most of the rest of the world (most recently to South America and Africa) and are considered pest insects almost everywhere.

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: There are species of "Pieris" that are not pests, such as the North American species "Pieris oleracea" and "Pieris virginiensis".

title: Pieris (butterfly)
text: These butterflies feed successfully only on specific native vegetation.

title: Pieris canidia
text: Pieris canidia, the Indian cabbage white, is a butterfly in the family Pieridae. "

title: Pieris canidia
text: Pieris rapae" is one of the closest species in the Pieridae family.

title: Phlebodium aureum
text: Phlebodium aureum (golden polypody, golden serpent fern, cabbage palm fern, gold-foot fern, hare-foot fern; syn.

title: Phlebodium aureum
text: "Polypodium aureum", "Polypodium leucatomos") is an epiphytic fern native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas.

title: Phlebodium aureum
text: It is confined to the eastern side of the continents, extending north into the United States to Florida and the extreme southeast of Georgia, and south through the Caribbean (the Bahamas, Puerto Rico, and Lesser Antilles), and northern and eastern South America to Paraguay.

title: Phlebodium aureum
text: It is the only species of "Phlebodium" found in North America, the other species all confined to South America.

title: Phlebodium aureum
text: Other common names include calaguala (Spanish language), laua`e haole (Hawaiian), samambaia (Portuguese), and hartassbräken (Swedish).

title: Henry Covered Bridge (Ohio)
text: The Henry Covered Bridge near Bartlett, Ohio is a historic covered bridge.

title: Henry Covered Bridge (Ohio)
text: The bridge is on TR61 off OH550 southeast of Bartlett, Ohio, in Washington County, Ohio.

title: Henry Covered Bridge (Ohio)
text: It is a "Multiple Kingpost" truss type, and it is 45 feet long, and was built in 1894.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: The Main Street Bridge is a historic structure located in Charles City, Iowa, United States.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: It spans the Cedar River for 248 ft .

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: Before a bridge was built at this location local citizens would cross the river by way of a ferry, at a ford in summer, and across the ice in winter.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: The first bridge at this location was washed away in a flood while it was under construction in 1858.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: The second bridge was completed in 1864, and it was destroyed in a flood two years later.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: A temporary bridge was completed in 1867, and it was replaced by a truss bridge in 1870.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: It was used for 40 years despite an engineer's study in 1892 that suggested it be condemned.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: The Floyd County Board of Supervisors approved a replacement bridge in 1908.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: The old bridge was moved to a new spot five blocks downstream, but contract problems delayed construction of the new bridge.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: Advance Construction Company of Waukesha, Wisconsin was finally awarded a contract in March 1909.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: The three span concrete filled spandrel arch bridge was designed by their designing engineer G.W. Miller.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: It was completed in 1910 for about $40,000, which was paid for by the county and the city.

title: Main Street Bridge (Charles City, Iowa)
text: The bridge was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1999.

title: Shinn Covered Bridge
text: The Shinn Covered Bridge is a historic wooden covered bridge in the southeastern part of the U.S. state of Ohio.

title: Shinn Covered Bridge
text: Located in the countryside northeast of Bartlett in Washington County, this single-span truss bridge was built in 1886 by local carpenter Charles T. Shinn.

title: Shinn Covered Bridge
text: Built of weatherboarded walls with stone abutments and a metal roof, the bridge features vertical siding, and its portals have remained vertical and resisted creeping into another shape.

title: Shinn Covered Bridge
text: The heart of the bridge's structure employs the Burr Truss design, which mixes the king post truss with a wooden arch designed by Andrea Palladio in the sixteenth century.

title: Shinn Covered Bridge
text: Shinn built his bridge to span the western branch of Wolf Creek in Palmer Township.

title: Shinn Covered Bridge
text: Measuring 98 ft in length, the bridge was constructed soon after the drowning of one of Shinn's children.

title: Bartlett's Bridge
text: Bartlett's Bridge is a historic stone arch bridge carrying Clara Barton Road over the French River in Oxford, Massachusetts.

title: Bartlett's Bridge
text: The bridge was built in 1889 to a design by Charles A. Allen, at the time a civil engineer for the city of Worcester.

title: Bartlett's Bridge
text: The bridge was built to replace an older wooden span at the request of Edwin Bartlett, the owner of textile mills in North Oxford, whose businesses and employees would have used the road.

title: Bartlett's Bridge
text: The bridge is 30 ft long and 42 ft wide, with its elliptical arch reaching a height of 13 ft above the river.

title: Bartlett's Bridge
text: The facing of the bridge is rough-cut granite that has been fixed with mortar.

title: Bartlett's Bridge
text: In contrast, the granite stones that make up the arch have been very precisely worked.

title: Bartlett's Bridge
text: The bridge has parapet walls made of large granite slabs 4.5 ft , 2 ft wide, and 1 ft thick.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: The Eisenhower Bridge is located east of Milton, Iowa, United States.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: It carries traffic on 252nd Street over the Fox River for 197 ft .

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: The supervisors from Des Moines and Lee counties met on September 7, 1887 to view the location of a new bridge between the two counties over the Skunk River on the Burlington-Fort Madison Road.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: Financing delayed building the new bridge.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: They determined that Des Moines County would pay three-fifths of the costs and Lee County the remainder.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: Chicago engineer Horace B. Horton designed the Pratt truss, and it was built by the James B. Diver Bridge Company of Keokuk, Iowa.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: The Walker's Ferry Bridge was originally a two-span structure, and it was completed for $9,435.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: It was replaced with another bridge in 1930, and one of the spans was relocated to this location.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: Known locally as the Eisenhower Bridge, it replaced an 1895 span that was washed out in a flood.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: While it lost some of its historical integrity, it remains an example of early wagon bridge construction.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
text: It is also one of the few iron truss bridges remaining in Iowa, and it was designed by a prominent bridge engineer.

title: Eisenhower Bridge (Milton, Iowa)
