text: Pergament Home Centers (today operating as Pergament Properties) is a former home improvement store chain in the New York tri-state area, with a heavy concentration of stores in New York and a few stores in New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Pergament Home Centers
text: They were home improvement stores similar to Rickel, which had a fairly diverse range of products.

title: Pergament Home Centers
text: These stores did reasonably well until Home Depot did a major expansion starting in 1989 (taking over the retail space of many closing Modell's Shopping World locations).

title: S.A.C.I. Falabella
text: Falabella is a Chilean multinational company.

title: S.A.C.I. Falabella
text: It is the second largest retail company in Chile after Cencosud and one of the largest in Latin America.

title: S.A.C.I. Falabella
text: It operates its flagship Falabella department stores in addition to Mall Plaza shopping centers, Tottus hyper & supermarkets, Banco Falabella banks, and Sodimac home improvement centers.

title: S.A.C.I. Falabella
text: The company also operates in the financial pharmaceutical sectors and others.

title: S.A.C.I. Falabella
text: The company has 259 stores and 27 Shopping malls.

title: S.A.C.I. Falabella
text: The stores are divided into 64 department stores branded as Falabella, 114 home improvement stores called Sodimac and 64 supermarkets branded as Tottus.

title: S.A.C.I. Falabella
text: In Peru the company owns the Saga Falabella, listed in the Lima Stock Exchange.

title: BauMax
text: The Baumax AG (own spelling: "bauMax") was an Austrian chain of home improvement stores.

title: BauMax
text: It was founded in 1976 by Karlheinz Essl, Sr. in the city of Klosterneuburg and operated more than 150 stores in Austria and several countries of Eastern Europe.

title: BauMax
text: As of 2010, the company employed over 9,000 people and generated an annual revenue of 1.13 billion euros.

title: BauMax
text: When the business came into financial trouble during the 2007 financial crisis, it was finally broken up by creditors in 2014/15.

title: Heisman curse
text: The Heisman curse is a term coined to reference a two-part assertion of a negative future for the winning player of the Heisman Trophy.

title: Heisman curse
text: The "curse" supposes that any college football player who wins the Heisman plays on a team that will likely lose its subsequent bowl game.

title: Heisman curse
text: The trend of post-award failure has garnered the attention of the mainstream media.

title: Heisman curse
text: Talk of a curse in relation to bowl results was particularly prevalent from 2003 to 2008, when six Heisman Trophy winners compiled a cumulative 1–5 bowl game record, and five of those six led number one ranked teams into the Bowl Championship Series (BCS) National Championship Game as favorites (Heisman Trophy winners, including Reggie Bush, who gave back his Heisman Trophy, are 4–8 overall in the BCS National Championship Game and College Football Playoff National Championship, although prior to 2009 they were 1–6).

title: Heisman curse
text: Additionally, the Heisman curse asserts that in most cases a Heisman winner will have either a poor career in the National Football League (NFL), or in fact not even see such a football career at all.

title: Heisman curse
text: Although many Heisman winners have not enjoyed success at the professional level, including players like Matt Leinart, Andre Ware, Jason White, Rashaan Salaam, Eric Crouch, Ty Detmer, Troy Smith and Gino Torretta, proponents of the "curse" rarely cite highly successful players such as Barry Sanders, Charles Woodson, Eddie George, Tim Brown, Bo Jackson, Marcus Allen, Earl Campbell, and Tony Dorsett among the notables.

title: Nick Eddy
text: Nicholas Matthew Eddy (born August 23, 1944) is a former American football player.

title: Nick Eddy
text: He was raised in Tracy, California.

title: Nick Eddy
text: A broad-shouldered 6 feet, 195 lbs, he attended the University of Notre Dame on a football scholarship.

title: Nick Eddy
text: Eddy was a standout running back and kick returner.

title: Nick Eddy
text: Eddy was an All-American halfback, leading Notre Dame to the 1966 national championship.

title: Nick Eddy
text: He finished third to Steve Spurrier and Bob Griese in the 1966 Heisman Trophy balloting.

title: Nick Eddy
text: The Detroit Lions drafted Eddy in the 1966 NFL Draft.

title: Nick Eddy
text: Eddy played for the Lions from 1967 to 1972, although he was never a star.

title: Nick Eddy
text: He was hampered by knee injuries.

title: Reds Bagnell
text: Francis "Reds" Bagnell (September 15, 1928 – July 10, 1995) was an American football halfback in college.

title: Reds Bagnell
text: He was an All-American tailback for the University of Pennsylvania, from which he graduated in 1951.

title: Reds Bagnell
text: He won the Maxwell Award, was third for Heisman Trophy balloting, and was elected to the College Football Hall of Fame.

title: Reds Bagnell
text: Inducted in 1970 to the Pennsylvania Sports Hall of Fame.

title: Reds Bagnell
text: He served as President of the College Football Hall of Fame.

title: Casey Weldon
text: William Casey Weldon (born February 3, 1969) is a former professional American football player.

title: Casey Weldon
text: Weldon is best known for being the quarterback for Florida State in the late-1980s and early-1990s.

title: Casey Weldon
text: During his senior season in 1991, Weldon finished runner-up in the Heisman Trophy balloting to Desmond Howard of Michigan.

title: Casey Weldon
text: He also played in the National Football League, World League and for the Birmingham Thunderbolts of the XFL.

title: Darnell Autry
text: Harrington Darnell Autry (born June 19, 1976) is a former American football player who played college football at Northwestern University.

title: Darnell Autry
text: In his sophomore season, he helped lead the 1995 Northwestern Wildcats to the Big Ten Conference Championship and the 1996 Rose Bowl.

title: Darnell Autry
text: Autry finished fourth in the Heisman Trophy balloting for 1995 and appeared on the cover of "Sports Illustrated" after a Northwestern victory over Penn State.

title: Bobby Humphrey
text: Bobby Gene Humphrey (born October 11, 1966) is a former professional American football player who was selected in the first round by the Denver Broncos in the 1989 NFL Supplemental Draft after a stellar career at the University of Alabama.

title: Bobby Humphrey
text: He was a three-sport star at Glenn High School in Birmingham, while receiving a scholarship to play football at Alabama.

title: Bobby Humphrey
text: In his four seasons playing for the Crimson Tide, Humphrey rushed for 3,420 yards (A school record at the time), caught 60 passes for 523 yards, and scored 40 touchdowns.

title: Bobby Humphrey
text: He made the College Football All-America Team in 1986 and 1987.

title: Bobby Humphrey
text: In 1986, he set a school record with 1,471 rushing yards.

title: Bobby Humphrey
text: In 1987, he was voted as UPI's offensive player of the year and finished 10th in the Heisman Trophy balloting.

title: Kurt Burris
text: Kurt Burris (June 27, 1932 – July 21, 1999) was an American gridiron football center.

title: Kurt Burris
text: He played college football at Oklahoma, where he was an All-American and finished second in the 1954 Heisman Trophy balloting.

title: Kurt Burris
text: In 2000, he was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame.

title: 1964 Illinois Fighting Illini football team
text: The 1964 Illinois Fighting Illini football team represented the University of Illinois in the 1964 Big Ten Conference football season.

title: 1964 Illinois Fighting Illini football team
text: Dick Butkus played center and linebacker for Illinoisfrom 1962 through 1964.

title: 1964 Illinois Fighting Illini football team
text: During the 1964 season, Butkus was a unanimous pick for the 1964 College Football All-America Team, was named the American Football Coaches Association Player of the Year, finished third in Heisman Trophy balloting (a remarkable achievement for a lineman), and was selected as the team's most valuable player.

title: Ivory Lee Brown
text: Ivory Lee Brown (born August 17, 1969) is a former professional American football running back in the National Football League and World League of American Football.

title: Ivory Lee Brown
text: He played for the Phoenix Cardinals of the NFL and the San Antonio Riders of the WLAF.

title: Ivory Lee Brown
text: Brown is the uncle of Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson.

title: Adrian Peterson
text: Adrian Lewis Peterson (born March 21, 1985) is an American football running back for the New Orleans Saints of the National Football League (NFL).

title: Adrian Peterson
text: He played college football at Oklahoma and was drafted by the Minnesota Vikings seventh overall in the 2007 NFL Draft.

title: Adrian Peterson
text: Peterson set the NCAA freshman rushing record with 1,925 yards as a true freshman during the 2004 season.

title: Adrian Peterson
text: As a unanimous first-team All-American, he became the first freshman to finish as the runner-up in the Heisman Trophy balloting.

title: Adrian Peterson
text: Peterson finished his college football career as the Sooners' third all-time leading rusher.

title: Dance Factory (video game)
text: Dance Factory is a PlayStation 2 game developed by Broadsword Interactive and published by Codemasters.

title: Dance Factory (video game)
text: It has been compared with Dance Dance Revolution, but unlike the Dance Dance Revolution series Dance Factory can generate dance moves from any music CD.

title: Dance Factory (video game)
text: It can be played with any PlayStation controller and allows input from the EyeToy camera, but the majority of gameplay is done with a foot-operated Dance pad and is available with or without a pad in the package.

title: Meiko Nakahara
text: Meiko Nakahara (中原めいこ , Nakahara Meiko ) (born May 8, 1959 in Chiba Prefecture) is a Japanese singer.

title: Meiko Nakahara
text: She debuted in 1982 with the single "Kon'ya dake Dance Dance Dance" (今夜だけDANCE DANCE DANCE ) and the album "Coconuts House" (ココナッツ・ハウス ) .

title: Meiko Nakahara
text: Her 1984 single was the 50th best-selling single of the year in Japan, with 237,000 copies sold.

title: Meiko Nakahara
text: Her song "Ro Ro Ro Russian Roulette" (ロ・ロ・ロ・ロシアンルーレット ) , the opening song from the anime television series "Dirty Pair", won the award for Best Song at the 8th in 1986.

title: Dancing Stage Fusion
text: Dancing Stage Fusion, abbreviated DS Fusion or simply Fusion, is a music video game released by Konami to the European PlayStation and PlayStation 2 gaming audience on 5 November 2004.

title: Dancing Stage Fusion
text: In April of the following year, "Dancing Stage Fusion" was released as an arcade game.

title: Dancing Stage Fusion
text: Fusion featured new gameplay features such as EyeToy support for the PlayStation 2 release as well as new music from hit pop artists.

title: Dancing Stage Fusion
text: The arcade version of Fusion was the first arcade machine in Europe since "Dancing Stage EuroMix 2" and set a milestone as the first "Dance Dance Revolution" arcade machine produced by Konami since "Dance Dance Revolution Extreme" in 2002.

title: Dancing Stage Fusion
text: The arcade release marked a total game engine upgrade from the old PlayStation-based boards to a new system built on top of an off-the-shelf PlayStation 2.

title: Dancing Stage Fusion
text: This hardware upgrade would be later featured in the global release of "Dance Dance Revolution SuperNova" in 2006.

title: Dance Dance Dance (novel)
text: Dance Dance Dance (ダンス・ダンス・ダンス , Dansu Dansu Dansu ) is the sixth novel by Japanese writer Haruki Murakami.

title: Dance Dance Dance (novel)
text: First published in 1988, it was translated into English by Alfred Birnbaum in 1994.

title: Dance Dance Dance (novel)
text: The book is a sequel to Murakami's novel "A Wild Sheep Chase".

title: Dance Dance Dance (novel)
text: In 2001, Murakami said that writing "Dance Dance Dance" had been a healing act after his unexpected fame following the publication of "Norwegian Wood" and that, because of this, he had enjoyed writing "Dance" more than any other.

title: Pinball, 1973
text: Pinball, 1973 (1973年のピンボール , Sen-Kyūhyaku-Nanajū-San-Nen no Pinbōru ) is a novel published in 1980 by Japanese author Haruki Murakami.

title: Pinball, 1973
text: The second book in the "Trilogy of the Rat" series, it is preceded by "Hear the Wind Sing" (1979) and followed by "A Wild Sheep Chase" (1982), and is the second novel written by Murakami.

title: Dub-I-Dub
text: "Dub-I-Dub" is a song recorded by Danish Eurodance act Me & My.

title: Dub-I-Dub
text: It was released in September 1995 as the first single from the eponymous album.

title: Dub-I-Dub
text: The song was successful in many European countries, being a top ten hit in Denmark (number 1), Sweden where it peaked at number 2, and Belgium.

title: Dub-I-Dub
text: The song was also a top 20 hit in Finland, Switzerland, Norway and Austria.

title: Dub-I-Dub
text: The single was the subject of multiple remixes and was included on band's best of "The Ultimate Collection", released in 2007.

title: Dub-I-Dub
text: "Dub-I-Dub" was used in video games, such as "Dance Dance Revolution 2ndMix", "Dancing Stage EuroMix", "Dance Dance Revolution Party Collection", and "Dance Dance Revolution X".

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
text: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle (ねじまき鳥クロニクル , Nejimakitori Kuronikuru ) is a novel published in 1994–1995 by Japanese author Haruki Murakami.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
text: The American translation and its British adaptation, dubbed the "only official translations" (English) are by Jay Rubin and were first published in 1997.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
text: For this novel, Murakami received the Yomiuri Literary Award, which was awarded to him by one of his harshest former critics, Kenzaburō Ōe.

title: Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves
text: Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves is a video game in the North American "Dance Dance Revolution" series for the Nintendo Wii by Konami.

title: Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves
text: It was released on , Disney Grooves is the third DDR title for the Wii and the fourth Disney title in the music video game's series.

title: Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves
text: According to a press release published by Konami Digital Entertainment on , "Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves" features greater integration with the Wii such as support for dancing Miis which can dress up in Disney-related costumes, dancing versions of classic Disney characters such as Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck and Goofy, as well as gameplay centered on challenging players and rewarding them with new content in-game.

title: Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves
text: At least 40 songs from Disney are playable, ranging from famous movie scores to dance remixes of classic songs including "It's a Small World", "A Spoonful of Sugar", "Zip-a-Dee-Doo-Dah" and "Circle of Life".

title: Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves
text: Disney Grooves supports up to four players using dance pad controllers, two of which are included with the game.

title: After the Quake
text: After the Quake (神の子どもたちはみな踊る , Kami no Kodomo-tachi wa Mina Odoru , lit.

title: After the Quake
text: "The children of the gods all dance") is a collection of 6 short stories by Japanese author Haruki Murakami, written between 1999 and 2000.

title: After the Quake
text: First published in Japan in 2000, it was released in English as after the quake in 2002 (translator Jay Rubin notes that Murakami "insisted" the title "should be all lower-case").

title: Dance Dance Revolution Mario Mix
text: Dance Dance Revolution Mario Mix, known as Dance Dance Revolution with Mario (ダンスダンスレボリューション ウィズ マリオ , Dansu Dansu Reboryūshon Uizu Mario ) in Japan and Dancing Stage Mario Mix in Europe, is a 2005 music video game developed by Konami and published by Nintendo for the GameCube.

title: Dance Dance Revolution Mario Mix
text: It is the first "Dance Dance Revolution" game to be released on a Nintendo video game console outside Japan.

title: Erica Packer
text: Erica Georgia Packer (née Baxter; born 10 November 1977) is an Australian singer and model.

title: Erica Packer
text: She was the second wife of Australia's eighth richest man, James Packer.

title: Brian Cook (football administrator)
text: Brian Carlyle Cook (born 14 November 1955) is a Scottish-born Australian businessman and former Australian rules football player and coach who is the current Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the Geelong Football Club in the Australian Football League (AFL).

title: Brian Cook (football administrator)
text: Cook played for a number of different clubs in several Australian states and territories, including the Box Hill Football Club in the Victorian Football Association (VFA), the Melbourne Football Club in the Victorian Football League (VFL), and the East Perth and Subiaco Football Clubs in the Western Australian National Football League (WANFL), and later captain-coached the Ainslie Football Club in the Australian Capital Territory Football League (ACTFL).

title: Brian Cook (football administrator)
text: After his retirement from coaching, Cook occupied positions with the Australian Sports Commission and the West Australian Football Commission, before being appointed CEO of the West Coast Eagles in 1990.

title: Brian Cook (football administrator)
text: He quit this position in 1999 to take up the same role with Geelong.

title: Crazy John's
text: Crazy John's was a mobile phone retail chain in Australia started by Turkish Australian businessman John Ilhan.

title: Crazy John's
text: Crazy John's was the largest independent phone retailer in Australia, employing more than 400 people with more than 60 retail stores.

title: Crazy John's
text: Following his death in 2007, Ilhan's wife Patricia sold her stake in the company to Vodafone Australia, now a part of Vodafone Hutchison Australia.

title: Crazy John's
text: Originally a dealer of Telstra Mobile, Crazy John's became a Mobile Virtual Network Operator through the Vodafone Australia network, dealing directly with customers and offering its own competitive mobile phone deals and plans.

title: Dipangkorn Rasmijoti
text: Prince Dipangkorn Rasmijoti (born 29 April 2005; Thai: ทีปังกรรัศมีโชติ ; rtgs: "Thipangkon Ratsamichot" ; ] ) is a member of the country's Chakri dynasty and heir presumptive to the throne of Thailand.

title: Dipangkorn Rasmijoti
text: He is the fifth son of King Vajiralongkorn.

title: Dipangkorn Rasmijoti
text: His mother is Srirasmi Suwadee, the king's third legal wife.

title: Dipangkorn Rasmijoti
text: His father also has a daughter by his first wife and five children (four sons and a daughter) by his second wife; all the children of the second wife were born before the then-crown prince married their mother but after the Crown Prince married her the 5 children were legitimised by marriage.

title: Dipangkorn Rasmijoti
text: After the Crown Prince divorced his second wife in 1996, he disowned her sons.

title: Dipangkorn Rasmijoti
text: Thus, Dipangkorn is the only recognised son of the king.

title: Leg of mutton nude
text: Double Nude Portrait: The Artist and his Second Wife 1937 (also known as the Leg of mutton nude portrait) is an oil on canvas painting by British artist Stanley Spencer.

title: Leg of mutton nude
text: It depicts Spencer and his soon-to-be second wife, Patricia Preece, beside a raw leg of lamb.

title: Leg of mutton nude
text: The painting is sexually charged: Spencer's second wife was a lesbian in a long-term relationship when they married, and their marriage was never consummated.

title: Leg of mutton nude
text: The painting is held by the Tate Gallery, which describes it as "probably now Spencer's most famous picture".

title: James Packer
text: James Douglas Packer (born 8 September 1967) is an Australian businessman and investor.

title: Trevor Kennedy
text: Trevor Kennedy (born Trevor John Kennedy; born in Perth, Western Australia, on 24 June 1942) is an Australian businessman and company director.

title: Trevor Kennedy
text: He has served on the board of directors of many Australian companies, including Consolidated Press Holdings and Qantas.

title: Trevor Kennedy
text: He is a former journalist and right-hand man of Kerry Packer and a former business associate of Malcolm Turnbull, current leader of the Australian Parliamentary Liberal Party and the 29th Prime Minister of Australia.

title: Polygamy in Morocco
text: Polygamy in Morocco is legal, but very uncommon due to restrictions that were introduced by the government in 2004 that mandated financial qualifications a husband must meet in order to marry a second wife.

title: Polygamy in Morocco
text: In addition, a husband must have written permission from his current wife before marrying a second wife.

title: Polygamy in Morocco
text: Breaking these rules and marrying without permission from one's current wife can and has resulted in arrests.

title: Alan Cransberg
text: Alan John Cransberg (born 22 September 1958) is an Australian businessman and former Australian rules footballer who is the current chairman of the West Coast Eagles in the Australian Football League, as well as a member of the boards of several other organisations.

title: Alan Cransberg
text: Cransberg grew up in Bunbury, Western Australia, attending Bunbury Senior High School.

title: Alan Cransberg
text: He played for the South Bunbury Football Club in the South West Football League (SWFL), before being recruited by the Swan Districts Football Club in the Perth-based Western Australian National Football League (WANFL) prior to the 1976 season.

title: Alan Cransberg
text: Cransberg went on to play 115 games for Swan Districts, mainly playing as a defender.

title: Alan Cransberg
text: He played at centre half-back in Swan Districts' 1982 premiership team, and also played in the premiership side the following season, retiring after the 1983 season to concentrate on his business career.

title: Alan Cransberg
text: Cransberg graduated from the University of Western Australia in 1980 with an honours degree in civil engineering.

title: Alan Cransberg
text: He joined Alcoa Australia after his graduation, and held various planning, engineering and managerial positions from 1981 to 1997, before being appointed location manager of the company's Pinjarra alumina refinery in 1998.

title: Ben Roberts-Smith
text: Benjamin "Ben" Roberts-Smith, (born 1 November 1978) is an Australian businessman, former Australian Army soldier, and a recipient of the Victoria Cross for Australia (VC), the highest award in the Australian honours system.

title: Ben Roberts-Smith
text: Roberts-Smith was awarded the VC for his actions during a helicopter assault into Tizak on 11 June 2010 as part of an offensive in the Shah Wali Kot region while serving with the Special Air Service Regiment in Afghanistan.

title: Ben Roberts-Smith
text: The medal, together with his Medal for Gallantry awarded during a tour of Afghanistan in 2006, made Roberts-Smith the most highly decorated member of the Australian Defence Force.

title: Ben Roberts-Smith
text: He was presented with the VC by the Governor-General of Australia, Quentin Bryce, at a ceremony in Perth on 23 January 2011.

title: Ben Roberts-Smith
text: He was also later awarded a Commendation for Distinguished Service for his leadership as a patrol commander during a 2012 tour of Afghanistan.

title: Mırra
text: Mırra is a traditional type of bitter coffee prepared in the Hatay, Adana, Urfa and Mardin provinces of Turkey, as well as in some Arab countries like Lebanon and Syria, which is also sometimes correctly referred to as Arabic coffee because the name is derived from Arabic; "mur" meaning bitter.

title: Mırra
text: Since it is very bitter and dark, it is served in tiny cups without handles similar in size to Italian espresso cups.

title: Mırra
text: The coffee beans for Mırra are common coffea arabica coffee beans, which however are roasted twice in order to give it its bitter taste.They are ground so that they are still grainy, unlike Turkish coffee which is more like a powder.

title: Mırra
text: The coffee is put into a narrow-topped small boiling pot called cezve, and water is added, mostly accompanied by some cardamom in order to give it a more aromatic flavour.

title: Zaječická hořká
text: Zaječická hořká (bitter water from Zajecice, administrative part of village Bečov, near Most Northern Bohemia) (German: "Saidschitzer Bitterwasser") is strongly mineralized natural bitter water.

title: Zaječická hořká
text: Known since the 16th century for its purgative and gentle laxative effects.

title: Zaječická hořká
text: Rises from a wells located in the vicinity of Zaječice, Sedlec (part of Korozluky) and Korozluky.

title: Zaječická hořká
text: It ranks among strongly mineralized mineral waters of the Magnesium sulphate type; it is cool, hypertonic, slightly opalescent, yellowish, scent-free, with a strongly bitter flavour.

title: Bitter electromagnet
text: A Bitter electromagnet or Bitter solenoid is a type of electromagnet invented in 1933 by American physicist Francis Bitter used in scientific research to create extremely strong magnetic fields. Bitter electromagnets have been used to achieve the strongest continuous manmade magnetic fields on earth (up to 45 teslas - as of 2011).

title: Leucopaxillus gentianeus
text: Leucopaxillus gentianeus is a bitter-tasting, inedible mushroom commonly known as the bitter false funnelcap, or the bitter brown leucopaxillus.

title: Leucopaxillus gentianeus
text: A common synonym is "Leucopaxillus amarus".

title: Leucopaxillus gentianeus
text: The bitter taste is caused by a triterpene called cucurbitacin B.

title: Leucopaxillus gentianeus
text: The species was first described in 1873 as "Clitocybe gentianea" by French mycologist Lucien Quélet.

title: Leucopaxillus gentianeus
text: František Kotlaba transferred it to "Leucopaxillus" in 1966.

title: Jester
text: A jester, court jester, or fool, was historically an entertainer during the medieval and Renaissance eras who was a member of the household of a nobleman or a monarch employed to entertain him and his guests.

title: Jester
text: A jester was also an itinerant performer who entertained common folk at fairs and markets.

title: Jester
text: Jesters are also modern-day entertainers who resemble their historical counterparts.

title: Hollywood Outlaw Movie
text: Hollywood Outlaw, The Unmaking of a Bitter Jester is the director’s cut of the controversial documentary "Bitter Jester" which was buried in 2004 amidst much scandal, never to be seen again.

title: Hollywood Outlaw Movie
text: Directed by, written by, and starring Maija DiGiorgio, this film follows her through the construction and subsequent deconstruction of Bitter Jester, including all of the footage that sparked the scandal leading to blackmail and censorship.

title: Fagopyrum tataricum
text: Fagopyrum tataricum, also known as Tartary buckwheat, duckwheat, India buckwheat, India wheat, green buckwheat, ku qiao, or bitter buckwheat, is a domesticated food plant in the genus "Fagopyrum" in the family Polygonaceae.

title: Fagopyrum tataricum
text: With another species in the same genus, common buckwheat, it is often counted as a cereal, but unlike the true cereals the buckwheats are not members of the grass family.

title: Fagopyrum tataricum
text: Thus they are not related to true wheat.

title: Fagopyrum tataricum
text: Tartary buckwheat is more bitter, but contains more rutin than common buckwheat.

title: Fagopyrum tataricum
text: It also contains quercitrin.

title: Ratafia
text: Ratafia is a term used for two types of sweet alcoholic beverage, either a fortified wine or a fruit-based beverage.

title: Ratafia
text: The latter type is a liqueur or cordial flavoured with lemon peel, herbs in various amounts (nutmeg, cinnamon, clove, mint, rosemary, anise, etc.) typically combined with sugar.

title: Ratafia
text: It may also be prepared with peach or cherry kernels, bitter almonds, or other fruits, as many different varieties are made.

title: Ratafia
text: The same name is given to a flavouring essence resembling bitter almonds, and also to a light biscuit.

title: Ratafia
text: The former type is a type of "mistelle", a mixture of marc brandy and the unfermented juice of the grape, and it is the type of Ratafia produced in France.

title: Bitter Jester
text: Bitter Jester is a documentary starring Maija DiGiorgio, Kenny Simmons, Jody Del Giorno and Heather McConnell.

title: Bitter Jester
text: It's a portrait of the comedy world that includes interviews with a multitude of stars including Richard Pryor, Richard Belzer and many others.

title: Light cavalerie vodka
text: Light cavalerie vodka is a type of bitter.

title: Light cavalerie vodka
text: Specifically a type of Polish bitter known as nalewka, a macerate of herbs and spices in a distilled spirit, in this case vodka.

title: Light cavalerie vodka
text: The family of nalewka for which this belongs is commonly known as "Bitter Drops."

title: Transport for Greater Manchester
text: Transport for Greater Manchester (TfGM) is the public body responsible for co-ordinating transport services throughout Greater Manchester, in North West England.

title: Transport for Greater Manchester
text: The organisation traces its origins to the Transport Act 1968, when the SELNEC Passenger Transport Executive was established to co-ordinate public transport in and around Manchester.

title: Transport for Greater Manchester
text: Between 1974 and 2011, this body was known as the Greater Manchester Passenger Transport Executive (GMPTE), until a reformation of local government arrangements in Greater Manchester granted the body more powers and prompted a corporate rebranding.

title: Transport for Greater Manchester
text: The strategies and policies of Transport for Greater Manchester are set by the Greater Manchester Combined Authority and its Transport for Greater Manchester Committee.

title: Eccles Interchange
text: Eccles Interchange is a transport hub in Eccles, Greater Manchester, England.

title: Eccles Interchange
text: It is composed of a bus station, and a single-platform Metrolink light rail station, the latter of which is the terminus of the system's Eccles Line.

title: Eccles Interchange
text: It opened on 21 July 2000.

title: Eccles Interchange
text: It is roughly 310 m away from Eccles railway station.

title: Greater Manchester Combined Authority
text: The Greater Manchester Combined Authority (GMCA) is the combined authority of Greater Manchester, England.

title: Greater Manchester Combined Authority
text: It was established on 1 April 2011 and consists of eleven indirectly elected members, each a directly elected councillor from one of the ten metropolitan boroughs that comprise Greater Manchester together with the Mayor of Greater Manchester.

title: Greater Manchester Combined Authority
text: The authority derives most of its powers from the Local Government Act 2000 and Local Democracy, Economic Development and Construction Act 2009, and replaced a range of single-purpose joint boards and quangos to provide a formal administrative authority for Greater Manchester for the first time since the abolition of the Greater Manchester County Council in 1986.

title: Church of St Mary the Virgin, Eccles
text: St Mary the Virgin's Church is an active Anglican parish church in Eccles, Greater Manchester, England.

title: Church of St Mary the Virgin, Eccles
text: The church is in the Eccles deanery, the archdeaconry of Salford and the diocese of Manchester.

title: Church of St Mary the Virgin, Eccles
text: Together with St Andrew's Eccles, St Paul's, Monton, Christ Church, Patricroft and St James', Hope the church is part of the team benefice of Eccles.

title: Church of St Mary the Virgin, Eccles
text: The church was granted Grade I Listed status in 1964.

title: Demography of Greater Manchester
text: The demography of Greater Manchester is analysed by the Office for National Statistics and data is produced for each of its ten metropolitan boroughs, each of the Greater Manchester electoral wards, the NUTS3 statistical sub-regions, each of the Parliamentary constituencies in Greater Manchester, the 15 civil parishes in Greater Manchester, and for all of Greater Manchester as a whole; the latter of which had a population of 2,682,500 at the 2011 UK census.

title: Demography of Greater Manchester
text: Additionally, data is produced for the Greater Manchester Urban Area.

title: Demography of Greater Manchester
text: Statistical information is produced about the size and geographical breakdown of the population, the number of people entering and leaving country and the number of people in each demographic subgroup.

title: Mayor of Greater Manchester
text: The Mayor of Greater Manchester is a directly elected political post responsible for the strategic government of Greater Manchester, including health, transport, housing, strategic planning, waste management, policing, the Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service and skills.

title: Mayor of Greater Manchester
text: The creation of the Mayor of Greater Manchester was agreed between the then Chancellor of the Exchequer, George Osborne, and Greater Manchester's 10 district council leaders.

title: Mayor of Greater Manchester
text: As well as having specific powers, the Mayor chairs the Greater Manchester Combined Authority, also assuming the powers of the Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner.

title: Mayor of Greater Manchester
text: Tony Lloyd was appointed as Interim Mayor for Greater Manchester on 29 May 2015.

title: Eric A. Sykes
text: Eric Anthony Sykes (5 February 1883–12 May 1945), born Eric Anthony Schwabe in Barton-upon-Irwell, Eccles, Greater Manchester, England, was a soldier and firearms expert.

title: Eric A. Sykes
text: He is most famous for his work with William E. Fairbairn in the development of the eponymous Fairbairn-Sykes Fighting Knife and modern British Close Quarters Battle (CQB) martial arts during World War II.

title: Eric A. Sykes
text: Originally working for an import/export company selling weapons in East Asia, he claimed he volunteered for and served in the British Army as a sharpshooter on the Western Front during World War I.

title: Eric A. Sykes
text: Returning to China in 1917, he joined the volunteer branch of the Shanghai Municipal Police (SMP) Specials with the rank of Inspector in 1926.

title: Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner
text: The Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner was the police and crime commissioner, an elected official tasked with setting out the way crime is tackled by the Greater Manchester Police in Greater Manchester.

title: Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner
text: The post was created on 21 November 2012, following an election held on 15 November 2012, and replaced the Greater Manchester Police Authority.

title: Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner
text: Upon the creation of a Mayor of Greater Manchester and the inaugural election to that position, the duties of Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner were absolved into the mayoralty and the office itself abolished.

title: Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner
text: For the entirety of its existence, the commissioner was Labour Party politician Tony Lloyd.

title: Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner
text: The police and crime commissioner was required to produce a strategic Greater Manchester Police and Crime Plan, setting out the priorities for the Greater Manchester Police, and their work is scrutinised by the Greater Manchester Police and Crime Panel.

title: Greater Manchester Police and Crime Commissioner
text: In November 2014 it was announced that the role would be replaced with a directly elected Mayor of Greater Manchester, and the term of office of the incumbent commissioner was extended to May 2017.

title: Greater Manchester County Council
text: The Greater Manchester County Council (GMCC) was the top-tier local government administrative body for Greater Manchester from 1974 to 1986.

title: Greater Manchester County Council
text: A strategic authority, with responsibilities for public transport, planning, emergency services and waste disposal, it was composed of 106 members drawn from the ten metropolitan boroughs of Greater Manchester.

title: Greater Manchester County Council
text: The Greater Manchester County Council shared power with ten lower-tier district councils, each of which directed local matters.

title: Greater Manchester County Council
text: It was also known as the Greater Manchester Council (GMC) and the Greater Manchester Metropolitan County Council (GMMCC).

title: Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority
text: The Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority (GMITA) was a local government institution responsible for the strategic direction of passenger transport in Greater Manchester.

title: Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority
text: It existed from 1969 to 1974 as the SELNEC Passenger Transport Authority and was then replaced by Greater Manchester County Council.

title: Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority
text: It was created again in 1986 as the Greater Manchester Passenger Transport Authority.

title: Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority
text: It was renamed in 2008 as the Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority.

title: Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority
text: Policy of the authority was delivered by the Greater Manchester Passenger Transport Executive.

title: Greater Manchester Integrated Transport Authority
text: It was replaced by the Greater Manchester Combined Authority in 2011.

title: List of TVXQ concert tours
text: The South Korean pop duo TVXQ have embarked on thirteen headlining concert tours, one of which has been worldwide, and eight others that were based exclusively in Japan.

title: List of TVXQ concert tours
text: TVXQ originally debuted as a five-member group in December 2003, with members U-Know Yunho, Max Changmin, Hero Jaejoong, Micky Yoochun, and Xiah Junsu.

title: List of TVXQ concert tours
text: The group made their headlining debut in February 2006 through their Rising Sun Tour, performing four sell-out shows in South Korea, one show in Thailand, and one show in Malaysia, which was the first K-pop concert held in the country.

title: List of TVXQ concert tours
text: They visited China and Taiwan for the first time for their O Tour, which commenced in January 2007.

title: List of TVXQ concert tours
text: Their third and last concert tour as a quinet, the Mirotic Tour, was announced to tour cities beyond South Korea, China, and Thailand throughout 2009 and 2010, but the remaining concert dates were cancelled soon after members Jaejoong, Yoochun, and Junsu entered a legal battle with their Korean agency S.M. Entertainment, subsequently leading to their departure.

title: List of TVXQ concert tours
text: In January 2011, TVXQ restarted their activities as a duo, with remaining members Yunho and Changmin.

title: Yunho
text: Jung Yun-ho (Hangul: 정윤호 ; Hanja: 鄭允浩 ; born February 6, 1986), also known by his stage name U-Know Yunho (유노윤호 ) or simply U-Know, is a South Korean singer, actor, and a member of the pop duo TVXQ.

title: Yunho
text: Born and raised in Gwangju, South Korea, Yunho auditioned for the Korean talent agency S.M. Entertainment in 2001.

title: Yunho
text: After two years of training, Yunho debuted with TVXQ in December 2003.

title: Yunho
text: Fluent in both Korean and Japanese, Yunho has achieved commercial success throughout Asia as a member of TVXQ.

title: Changmin
text: Shim Chang-min (Hangul: 심창민 ; Hanja: 沈昌珉 ; born February 18, 1988), also known by his stage name Max Changmin (최강창민 ; "Choegang Changmin " ) or simply MAX, is a South Korean singer, actor, and a member of the pop duo TVXQ.

title: Changmin
text: Born and raised in Seoul, South Korea, Changmin was scouted by an S.M. Entertainment talent agent when he was fourteen years old.

title: Changmin
text: He made his debut as TVXQ's youngest member in December 2003.

title: Live World Tour: Catch Me in Seoul
text: Live World Tour: Catch Me in Seoul (printed as TVXQ!

title: Live World Tour: Catch Me in Seoul
text: The 4th World Tour "Catch Me in Seoul") is a live album by South Korean pop duo TVXQ.

title: Live World Tour: Catch Me in Seoul
text: It was recorded at the Olympic Gymnastics Arena from November 17–18, 2012, during the Seoul stop for the duo's fourth concert tour, .

title: Catch Me (album)
text: Catch Me is the sixth Korean studio album (eleventh overall) by South Korean pop duo TVXQ.

title: Catch Me (album)
text: It was digitally released on September 24, 2012, followed by a physical CD release on September 26, 2012 by S.M. Entertainment and KMP Holdings.

title: Catch Me (album)
text: The album is a follow-up to their successful 2011 release "Keep Your Head Down", which was TVXQ's first album since becoming a two-piece band with members U-Know Yunho and Max Changmin.

title: Spellbound (TVXQ album)
text: Spellbound, known as Surisuri (Hangul: 수리수리) in Korean, is the repackage of "Tense" (2014), the seventh Korean studio album by South Korean pop duo TVXQ.

title: Spellbound (TVXQ album)
text: It was released on February 27, 2014 by S.M. Entertainment, almost two months after the original record.

title: Spellbound (TVXQ album)
text: The repackage features three newly recorded songs, including the lead single "Spellbound".

title: Spellbound (TVXQ album)
text: The repackage had two-day shipments of 61,405 copies and debuted at number two on the Gaon Albums Chart.

title: Spellbound (TVXQ album)
text: It sold 110,566 physical units in 2014, becoming TVXQ's best-selling repackage album on the chart.

title: List of songs recorded by TVXQ
text: South Korean pop duo TVXQ, known as Tohoshinki (東方神起 , Tōhōshinki ) in Japanese releases, have released 7 Korean studio albums, 8 Japanese studio albums, one Korean EP, three Japanese compilations albums, 22 official Korean singles, and 43 official Japanese singles.

title: List of songs recorded by TVXQ
text: They have collaborated with other artists for their album and promotional releases.

title: List of songs recorded by TVXQ
text: TVXQ debuted as a five-piece boy band in 2003 under S.M. Entertainment and made their Japanese debut in 2005 under Avex Group.

title: List of songs recorded by TVXQ
text: Aside from Korean and Japanese, TVXQ have also recorded Mandarin-language versions of their Korean singles.

title: Catch Me (TVXQ song)
text: "Catch Me" (stylized as "Catch Me -If you wanna-" in Japan) is a song by South Korean pop duo TVXQ, also known as Tohoshinki in Japan.

title: Catch Me (TVXQ song)
text: Written by Yoo Young-jin and Yoo Han-jin, two versions of "Catch Me" exist: the original Korean-language version, which served as the lead single for the duo's sixth Korean studio album "Catch Me" (2012), and a Japanese-language version, which was released as the fourth and last single for their sixth Japanese studio album, "Time" (2013).

title: Catch Me (TVXQ song)
text: The Korean version of "Catch Me" was made available for download on September 24, 2012, the same date as the full album's digital release.

title: Catch Me (TVXQ song)
text: The Japanese version of "Catch Me" was released by Avex Trax in Japan as TVXQ's 36th Japanese CD single on January 16, 2013.

title: Something (TVXQ song)
text: "Something" is a song by South Korean pop duo TVXQ, also known as Tohoshinki in Japan.

title: Something (TVXQ song)
text: Serving as the lead single for their seventh Korean studio album "Tense" (2014), the song was produced by TVXQ's long-time collaborator Yoo Young-jin and co-written by Yoo with his brother Yoo Han-jin.

title: Something (TVXQ song)
text: Introduced as TVXQ's tenth anniversary comeback single, "Something" was released by S.M. Entertainment on January 6, 2014.

title: Something (TVXQ song)
text: Two versions of the song exist; the original Korean-language version, and a Japanese-language version, which was released by Avex Trax as a double A-sided CD single, along with "Hide & Seek", in Japan on February 5, 2014.

title: Something (TVXQ song)
text: It served as the fourth and final single release for the duo's seventh Japanese studio album, "Tree" (2014).

title: Something (TVXQ song)
text: Within a week of its release, the single was certified gold by the Recording Industry Association of Japan (RIAJ) for shipments of over 100,000.

title: Before U Go
text: Before U Go (Hangul: 이것만은 알고 가 ; "just know this before you go") is the repackage of "Keep Your Head Down" (2011), the fifth Korean studio album by South Korean pop duo TVXQ.

title: Before U Go
text: It was released on March 16, 2011 by S.M. Entertainment, two months after the original record.

title: Before U Go
text: The repackage features three new tracks, all of which are remixes of the album's only lead single, "Before U Go."

title: Before U Go
text: The single is produced by TVXQ's frequent collaborator Yoo Young-jin, who also produced their fifth album lead single "Keep Your Head Down".

title: Toso
text: Toso ( ) , or o-toso, is spiced medicinal sake traditionally drunk during New Year celebrations in Japan.

title: Vino cotto
text: Vino cotto (literally 'cooked wine’, also vi'cotto or vi'cuotte), is a type of wine from the Marche and Abruzzo in Central Italy, made primarily in the hills of the Province of Ascoli Piceno and the Province of Macerata.

title: Vino cotto
text: It is a strong ruby-colored wine, usually semi-sweet, and traditionally drunk in small glasses with puddings and cheese.

title: Nadar climber
text: Nadar climbers (also known as Pannayeri Nadars or Pannayeri Shanars ) constituted the major bulk of today’s Nadar community.

title: Nadar climber
text: They were considered as the "largest sub sect" of today's Nadar community.

title: Nadar climber
text: They were historically humble cultivators of palmyra trees and jaggery and a few also involved in toddy trade.

title: Nadar climber
text: Majority of Nadar climbers have given up their traditionally occupation, toddy tapping, and today they are widely into education, business and other important fields.

title: Om Records
text: Om Records is a US-based record label, established in 1995, which releases electronic music, dance music, and hip hop.

title: Om Records
text: The label was founded in San Francisco in 1995 by Chris Smith.

title: Om Records
text: Om Records releases both artist albums and various compilations.

title: Om Records
text: Some of the most notable compilations include Om Lounge and the Mushroom Jazz series.

title: Om Records
text: Om's current roster of artists includes Groove Armada, Underworld, Dirty Vegas, Bassnectar, Indiana Taurus, J Boogie, People Under The Stairs, Samantha James, Amp Live, Greenskeepers, Hot Toddy, Wagon Cookin, to name a few.

title: Om Records
text: Past artists have included Kaskade, Wolfgang Gartner, Ladybug Mecca, Juan Atkins and Naked Music NYC.

title: Submarino (beverage)
text: The submarino (meaning ""submarine"" in Spanish) or remo (meaning ""oar"") is a beverage traditionally drunk in Argentina and Uruguay.

title: Submarino (beverage)
text: It consists of a bar of dark chocolate melted inside a glass of hot milk and stirred with a long spoon (similar to an iced tea spoon) until the chocolate is completely dissolved.

title: Hot toddy
text: A hot toddy, also known as hot whiskey in Ireland, is typically a mixed drink made of liquor and water with honey (or, in some recipes, sugar), herbs (such as tea) and spices, and served hot.

title: Hot toddy
text: Hot toddy recipes vary and are traditionally drunk before retiring for the night, or in wet or cold weather.

title: Hot toddy
text: Some believe the drink relieves the symptoms of the cold and flu—in "How to Drink", Victoria Moore describes the drink as "the vitamin C for health, the honey to soothe, the alcohol to numb".

title: Hot toddy (disambiguation)
text: Hot toddy is a mixed drink, usually including alcohol, that is served hot.

title: Blueberry Tea
text: The Blueberry Tea is a cocktail made from tea and liqueurs.

title: Blueberry Tea
text: It is served hot, and could be considered a variant on the hot toddy.

title: Blueberry Tea
text: Its name derives from its fruity taste, which some compare to blueberries.

title: Wassail
text: Wassail ( , ; Old Norse "ves heil", Old English "was hál", literally: "be hale") is a beverage of hot mulled cider, traditionally drunk as an integral part of wassailing, a Medieval English drinking ritual intended to ensure a good cider apple harvest the following year.

title: Ralph Giannini
text: Ralph "Toddy" Giannini (1917–1996), known to many as "Hot Toddy," was a member of the 1940 All-American basketball team representing Santa Clara University.

title: Ralph Giannini
text: He and his other teammates were known as the "Magicians of the Maplewood".

title: Ralph Giannini
text: In 1940 Giannini headed the All-American all star team to a 44-42 defeat of the Harlem Globetrotters before a crowd of 22,000 fans in Madison Square Garden.

title: Ralph Giannini
text: Ralph "Toddy" Giannini was also inducted into the San Francisco Prep Hall of fame as well as Santa Clara University's Hall of Fame.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: British actor Christian Bale has starred in various films, as well as advertisements and a video game.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: He made his acting debut in 1986, on the television film "".

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: The following year, he made his film debut starring alongside John Malkovich and Miranda Richardson in the war film "Empire of the Sun".

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: Bale's role of a young boy, interned in China by the Japanese, received praise from most film critics.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: Two years later, Bale had a minor role in "Henry V", a drama film based on William Shakespeare's play "The Life of Henry the Fifth".

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: It has been considered one of the best Shakespeare film adaptations ever made.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: In 1992, Bale starred as Jack Kelly in the Walt Disney musical drama "Newsies", which was a critical and commercial failure; however, it gained a cult following.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: He received a role in the 1994 drama "Little Women", which garnered positive reviews.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: Bale lent his voice for the Disney animated film "Pocahontas" in 1995, although it received a mixed reception and attained box office success.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: He starred as British journalist Arthur Stuart in the Todd Haynes-directed drama "Velvet Goldmine" (1998).

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: Although critics were divided on the film, Bale's role was "eagerly anticipated".

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: Bale portrayed Demetrius in the critically praised 1999 film "A Midsummer Night's Dream", an adaptation of Shakespeare's play of the same name, directed by Michael Hoffman.

title: Christian Bale filmography
text: The same year, he portrayed Jesus of Nazareth in the television movie "Mary, Mother of Jesus".

title: Trading Mom
text: Trading Mom, also known as The Mommy Market, is a 1994 American fantasy/comedy film written and directed by Tia Brelis, based on her mother Nancy Brelis' homonymous book.

title: Trading Mom
text: It stars Sissy Spacek and Anna Chlumsky, and features the final acting role of André the Giant, who died a year before it was released.

title: Gidget Goes to Rome
text: Gidget Goes to Rome is a 1963 Columbia Pictures Eastmancolor feature film starring Cindy Carol as the archetypal high school teen surfer girl originally created by Sandra Dee in the 1959 film "Gidget".

title: Gidget Goes to Rome
text: The film is the third of three Gidget films directed by Paul Wendkos and expands upon Gidget's romance with boyfriend Moondoggie.

title: Gidget Goes to Rome
text: The screenplay was written by Ruth Brooks Flippen based on characters created by Frederick Kohner.

title: Gidget Goes to Rome
text: Veterans of previous Gidget films making appearances include James Darren as "Moondoggie", Joby Baker, and Jean "Jeff" Donnell as Gidget's mom, Mrs. Lawrence.

title: Gidget Goes to Rome
text: The film has been released to VHS and DVD.

title: Eleventh Mom
text: Eleventh Mom (; also known as My 11th Mother) is a 2007 South Korean film starring Kim Hye-soo, Kim Young-chan and Ryu Seung-ryong.

title: Eleventh Mom
text: It was released on November 29, 2007 and attracted 350,204 admissions.

title: Shelley Bennett
text: Shelley Bennett (born October 14, 1981) is an American actress, producer, and published artist.

title: Shelley Bennett
text: Her early roles include Vivian Goodmanson on "As the World Turns", and the role of Erica starring opposite Kaley Cuoco, Nick Carter, and Kevin Zegers in the feature film "The Hollow" from producer Mason Novick (Juno, 500 Days of Summer).

title: Shelley Bennett
text: She was also the voice for various characters for Disney's TV series "Teamo Supremo".

title: Shelley Bennett
text: Recent feature film roles include Sheila in "Happy New Year" produced by Iain Smith (Children of Men, Cold Mountain) and Amber in "Machine Head" both due for release in 2011.

title: Shelley Bennett
text: She appears in Bill Maher's documentary "Bright Day!"

title: Shelley Bennett
text: and is the director and producer for the 2010 documentary "Behind the Veil".

title: Shelley Bennett
text: In 2009, she served as a film juror for the 19th Cairo International Film Festival for Children and her artwork has been published multiple times in the "David Geffen Journal of Arts and Literature" .

title: Shashaa Tirupati
text: Shashaa Tirupati is a playback singer, songwriter and voice over artist of Indo-Canadian origin, with family roots in Kashmir, predominantly active in the Bollywood and South Indian music industries.

title: Shashaa Tirupati
text: She is the voice behind Bollywood hits such as: "The Humma Song" (OK Jaanu), "Phir Bhi Tumko Chahunga" (with Arijit Singh) (Half Girlfriend), "Baarish" (Half Girlfriend), "Kanha" (Shubh Mangal Saavdhan), "O Sona Tere Liye" (with A.R. Rahman) and "Chal Kahin Door", both from the Sridevi starrer MOM.

title: Valentina (2008 film)
text: Valentina is a 2008 Argentinian traditionally animated romantic-comedy film released in theaters throughout Argentina, Mexico, and Uruguay on July 24, 2008.

title: Valentina (2008 film)
text: It also had a limited release in the United States later that year.

title: Valentina (2008 film)
text: It did very poorly at the foreign and international box-office, resulting a box-office bomb.

title: Valentina (2008 film)
text: It stars Florencia Otero, as the voice of Valentina, and Sebastián Francini, as the voice of Fede.

title: Valentina (2008 film)
text: It is also Illusion Studios' first feature film.

title: Chinatown Nights (1929 film)
text: Chinatown Nights, also known as Tong War, is a 1929 film starring Wallace Beery and begun as a silent film then finished as an all-talking sound one via dubbing.

title: Chinatown Nights (1929 film)
text: Directed by William A. Wellman and released by Paramount Pictures, "Chinatown Nights" also stars Florence Vidor, former wife of director King Vidor, who did not dub her own voice and quit the movie business immediately afterward, preferring not to work in sound films; her voice in "Chinatown Nights" was supplied by actress Nella Walker.

title: Chinatown Nights (1929 film)
text: The supporting cast includes Warner Oland as a Chinese gangster and Jack Oakie as a stuttering reporter.

title: Chinatown Nights (1929 film)
text: The movie was based upon the story "Tong War" by Samuel Ornitz.

title: Phir Bhi Tumko Chaahunga
text: "Phir Bhi Tumko Chaahunga" (English: "I will still love you") is a song from the Indian film "Half Girlfriend".

title: Phir Bhi Tumko Chaahunga
text: Picturised on Shraddha Kapoor and Arjun Kapoor, the song has been sung by Arijit Singh and Shashaa Tirupati.

title: Phir Bhi Tumko Chaahunga
text: The music of the song is composed by Mithoon and the lyrics are penned by Manoj Muntashir.

title: Phir Bhi Tumko Chaahunga
text: Reprise version of the track is sung by Arijit Singh titled, "Pal Bhar (Chaahunga Reprise)", and also another version titled, "Phir Bhi Tumko Chaahungi" is sung by Shraddha Kapoor along with the instrumental "Half Girlfriend (Love Theme)".

title: Garfield Gets Real
text: Garfield Gets Real (also known as Garfield 3D in some regions) is a 2007 American CGI movie starring Garfield.

title: Garfield Gets Real
text: It was produced by Paws, Inc. in cooperation with Davis Entertainment, and The Animation Picture Company and distributed by 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment.

title: Garfield Gets Real
text: It was written by Garfield's creator Jim Davis, who started working on the script in the fall of 1996.

title: Garfield Gets Real
text: This was the first fully animated Garfield film since the last "Garfield and Friends" TV episode aired in 1995, and the first to be written by Davis since the 1991 television special "Garfield Gets a Life".

title: Garfield Gets Real
text: The movie was released in theaters August 9, 2007, and the DVD was shipped to stores on November 20, 2007.

title: Garfield Gets Real
text: Gregg Berger, an actor from the original series, reprises his role of Odie, but Garfield is now voiced by veteran voice actor Frank Welker, since the original actor Lorenzo Music died in 2001 and Jon is voiced by Wally Wingert, as Thom Huge retired that same year.

title: Garfield Gets Real
text: The film's success led to two sequels: "Garfield's Fun Fest" (2008) and "Garfield's Pet Force" (2009).

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: WWE One Night Stand was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event, produced every June by WWE, a professional wrestling promotion based in Connecticut.

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: The event was created in 2005, with its inaugural event taking place in June of that year.

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: The event's name refers to its original format, that being a one night reunion show for former Extreme Championship Wrestling alumni.

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: The first two shows were promoted under the ECW acronym; this however was changed for the 2007 and 2008 events.

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: As WWE launched their own version of ECW in 2006, these two shows were promoted under the WWE acronym.

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: The final event under the One Night Stand name was in 2008 before being renamed to Extreme Rules in 2009.

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: This event was noted by WWE to be a direct continuation of the One Night Stand chronology.

title: WWE One Night Stand
text: However, the 2010 event was later promoted as only the second event under a new chronology, one that is no longer a direct continuation of the One Night Stand event.

title: Impact One Night Only
text: Impact: One Night Only is a series of professional wrestling events held by Impact Wrestling (formerly known as Total Nonstop Action Wrestling (TNA)).

title: Impact One Night Only
text: Most events are taped and released later periodically as a three-hour pay-per-view broadcast.

title: Impact One Night Only
text: The series began airing in April 2013, with new PPVs released on the first Friday of every month, except for the four months each year that each feature a live TNA pay-per-view event, with the exception of Hardcore Justice 2014 which was aired on January 10, 2014.

title: Impact One Night Only
text: Every show is themed, e.g. around the X Division or tag team division.

title: Impact One Night Only
text: Promoted as individual "specials", the events—unlike the live pay-per-view events—are not connected to the storylines featured on TNA's weekly television programming nor to each other, though later One Night Only events still incorporated storylines into matches and situations.

title: Impact One Night Only
text: The concept was announced on January 11, 2013 by Impact President Dixie Carter as a part of a change to their pay-per-view programming.

title: Impact One Night Only
text: Prior to the change, Impact Wrestling held live pay-per-view events monthly.

title: Impact One Night Only
text: Jeremy Borash and Josh Mathews handle commentary duties.

title: One Night in Rome
text: One Night in Rome is a 1924 film starring Laurette Taylor.

title: One Night in Rome
text: The film was directed by Clarence G. Badger and written J. Hartley Manners, Ms. Taylor's husband, based upon his play.

title: One Night in Rome
text: Laurette Taylor was a great name of the American theatre, who made only three films in a triumph-studded career, all of them derived from plays by her husband.

title: One Night in Rome
text: This was the last of those three films (the previous two had been done by Metro Pictures).

title: One Night in Rome
text: Ms. Taylor seems to have enjoyed making "One Night in Rome" as she kept a personal print of the movie to always show guests at her home, re-running it over and over again.

title: One Night Only (TV series)
text: One Night Only is a British entertainment show, celebrating the best of British Music.

title: One Night Only (TV series)
text: Myleene Klass hosted the first episode in December 2008 with the singer Tom Jones.

title: One Night Only (TV series)
text: Ben Shephard hosted in 2009 and 2010, which saw Rod Stewart and Phil Collins take to the stage.

title: One Night Only (TV series)
text: In November 2010, Fearne Cotton hosted a one-off special with Bon Jovi and in 2011 presented by Christine Bleakley featuring music from Duran Duran.

title: One Night Only (TV series)
text: Another episode aired in November 2014, with Rob Brydon hosting "Neil Diamond: One Night Only".

title: One Night Only (TV series)
text: Joanna Lumley presented the seventh episode with Bette Midler in December 2014.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: WWE Extreme Rules (simply known as Extreme Rules) is a professional wrestling event produced annually by WWE, a Connecticut-based promotion, and broadcast live and available only through pay-per-view (PPV) and the WWE Network.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: The name of the event stems from most matches being contested under hardcore wrestling regulations; the defunct Extreme Championship Wrestling (ECW) promotion originally used the term to describe the regulations for all of its matches.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: The event name was established in 2009; however, its theme began with its predecessor, One Night Stand, which was promoted in 2005 and 2006 as an ECW reunion show.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: In 2007, WWE promoted the show as one of its own regular PPV events but kept the ECW concept of Extreme Rules matches.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: In 2009, WWE renamed the One Night Stand event to WWE Extreme Rules.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: The 2009 Extreme Rules event was noted by WWE to be a direct continuation of the One Night Stand chronology.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: However, the 2010 event was later promoted as only the second event under a new chronology, one that is no longer a direct continuation of the One Night Stand events.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: Starting in 2010, Extreme Rules was moved from June to late April/early May to replace Backlash as the post-WrestleMania pay-per-view event.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: For 2013, the event was scheduled to take place in mid-May and replace Over the Limit, which was moved to October before being discontinued later that year and replaced by Battleground.

title: WWE Extreme Rules
text: The event will return to the early June slot of WWE's pay-per-view calendar and will be a Raw-exclusive pay-per-view event.

title: Elton John One Night Only – The Greatest Hits
text: Elton John One Night Only – The Greatest Hits is a live album released by Elton John in 2000.

title: Elton John One Night Only – The Greatest Hits
text: The album was recorded on 20 and 21 October 2000 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Elton John One Night Only – The Greatest Hits
text: An extended version was also released as a DVD, entitled One Night Only: The Greatest Hits Live at Madison Square Garden.

title: Elton John One Night Only – The Greatest Hits
text: The title is "one night only" because the recording equipment failed to tape most of the audio from the first night, leaving only the second night to be recorded as an album.

title: Elton John One Night Only – The Greatest Hits
text: In the US, it was certified gold in July 2001 by the RIAA.

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: "You and Me" is a song by One Night Only, from their 2008 album "Started a Fire", released as their debut single on October 29, 2007.

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: It was released on 7" vinyl and CD, reaching #46 in the following weeks UK singles chart.

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: The B-side for the CD is "What's Your Melody".

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: The vinyls have either "Nintendo" or "Go Go Go".

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: Their video for "You and Me" was posted on MySpace.

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: It was so well received that MySpace asked the band to make a short film, "One Night Only Welcomes You to Helmsley".

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: They were also a MySpace featured artist and on the homepage.

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: In October and November 2007, One Night Only supported The Pigeon Detectives on tour.

title: You and Me (One Night Only song)
text: In December 2007, they embarked on their own headline tour.

title: One Night in One City
text: One Night in One City, also known as "One Night in a City" and "One Night in the City" (Czech: "Jedné noci v jednom městě" ) is a stop-motion-animated feature-length black comedy horror film from the Czech Republic.

title: One Night in One City
text: It was released theatrically in its home country on 25 January 2007 and features only incomprehensible mumblings instead of dialogue, much like the earlier animated feature "Krysar".

title: One Night Stand (video game)
text: One Night Stand is a visual novel developed by Kinmoku.

title: One Night Stand (video game)
text: In the interactive story, players wake up from a drunken one night stand beside a stranger and must piece together the events of the previous night.

title: One Night Stand (video game)
text: It was based on a free game Kinmoku wrote for a game jam at itch.io.

title: One Night Stand (video game)
text: "One Night Stand" was released on October 20, 2016.

title: One Night (ELO Part II album)
text: One Night is a live album recorded and released by ELO Part II.

title: One Night (ELO Part II album)
text: The concert was recorded on 18-19 March 1995 at the Sydney Entertainment Centre, Australia while the band was on tour.

title: One Night (ELO Part II album)
text: It was called "One Night" since ELO Part II was in Australia only for one night.

title: One Night (ELO Part II album)
text: The album's official release was UK, 1996 2 CD and US, May 20, 1997 1 CD.

title: List of leading Thoroughbred racehorses
text: The list of leading Thoroughbred racehorses contains the names of undefeated racehorses and other horses that had an outstanding race record in specific categories.

title: List of leading Thoroughbred racehorses
text: Note though that many champions do not appear on the list as an unexpected defeat may be caused by many factors such as injury, illness, going, racing tactics and differences in weight carried, the latter being particularly significant in North America and Australia where handicaps are common even at the highest level of racing.

title: Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney
text: Cornelius Vanderbilt "C.V." ("Sonny") Whitney (February 20, 1899 – December 13, 1992) was an American businessman, film producer, writer, philanthropist, polo player, and government official, as well as the owner of a leading stable of thoroughbred racehorses.

title: 2008 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: The 2008 World Thoroughbred Rankings was the 2008 edition of the World Thoroughbred Rankings.

title: 2008 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: It was an assessment of Thoroughbred racehorses issued by the International Federation of Horseracing Authorities (IFHA) in January 2009.

title: 2008 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: It included horses aged three or older which competed in flat races anywhere in the world during 2008.

title: 2008 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: It was the first edition to be open to all horses irrespective of where they raced or were trained.

title: 2008 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: In previous years the IFHA had published two separate listings – a "Northern Hemisphere" edition in January, and a "Southern Hemisphere" version in August.

title: 2012 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: The 2012 World Thoroughbred Rankings was the 2012 edition of the World Thoroughbred Rankings.

title: 2012 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: It was an assessment of Thoroughbred racehorses issued by the International Federation of Horseracing Authorities (IFHA) in January 2012.

title: 2012 World Thoroughbred Rankings

title: 2012 World Thoroughbred Rankings

title: 2011 World Thoroughbred Rankings
text: It included horses aged three or older which competed in flat races during 2011.

title: 2011 World Thoroughbred Rankings

title: 2009 World Thoroughbred Rankings
