text: The song was credited to VM Holdet as the Danish national side is known as Landsholdet.

title: Re-Sepp-Ten
text: The song was recorded in the Werner studio by members of the Danish national football team with additional contributions by Dodo Gad, Jens Rud and Steen Christiansen, all from the Danish band Dodo and the Dodos, Poul Halberg and by Henrik Stanley Møller.

title: Re-Sepp-Ten
text: The music was composed by Michael Bruun, and arranged and produced by him.

title: Strip No More
text: "Strip No More" is a single by Danish band Lukas Graham, about a stripper who has stopped stripping.

title: Strip No More
text: The song was released as a digital download on 16 June 2015 through Then We Take the World.

title: Strip No More
text: The song peaked at number one on the Danish Singles Chart.

title: Strip No More
text: The song was written by Lukas Forchhammer, Christopher Steven Brown, Sebastian Fogh, Stefan Forrest, Morten Ristorp, Morten Pilegaard, Magnus Larsson, Brandon O'Bryant Beal and Mark Falgren.

title: Better Than Yourself (Criminal Mind Pt 2)
text: "Better Than Yourself (Criminal Mind Pt 2)" is a single by Danish band Lukas Graham.

title: Better Than Yourself (Criminal Mind Pt 2)
text: The song was released in Denmark as a digital download in 22 October 2012.

title: Better Than Yourself (Criminal Mind Pt 2)
text: The song peaked at number one on the Danish Singles Chart.

title: Better Than Yourself (Criminal Mind Pt 2)
text: The song was written by Lukas Forchhammer, Rasmus Hedegaard and Brandon Beal.

title: Better Than Yourself (Criminal Mind Pt 2)
text: The song's opening piano accompaniment is a direct quote from Beethoven's "Moonlight Sonata".

title: Home Dead (album)
text: Home Dead is a 2001 EP by Danish band Kashmir.

title: Home Dead (album)
text: An in-between EP, "Home Dead" was made after the success of "The Good Life", and before the band rediscovered themselves with "Zitilites".

title: Home Dead (album)
text: The music on this album, is a reflection of the crisis depicted in "Rocket Brothers", a documentary film about the band.

title: Dancin' (on a Saturday Night)
text: "Dancin' (on a Saturday Night)" is a song written by Lynsey de Paul and Barry Blue, that was recorded by Blue and released as a single in 1973 on Bell Records.

title: Dancin' (on a Saturday Night)
text: It reached the number 2 on the UK Singles Chart, number 2 on the Australian Kent Music chart, number 9 on the German singles chart and number 11 on the Dutch singles chart.

title: Dancin' (on a Saturday Night)
text: Flash Cadillac & the Continental Kids released their version of the song as a single in 1974 and it reached number 79 on the Cashbox singles charts and number 93 on the Billboard Hot 100.

title: Dancin' (on a Saturday Night)
text: In Canada, a version recorded by bond reached number 12 on the CHUM Chart.

title: Dancin' (on a Saturday Night)
text: The Danish band, Clear Sound, also recorded a version with Danish text by Finn Reiner which charted at number 17 in the Danish Hitlister.

title: Dancin' (on a Saturday Night)
text: Junior Janson also released a version of the song as a single in 1975.

title: Søndagsbarn
text: "Søndagsbarn" is a single by Danish hip hop group Suspekt featuring vocals from Danish band Lukas Graham.

title: Søndagsbarn
text: The song was released as a digital download in Denmark on 22 May 2015 through Tabu Records.

title: Søndagsbarn
text: The song peaked to number three on the Danish Singles Chart.

title: The Danish Way to Rock
text: "The Danish Way to Rock" is a Danish language 2010 FIFA World Cup theme song for Denmark and a hit single by Danish band Nephew featuring Landsholdet (meaning "the national team" in Danish).

title: The Danish Way to Rock
text: The song went straight into #1 in the Tracklisten, the Danish Singles Chart.

title: Claess & Willumsen
text: Claess and Willumsen is a Danish band featuring Claess Sorensen and Pelle Willumsen.

title: Claess & Willumsen
text: The debut album "No Receipt" was released in 2007.

title: Claess & Willumsen
text: The band recorded and produced their own album using garage sale equipment and one lonely microphone bought from a Danish composer leaving for Hollywood.

title: Claess & Willumsen
text: Despite the obstacles some of the songs found their way to US television and Danish radio.

title: Claess & Willumsen
text: The album was released online in most of the world and some of the songs have sold in Canada, Germany and USA.

title: Claess & Willumsen
text: The song "Someday" aka "I'll find my way someday" was featured in the American television series "Army Wives" on Lifetime Television.

title: Claess & Willumsen
text: In 2007, Claess & Willumsen signed a contract with NOMA Music.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: Mike Smith started as an A&R man at MCA Publishing as a scout in 1988, where he signed Blur, Levitation and scouted The Smashing Pumpkins.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: He then moved to EMI Publishing in 1992, where he went on to sign acts, such as PJ Harvey, Elastica, Supergrass, Teenage Fan Club, Doves, Starsailor, The Beta Band, The Avalanches, Gorillaz, The White Stripes, The Libertines, The Scissor Sisters, The Arcade Fire, and Arctic Monkeys, as well as resigning Blur and progressing to the position of Head of A&R.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: He also worked with artists such as Robbie Williams, The Verve and Beth Orton.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: Smith moved to Columbia Records UK in 2006 to work as the Managing Director.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: In 2006, he signed Mark Ronson and Calvin Harris.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: In 2007, signings included The Ting Tings, MGMT, The Hugs, The Gossip and Glasvegas.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: The following year, he signed Miike Snow and Lissie to the label and in 2009, Magnetic Man, Miles Kane and Paul Epworth.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: Band of Horses, Katy B, The Vaccines and Ryan Adams were all signed in 2010 and in the following year, he signed Madeon and The Civil Wars.

title: Mike Smith (A&R man)
text: Acts he also looked after included Kings of Leon, Bruce Springsteen, Bob Dylan, Foo Fighters, Matt Cardle, Ke$ha, Sleigh Bells, and Kasabian.

title: William Allen White
text: William Allen White (February 10, 1868 – January 29, 1944) was an American newspaper editor, politician, author, and leader of the Progressive movement.

title: William Allen White
text: Between 1896 and his death, White became a spokesman for middle America.

title: Søren Solkær
text: Søren Solkær (born 3 September 1969 and formerly known as Søren Solkær Starbird), is a Danish photographer best known for his portraits of musicians.

title: Søren Solkær
text: He is most recognised as the man responsible for various iconic images of Björk, The White Stripes, Franz Ferdinand, David Lynch, Arctic Monkeys, R.E.M. and U2.

title: Horace Bumstead
text: Horace Bumstead ( September 1841- January 1919) was a Congregationalist minister and educator.

title: Horace Bumstead
text: He used his career to fight for African American education and became the second president of Atlanta University (1888-1907).

title: Horace Bumstead
text: Bumstead was one of the first white men in the United States to fight for educational rights for African Americans.

title: Horace Bumstead
text: As a white man, he was condemned by many for taking on this role, but African Americans rallied behind his efforts and viewed him as a spokesman.

title: Summer of the Monkeys
text: Summer of the Monkeys is a 1976 children's novel written by Wilson Rawls.

title: Summer of the Monkeys
text: It was published by Doubleday (later released by Yearling Books) and was the winner of the William Allen White Book Award and the California Young Reader Medal.

title: Holden-Keating Gang
text: The Holden-Keating Gang was a bank robbing team, led by Thomas James Holden (1896–1953) and Francis Keating (1899–July 25, 1978), which was active in the Midwestern United States during the 1925 and 1939.

title: Holden-Keating Gang
text: Holden was described by a spokesman for the FBI as "a menace to every man, woman and child in America" and was the first fugitive to be officially listed on the FBI's Top Ten Most Wanted List in 1950.

title: Hätteberget
text: Hätteberget is the name of a Swedish docking lighthouse situated in the sea west of Marstrand and south of Tjörn.

title: Hätteberget
text: It was built in 1977 as a replacement for the old Pater Noster Lighthouse.

title: Hätteberget
text: The lighthouse is a 26 metre high concrete tower with helicopter landing.

title: Hätteberget
text: It is painted with a red belt and has a gray cap on top.

title: Hätteberget
text: The light from the white sector can reach 21.5 nmi .

title: Vance Powell
text: Vance Powell is a four time winning Grammy Award winning American record producer, engineer and mixer.

title: Vance Powell
text: His credits include Chris Stapleton, Jack White, Tyler Bryant & The Shakedown, The Raconteurs, The Dead Weather, The White Stripes, Arctic Monkeys, Wolfmother, Seasick Steve, Black Prairie, The Revivalists, Tinariwen, JEFF the Brotherhood, Daniel Ellsworth & The Great Lakes, and Martina McBride, among many others.

title: Curtis Glencross
text: Curtis Jack Glencross (born December 28, 1982) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey player.

title: Curtis Glencross
text: An undrafted player, he signed with the Anaheim Mighty Ducks as a free agent in 2004 and made his NHL debut with the team in 2007.

title: Curtis Glencross
text: He has also played for the Columbus Blue Jackets, Edmonton Oilers, Calgary Flames and Washington Capitals.

title: Curtis Glencross
text: He was an effective goal scorer and active within the community during his time in Calgary, which led to the team naming him its recipient of the Ralph T. Scurfield Humanitarian Award in 2012.

title: Curtis Glencross
text: After splitting the 2014–15 season between Calgary and Washington, Glencross was unable to reach a contract deal with any NHL team (despite pre-season attempts with the Toronto Maple Leafs and Colorado Avalanche and opted to retire as a player.

title: Curtis Glencross
text: During his playing career, Glencross was a spokesman for the Special Olympics.

title: Curtis Glencross
text: He has also participated with Rae Croteau Jr.'s chuckwagon racing team in the summer.

title: Australian Ecology Research Award (AERA)
text: The Australian Ecology Research Award (AERA) is an award presented by the Ecological Society of Australia for a specific body of recent ecological work by a mid-career researcher.

title: Australian Ecology Research Award (AERA)
text: Initiated in 2008, the AERA was inspired, in part, by the Robert H. MacArthur Award of the Ecological Society of America.

title: Australian Ecology Research Award (AERA)
text: The AERA is not restricted to any particular sector, and aims to recognize outstanding ecological research; nominations of researchers from academia, and the public and private sector agencies are invited annually.

title: Utpal Dutt
text: Utpal Dutta (Bengali: "উৎপল দত্ত" "Utpôl Dôtto", ) (29 March 1929 – 19 August 1993) was an Indian actor, director, and writer-playwright.

title: Utpal Dutt
text: He was primarily an actor in Bengali theatre, where he became a pioneering figure in Modern Indian theatre, when he founded the "Little Theater Group" in 1949.

title: Utpal Dutt
text: This group enacted many English, Shakespearean and Brecht plays, in a period now known as the "Epic theater" period, before it immersed itself completely in highly political and radical theatre.

title: Utpal Dutt
text: His plays became an apt vehicle for the expression of his Marxist ideologies, visible in socio-political plays such as "Kallol" (1965), "Manusher Adhikar", "Louha Manob" (1964), "Tiner Toloar" and "Maha-Bidroha".

title: Utpal Dutt
text: He also acted in over 100 Bengali and Hindi films in a career spanning 40 years, and remains most known for his roles in films such as Mrinal Sen’s "Bhuvan Shome" (1969), Satyajit Ray’s "Agantuk" (1991), Gautam Ghose’s "Padma Nadir Majhi" (1993) and Hrishikesh Mukherjee's breezy Hindi comedies such as "Gol Maal" (1979) and "Rang Birangi" (1983).

title: Siddhartha Jadhav
text: Siddhartha Ramchandra Jadhav is an Indian actor and comedian.

title: Siddhartha Jadhav
text: He is popular on television and has acted in Marathi and Hindi movies making him one of the most talented and successful actors in both Marathis films and television.

title: Siddhartha Jadhav
text: He has acted in several Bollywood movies like "Golmaal" and "Golmaal Returns" but he asserts that his first love is Marathi film, TV and stage.Jadhav also acted in a bengali movie named Ami Subhah Bolchi having Mithun chakraborty as the lead.

title: Siddhartha Jadhav
text: He is currently paired with Bharti Singh on TV show Comedy Circus Ke Ajoobe and has been working with her for 3 seasons consecutive.

title: Gita Dey
text: Gita Dey (5 August 1931 – 17 January 2011) was a renowned actress in Bengali Tollywood films, theatre and Bengali folk theater.

title: Gita Dey
text: She became a stage artist at the age of 6 years.

title: Gita Dey
text: She came to the film industry in 1943.

title: Gita Dey
text: Her first film release was "Ahuti" (1941) as a child actress.

title: Gita Dey
text: She acted in over two hundred Bengali language films and over two thousand stage shows.

title: Gita Dey
text: She acted in the movie "Teen Kanya" under the direction of Satyajit Roy and Rittik Ghatak's "Meghe Dhaka Tara, Subarnarekha, Komal Gandhar, Kato Ajanare".

title: Gita Dey
text: She also acted in Hindi movies such as "Parineeta" (2005) with Vidya Balan and Sanjay Dutt and other movies.

title: Gita Dey
text: She was associated with All India Radio for a long time doing Shruti Natok.

title: Gita Dey
text: She received the Presidential Award for Lifetime Achievement from Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam and many other awards during her lifetime.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: Debashree Roy is an Indian actress who has performed in over hundred films.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: She is a National Award winner actress and known for her work in Bengali cinema.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: She has been a highly successful leading actress in Bengali cinema throughout eighties and nineties as well as a critically acclaimed actress.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: She started her career as a child artist in a Bengali film named "Pagal Thakur" (1966) directed by Hiranmoy Sen. She was launched as an adult actress in Arabinda Mukhopadhyay's Bengali flick "Nadi Theke Sagare" (1978).

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: In 1980, Tarun Majumdar cast her in his romantic flick "Dadar Kirti" which literally made her a star.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: She acted in Aparna Sen's directorial debut 36 Chowringhee Lane (1981).

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: She appeared in Hindi films like Kanak Mishra's "Jiyo To Aise Jiyo" (1981), Desh Gautam's "Bura Aadmi" (1982), Kovelamudi Raghavendra Rao's "Justice Chaudhury" (1983), Mukul Dutt's "Phulwari" (1984), Akash Jain's "Seepeeyan" (1984), Vijay Singh's "Kabhi Ajnabi The" (1985), Bhabendra Nath Saikia's "Kaal Sandhya" (1997).

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: Her "Kabhi Ajnabi The" was assumed to be a huge hit at box office but it turned out to be a major flop at box office causing a doom to her Bollywood career.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: In 1985, she acted in Tarun Majumdar's romantic flick Bhalobasa Bhalobasa which was a major success at box office.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: This film ensured Roy's pairing with Tapas Paul as the leading on-screen pairing of nineteen eighties.

title: Debashree Roy filmography
text: Her other major hits with Paul are "Lalmahal" (1986), "Uttar Lipi" (1986), "Arpan" (1987), "Shankhachur" (1988), "Surer Sathi" (1988), "Surer Akashe" (1988), "Nayanmani" (1989), "Chokher Aloy" (1989), "Shubha Kamana" (1991), "Mayabini" (1992), "Phire Paoa" (1993), "Tobu Mone Rekho" (1994), "Putrabadhu" (1998).

title: Anil Chatterjee
text: Anil Chatterjee (Chattopadhyay) Bengali: অনিল চ্যাটার্জী (চট্টোপাধ্যায়) (25 October 1929 – 17 March 1996) was a Bengali actor in the Bengali cinema during the early fifties through the mid-nineties and is mostly remembered as a character actor.

title: Anil Chatterjee
text: He acted or performed in about 150 movies, including a few in Hindi.

title: Anil Chatterjee
text: He played different shades, though mostly as a character actor, as well as in leading roles and at times as an antagonist, despite the limited opportunities he received.

title: Anil Chatterjee
text: Irrespective of the roles, he left an indelible impression on the viewers and the critics.

title: Anil Chatterjee
text: He also acted in the leading role in a tele-serial named "Naqab" in the national network of Doordarshan.

title: Anil Chatterjee
text: He is one of the very few selected actors who worked with Satyajit Ray, Ritwik Ghatak, Tapan Sinha and Mrinal Sen; with the first three directors, he performed in more than a number of occasion.

title: Anil Chatterjee
text: His performance in the title role of the film "Deshbandhu Chittaranjan"  won the appreciation of Basanti Devi, the wife of the "Deshbandhu" (she is said to have personally blessed the actor).

title: Maharshi Raghava
text: Maharshi Raghava (born "Raghava Gogineni") is an Indian actor from Andhra Pradesh.

title: Maharshi Raghava
text: He acted in more than 170 films in various roles.

title: Maharshi Raghava
text: He shot into fame as a lead actor with his first film "Maharshi".

title: Maharshi Raghava
text: The same film earned him the title "Maharshi".

title: Maharshi Raghava
text: He also acted in TV serials.

title: War Chhod Na Yaar
text: War Chhod Na Yaar (English translation: "Quit the War, Dude") is a 2013 Hindi Indian war comedy film directed and written by Faraz Haider and dialogues are written by Deepak Kingrani.

title: War Chhod Na Yaar
text: The film was announced on 30 March 2013 with a launch party at Novotel Hotel in the presence of the lead actors, Sharman Joshi, Soha Ali Khan, Javed Jaffery, Sanjai Mishra, Dalip Tahil and Mukul Dev who play important characters in the film.

title: Farida Jalal
text: Farida Jalal (born 1949) is an Indian actress, who has acted in over two hundred Bollywood films.

title: Farida Jalal
text: Known primarily for her work in Hindi cinema, she has also worked in Telugu, Tamil and English-language films.

title: David Dencik
text: Karl David Sebastian Dencik (born 31 October 1974) is a Swedish-Danish actor.

title: David Dencik
text: He has acted in both Swedish and Danish films, and has also had major roles in English-language films including "Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy" and " The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo".

title: Soha Ali Khan
text: Soha Ali Khan Khemu (born Soha Ali Khan , 4 October 1978) is an Indian film actress, known primarily for her work in the Hindi film industry, although she has also acted in Bengali and English-language films.

title: Callington Mill
text: Callington Mill is a Lincolnshire tower mill built in 1837 in Oatlands, Tasmania by John Vincent.

title: Callington Mill
text: It has recently been restored so that it is now in full working order and is the only operating mill of its type in the Southern Hemisphere.

title: Callington Mill
text: It is the third oldest windmill in Australia.

title: Callington Mill
text: Traditional baker and blacksmith Alan Scott was a central figure at the mill.

title: Callington Mill
text: Today the mill is a major tourist attraction of Oatlands.

title: Callington Mill
text: Visitors are able to climb the internal stairs for a view across Oatlands and surrounds.

title: Callington Mill
text: The mill site comprises the windmill, a granary, stable, miller’s cottage and mill owner’s house.

title: Rimstone
text: Rimstone, also called gours, is a type of speleothem (cave formation) in the form of a stone dam.

title: Rimstone
text: Rimstone is made up of calcite and other minerals that build up in cave pools.

title: Rimstone
text: The formation created, which looks like stairs, often extends into flowstone above or below the original rimstone.

title: Rimstone
text: Often, rimstone is covered with small, micro-gours on horizontal surfaces.

title: Rimstone
text: Rimstone basins may form terraces that extend over hundreds of feet, with single basins known up to 200 feet long from Tham Xe Biang Fai in Laos

title: Voice type
text: A voice type is a particular human singing voice identified as having certain qualities or characteristics of vocal range, vocal weight, tessitura, vocal timbre, and vocal transition points ("passaggio"), such as breaks and lifts within the voice.

title: Voice type
text: Other considerations are physical characteristics, speech level, scientific testing, and vocal register.

title: Voice type
text: A singer's voice type is identified by a process known as voice classification, by which the human voice is evaluated and thereby designated into a particular voice type.

title: Voice type
text: The discipline of voice classification developed within European classical music and is not generally applicable to other forms of singing.

title: Voice type
text: Voice classification is often used within opera to associate possible roles with potential voices.

title: Voice type
text: Several different voice classification systems are available to identify voice types, including the German "Fach" system and the choral music system among many others; no system is universally applied or accepted.

title: Wishing Stairs
text: Wishing Stairs ( also known as Whispering Corridors 3: Wishing Stairs) is a 2003 South Korean horror film.

title: Wishing Stairs
text: It is the third installment of the "Whispering Corridors" film series set in girls high schools, but, as with all films in the series, is unrelated to the others; apart from a song being sung in one scene that is a pivotal plot in "Voice".

title: Highland Inn
text: The Highland Inn (1908–1957) was a year-round resort hotel built and operated by the Grand Trunk Railway (GTR), in Ontario’s Algonquin Provincial Park.

title: Highland Inn
text: It was located near the park offices on the northern edge of Cache Lake, and was a focal point for the park for many years.

title: Highland Inn
text: Wishing to return the park lands to a more natural state, the Inn was purchased by the Ontario Government in 1957 and removed.

title: Highland Inn
text: Today all that remains are traces of the concrete stairs and platform that met the CNR line, which was lifted after departure of the last train in 1959.

title: Song Ji-hyo
text: Cheon Soo-yeon (born Cheon Seong-im on August 15, 1981), better known by her stage name Song Ji-hyo, is a South Korean actress and model.

title: Song Ji-hyo
text: She made her acting debut in "Wishing Stairs" (2003), one of the horror "Whispering Corridors film series".

title: Song Ji-hyo
text: She then received further recognition for her roles in the romantic comedy drama "Princess Hours" (2006), the historical drama "Jumong" (2006), the historical film "A Frozen Flower" (2008), the crime film "New World" (2013), the romantic comedy drama "Emergency Couple" (2014), and family melodrama "My Wife's Having an Affair this Week" (2016).

title: Exchange Ilford
text: The Exchange Ilford is the main retail shopping mall in the town centre of Ilford, London.

title: Exchange Ilford
text: It was owned by The Mall Fund for a period of time but has now been sold and reverted to its original name of "The Exchange Mall".

title: Exchange Ilford
text: It trades from three levels of retail, though its architectural design layout has resulted in the lower floor of retail being separated into two parts, meaning customers wishing to access both parts of the lower level have to travel between the sections via the middle level.

title: Exchange Ilford
text: There is also an upper level of retail and food court facilities accessed from the middle level.

title: Exchange Ilford
text: Transit between levels is via a series of lifts, stairs and escalators within the Mall; in addition, some stores trade from two or more levels of the mall.

title: Wishing well (disambiguation)
text: Wishing well is a type of well in European folklore.

title: Ninnu Kori
text: Ninnu Kori (English: "Wishing For You" ) is a Telugu language romance film directed by debutant Shiva Nirvana and produced by DVV Danayya under DVV Entertainments.

title: Ninnu Kori
text: Nani and Nivetha Thomas play the lead roles in the movie while Aadhi Pinisetty plays a pivotal role.

title: Ninnu Kori
text: Gopi Sunder was roped in to compose music for the film.

title: Ninnu Kori
text: Prawin Pudi and Karthik Ghattamaneni are the editor and cinematographer of this movie respectively.

title: Ninnu Kori
text: The movie was launched in November 2016 and shooting commenced in February 2017 in the United States.

title: Ninnu Kori
text: The film released on July 7, 2017.

title: List of ancient spiral stairs
text: The list of ancient spiral stairs contains a selection of Greco-Roman spiral stairs constructed during classical antiquity.

title: List of ancient spiral stairs
text: The spiral stair is a type of stairway which, due to its complex helical structure, has been introduced relatively late into architecture.

title: List of ancient spiral stairs
text: Although the oldest example dates back to the 5th century BC, it was only in the wake of the influential design of the Trajan's Column that this space-saving new type permanently caught hold in Roman architecture.

title: Switched at Birth (season 2)
text: The second season of ABC Family drama television series "Switched at Birth" was commissioned on August 17, 2012.

title: Switched at Birth (season 2)
text: It premiered on January 7, 2013 in the United States and consisted of 21 episodes.

title: Switched at Birth (season 2)
text: The season is produced by ABC Family, Pirates' Cove Entertainment and Suzy B Productions, with Paul Stupin, Becky Hartman Edwards, John Ziffren, and series creator Lizzy Weiss serving as executive producers.

title: Switched at Birth (season 3)
text: The third season of ABC Family drama television series "Switched at Birth" began on January 13, 2014, and will consist of 22 episodes.

title: Switched at Birth (season 3)
text: The season is produced by ABC Family, Pirates' Cove Entertainment, and Suzy B Productions, with Paul Stupin and series creator Lizzy Weiss serving as executive producers.

title: Switched at Birth (TV series)
text: Switched at Birth is an American teen/family drama television series that premiered on ABC Family on June 6, 2011, at 9:00 ET/PT.

title: Switched at Birth (TV series)
text: The one-hour scripted drama is set in the Kansas City metropolitan area, and revolves around two teenagers who were switched at birth and grew up in very different environments: one in an affluent suburb, and the other in working-class areas.

title: Switched at Birth (TV series)
text: According to ABC Family, it is "the first mainstream television series to have multiple deaf and hard-of-hearing series regulars and scenes shot entirely in American Sign Language (ASL)".

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: "Switched at Birth" is an American television drama series which premiered on ABC Family on June 6, 2011.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: Created by Lizzy Weiss, the series follows two teenage girls who learn that they were switched at birth.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: On August 17, 2012, ABC Family renewed "Switched at Birth" for a second season, which premiered on January 7, 2013.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: All of the episode titles take their names from pieces of artwork.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: On July 30, 2013, ABC Family renewed the series for a full 22-episode third season, which premiered in January 2014.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: The second half of season 3 premiered on June 16, 2014.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: On August 13, 2014, the series was renewed for a fourth season, which premiered on January 6, 2015.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: ABC Family, which changed its name to Freeform in January 2016, announced on Wednesday October 21, 2015, that it had renewed the series for a fifth and final season.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: The fifth season began airing on January 31, 2017, and concluded on April 11, 2017.

title: List of Switched at Birth episodes
text: During the course of the series, episodes of "Switched at Birth " aired over seasons.

title: Lea Thompson
text: Lea Katherine Thompson (born May 31, 1961) is an American actress, television director, and television producer.

title: Lea Thompson
text: She is known for her role as Lorraine Baines in the "Back to the Future" trilogy and as the title character in the 1990s NBC sitcom "Caroline in the City".

title: Lea Thompson
text: Other films for which she is known include "All the Right Moves" (1983), "Red Dawn" (1984), "Howard the Duck" (1986) "Some Kind of Wonderful" (1987), and "The Beverly Hillbillies" (1993).

title: Lea Thompson
text: From 2011-2017, she co-starred as Kathryn Kennish in the Freeform (formerly ABC Family) series "Switched at Birth".

title: Lucas Grabeel
text: Lucas Stephen Grabeel ( ; born November 23, 1984) is an American actor, director, producer, singer and songwriter.

title: Lucas Grabeel
text: He is best known for roles such as Ryan Evans in the "High School Musical" film series, as Ezra Chase in The Adventures of Food Boy (2008) and as Ethan Dalloway in the third and fourth installments of the Halloweentown series: "Halloweentown High" (2004) and "Return to Halloweentown" (2006).

title: Lucas Grabeel
text: He also appeared as a young Lex Luthor and Conner Kent in the television series "Smallville".

title: Lucas Grabeel
text: He played Toby Kennish in the ABC Family/Freeform drama "Switched at Birth".

title: Lucas Grabeel
text: He provides the voice of Deputy Peck in the Disney Junior TV series "Sheriff Callie's Wild West".

title: Alice Upside Down
text: Alice Upside Down is a 2007 comedy-drama film, based in the "Alice" series written by Phyllis Reynolds Naylor.

title: Alice Upside Down
text: The film was shot at Bishop DuBourg High School in St. Louis, Missouri, United States.

title: Alice Upside Down
text: Screened in limited cinema in 2007, it was released wide straight-to-DVD on July 29, 2008.

title: Alice Upside Down
text: In North America, it airs on Starz Kids & Family, but in the early years, it was on demand.

title: Alice Upside Down
text: The film's plot centers on Alice, an 11-year-old girl starting the sixth grade at a new school.

title: Alice Upside Down
text: It was starring Alyson Stoner, Lucas Grabeel, Bridgit Mendler, Luke Perry, Penny Marshall and Ashley Eckstein.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: "General Hospital" is the longest running American television serial drama, airing on ABC.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: Created by Frank and Doris Hursley, the series premiered on April 1, 1963.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: The longest-running cast member is Leslie Charleson, who has portrayed Dr. Monica Quartermaine since August 17, 1977, also making her one of the longest-tenured actors in American soap operas.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: Former cast member Rachel Ames was previously the series' longest-running cast member, portraying Audrey Hardy from 1964 to 2007, and making guest appearances in 2009 and 2013, the latter for the series' fiftieth anniversary.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: Ames made a special appearance on October 30, 2015.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: Actors Genie Francis and Kin Shriner, who portray Laura Spencer and Scott Baldwin, are the second and third longest-running cast members, having joined "General Hospital" in February and August 1977, respectively.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: Actress Jacklyn Zeman — who portrays Bobbie Spencer — is the fourth longest-running cast member, joining the serial in December 1977.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: Actress Jane Elliot, who joined the serial in June 1978 as Tracy Quartermaine, is the fifth longest-running cast member, joining "General Hospital" in June 1978 until her departure in May 2017.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: Former cast member Anthony Geary, who portrayed Luke Spencer, was the sixth longest-running cast member, having joined "General Hospital" in November 1978.

title: General Hospital cast members
text: The following list is of cast members who are currently on the show: the main and recurring cast members, or those who are debuting, departing or returning to the series.

title: Constance Marie
text: Constance Marie Lopez (born September 9, 1965) known professionally as Constance Marie, is an American actress.

title: Constance Marie
text: She is known for her role as Angie Lopez on "George Lopez" (2002–2007) and her role as Marcela Quintanilla (mother of Selena) in the 1997 film "Selena".

title: Constance Marie
text: She portrayed Regina Vasquez on the ABC Family/Freeform drama "Switched at Birth" (2011–2017).

title: Switched at Birth (season 4)
text: On August 13, 2014, ABC Family announced that it has picked up a fourth season of its hit original drama series "Switched at Birth", premiering on January 6, 2015.

title: Switched at Birth (season 4)
text: The season is produced by ABC Family, Pirates' Cove Entertainment, and Suzy B Productions, with Paul Stupin and series creator Lizzy Weiss serving as executive producers.

title: Eleonora Pedron
text: Eleonora Pedron (born 13 July 1982) is an Italian model and actress, who was crowned Miss Italia 2002.

title: Eleonora Pedron
text: She later briefly served as a weather presenter on Italy's Rete 4 channel.

title: Eleonora Pedron
text: As an actress she was most recently seen in the TV series "Donna Detective".

title: Alex Belli
text: Alex Belli (born 22 December 1982 in Parma) is an Italian model, media personality and actor, best known for his role (Jacopo Castelli, 2010-2015) on daytime soap opera "CentoVetrine".

title: Alex Belli
text: In 2005 Alex Belli started his career as a model in London, Paris, New York City and Milan.

title: Alex Belli
text: In January 2012 he took part (with Bobo Vieri, Andrés Gil, Anna Tatangelo, Ria Antoniou, Ariadna Romero and other contestant) in the Italian reality show "Ballando con le Stelle" hosted on Rai 1 by Milly Carlucci with Paolo Belli and his "Big Band".

title: Alex Belli
text: Alex Belli in 2013, after 3 years of engagement, married Katarina Raniakova, a Slovakian model: they divorced in 2017.

title: Elena Santarelli
text: Elena Santarelli (born 18 August 1981) is an Italian model, television personality and actress.

title: Basaglia Law
text: Basaglia Law or Law 180 (Italian: "Legge Basaglia, Legge 180" ) is the Italian Mental Health Act of 1978 which signified a large reform of the psychiatric system in Italy, contained directives for the closing down of all psychiatric hospitals and led to their gradual replacement with a whole range of community-based services, including settings for acute in-patient care.

title: Basaglia Law
text: The Basaglia Law is the basis of Italian mental health legislation.

title: Basaglia Law
text: The principal proponent of Law 180 and its architect was Italian psychiatrist Franco Basaglia.

title: Basaglia Law
text: Therefore, Law 180 is known as the “Basaglia Law” from the name of its promoter.

title: Basaglia Law
text: The Parliament of Italy enacted Law 180 on May 13, 1978, and thereby initiated the gradual dismantling of psychiatric hospitals.

title: Basaglia Law
text: Implementation of the psychiatric reform law was accomplished in 1998 which marked the very end of the state psychiatric hospital system in Italy.

title: Basaglia Law
text: The Law has had worldwide impact as other counties took up widely the Italian model.

title: Basaglia Law
text: It was "Democratic Psychiatry" which was essential in the birth of the reform law of 1978.

title: Eva Riccobono
text: Eva Riccobono (born 7 February 1983) is an Italian model, actress, and television presenter.

title: Astrophel and Stella
text: Probably composed in the 1580s, Philip Sidney's Astrophil and Stella is an English sonnet sequence containing 108 sonnets and 11 songs.

title: Astrophel and Stella
text: The name derives from the two Greek words, 'aster' (star) and 'phil' (lover), and the Latin word 'stella' meaning star.

title: Astrophel and Stella
text: Thus Astrophil is the star lover, and Stella is his star.

title: Astrophel and Stella
text: Sidney partly nativized the key features of his Italian model Petrarch, including an ongoing but partly obscure narrative, the philosophical trappings of the poet in relation to love and desire, and musings on the art of poetic creation.

title: Astrophel and Stella
text: Sidney also adopts the Petrarchan rhyme scheme, though he uses it with such freedom that fifteen variants are employed.

title: Flavia Vento
text: Flavia Vento (born 17 April 1977) is an Italian model, actress and presenter.

title: Marta Ribera
text: Marta Ribera is a Spanish theatrical actress star born in 1971.

title: Marta Ribera
text: She is perhaps best known for her roles in the Frank Wildhorn musical Jekyll & Hyde (musical) in the starring role of Lucy Harris and her most recent role as The Lady of the Lake in Monty Python's Spamalot.

title: Marta Ribera
text: She has also appeared as Sally Bowles in Cabaret (musical), amongst other roles.

title: Janine Gutierrez
text: Janine Marie Elizabeth de Leon Gutierrez, known professionally as Janine Gutierrez (born 2 October 1989, Quezon City) is a Filipina actress, television host and commercial model.

title: Janine Gutierrez
text: A graduate of the Ateneo de Manila University with a degree in European Studies, she is currently a contract artist of GMA Network.

title: Margareth Madè
text: Margareth Madè (22 June 1982, Paternò, Italy) born Margareth Tamara Maccarrone is an Italian model and actress.

title: Margareth Madè
text: She uses her artist name because her own surname "Maccarrone" has too many associations with pasta.

title: Cultural depictions of Harold Godwinson
text: Fictional accounts based on the events surrounding Harold Godwinson's brief reign as king of England have been published, notably the play "Harold", by Alfred, Lord Tennyson, in 1876; and the novel "Last of the Saxon Kings", by Edward Bulwer-Lytton, in 1848.

title: Cultural depictions of Harold Godwinson
text: Rudyard Kipling wrote a short story, included in his 1910 collection, "Rewards and Fairies", where an aged King Harold meets Henry I and dies in the arms of a Saxon knight.

title: Edith Walks
text: Edith Walks is a 2017 documentary film directed by Andrew Kötting which imagines a journey by Edith the Fair, wife of English king Harold Godwinson, from Waltham Abbey where he is buried to near the site of the Battle of Hastings and the invasion of England by William the Conqueror in 1066.

title: Edith Walks
text: It includes contributions from the writers Alan Moore and Iain Sinclair, the torch singer Claudia Barton, and the musician Jem Finer.

title: Battle of Hastings
text: The Battle of Hastings was fought on 14 October 1066 between the Norman-French army of William, the Duke of Normandy, and an English army under the Anglo-Saxon King Harold Godwinson, beginning the Norman conquest of England.

title: Battle of Hastings
text: It took place approximately 7 mi northwest of Hastings, close to the present-day town of Battle, East Sussex, and was a decisive Norman victory.

title: The Last English King
text: The Last English King (1997) is a historical novel by English writer Julian Rathbone.

title: The Last English King
text: The novel covers the time of the Battle of Hastings.

title: The Last English King
text: It revolves around Walt Edwinson, a housecarl of Harold Godwinson, the last Anglo-Saxon king of England.

title: The Last English King
text: The story starts with Walt returning to his home at Iwerne in Dorset four years after the Battle of Hastings.

title: The Last English King
text: He had fled England after the defeat of the Anglo-Saxons and had spent the time travelling across Europe and Asia Minor.

title: The Last English King
text: The story of his journey from Constantinople via Nicomedia and Nicaea to Side is then recounted in parallel with his recollections of the time before the battle, such as his accompanying Harold to William of Normandy's attack on Dinan.

title: Godwin, Earl of Wessex
text: Godwin of Wessex (Old English: "Godƿin" ; 100115 April 1053) was one of the most powerful earls in England under the Danish king Cnut the Great and his successors.

title: Godwin, Earl of Wessex
text: Cnut made him the first Earl of Wessex.

title: Godwin, Earl of Wessex
text: Godwin was the father of King Harold Godwinson and Edith of Wessex, wife of King Edward the Confessor.

title: Tostig Godwinson
text: Tostig Godwinson ( 1026 – 25 September 1066) was an Anglo-Saxon Earl of Northumbria and brother of King Harold Godwinson.

title: Tostig Godwinson
text: After being exiled by his brother, Tostig supported the Norwegian king Harald Hardrada's invasion of England, and was killed at the Battle of Stamford Bridge.

title: Battle of Stamford Bridge
text: The Battle of Stamford Bridge took place at the village of Stamford Bridge, East Riding of Yorkshire, in England on 25 September 1066, between an English army under King Harold Godwinson and an invading Norwegian force led by King Harald Hardrada and the English king's brother Tostig Godwinson.

title: Battle of Stamford Bridge
text: After a bloody battle, both Hardrada and Tostig along with most of the Norwegians were killed.

title: Battle of Stamford Bridge
text: Although Harold Godwinson repelled the Norwegian invaders, his army was defeated by the Normans at Hastings less than three weeks later.

title: Battle of Stamford Bridge
text: The battle has traditionally been presented as symbolising the end of the Viking Age, although major Scandinavian campaigns in Britain and Ireland occurred in the following decades, such as those of King Sweyn Estrithson of Denmark in 1069–1070 and King Magnus Barefoot of Norway in 1098 and 1102–1103.

title: Gytha Thorkelsdóttir
text: Gytha Thorkelsdóttir (Old English: "Gȳða Þorkelsdōttir" , 997 – c. 1069), also called Githa, was a Danish noblewoman.

title: Gytha Thorkelsdóttir
text: She was the mother of King Harold Godwinson and of Edith of Wessex, queen consort of King Edward the Confessor of England.

title: Edith the Fair
text: Edith the Fair (Old English: "Ealdgȳð Swann hnesce" , "Edyth the Gentle Swan"; c. 1025 – c. 1086), also known as Edith Swanneck, was the first wife of King Harold Godwinson.

title: Edith the Fair
text: "Swanneck" (or Swan-Neck) comes from the folk etymology which made her in Old English as "swann hnecca", "swan neck", which was actually most likely a corrupted form of "swann hnesce, ""Gentle Swan"" ".

title: Edith the Fair
text: She is sometimes confused with Ealdgyth, daughter of Earl Ælfgar of Mercia, who was queen during Harold's reign.

title: Leofwine Godwinson
text: Leofwine Godwinson (c. 1035 – 14 October 1066) was a younger brother of King Harold Godwinson, the fifth son of Earl Godwin.

title: Robin Guarino
text: Robin Guarino (born April 3, 1960) is an opera and film director.

title: Robin Guarino
text: She has directed operas such as "The Marriage of Figaro", "Don Giovanni", "Lohengrin", "Così fan tutte" , and "The Magic Flute" at the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Robin Guarino
text: Also, she has directed at Seattle Opera, Glimmerglass Opera, Chautauqua Opera, Virginia Opera, and Wolf Trap Opera.

title: Robin Guarino
text: She continues to direct, most recently "L'etoile" and "The Marriage of Figaro" for the Wolf Trap Opera Festival, " La Calisto", "The Magic Flute" and "Iphigénie en Aulide" for Juilliard Opera Center, and at Gotham Chamber Opera, "Il Signor Bruschino".

title: Robin Guarino
text: She currently holds the J. Ralph Corbett Distinguished Chair in Opera at the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music."

title: Bum Phillips (opera)
text: Bum Phillips is an opera in two acts by American composer Peter Stopschinski.

title: Bum Phillips (opera)
text: Kirk Lynn wrote the English language libretto based on Bum Phillips' memoirs "Bum Phillips: Coach, Cowboy, Christian".

title: Bum Phillips (opera)
text: The opera was conceived by theater director Luke Leonard and commissioned by Monk Parrots, Inc. as described in a 2014 "Sports on Earth" article titled "A Night at the "Bum Phillips" Opera".

title: Alexis Soriano
text: Alexis Soriano is a Spanish-Lithuanian orchestral conductor and composer.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: A pupil of Ilya Musin, and later of Valery Gergiev, he has been Principal Associate Conductor of The Hermitage Orchestra for ten years and is Artistic Director of the "Spanish Evenings Festival" in Saint Petersburg.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: On the invitation of Gergiev, he made his debut at the Mariinsky Theater, conducting Mozart's "The Marriage of Figaro".

title: Alexis Soriano
text: Since 2009 he has been Artistic Director and principal conductor of the chamber opera company, "Opera Incognita" and conducted the company's first fully staged opera, "The letters of Van Gogh" by Grigory Frid, at the Hermitage Theatre.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: The production was nominated for the Golden Mask Award.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: His repertoire also includes contemporary and rarely performed music, especially Spanish.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: He was chief conductor of INSO Lviv Symphony Orchestra between 2010 and 2012.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: He has conducted the first recording of José Lidón's 1792 opera, "Glaura y Cariolano".

title: Alexis Soriano
text: Since 2012 he has been Artistic Director of New York Opera Society.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: In 2014 he was elected as one of the "100 Spaniards" which excelled abroad in their own discipline.

title: Alexis Soriano
text: Among the orchestras he has conducted are those of the Mariinsky Theatre, Teatro Colón, and the Teatro Real in Madrid as well as the Lithuanian National Orchestra, Saint Petersburg Symphony, Prague Symphony, English Chamber Orchestra, and Taipei Symphony.

title: 4 Devils
text: 4 Devils (also known as Four Devils) is a lost 1928 American silent drama film directed by German film director F. W. Murnau and starring Janet Gaynor.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: Phillip Boykin (sometimes credited as Phillip Lamar Boykin) is an American bass-baritone, broadway, gospel, jazz and opera singer, film and stage actor.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: In 2017 he was featured in the Broadway revival of "Sunday in the Park with George" and made Broadway history as the first African-American Boatman/Lee Randolph while reopening Broadway's newest and oldest theater at the time The Hudson Theater New York City which played it last Broadway show in 1968.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: Phillip will play the role of Tonton Julian in the Revival of "Once On This Island".

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He was also featured in On the Town at the Lyric Theater.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He was nominated for the Tony Award, as well as the Drama Desk and Outer Critic Circle Award for Outstanding Featured Actor in a Musical for his role as Crown in the Broadway revival of (Porgy and Bess).

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He was awarded the Theater World Award for his Outstanding Broadway debut.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He is the founder and director of "The NYGospel Brothers" a Gospel Quartet that travels around the world spreading the good news.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: One of ten children, Boykin grew up in Greenville, South Carolina.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He started studies in Opera Performance at South Carolina State College before transferring to the North Carolina School of the Arts.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He left NCSA in 1990 and moved to the Hartt School of the University of Hartford where he received his Bachelor of Music in Vocal Performance in 1995.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He later studied toward a Master's degree in Opera and Jazz Vocals from Howard University.

title: Phillip Boykin
text: He was seen on the big screen in Freedom starring Cuba Gooding Jr., Top Five starring Chris Rock and Easter Mysteries written by Tony Award Winning Broadway producer John O’Boyle.

title: Lord Byron (opera)
text: Lord Byron is an opera in three acts by Virgil Thomson to an original English libretto by Jack Larson, inspired by the historical character Lord Byron.

title: Lord Byron (opera)
text: This was Thomson's third and final opera.

title: Lord Byron (opera)
text: He wrote it on commission from the Ford Foundation for the Metropolitan Opera (Met), but the Met never produced the opera.

title: Lord Byron (opera)
text: The first performance was at Lincoln Center, New York City on April 20, 1972, by the music department of the Juilliard School with John Houseman as stage director, Gerhard Samuel as the conductor and Alvin Ailey as the choreographer.

title: Lord Byron (opera)
text: A performance of a revised version, by the composer, took place in 1985 with the New York Opera Repertory Theater.

title: Brett C. Leonard
text: Brett C. Leonard is an American dramatist, screenwriter and producer.

title: Brett C. Leonard
text: A member of the LAByrinth Theater Company of New York City, he is best known for his tragic drama "The Long Red Road" which was performed at the Goodman Theatre in Chicago under Philip Seymour Hoffman as director, starring Tom Hardy, and for his play "Guinea Pig Solo", originally produced as a co-production between LAByrinth and NY's Public Theater, starring John Ortiz.

title: Brett C. Leonard
text: Leonard also wrote and produced for the HBO TV series "Hung" (2011).

title: Brett C. Leonard
text: , wrote and served as a Supervising Producer for the AMC series "Low Winter Sun", was a writer and Co-Executive Producer on Amazon's "Mad Dogs," a Consulting Producer on AMC's "Fear the Walking Dead" and Creative Consultant on BBC/FX drama "Taboo."

title: Brett C. Leonard
text: Also of note are his plays "Ninth and Joanie" directed by Mark Wing-Davey, produced in New York City by LAByrinth Theater Company, "Roger and Vanessa", produced at Theatre 503 in London, The Actors' Gang in Los Angeles and Tap Gallery in Sydney and "Unconditional", produced by LAByrinth at NYC's Public Theater, directed by Mark Wing-Davey and published in "New Playwrights: The Best Plays of 2008".

title: Brett C. Leonard
text: His low-budget film "Jailbait", based on his play, starred Michael Pitt and Stephen Adly Guirgis, premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival, won Best Narrative Feature at Lake Placid Film Festival and was released theatrically in 2005.

title: David Alden
text: David Alden (born 1949 in New York City) is a prolific theater and film director known for his post-modernist settings of opera.

title: David Alden
text: He is the twin brother of Christopher Alden, also an opera director in the revisionist mold.

title: David Alden
text: The two brothers have covered much of the same repertoire in their long careers, but whereas Christopher's operatic settings place greater emphasis on his characters' emotional range, David's protagonists are more broadly caricatured and his productions far more politically charged.

title: David Alden
text: Another distinguishing feature between them is that David has been more active in Europe throughout his career, having enjoyed a particularly close creative partnership with Sir Peter Jonas for more than two decades, at both the English National Opera and the Bavarian State Opera.

title: Julien Nitzberg
text: Julien Nitzberg (born 1965) is a US screenwriter, stage writer, lyricist, theater director and film director, best known in the film world as the director of the documentary "The Wild and Wonderful Whites of West Virginia".

title: Julien Nitzberg
text: In the theater world, Nitzberg is best known for his controversial musical "The Beastly Bombing or A Terrible Tale of Terrorists Tamed by the Tangles of True Love".

title: Julien Nitzberg
text: Nitzberg wrote the book and lyrics and directed this musical in Los Angeles and New York.

title: Julien Nitzberg
text: "The Beastly Bombing" won the LA Weekly Theater Award for Best Musical of the Year.

title: 2012 US Open – Men's singles final
text: The 2012 US Open Men's Singles final was the championship tennis match of the Men's Singles tournament at the 2012 US Open.

title: 2012 US Open – Men's singles final
text: In the final, Andy Murray defeated defending champion Novak Djokovic 7–6, 7–5, 2–6, 3–6, 6–2 to win the match.

title: 2012 US Open – Men's singles final
text: It was the equal-longest US Open men's final in history, lasting 4 hours and 54 minutes (equalling the 1988 US Open final played by Ivan Lendl and Mats Wilander), and the equal second-longest men's final in the Open era, only behind the 2012 Australian Open final.

title: 2012 US Open – Men's singles final
text: By winning the 2012 US Open, Murray became the first British man since Fred Perry in 1936 to win a Grand Slam singles title, and the first British man in the Open Era to do so.

title: 2012 US Open – Men's singles final
text: The match is a significant part of the rivalry between the two players.

title: 2012 US Open – Men's singles final
text: This match also marked a milestone for Murray, as it was his 100th match win at a grand slam tournament.

title: Williams sisters
text: The Williams sisters are two professional American tennis players: Venus Williams (b. 1980), a seven-time Grand Slam title winner (singles), and Serena Williams (b. 1981), twenty-three-time Grand Slam title winner (singles), both of whom were coached from an early age by their parents Richard Williams and Oracene Price.

title: Williams sisters
text: There is a noted professional rivalry between them – between the 2001 US Open and the 2017 Australian Open tournaments, they met in nine Grand Slam singles finals.

title: Williams sisters
text: They became the first two players, female or male, to play in 4 consecutive grand slam singles finals from the 2002 French Open to the 2003 Australian Open; Serena famously won all 4 to complete the first of two "Serena Slams".

title: Williams sisters
text: Between 2000 and 2016, a 17-year span, they collectively won 12 Wimbledon singles titles (Venus won 5 and Serena won 7).

title: Williams sisters
text: By winning the 2001 Australian Open women's doubles title, they became the 5th pair to complete the Career Doubles Grand Slam and the only pair to complete the Career Doubles Golden Slam.

title: Williams sisters
text: At the time, Venus and Serena were only 20 and 19 years old, respectively.

title: Williams sisters
text: Since then they have gone on to add another two Olympic gold medals in the 2008 Beijing Olympics and the 2012 London Olympics.

title: Williams sisters
text: Nearly a decade later, the duo would go on to win 4 consecutive grand slam doubles titles from 2009 Wimbledon through 2010 Roland Garros, which would catapult them to co-No.

title: Williams sisters
text: 1 doubles players on 7 June 2010.

title: Williams sisters
text: Two weeks later, on 21 June 2010, Serena would hold the No. 1 singles ranking and Venus would be right behind her at No. 2 in singles.

title: Williams sisters
text: Their most recent grand slam doubles titles came at the 2012 Wimbledon & 2016 Wimbledon events.

title: Williams sisters
text: They remain very close, often watching each other's matches in support, even after one of them has been knocked out of a tournament.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: The 2017 Australian Open Men's Singles final was the championship tennis match of the Men's Singles tournament at the 2017 Australian Open.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: It was contested between Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, ranked 17th and 9th in the world respectively.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: It was their record ninth meeting in a Grand Slam final in their rivalry, and their 1st meeting in a Grand Slam final since the 2011 French Open.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: In a rematch of the 2009 Australian Open final, which Nadal won in 5 sets, Roger Federer won the duel in 5 sets, beating Nadal for the first time in a Grand Slam since the 2007 Wimbledon final.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: He also trailed Nadal 3–1 in the final set but won 5 games in a row to win the title.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: This ended a 6-match losing streak against Nadal in Grand Slam events.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: Having lost all of their previous three encounters, this was the first time Federer defeated Nadal at the Australian Open and also marked Federer's first Grand Slam victory over Nadal outside the grass courts of Wimbledon.

title: 2017 Australian Open – Men's singles final
text: Federer extended his record of Grand Slam men's singles titles to 18, marking the third time he broke his own all-time record, after breaking the previous record of 14, held by Pete Sampras.

title: Sandra Reynolds
text: Sandra Reynolds Price ("née" Reynolds; born 4 March 1934) is a former tennis player from South Africa who won four Grand Slam women's doubles championships and one Grand Slam mixed doubles championship.

title: Sandra Reynolds
text: Her best Grand Slam singles result was reaching the 1960 Wimbledon final, losing to Maria Bueno 8–6, 6–0.

title: Sandra Reynolds
text: Reynolds is the only female player from South Africa to have reached the Wimbledon singles final, and she is one of three to have reached a singles final in a Grand Slam.

title: Sandra Reynolds
text: In 1961, she was seeded no. 1 for the Wimbledon Ladies Singles Championship, making her the only South African player (man or woman) ever to be seeded first in a Grand Slam singles event.

title: Sandra Reynolds
text: She was the runner-up at the 1959 , losing to Sally Moore in the final.

title: Sandra Reynolds
text: Price won the German Championships in 1960, 1961, and 1962.

title: Sandra Reynolds
text: She was the runner-up at the 1959 Italian Championships, having defeated Bueno in a semifinal, then losing to Christine Truman in the final.

title: 1973 Queen's Club Championships
text: The 1973 Queen's Club Championships was a tennis tournament played on grass courts at the Queen's Club in London in the United Kingdom.

title: 1973 Queen's Club Championships
text: The men's tournament was part of the 1973 Commercial Union Assurance Grand Prix circuit while the women's event was part of the 1973 Women's Grand Prix tour.

title: 1973 Queen's Club Championships
text: It was the 74th edition of the tournament and was held from June 17 through June 23, 1973.

title: 1973 Queen's Club Championships
text: Ilie Năstase and Olga Morozova won the singles titles.

title: Francesca Schiavone
text: Francesca Schiavone (] ; born 23 June 1980 in Milan) is an Italian tennis player who turned professional in 1998.

title: Francesca Schiavone
text: She won the 2010 French Open singles title, becoming the first Italian woman to win a Grand Slam event in singles.

title: Francesca Schiavone
text: She was also runner-up at the 2011 French Open.

title: Francesca Schiavone
text: Her career high ranking is world No. 4, achieved on 31 January 2011.

title: Francesca Schiavone
text: To date, Schiavone is the last one handed-backhand player to win a Grand Slam title on the women's tour.

title: Li Na
text: Li Na (; ; born 26 February 1982) is a retired Chinese professional tennis player, who achieved a career-high WTA-ranking of world No. 2 on 17 February 2014.

title: Li Na
text: Over the course of her career, Li won seven WTA singles titles and two Grand Slam singles titles at the 2011 French Open and 2014 Australian Open.

title: Li Na
text: Li's rise to prominence came after those victories, which made her the first and only Grand Slam singles champion from East Asia and Asia as a whole.

title: Li Na
text: Prior to this, she had already become the first player representing an East Asian and Asian country to appear in a Grand Slam singles final, a milestone she achieved at the 2011 Australian Open.

title: Li Na
text: Li was also the runner-up at the 2013 Australian Open and 2013 WTA Tour Championships, a three-time quarterfinalist at Wimbledon and a semifinalist at the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games and 2013 US Open.

title: Li Na
text: Among her other most notable accolades, she was the first Chinese player to win a WTA tour title at the Guangzhou International Women's Open in 2004, the first to reach a Grand Slam singles quarterfinal at the 2006 Wimbledon Championships, and the first to break into the world's top 10.

title: Li Na
text: Her feats have sparked a major population growth of tennis players in East Asia, earning her the reputation as the region's tennis pioneer and trailblazer.

title: 2011 French Open – Women's Singles
text: Francesca Schiavone was the defending champion, but lost in the final to Li Na, 6–4, 7–6, making Li the first Asian and Chinese Grand Slam singles champion.

title: 1974 Virginia Slims of Philadelphia
text: The 1974 Virginia Slims of Philadelphia was a women's tennis tournament played on indoor carpet courts at the Palestra in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in the United States that was part of the 1974 Virginia Slims World Championship Series.

title: 1974 Virginia Slims of Philadelphia
text: It was the third edition of the tournament and was held from April 22 through April 28, 1974.

title: 1974 Virginia Slims of Philadelphia
text: Seventh-seeded Olga Morozova won the singles title and earned $10,000 first-prize money.

title: 1968 US Open (tennis)
text: The 1968 US Open (formerly known as U.S. National Championships) was a tennis tournament that took place on the outdoor grass courts at the West Side Tennis Club, Forest Hills in New York, United States.

title: 1968 US Open (tennis)
text: The tournament ran from 29 August until 8 September.

title: 1968 US Open (tennis)
text: It was the 88th staging of the tournament and the fourth Grand Slam event of 1968.

title: 1968 US Open (tennis)
text: It was the first edition of the tournament in the Open Era of tennis and as such for the first time offered prize money, totaling $100,000.

title: 1968 US Open (tennis)
text: Arthur Ashe and Virginia Wade won the singles titles.

title: 1968 US Open (tennis)
text: Ashe was still registered as an amateur and therefore not entitled to the $14,000 first-prize money, which instead went to runner-up Tom Okker, while Wade earned $6,000.

title: 1968 US Open (tennis)
text: Frank Parker, at the age of 52, lost to eventual champion Arthur Ashe in the second round, and still holds the record for the oldest man to compete in a Grand Slam singles tournament.

title: Klaus Ewerth
text: Klaus Ewerth (28 March 1907 – 20 December 1943) was a German U-boat commander in World War II.

title: Klaus Ewerth
text: He reached the rank of "Kapitän zur See" with the "Kriegsmarine" during World War II.

title: Hans Jenisch
text: Hans Jenisch (19 October 1913 – 29 April 1982) was a "Kapitänleutnant" in Nazi Germany's "Kriegsmarine" during World War II and a "Kapitän zur See" in West Germany's "Bundesmarine".

title: Hans Jenisch
text: He commanded the Type VIIA U-boat "U-32" , sinking seventeen ships on seven patrols, for a total of gross register tons (GRT) of Allied shipping, to become the 26th highest scoring U-Boat ace of World War II.

title: Ernst Kals
text: Ernst Kals (2 August 1905 – 2 November 1979) was a "Kapitän zur See" with the "Kriegsmarine" during World War II.

title: Ernst Kals
text: He commanded the Type IXC U-boat "U-130" on five patrols, and sank twenty ships, for a total of 145,656 tons of Allied shipping.

title: Ernst Kals
text: He was awarded the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross, awarded to recognise extreme battlefield bravery or successful military leadership.

title: Wolf Junge
text: Wolf Junge was a German naval officer of World War II.

title: Wolf Junge
text: As a Kapitän zur See, he was appointed the executive officer of the battleship "Tirpitz" in August 1943 under Kapitän zur See Hans Meyer.

title: Wolf Junge
text: He temporarily took control of the ship on 3 April 1944 when Meyer was badly wounded during the Operation Tungsten air attack on "Tirpitz".

title: Wolf Junge
text: Junge was subsequently confirmed in this role during May.

title: Wolf Junge
text: However, he was unpopular with the battleship's crew as he was perceived to have had little experience operating warships at sea.

title: Wolf Junge
text: Junge handed command of "Tirpitz" to Kapitän zur See Robert Weber in November 1944.

title: German auxiliary cruiser Widder
text: "Widder" (HSK 3) was an auxiliary cruiser ("Hilfskreuzer") of Nazi Germany's "Kriegsmarine" that was used as a merchant raider in the Second World War.

title: German auxiliary cruiser Widder
text: Her Kriegsmarine designation was Schiff 21, to the Royal Navy she was Raider D.

title: German auxiliary cruiser Widder
text: The name "Widder" (Ram) represents the constellation Aries in German.

title: German auxiliary cruiser Widder
text: The name was given after the horoscope sign of the ship's master, "Kapitän zur See" Helmuth von Ruckteschell.

title: Ernst Heinrich Lindemann
text: Ernst Heinrich Lindemann (25 January 1833 in Kirchlengern – 8 May 1900 in Düsseldorf) was German politician and mayor of Essen, Dortmund and Düsseldorf.

title: Ernst Heinrich Lindemann
text: His grandson "Kapitän zur See" Ernst Lindemann was the commander of the battleship "Bismarck".

title: German destroyer Z43
text: Z43 was a Type 1936B destroyer of Nazi Germany's "Kriegsmarine".

title: German destroyer Z43
text: She was laid down on 1 May 1942 at Deschimag in Bremen, launched on 22 September 1943 and commissioned on 24 March 1944.

title: German destroyer Z43
text: Her service was with the 6th Destroyer Flotilla in the Baltic Sea under the command of Kapitän zur See Wenniger and later Fregattenkapitän Lampe.

title: German destroyer Z43
text: She mainly escorted ships, including the Heavy Cruiser "Admiral Scheer" , and participated in a minelaying operation in December 1944, where her sisters "Z35" and "Z36" were sunk.

title: German destroyer Z43
text: She was badly damaged by a mine on 10 April 1945, and scuttled on 3 May of that same year.

title: Hansjürgen Reinicke
text: Hans-Jürgen "Hansjürgen" Rudolf Reinicke (10 August 1902 – 29 January 1978) was a "Kapitän zur See", commander of heavy cruiser "Prinz Eugen", in Nazi Germany's "Kriegsmarine" during the Second World War and recipient of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross.

title: 21st U-boat Flotilla
text: 21st U-boat Flotilla ("21.

title: 21st U-boat Flotilla
text: Unterseebootsflottille") was a unit of Nazi Germany's "Kriegsmarine" before and during World War II.

title: 21st U-boat Flotilla
text: It was formed in 1935 as a "Schulverband" ("School Unit") based at Kiel under the command of "Kapitän zur See" Kurt Slevogt ("Chef des Schulverbandes").

title: Ernst Lindemann
text: Otto Ernst Lindemann (28 March 1894 – 27 May 1941) was a German "Kapitän zur See" (naval captain).

title: Ernst Lindemann
text: He was the only commander of the battleship "Bismarck" during its eight months of service in World War II.

title: Yasuhito Endō
text: Yasuhito Endō (遠藤 保仁 , Endō Yasuhito , born 28 January 1980 in Sakurajima in Kagoshima Prefecture) is a Japanese footballer, who currently plays for the J. League team Gamba Osaka.

title: Yasuhito Endō
text: His older brother Akihiro, who retired in 2008, is also a former professional footballer, and was selected as one of Japan under-23 national football team members played at 1996 Olympics.

title: Yasuhito Endō
text: He is considered a cult hero at Gamba Osaka and the Japan National Football Team.

title: Yasuhito Endō
text: It is because he has formidable passing ability, leadership, and goal scoring ability.

title: Yasuhito Endō
text: He is also known for his excellent accuracy on free kicks and is revered as one of Japan's most creative midfielders as well as one of the most talented Japanese footballers of his generation, despite only playing domestically in his home country.

title: George Young (Scottish footballer)
text: George Lewis Young (27 October 1922 – 10 January 1997) was a Scottish footballer, best remembered for his association with Rangers and for being the first player to receive more than 50 caps for the Scotland national team.

title: Vanda & Young
text: Vanda & Young were a songwriting/producing duo composed of Harry Vanda and George Young.

title: Vanda & Young
text: They performed as members of 1960s Australian rock group The Easybeats where Vanda was their lead guitarist and backing singer and Young was their rhythm guitarist and backing singer.

title: Vanda & Young
text: Vanda & Young co-wrote most of The Easybeats later hits including their international hit "Friday on My Mind" and they were the record producers for the group from 1967.

title: Vanda & Young
text: Young is the older brother of Malcolm and Angus Young of the hard rock band AC/DC, being the record producer behind several of the band's biggest albums (such as 1976's "Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap").

title: Lewis Young (Australian footballer)
text: Lewis Young (born 20 December 1998) is a professional Australian rules footballer playing for the Western Bulldogs in the Australian Football League (AFL).

title: Lewis Young (Australian footballer)
text: He was drafted by the Western Bulldogs with their third selection and forty-ninth overall in the 2016 national draft.

title: Lewis Young (Australian footballer)
text: He made his debut in the twenty point win against Carlton at Etihad Stadium in round seventeen of the 2017 season.

title: Rick Clausen
text: Richard James Clausen (born June 29, 1982) is the current offensive coordinator/quarterbacks coach at Calabasas High School.

title: Rick Clausen
text: He is also a former American football player who played college football for Louisiana State University and University of Tennessee.

title: Rick Clausen
text: During his two years at LSU (2001 Redshirt and 2002), he played in three games, starting the 2002 game against Ole Miss.

title: Rick Clausen
text: At the end of the 2002 season, he transferred to Tennessee, where he walked on to the football team as a backup quarterback, sitting out the 2003 season under the NCAA transfer rules.

title: Rick Clausen
text: His older brother, Casey, also played college football for Tennessee in 2000-2003 and is the head football coach at Calabasas High School.

title: Rick Clausen
text: His youngest brother, Jimmy, formerly played quarterback for the Baltimore Ravens of the NFL.

title: Scott Young (American football)
text: Scott Lewis Young (born July 15, 1981) is a retired American football guard.

title: Scott Young (American football)
text: He was drafted by the Philadelphia Eagles in the fifth round of the 2005 NFL Draft.

title: Scott Young (American football)
text: He played college football at Brigham Young.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: William Travis "Bully" Van de Graaff (October 25, 1895 – April 26, 1977) was an American football player, coach, and college athletics administrator.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: He attended Tuscaloosa High School.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: He played college football at the University of Alabama, where he was selected as an All-American in 1915, Alabama's first.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: He was 6'1" 187 pounds.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: "Bully" was placed on an "Associated Press" Southeast Area All-Time football team 1869-1919 era.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: Van de Graaff served as the head football coach at Colorado College from 1926 to 1939, compiling a record of 49–47–6.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: He coached hall of famer Dutch Clark.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: He died in Colorado Springs, Colorado on April 26, 1977 at the age of 81.

title: William T. Van de Graaff
text: He was the older brother of physicist Robert J. Van de Graaff, the designer of the Van de Graaff generator which produces high voltages. Bully's two older brothers, Hargrove and Adrian, were also Alabama football players.

title: Bob Young (American football)
text: Robert Allen Young (September 3, 1942 – June 17, 1995) was an American football offensive guard who played 16 seasons in the National Football League, mainly for the St. Louis Cardinals, where he and other Cardinal offensive linemen are credited with introducing modern weightlifting/powerlifting into the training regime of the NFL.

title: Bob Young (American football)
text: He was named to two Pro Bowls (1978 & 1979) and was a first team All Pro selection in 1979 as well.

title: Bob Young (American football)
text: Young attended Howard Payne University.

title: Bob Young (American football)
text: He was the older brother of three-time world powerlifting champion Doug Young.

title: Lewis Young
text: Lewis Jack Young (born 27 September 1989) is an English professional footballer who plays for Crawley Town.

title: Lewis Young
text: He can play either as a striker, as a right winger or as, most recently, a right back.

title: Lewis Young
text: He is the younger brother of Manchester United footballer Ashley Young.

title: Retreat, Hell!
text: Retreat, Hell!

title: Retreat, Hell!
text: is a 1952 American war film about the 1st Marine Division in the Korean War, directed by Joseph H. Lewis.

title: Retreat, Hell!
text: It stars Frank Lovejoy as a career Marine battalion commander who is recalled from work at an American embassy, Richard Carlson as a veteran captain and communications specialist of World War II called up from the Marine Corps Reserves, Russ Tamblyn as a seventeen-year-old private who hides his true age to serve with the unit overseas and outdo his older brother, also a Marine, and Nedrick Young (credited as Ned Young).

title: Retreat, Hell!
text: Also appearing in the film is Peter Julien Ortiz, a highly decorated Marine who served in the Office of Strategic Services (OSS) and appeared in various films after retiring from the military.

title: Id Tech 5
text: id Tech 5 is a proprietary game engine released by id Software.

title: Id Tech 5
text: It follows its predecessors, id Tech 1, 2, 3 and 4, all of which have subsequently been published under the GNU General Public License.

title: Id Tech 5
text: It was seen as a major advancement over id Tech 4.

title: Id Tech 5
text: The engine was first demonstrated at the WWDC 2007 by John D. Carmack on an eight-core computer; however, the demo used only a single core with single-threaded OpenGL implementation running on a 512 MB 7000 class Quadro video card.

title: Id Tech 5
text: <ref name="http://www.Gaminggroove.com posting"> </ref> id Tech 5 was first used in the video game "Rage", followed by "", "The Evil Within" and "".

title: Amen: The Awakening
text: Amen: The Awakening was a narrative driven first-person shooter/role-playing video game with some stealth elements by Cavedog Entertainment.

title: Amen: The Awakening
text: It was to be the first FPS by Cavedog.

title: Amen: The Awakening
text: 60% completed, it was canceled in 2000 for a variety of reasons, one of which being that its overall scope and proprietary game engine was far too ambitious, given computer hardware of the time.

title: Rockstar Advanced Game Engine
text: The Rockstar Advanced Game Engine (RAGE) is a proprietary game engine developed by the RAGE Technology Group at Rockstar San Diego, with contributions by other Rockstar Games subsidiaries.

title: Rockstar Advanced Game Engine
text: The engine has been used on several different platforms such as Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Wii, Xbox 360 and Xbox One.

title: Rockstar Advanced Game Engine
text: The Angel Game Engine was originally developed by Angel Studios for "Midtown Madness" and later the sixth generation console era versions of the "Midnight Club" series and other Angel Studios games.

title: Tom Clancy's The Division
text: Tom Clancy's The Division is an online-only action role-playing video game developed by Massive Entertainment and published by Ubisoft, with assistance from Red Storm Entertainment, for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.

title: Tom Clancy's The Division
text: It was announced during Ubisoft's E3 2013 press conference, and was released worldwide on 8 March 2016.

title: Tom Clancy's The Division
text: It is set in a near future New York City in the aftermath of a smallpox pandemic; the player, who is an agent of the eponymous Strategic Homeland Division, commonly referred to as simply "The Division", is tasked with helping the group rebuild its operations in Manhattan, investigate the nature of the outbreak, and combating criminal activity in its wake.

title: Tom Clancy's The Division
text: "The Division" is structured with elements of role-playing games, as well as collaborative and player versus player online multiplayer.

title: Project I.G.I.: I'm Going In
text: Project I.G.I.: I'm Going In (released in Europe as simply Project I.G.I.) is a tactical first-person shooter video game developed by Innerloop Studios and released on December 15, 2000 by Eidos Interactive.

title: Project I.G.I.: I'm Going In
text: Upon release the game received mixed reviews due to a number of shortcomings, including poorly programmed A.I., lack of a mid-game save option, and the lack of multiplayer features.

title: Project I.G.I.: I'm Going In
text: However it was praised for its superb sound design and graphics, thanks in part to its use of a proprietary game engine that was previously used in Innerloop's "Joint Strike Fighter".

title: Snowdrop (game engine)
text: Snowdrop is a proprietary game engine created by Ubisoft for use on Microsoft Windows, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One.

title: Snowdrop (game engine)
text: It was first revealed at E3 2013 with "Tom Clancy's The Division", the first game using the engine.

title: ParaEngine
text: ParaEngine Corporation is a technology and product company focusing on 3D virtual world technologies.

title: ParaEngine
text: It is usually referred to as P.E. for short.

title: ParaEngine
text: ParaEngine Co. is founded by LiXizhi in Shenzhen in the People's Republic of China.

title: ParaEngine
text: In 2009.10, it launched its first public product called Haqi Town, a creative social MMO for kids.

title: ParaEngine
text: In Haqi Town, each user has its own avatar, virtual land, and can build up their dream world easily.

title: ParaEngine
text: ParaEngine Corporation (P.E.) also focuses on the research and development of a distributed computer game engine called ParaEngine.

title: ParaEngine
