text: URB magazine gave the album 4 out of 5 stars and stated that it was "Heavily influenced by the golden age of De La Soul, Pete Rock and DJ Premier" and that it featured "12 top-shelf tracks" The album also earned the duo Featured Artist status on the Okayplayer website.

title: Lawless Element
text: Magnif has continued production work for a number of other underground acts, and released a mixtape titled "SupaBeatMaker" in late 2005.

title: Lawless Element
text: The duo has announced plans for their second album, tentatively titled "Evil", scheduled for released in 2008 on Babygrande Records.

title: Lawless Element
text: Magnif is also planning the release of a full-length production and solo album.

title: Sunset Blvd. (Yancey Boys album)
text: Sunset Blvd. is the debut LP by Detroit-based hip hop duo Yancey Boys (Illa J and Frank Nitt), released on October 29, 2013 by Yancey Media Group in conjunction with Delicious Vinyl and distributed through Traffic Entertainment Group.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Islam is historically divided into two major sects, Sunni and Shia Islam, each with its own sub-sects.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Large numbers of Shia Arab Muslims live in some Arab countries including Lebanon, Yemen, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Oman, the UAE, and Qatar.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Shia Muslims are a numerical majority in Iraq and Bahrain.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Approximately half of the population in Yemen are Shia Muslims.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Exactly half of Muslims in Lebanon are Shia Muslims.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: There is also a very large population of Shia Muslims living in the Arab Persian Gulf countries especially in Saudi Arabia.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Approximately the whole population of East Saudi Arabia, the Eastern Province are Shia Muslims.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Although government statistics claim that roughly only 20-40% of the Muslim population are Shia Muslims, there has been dispute to the authenticity of this figure and recent reports and investigations indicate that there is in fact a much larger population of Shia Muslims present, with estimate figures over 45% or even making the majority of Muslim population.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Saudi Arabia follows a strict recently established sect of Islam, Wahhabism, there is little freedom of religion between the different sects even whilst all of the population are Muslims.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Smaller Shia groups are present in Egypt and Jordan.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Despite the heavy presence of Shia Muslims in some Arab countries, particularly among the population of the Persian Gulf Arab countries, they have been treated poorly throughout history.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: Additionally, in recent times, Shia Muslims along with Kurds have faced genocide by the pan-Arabist regime of Saddam Hussein.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: For both historical and political reasons, the Shia have fared rather poorly in much of the Arab world, and the topic of Shi‘ism and Shia groups is one of the most sensitive issues for the Sunni elite.

title: Shia Muslims in the Arab world
text: This article discusses both the history of Shī‘a Islam in the Arab world from the dawn of Islam and their current situation in the Arabic-speaking world.

title: Shuangmiao, Inner Mongolia
text: Shuangmiao () is a town under the administration of Hanggin Rear Banner in southwestern Inner Mongolia, China, located about 26 km southwest of the banner seat and 44 km north-northwest of downtown Bayannur.

title: Shuangmiao, Inner Mongolia
text: , it has 14 villages under its administration.

title: Chahar Right Rear Banner
text: Chahar Right Rear Banner (Mongolian: ᠴᠠᠬᠠᠷ ᠪᠠᠷᠠᠭᠤᠨ ᠭᠠᠷᠤᠨ ᠬᠣᠶᠢᠲᠤ ᠬᠣᠰᠢᠭᠤ ; Цахар баруун гарын хойд хошуу; "Čaqar Baraɣun Ɣarun Qoyitu qosiɣu"; ) is a banner of Inner Mongolia, People's Republic of China, bordering Shangdu County to the northeast, Xinghe County to the southeast, Chahar Right Front Banner to the south, Zhuozi County to the southwest, Chahar Right Rear Banner to the west, Siziwang Banner to the northwest, and Xilin Gol to the north.

title: Chahar Right Rear Banner
text: It is under the administration of Ulaan Chab City, which lies to the south along the G55 Erenhot–Guangzhou Expressway.

title: Chahar Right Rear Banner
text: The most important settlement in the banner is Baiyinchagan.

title: Hanggin Banner
text: Hanggin (or Hangjin) Banner (Mongolian: ᠬᠠᠩᠭᠢᠨ ᠬᠣᠰᠢᠭᠤ Қанин қосиу "Qaŋɣin qosiɣu"; ) is a banner in the southwest of Inner Mongolia, People's Republic of China, bordering Dalad Banner to the east, Otog Banner to the southwest, and Bayan Nur to the north.

title: Hanggin Banner
text: It is under the administration of Ordos City.

title: Hanggin Rear Banner
text: Hanggin Rear Banner (Mongolian: ᠬᠠᠩᠭᠢᠨ ᠬᠣᠶᠢᠲᠤ ᠬᠣᠰᠢᠭᠤ Қанин Қоыиту қосиу "Qaŋɣin Qoyitu qosiɣu"; ), 1,767 km2, 300,000 inhabitants (2004), administrative center: Shanba (陕坝镇).

title: Altanochir (1882–1949)
text: Altanochir (1882–1949) was an Inner Mongolian prince, politician, and general under the Republic of China and Mengjiang governments.

title: Altanochir (1882–1949)
text: He served as deputy head of Yeke-juu League (today Ordos City).

title: Altanochir (1882–1949)
text: An ethnic Mongol, he was a native of Right-Wing Rear Banner, Ordos (today administered as Hanggin Banner, Ordos City).

title: Riverview, New Brunswick
text: Riverview is a Canadian town in Albert County, New Brunswick, Canada.

title: Riverview, New Brunswick
text: Riverview is located on the south side of the Petitcodiac River, across from the larger cities of Moncton and Dieppe.

title: Riverview, New Brunswick
text: Riverview has an area of 34 km2 , and a population density of 564.6 PD/km2 .

title: Riverview, New Brunswick
text: Riverview's slogan is "A Great Place To Grow".

title: Riverview, New Brunswick
text: With a population of 19,667, Riverview is the fifth largest municipality in New Brunswick, having a larger population than the cities of Edmundston, Bathurst, Campbellton, and Miramichi, despite its designation of "town".

title: Statistical inference
text: Statistical inference is the process of deducing properties of an underlying probability distribution by analysis of data.

title: Statistical inference
text: Inferential statistical analysis infers properties about a population: this includes testing hypotheses and deriving estimates.

title: Statistical inference
text: The population is assumed to be larger than the observed data set; in other words, the observed data is assumed to be sampled from a larger population.

title: Urad Rear Banner
text: Urad Rear Banner (Mongolian: ᠤᠷᠠᠳ ᠤᠨ ᠬᠣᠶᠢᠲᠤ ᠬᠣᠰᠢᠭᠤ "Urad-un Qoyitu Qosiɣu", Урадын хойд хошуу; ) or Urad Houqi is a banner of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, People's Republic of China.

title: Urad Rear Banner
text: It is located in the west of the region, 44 km northwest of the city of Bayan Nur, which administers this banner.

title: Urad Rear Banner
text: The banner has a total area of 24,925 km2 and in 2004 had a population of 60,000.

title: Urad Rear Banner
text: Its seat is located in the town of Bayan Bolag (巴音宝力格镇).

title: Horqin Left Rear Banner
text: Horqin Left Rear Banner (Mongolian: ᠬᠣᠷᠴᠢᠨ ᠵᠡᠭᠦᠨ ᠭᠠᠷᠤᠨ ᠬᠣᠶᠢᠲᠤ ᠬᠣᠰᠢᠭᠤ Қорчин Жэгүн арун Қоыиту қосиу "Qorčin Jegün Ɣarun Qoyitu qosiɣu"; Mongolian: "Qorcin jegün garun qoyidu qosigu" 'Northern banner of the Khorchin east wing'; , original Mongolian name "Büve vang qosigu") is a banner of southeastern Inner Mongolia, People's Republic of China, bordering Liaoning province to the south.

title: Horqin Left Rear Banner
text: It is under the administration of Tongliao City, 75 km to the north.

title: Horqin Left Rear Banner
text: The local Mongolian dialect is Khorchin Mongolian.

title: Schwartz's
text: Schwartz's (French: "Chez Schwartz"), also known as the Montreal Hebrew Delicatessen (French: "Charcuterie Hebraique de Montréal, Inc."), is a delicatessen restaurant and take-out, located at 3895 Saint-Laurent Boulevard in Montreal, Quebec.

title: Schwartz's
text: It was established in 1928 by Reuben Schwartz, a Jewish immigrant from Romania.

title: Schwartz's
text: Schwartz's is the most famous remaining Montreal-style smoked meat restaurant.

title: Schwartz's
text: The restaurant also sells smoked meat by mail order.

title: Schwartz's
text: It is kosher style rather than kosher.

text: Mark T. Smith (born January 12, 1968) is a celebrated American painter.

title: Mark T. Smith
text: He is widely known for his colorful, complex paintings and his passion for the application of art into the fabric of everyday life, such as celebrated contemporary eateries such as Taco BellTM and Long John Silver'sTM.

title: Tahar Rahim

title: Van Gogh (1991 film)
text: Van Gogh is a 1991 French film written and directed by Maurice Pialat.

title: Van Gogh (1991 film)
text: It stars Jacques Dutronc in the role of Dutch painter Vincent van Gogh, a role for which he won the 1992 César Award for Best Actor.

title: Van Gogh (1991 film)
text: Set in 1890, the film follows the last 67 days of Van Gogh's life and explores his relationships with his brother Theo, his physician Paul Gachet (most famous as the subject of Van Gogh's painting "Portrait of Dr. Gachet"), and the women in his life, including Gachet's daughter, Marguerite.

title: Samuel Poe
text: Samuel Johnson Poe an American football halfback for the Princeton Tigers in 1882 and 1883.

title: Samuel Poe
text: He graduated from Princeton in 1884, he was also earned All-American honors as a lacrosse player.

title: Samuel Poe
text: Samuel was the eldest member of the Poe brothers, six celebrated American football players at Princeton University from 1882 until 1901.

title: Samuel Poe
text: They were sons of John P. Poe, Sr., an 1854 Princeton graduate himself and the Attorney General of Maryland from 1891 until 1895.

title: Samuel Poe
text: They were also second cousins, twice removed, of the celebrated poet Edgar Allan Poe, who died in 1849.

title: Jacques Mathou
text: Jacques Mathou is a French actor, best known for his appearance in "Delicatessen".

title: Mariette Leslie Cotton
text: Mariette Leslie Cotton (1866-1947) was a celebrated American artist who usually gave her name as Mrs. Leslie Cotton.

title: Mariette Leslie Cotton
text: A student of William Merritt Chase, Carolus-Duran, and Jean-Jacques Henner , she worked mainly in Paris but also maintained studios in London and New York.

title: Mariette Leslie Cotton
text: By birth and marriage she possessed a level of wealth and social prestige that, together with her artistic skill, enabled her to obtain lucrative commissions from prominent individuals.

title: Mariette Leslie Cotton
text: The portraits she painted were praised for their veracity, style, and fine technique.

title: Mariette Leslie Cotton
text: Their subjects included kings, aristocrats, celebrities, and members of wealthy families.

title: Mariette Leslie Cotton
text: Late in her career a critic wrote that her "popularity has a sound basis, for her portraits combine such abstract artistic qualities as effective and infinitely varied design and daringly unconventional arrangements of color, with strong characterization and a likeness that never fails to be convincing," and added, "her concern with the artistic problem never makes her obtrude her own personality or offend the sitter's susceptibilities."

title: James Gamble Rogers II
text: James Gamble Rogers II (January 24, 1901 – October 30, 1990) was a celebrated American architect practicing primarily in Winter Park, Florida in the middle years of the twentieth century.

title: James Gamble Rogers II
text: He is noted for suavely elegant residential and commercial work, in the Spanish Revival, Mediterranean Revival, French Provincial, and Colonial Revival styles.

title: Paris Awakens

title: Delicatessen (film)

title: Man from 1997
text: The music was written by David Buttolph and the cinematographer was Ted D. McCord.

title: Man from 1997
text: The show was originally telecast on November 27, 1956 and a kinescope of the broadcast currently exists.

title: Jump into Hell

title: Jump into Hell
text: The film stars Jacques Sernas (billed as "Jack Sernas") and Kurt Kasznar.

title: Jump into Hell

text: It was shot in Ibiza.

title: Dieci canzoni d'amore da salvare

title: Dieci canzoni d'amore da salvare

text: An Apsara is a female spirit from Hindu and Buddhist mythology.

title: Picobrouwerij Alvinne
text: Picobrouwerij Alvinne is a small brewery in the small hamlet of Moen near the Belgian city of Zwevegem.

title: Picobrouwerij Alvinne
text: The name of the brewery derives from a female spirit of local folk tales, who can be seen depicted on the brewery's logo and labels.

title: Likhoradka
text: Likhoradka (Russian: "Лихорадка", Serbian: "Милоснице" or "Milosnice") or tryasavitsa is a female spirit in Slavic mythology.

title: Likhoradka
text: Likhoradka was purported to be able to possess a person's body and cause sickness.

title: Likhoradka
text: In some tales, she is considered a creation of the dark deity Chernobog.

title: Likhoradka
text: Later Russian legends describe 12 Likhoradkas, with individual names associated with special illnesses.

title: Likhoradka
text: In modern Russian, the word likhoradka has obtained the meaning "fever".

title: Likhoradka
text: As a mythological figure, Likhoradka was related to the figure of Chuma, which in modern Russian is the term for plague.

title: Likhoradka
text: Likhoradka was sometimes portrayed as a tall woman with dishevelled hair, a pale face and a white dress, who brought sickness to people she tried to touch or to kiss.

title: Al Basty
text: Al Basty (Turkish: "Albastı"; Tatar, Kyrgyz, Kazakh: "Албасты", Chuvash: "Алпастă", Azerbaijanese: "Albasdı", Russian: "Албасты́") or Al Kardai is an ancient female spirit, the personification of guilt, found in folklore throughout the Caucasus mountains, with origins going as far back as Sumerian mythology.

title: Fomorians
text: The Fomorians (Old Irish: Fomoire , Modern Irish: Fomhóraigh ) are a supernatural race in Irish mythology.

title: Fomorians
text: They are often portrayed as hostile and monstrous beings who come from the sea or underground.

title: Fomorians
text: Later, they were portrayed as giants and sea raiders.

title: Fomorians
text: They are enemies of Ireland's first settlers and opponents of the Tuatha Dé Danann, the other supernatural race in Irish mythology.

title: Fomorians
text: However, their relationship with the Tuath Dé is complex and some of their members intermarry and have children.

title: Fomorians
text: The Fomorians have thus been likened to the jötnar of Norse mythology.

title: Sea nymph
text: A sea nymph, in mythology, is a female nature deity of the sea, or female spirit of sea waters.

title: VMAQT-1
text: Marine Tactical Electronic Warfare Training Squadron 1 (VMAQT-1) is a United States Marine Corps electronic warfare training squadron consisting of EA-6B Prowler jets.

title: VMAQT-1
text: The squadron is based at Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point, North Carolina and falls under the command of Marine Aircraft Group 14 (MAG-14) and the 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (2nd MAW).

title: VMAQT-1
text: The VMAQT-1 logo is the Banshee, an Irish mythological figure foretelling death.

title: VMAQT-1
text: Its motto is “Tairngreacht Bas,” Gaelic for “Death Foretold.”

title: Pramlocha
text: According to Hindu mythology, Pramlocha was an apsaras (a female spirit of the clouds and waters).

title: Banshee
text: A banshee ( ; Modern Irish "bean sí", from Old Irish: "ban síde" , ] , "woman of the fairy mound" or "fairy woman") is a female spirit in Irish mythology who heralds the death of a family member, usually by shrieking or keening.

title: Banshee
text: Her name is connected to the mythologically-important tumuli or "mounds" that dot the Irish countryside, which are known as síde (singular "síd") in Old Irish.

title: Rusalka
text: A rusalka (Russian: руса́лка , "rusálka " ; Polish: "rusałka" ) is a water nymph, a female spirit in Slavic mythology and folklore.

title: Rusalka
text: The term is sometimes translated from Bulgarian, Belarusian, Russian and Ukrainian as .

title: Steve Arbuckle

title: Steve Arbuckle
text: He started his career as a theatre actor at Cape Breton University, then made his first move into film in 2003 with the lead role in the short film "Todd and the Book of Pure Evil", which also starred Julian Richings and John Bregar.

title: Steve Arbuckle
text: He appeared as Oliver Peele in 2010 in the pilot episode of the CBS show "Blue Bloods".

title: Steve Arbuckle
text: Arbuckle is now living in Toronto, Ontario.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: Taiwanese entertainer Jolin Tsai ( ) has been featured in two feature films, five short films, four television dramas, and one variety show.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: In 2001, she made her acting debut as a guest appearance in the television drama, "Six Friends", which was directed by Ma Kung-wei.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: Her next television dramas, "Come to My Place", directed by Doze Niu, and "In Love", directed by Ouyang Sheng and Chang Chih-chao, were released in 2002.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: Tsai followed it with a leading role in the television drama, "Hi Working Girl" (2003), which was directed by Huang Ko-i and Wu Ssu-ta, with Taiwanese actor Show Lo.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: She received mixed reviews for her leading role in the television drama.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: To further promote her studio album in 2007, she played the title role in the film, "Agent J", which was directed by Jeff Chang, Kuang Sheng, and Lai Wei-kang.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: She was received positively for her leading role in the film.

title: Jolin Tsai filmography

title: Jolin Tsai filmography
text: She voiced a European rabbit named Judy Hopps who is a newly appointed member of the Zootopia Police Department in the film's Taiwanese version.

title: Siobhan Finneran

text: Ashley Cheadle is an Australian actress, surfer and singer, who now lives in Australia .
