text: The event took place in Grand Cayman in the Cayman Islands from 3 to 9 April.

title: Cayman Islands Open 2011
text: Nicol David won her third Cayman Islands Open trophy, beating Jenny Duncalf in the final.

title: Phoenix Hong Kong Channel
text: Phoenix Hong Kong Channel is one of the six channels that Phoenix Television operates.

title: Phoenix Hong Kong Channel
text: It was launched on 28 March 2011 in order to serve Chinese viewers in Hong Kong, and it is Phoenix Television's first Yue Chinese-language channel that is available across Hong Kong.

title: Phoenix Hong Kong Channel
text: This channel now broadcasts through cable television and satellite television systems.

title: Phoenix Hong Kong Channel
text: Some of its programmes still broadcasting in Mandarin Chinese.

title: Cayman Islands at the 2011 Pan American Games
text: The Cayman Islands will compete at the 2011 Pan American Games in Guadalajara, Mexico, October 14–30, 2011.

title: Cayman Islands at the 2011 Pan American Games
text: The Cayman Islands will send twelve athletes in four sports, the same number as from the 2007 Pan American Games in Rio de Janeiro.

title: Cayman Islands at the 2011 Pan American Games
text: The Chef de Mission of the team will be general secretary of the Cayman Islands Football Association, Bruce Blake.

title: .ky
text: ky is the Internet country code top-level domain (ccTLD) for the Cayman Islands.

title: .ky
text: Registration is limited until September 2, 2015 to residents and registered companies in the Cayman Islands, and a local address is required for the registrant.

title: .ky
text: After September 2, 2015 the .

title: .ky
text: ky extension is available to anyone Worldwide on a first-come first-served basis.

title: .ky
text: The Cayman Islands also has the international three letter code, CYM, and has won a bid to be awarded the .

title: .ky
text: cym domain name in a future expansion of the top level domain space.

title: The Pastor's Wife (film)
text: The Pastor's Wife is a 2011 biographical television film, starring Rose McGowan as Mary Winkler and based on the true crime book of the same title by author Diane Fanning.

title: The Pastor's Wife (film)
text: It premiered on Saturday, November 5, at 8 pm ET/PT on the Lifetime Network.

title: Scream (1996 film)
text: Scream is a 1996 American slasher film written by Kevin Williamson and directed by Wes Craven.

title: Scream (1996 film)
text: The film stars David Arquette, Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox, Matthew Lillard, Rose McGowan, Skeet Ulrich, and Drew Barrymore.

title: Scream (1996 film)
text: Released on December 20, 1996, "Scream" follows the character of Sidney Prescott (Campbell), a high school student in the fictional town of Woodsboro, California, who becomes the target of a mysterious killer known as Ghostface.

title: Scream (1996 film)
text: The film combined black comedy and "whodunit" mystery with the violence of the slasher genre to satirize the clichés of the horror film genre popularized in films such as "Halloween" and "Friday the 13th".

title: Scream (1996 film)
text: The film was considered unique at the time of its release for featuring characters who were aware of real world horror films and openly discussed the clichés that "Scream" attempted to subvert.

title: Emotional Technology
text: Emotional Technology is the fourth studio album by electronica artist BT.

title: Emotional Technology
text: Transitioning towards a poppier sound, the album features some of BT's well-known hits, including "Somnambulist", "The Force of Gravity" and "Superfabulous".

title: Emotional Technology
text: "Somnambulist", also known as "Simply Being Loved", holds the Guinness World Record for most vocal edits in a single track, with 6,178 in the album version.

title: Emotional Technology
text: The album features vocal performances by JC Chasez, Rose McGowan, and Transeau himself, among others.

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: Earl McGraw and his son Edgar McGraw are two fictional characters played by Michael Parks and James Parks.

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: They appear in several feature films by Robert Rodriguez and Quentin Tarantino, including the "From Dusk till Dawn" franchise, "", and in various works from the "Grindhouse" project.

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: Despite being killed off in his first appearance in "From Dusk till Dawn", various characters named Earl and Edgar have returned in several other films from Rodriguez and Tarantino.

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: Talking with a heavy Texas accent and delivering profanity laden dialogue, the Earl character often serves as comic relief.

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: He and Edgar are consistently portrayed as Texas Rangers.

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: Edgar is portrayed by James Parks, the real-life son of Michael Parks.

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: Earl has a daughter who is introduced in the "Grindhouse" films, named Dakota, played by Marley Shelton, who plays a large role in "Planet Terror".

title: Earl and Edgar McGraw
text: Dakota also appears in the portrayed by Nicky Whelan.

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
text: Conan the Barbarian is a 2011 American sword and sorcery film based on the character of the same name created by Robert E. Howard.

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
text: The film is a new interpretation of the "Conan" mythology, and is not related to the films featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger.

title: Conan the Barbarian (2011 film)
text: It stars Jason Momoa in the title role, alongside Rachel Nichols, Rose McGowan, Stephen Lang, Ron Perlman, and Bob Sapp with Marcus Nispel directing.

title: Amy Blue
text: Amy Blue is a British alternative rock band composed of Simon Chatterton (guitar), JP Rutter (guitar), Lex Sampson (drums) and Tom Parr (bass).

title: Amy Blue
text: The group's name was inspired by Rose McGowan's character in the 1995 Gregg Araki movie "The Doom Generation".

title: Devil in the Flesh (1998 film)
text: Devil in the Flesh is a 1998 American thriller film starring Rose McGowan.

title: Devil in the Flesh (1998 film)
text: The film was also released under the title "Dearly Devoted".

title: Devil in the Flesh (1998 film)
text: It was co-scripted by Kelly Carlin-McCall but is not based on the twice-filmed Raymond Radiguet novel "Le Diable au corps" ("The Devil in the Flesh").

title: Paige Matthews
text: Paige Matthews is a fictional character from the American television series "Charmed", played by Rose McGowan from October 4, 2001 until May 21, 2006.

title: Paige Matthews
text: The character was created by executive producer Brad Kern as a replacement for lead character Prue Halliwell, following the departure of actress Shannen Doherty.

title: Paige Matthews
text: Paige is introduced in season four as the fiercely independent younger half-sister of the show's remaining female leads, sisters Piper (Holly Marie Combs) and Phoebe Halliwell (Alyssa Milano).

title: Paige Matthews
text: Like her sisters, Paige is a witch, and more specifically, one of the "Charmed Ones"—three of the most powerful witches of all time.

title: Paige Matthews
text: Paige is introduced as the secret love child of the Halliwell sisters' mother Patty (Finola Hughes) and her "whitelighter" (guardian angel) Sam Wilder (Scott Jaeck), making Paige both a witch and whitelighter.

title: Paige Matthews
text: She was given up at birth and raised by her adoptive parents.

title: The Doom Generation
text: The Doom Generation is a 1995 American dark comedy film written and directed by Gregg Araki.

title: The Doom Generation
text: It stars James Duval, Rose McGowan, and Johnathon Schaech.

title: The Doom Generation
text: The film follows two troubled teenage lovers Amy Blue (McGowan) and Jordan White (Duval) who pick up a young handsome drifter named Xavier Red (Schaech).

title: The Doom Generation
text: After he accidentally kills a store's clerk, the trio embarks on a journey full of sex, violence, and people from Amy's past.

title: The Doom Generation
text: Billed as "A Heterosexual Movie by Gregg Araki", "The Doom Generation" is the second film in the director's trilogy known as the "Teenage Apocalypse Trilogy", the first being "Totally Fucked Up" (1993) and the last one "Nowhere" (1997).

title: The Doom Generation
text: The characters of Amy Blue and Jordan White are based on the Mark Beyer comic strip "Amy and Jordan".

title: Dead Awake (2010 film)
text: Dead Awake is a 2010 mystery film starring Nick Stahl, Rose McGowan, and Amy Smart.

title: Dead Awake (2010 film)
text: The film was previously titled "Dylan's Wake".

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: Baloji Kunjar / Kunjir (17**–1816) (Marathi: बालाजी कुंजर / कुंजीर) was Maratha Sardar and Minister of Affairs in service of Peshwa Baji Rao II.

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: He was Peshwa Baji Rao II's favorite.

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: After the death of Peshwa Sawai Madhavrao, there was debates for the position of Peshwa among the maratha empire.

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: Balaji Kunjar performed a successful role to convey most friendly declaration and assurance between Baji Rao II and Nana Phadanvis, to appoint Baji Rao II as peshwa of Maratha Empire.

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: Peshwa Baji Rao II and Nana Phadanvis awarded inam (Jagir) to him in 14 villages near Purandhar fort, for his role.

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: He performed successful role in administration of maratha empire and as affairs minister or diplomat (vakil) for Peshwa Baji Rao II.

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: He along with his son Pandoji Kunjar and Narayan, enjoyed the position as Sur-Patil (सर-पाटील) at Pune Punch Mahals during the era of Peshawa Baji Rao II.

title: Balaji Kunjar
text: He along with his family has long enjoyed the privileges of sar-patil of 360 villages and towns in the Subha of Poona.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: New Palace, Kolhapur is a palace situated in Kolhapur, in the Indian state of Maharastra.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: It was constructed between 1877–1884.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: Being an excellent specimen of architecture built in black polished stone, it has been an attraction for tourists.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: It has extensive premises with a garden, fountain and wrestling ground.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: The whole building is eight-angled and has a tower in the middle.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: The clock on it was fixed in 1877.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: At separate distances there are small towers.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: On every glass are painted the events in Shivaji's life.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: There is a zoo and a ground lake.

title: New Palace, Kolhapur
text: Even today, it is the residence of Chhatrapati Shahu, the direct descendent of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, the founder of Maratha Empire.

title: Maratha Navy
text: The Maratha Navy refers to the naval wing of the armed forces of Maratha Empire, which existed from around mid-17th century to mid-18th century in India.

title: Maratha Navy
text: The founder of Maratha Empire Chhatrapati Shivaji is considered as the "Father of Indian Navy".

title: Bhonsle
text: The Bhonsle (or Bhonsale, Bhosale, Bhosle) are a prominent group within the Maratha clan system.

title: Bhonsle
text: Traditionally a warrior clan, some members served as rulers of several states in India, the most prominent being Shivaji, the founder of the Maratha Empire.

title: Bhonsle
text: His successors ruled as chhatrapatis (emperors/maharajas) from their capital at Satara, although "de facto" rule of the empire passed to the Peshwas, the Maratha hereditary chief ministers, during the reign of Shahu I.

title: Bhonsle
text: In addition to the Bhonsle Chhatrapatis of Satara, rulers of the Bhonsle clan established themselves as junior branch of Chhatrapatis at Kolhapur, and as Maharajas of Nagpur in modern-day Maharashtra in the 18th century.

title: Rajaram II of Satara
text: Rajaram II Bhonsle, also known as Ramaraja, was the 6th monarch of Maratha Empire.

title: Rajaram II of Satara
text: He was an adopted son of Chhattrapati Shahu.

title: Rajaram II of Satara
text: Tarabai had presented him to Shahu as her own grandson and used him to grab power after Shahu's death.

title: Rajaram II of Satara
text: However, after being sidelined, she stated that Rajaram II was only an imposter.

title: Rajaram II of Satara
text: Nevertheless, Peshwa Balaji Baji Rao retained him as the titular Chhatrapati.

title: Rajaram II of Satara
text: In reality, Peshwa and other chiefs had all the executive power, while Rajaram II was only a figurehead.

title: Balaji Vishwanath
text: Balaji Vishwanath (Bhatt) was born into a Konkanastha Brahmin (aka Chitpavan) family.

title: Balaji Vishwanath
text: The family hailed from the coastal Konkan region of present-day Maharashtra and were the hereditary Deshmukh for Shrivardhan under the Siddi of Janjira.

title: Balaji Vishwanath
text: He went out in search of employment to the upper regions of western ghats and worked as a mercenary trooper under various Maratha generals.

title: Balaji Vishwanath
text: According to Kincaid & Parasnis, Balaji Vishwanath entered the Maratha administration during the reign of Chhatrapati Sambhaji or the regency of his brother, Rajaram.

title: Balaji Vishwanath
text: Later he served as an accountant for the Maratha general, Dhanaji Jadhav, at Janjira.

title: Balaji Vishwanath
text: Between 1699 and 1702, he served as the "Sar-subhedar" or head-administrator at Pune and from 1704 to 1707 as Sarsubedar of Daulatabad.

title: Balaji Vishwanath
text: By the time Dhanaji died, Balaji had proven himself as an honest and able officer.Balaji fell out with Dhanaji's son and successor , Chandrarao Jadhav and went over to the newly released Maratha ruler Chhatrapati Shahu who took note of his abilities and appointed Balaji as his assistant ("c."1708).

title: Shahu I
text: Shahu Bhonsle (1682–1749 CE) was the fifth Chhatrapati of the Maratha Empire created by his grandfather, Shivaji.

title: Shahu I
text: Shahu, he was taken prisoner with his mother in 1689 by Mughal General,Nusrat Jang.

title: Shahu I
text: He came out of captivity by the Mughals and defeated his aunt Tarabai in an internecine conflict to gain the throne in 1708.

title: Shahu I
text: After the death of Aurangzeb, leading Mughal courtiers released Shahu with a force of fifty men, thinking that a friendly Maratha leader would be a useful ally.

title: Baji Rao I
text: Baji Rao (18 August 1700 – 28 April 1740) was a general of the Maratha Empire in India.

title: Baji Rao I
text: He served as "Peshwa" (Prime Minister) to the fifth Maratha Chhatrapati (Emperor) Shahu from 1720 until his death.

title: Baji Rao I
text: He is also known by the name Bajirao Ballal.

title: Maynak Bhandari
text: Maynak Bhandari was one of the first chiefs or Admiral of the Maratha Navy under Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, and helped in both building the Maratha Navy and safeguarding the coastline of the emerging Maratha Empire.

title: Maynak Bhandari
text: Under his leadership, Maratha navy won the battle at Khanderi fort near Alibaug.

title: Maynak Bhandari
text: He was belong to the Bhandari caste.

title: Maynak Bhandari
text: Along with Daria Sarang, another admiral who served Maharaj, Bhandari commanded a naval fleet of 200 ships.

title: Maynak Bhandari
text: Their official titles of Mai Nayak Bhandari and Daria Sarang translate to Water Leader and Sea Captain, respectively.

title: Maynak Bhandari
text: The Maratha Navy was the forerunner of India's present-day Coast Guard.

title: Maynak Bhandari
text: A memorial has been built to Ram Nayak Bhandari at Bhatye Village, close to Ratnagiri town.

title: Maratha emperors
text: The Maratha emperors, from the early 17th century to the early 18th century, built and ruled the Maratha Empire on the Indian subcontinent, mainly corresponding to the modern countries of Bangladesh, India and Pakistan. )

title: Maratha emperors
text: Their power rapidly dwindled during the 18th century and the last of the emperors was deposed in 1818, with the establishment of the British Raj.

title: Maratha emperors
text: At their empire's greatest extent in the late 17th and early 18th centuries, they controlled much of the Indian subcontinent, extending from Bengal in the east to Atak and Sindh in the west, Kashmir in the north to the Kaveri basin in the south.

title: Maratha emperors
text: Peshwas served as subordinates to the Chhatrapati (the Maratha king), but later, they became the leaders of the Marathas, and the Chatrapati was reduced to a nominal ruler.

title: Maratha emperors
text: During the last years of the Maratha Empire, Peshwe were instrumental in expanding the Maratha empire to this extent.

title: Jessica Mulroney
text: Jessica Mulroney is a Canadian fashion stylist.

title: Jessica Mulroney
text: Formerly Jessica Brownstein, on October 30, 2008 she married Ben Mulroney, the oldest son, and second oldest child, of Mila and Brian Mulroney, a former Prime Minister of Canada.

title: Jessica Mulroney
text: Jessica Mulroney is Jewish.

title: Jessica Mulroney
text: The couple have three children.

title: Donald Trump Jr.
text: Donald John Trump Jr. (born December 31, 1977) is an American businessman and former reality TV personality.

title: Donald Trump Jr.
text: He is the oldest child of the 45th President of the United States, Donald Trump, and his first wife, Ivana.

title: Domitia Lepida the Elder
text: Domitia ("PIR2" D 171), more commonly referred to as Domitia the Elder -- in fact no ancient source ever calls her Lepida - (ca. 8 BC-June 59) was the oldest child of Antonia Major and Lucius Domitius Ahenobarbus (consul 16 BC), and the oldest granddaughter to Triumvir Mark Antony by Octavia Minor, a great-niece of the Roman Emperor Augustus, second cousin and sister-in-law to the Emperor Caligula, first cousin to the Emperor Claudius, maternal aunt to the Empress Valeria Messalina, and paternal aunt to Emperor Nero.

title: Domitia Lepida the Elder
text: She had two younger siblings: Domitia Lepida and Cn.

title: Domitia Lepida the Elder
text: Domitius Ahenobarbus (cos.

title: Domitia Lepida the Elder
text: The date of her birth is not recorded and can be only estimated as no later than 7 BC, but possibly as much as 10 years earlier, if one would allow a long delay between her birth and those of her two siblings.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: Clayton Anthony Fountain (September 12, 1955 – July 12, 2004) was a federal prisoner, member of the Aryan Brotherhood, and convicted murderer.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: Clayton was born on September 12, 1955, at the U.S. Army Hospital in Fort Benning, Georgia.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: Clayton was the oldest of six children, having one brother and four sisters, and was named after his father, Clayton Raleigh Fountain.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: The family moved every 11⁄2 to 2 years.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: While his father served combat tours in Korea and Vietnam and his mother was working, Clayton, as the oldest child in family, became a surrogate for both parents when he was very young.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: He recalled maternal responsibilities for cooking, ironing, serving, cleaning, and caring for his young siblings.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: It was the male/paternal role, however, for which his father had carefully trained him.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: While serving in the Marines, he was convicted of murdering his staff sergeant in 1974, while stationed in the Philippines.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: He was sentenced to life imprisonment, and was ultimately sent to the United States Penitentiary, Marion, which was at the time the highest-security prison in the nation.

title: Clayton Fountain
text: Fountain used his military training to murder three prisoners and one correctional officer with a homemade knife while serving time at Marion, and was labeled the "Most Dangerous Prisoner" in the federal system.

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: Zeresenay (Zeray) Alemseged (born 4 June 1969) is an Ethiopian paleoanthropologist and was Chair of the Anthropology Department at the California Academy of Sciences in San Francisco, United States.

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: He recently joined the faculty of the University of Chicago.

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: He is best known for his discovery, on December 10, 2000, of Selam, also referred to as “Lucy’s child”, the almost-complete fossilized remains of a 3.3 million year old child of the species "Australopithecus afarensis".

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: The “world’s oldest child”, she is the most complete skeleton of a human ancestor discovered to date.

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: Selam represents a milestone in our understanding of human and pre-human evolution and contributes significantly to our understanding of the biology and childhood of early species in the human lineage; a subject about which we have very little information.

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: Alemseged discovered Selam while working with the Dikika Research Project (DRP), a multi-national research project, which he both initiated in 1999 and leads.

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: The DRP has thus far made many important paleoanthropological discoveries and returns to the field each year to conduct further important research.

title: Zeresenay Alemseged
text: Alemseged’s specific research centers on the discovery and interpretation of hominin fossil remains and their environments, with emphasis on fieldwork designed to acquire new data on early hominin skeletal biology, environmental context, and behavior.

title: Child Welfare League of America
text: The Child Welfare League of America (CWLA) is the oldest child welfare organization in the United States.

title: Child Welfare League of America
text: The organization's primary objective is to "Make Children a National Priority.

title: Child Welfare League of America
text: The CWLA is the trusted authority for professionals who work with children and the only national organization with members from both public and private agencies, providing unique access and influence to all sectors of the children’s services field.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery, also known as Mary Elizabeth Day Care Center, is a historic building located in Sioux City, Iowa, United States.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: This is the oldest child day care facility in the state of Iowa, and the state's second-oldest preschool.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: The Sioux City Day Nursery was established in 1914 by the Wall Street Mission, a local settlement house operated by the Methodist Episcopal Church.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: They moved here in 1926, which is the first building designed as a day nursery in Iowa.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: The two-story brick Renaissance Revival building was designed by local architect Jurgen A. Raven, and built by The Lytle Company, a Sioux City construction firm.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: Parents were responsible for paying for at least part of their children's care, but it was also subsidized by religious institutions, private associations, and individuals.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: During the Great Depression, both the federal and state governments began to fund and license child care.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: The Works Progress Administration was involved in the 1930s.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: A garage and playhouse designed by Sioux City architect Knute E. Westerlind was built in 1940, and it is part of the historic designation.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: The facility was renamed the Mary Elizabeth Day Care Center in 1990.

title: Mary Elizabeth Day Nursery
text: The building was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1997.

title: Clear Creek Meeting House
text: The Clear Creek Meeting House is a Friends meeting house located at 14365 N. 350th Ave., southeast of McNabb, in Magnolia Township, Putnam County, Illinois.

title: Clear Creek Meeting House
text: The meeting house was built in 1875 to house the Illinois Yearly Meeting of the Religious Society of Friends, also known as the Quakers.

title: Clear Creek Meeting House
text: The Yearly Meeting was the westernmost annual meeting of the Hicksite Friends and attracted followers from several states.

title: Clear Creek Meeting House
text: The meeting house also hosted the Clear Creek Monthly Meeting, which was attended by local Quakers.

title: Clear Creek Meeting House
text: The building is typical of American Friends meeting houses; it features two square rooms with plain features both outside and inside.

title: Clear Creek Meeting House
text: The lack of ornamentation was designed to reflect the Quaker tenet of simplicity.

title: Clear Creek Meeting House
text: The meeting house is one of the few surviving western Quaker meeting houses which represent this tradition of Quaker architecture.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: The Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization and one of the oldest continuously meeting astronomy clubs in the nation.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: Originally named the Shreveport Junior Astronomical Society, it was founded in 1959 by a group of high school students led by a fellow student, Sara Worley.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: Fifteen people attended an organizational meeting to establish a club on October 10, 1959.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: Officers were elected at this meeting and Sara Worley became the first president of the Shreveport Junior Astronomical Society.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: A second organizational meeting took place on October 17, 1959, where a constitution and additional society-related details were established.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: The constitution was approved, signed, and ratified at a third meeting on October 24, 1959, although there was no State of Louisiana charter.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: The first public meeting of the club was held on November 14, 1959 at Centenary College of Louisiana.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: Two goals were announced: build an observatory and procure a planetarium for the Shreveport area.

title: Shreveport-Bossier Astronomical Society
text: Within five years, these two goals were accomplished through local participation and fundraising.

title: John Ingram McMorran
text: John Ingram McMorran (June 19, 1889 – February 24, 2003) was an American supercentenarian and was one of the recognized oldest people in the world, living to the age of 113 years, 250 days.

title: John Ingram McMorran
text: He was born in Goodland Township, Michigan, the oldest child of George McMorran (born October 15, 1859) and Lydia Ingram.

title: John Ingram McMorran
text: Ingram McMorran was the cousin of Representative Henry Gordon McMorran (1844–1929).

title: John Ingram McMorran
text: His sister, Lillia Elizabeth Webb née McMorran, lived to the age of 103.

title: John Ingram McMorran
text: In his youth, a fortuneteller predicted McMorran would live to age 111, but this seemingly outlandish forecast proved conservative, as barely one in six people who reach 111 live as long as McMorran finally did.

title: John Ingram McMorran
text: At the time of his death in 2003, his grandson, Bob McMorran, was a grandfather himself, to the then five-year-old Logan Saxton.

title: John Ingram McMorran
text: McMorran smoked, drank, and ate greasy food.

title: 4th Virginia Regiment
text: The 4th Virginia Regiment was raised on December 28, 1775, at Suffolk Court House, Virginia, for service with the Continental Army.

title: 4th Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment saw action at the Battle of Trenton, Battle of Princeton, Battle of Brandywine, Battle of Germantown, Battle of Monmouth and the Siege of Charleston.

title: 4th Virginia Regiment
text: Most of the regiment was captured at Charlestown, South Carolina, on May 12, 1780, by the British and the regiment was formally disbanded on January 1, 1783.

title: 1st Virginia Regiment
text: The 1st Virginia Regiment was raised, on July 17, 1775, at Williamsburg, Virginia as a state militia unit and later for service with the (U.S.) Continental Army.

title: 1st Virginia Regiment
text: Its origins go back to the Charles City-Henrico County Regiment of Militia founded in 1652.

title: 1st Virginia Regiment
text: During the French and Indian War, the Virginia Regiment was commanded by Colonel George Washington.

title: 1st Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment saw action at the Battle of Great Bridge, New York Campaign, Battle of Trenton, Battle of Princeton, Battle of Brandywine, Battle of Germantown, Battle of Monmouth, Battle of Stony Point and the Siege of Charleston.

title: 1st Virginia Regiment
text: Most of the regiment was captured at Charlestown, South Carolina, on May 12, 1780, by the British and the regiment was formally disbanded on November 15, 1783.

title: 1st Virginia Regiment
text: The 276th Engineer Battalion is the successor to the 1st Virginia Regiment.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: The 3rd Virginia Regiment was raised on December 28, 1775, at Alexandria, Virginia, for service with the Continental Army.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: The 3d Virginia's initial commander was Colonel Hugh Mercer, who was quickly promoted to brigadier general.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: Its second commander, George Weedon, was also promoted to brigadier general within a few months.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: Weedon was succeeded in command by Colonel Thomas Marshall, the father of Supreme Court Chief Justice John Marshall.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: During its time at Valley Forge its commander was Colonel William Heth.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment saw action in the New York Campaign the battles of Trenton, Princeton, Brandywine, Germantown, Monmouth and the Siege of Charleston.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: Most of the regiment was captured at Charlestown, South Carolina, on May 12, 1780, by the British and the regiment was formally disbanded on November 15, 1783.

title: 3rd Virginia Regiment
text: James Monroe, Thomas Helm, John Francis Mercer and James Markham Marshall served as lieutenants in this regiment.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: The 9th Virginia Regiment was authorized in the Virginia State Troops on January 11, 1776.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: It was subsequently organized between February 5 and March 16, 1776, and comprised seven companies of troops from easternmost Virginia.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: The unit was adopted into the Continental Army on May 31, 1776.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment participated in the Battle of Brandywine and the Battle of Germantown.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: At Germantown, under the command of Colonel George Mathews, the unit became separated from the remainder of General Nathanael Greene's division and over 400 men were taken prisoner by the British.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment penetrated so deeply into the British lines that it was isolated.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: Four retreating companies of the 1st British Light Infantry Battalion found themselves in the rear of the Virginians and attacked.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: Surprised, the 9th was driven farther into the British camp where it was beset by the brigade of Charles Grey, 1st Earl Grey and the 2nd British Light Infantry Battalion.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: After being attacked on all sides and Mathews wounded, the regiment surrendered near Kelly's Hill together with part of the 6th Virginia Regiment.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: The unit was consolidated with the 1st Virginia Regiment on May 12, 1779, and the consolidated unit was designated as the 1st Virginia Regiment.

title: 9th Virginia Regiment
text: The unit was captured on May 12, 1780, by the British Army at the Siege of Charleston and was disbanded on November 15, 1783.

title: 7th Virginia Regiment
text: The 7th Virginia Regiment was raised on January 11, 1776, at Gloucester, Virginia, for service with the Continental Army.

title: 7th Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment would see action at the Battle of Brandywine, Battle of Germantown (after which it wintered at Valley Forge), Battle of Monmouth and the Siege of Charleston.

title: 7th Virginia Regiment
text: Most of the regiment was captured at Charlestown, South Carolina, on May 12, 1780, by the British and the regiment was formally disbanded on January 1, 1783.

title: 7th Virginia Regiment
text: A 3rd Virginia Detachment made up of the 7th Virginia Regiment was at the so-called Waxhaw Massacre in 1780.

title: 12th Virginia Regiment
text: The 12th Virginia Regiment was raised on September 16, 1776, at Williamsburg, Virginia, for service with the (U.S.) Continental Army.

title: 12th Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment saw action in the Battle of Brandywine, Battle of Germantown, Battle of Monmouth and the Siege of Charleston.

title: 12th Virginia Regiment
text: Most of the regiment was captured at Charlestown, South Carolina, on May 12, 1780, by the British and the regiment was formally disbanded on January 1, 1783.

title: 2/9th Cavalry Commando Regiment (Australia)
text: The 2/9th Cavalry (Commando) Regiment was one of three commando regiments raised by the Australian Army for service during World War II.

title: 2/9th Cavalry Commando Regiment (Australia)
text: It was originally raised in 1940 as an armoured cavalry unit as part of the 8th Division, before being transferred to the 9th Division.

title: 2/9th Cavalry Commando Regiment (Australia)
text: Between 1941 and 1942 the regiment saw action in the Middle East before being withdrawn to Australia in early 1943.

title: 2/9th Cavalry Commando Regiment (Australia)
text: At this time the regiment was re-organised as the administrative headquarters for the 2/4th, 2/11th and 2/12th Commando Squadrons and it was converted into a commando regiment.

title: 2/9th Cavalry Commando Regiment (Australia)
text: Later in 1945 the unit saw action during the landings on Tarakan on Borneo before being disbanded upon the cessation of hostilities.

title: 6th Connecticut Regiment
text: The 6th Connecticut Regiment was raised on May 1, 1775, at New Haven, Connecticut, as a provincial regiment for the Continental Army.

title: 6th Connecticut Regiment
text: It then became a regiment of the Continental Line on January 1, 1776, designated the 10th Continental Regiment, and a regiment of the Connecticut Line on January 1, 1777, again designated the 6th Connecticut.

title: 6th Connecticut Regiment
text: The regiment saw action at the siege of Boston, the Battle of Long Island, the New York Campaign, and its colonel and company of light infantry served in the Corps of Light Infantry at the Battle of Stony Point.

title: 6th Connecticut Regiment
text: The regiment was merged into the 1st Connecticut Regiment on January 1, 1783, at West Point, New York and disbanded on November 16, 1783.

title: 5th Virginia Regiment
text: The 5th Virginia Regiment was raised on December 28, 1775, at Richmond, Virginia, for service with the U.S. Continental Army.

title: 5th Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment saw action at the Battle of Trenton, Battle of Princeton, Battle of Brandywine, Battle of Germantown, Battle of Monmouth and the Siege of Charleston.

title: 5th Virginia Regiment
text: The regiment was joined to the 3rd Virginia Regiment on May 12, 1779.

title: 5th Virginia Regiment
text: General William Russell and Col. Josiah Parker were two of its commanders.

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: The 1st Virginia State Regiment was a regiment of Virginia Militia that fought during the American Revolutionary War.

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: The regiment was authorized by the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Virginia in December 1776 as a force of regular troops for the Commonwealth's defense.

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: In 1777, Virginia had difficulty meeting its quota for the regular line of the Continental Army.

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: As a result, in July 1777 under the command of Colonel George Gibson, the regiment began a march North to temporarily join the Continental Army in the Philadelphia Campaign.

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: In January 1778, the Virginia General Assembly passed an act directing that the 1st Virginia State Regiment "now in Continental service, be continued in said service instead of the Ninth Virginia Regiment, made prisoners by the enemy in the Battle of Germantown."

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: The regiment camped at Valley Forge in the winter of 1777-78 and at Middlebrook in the winter of 1778-79 and participated in the Battle of Monmouth.

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: The regiment remained in the service of the Continental Army until late 1779 when redeployed Virginia.

title: 1st Virginia State Regiment
text: Unlike the standard division of eight found in the regular line regiments of the Continental Army, the 1st Virginia State Regiment consisted of ten companies including one of light infantry.

title: Amar después de amar
text: Amar, después de amar (English: "To love after love") is a 2017 Argentine telenovela produced by Telefe Contenidos and broadcast by Telefe premiered on 23 January 2017.

title: Amar después de amar
text: Starring Mariano Martínez, Isabel Macedo, Eleonora Wexler, Federico Amador, Michel Noher, Manuela Pal, Delfina Chaves, Franco Masini, Camila Mateos, Manuel Ramos and Virginia Lago in the lead roles.

title: Graduados
text: Graduados (English: The Graduates ) is a 2012 Argentine telenovela which was broadcast by Telefe from March 12 to December 19.

title: Graduados
text: The plot concerns a group of people who graduated from high school in 1989 and reunite twenty years later.

title: Graduados
text: The main character, Andrés Goddzer (Daniel Hendler), discovers that María Laura Falsini (Nancy Dupláa) was pregnant in 1989 and married Pablo Catáneo (Luciano Cáceres), who thought that he was the child's father.

title: Graduados
text: The resulting parental dispute, the love triangle of the main characters and 1980s nostalgia are frequent plot elements, and story arcs related to school bullying and LGBT rights are also featured.

title: Graduados
text: The frequent flashbacks of the characters to their high-school days use the same actors, playing teenagers.

title: Botineras
text: Botineras ("WAGs: Love for the Game") is an Argentine telenovela produced by Endemol and Underground.

title: Botineras
text: Airing on Telefe, it premiered on November 24, 2009, and was broadcast until August 25, 2010.

title: Botineras
text: The show revolves around the theme of football players and their romances, whilst also dealing with the different police investigations they stumble across during the show.

title: Botineras
text: When it first aired, the telenovela was originally a comedy, before later becoming a police drama.

title: Botineras
text: The original stars were Florencia Peña and Nicolás Cabré, who played Giselle López and Cristian "Chiqui" Flores.

title: Botineras
text: Peña resigned after the genre shift, as the shift caused her character to lose importance, which, compiled with Peña's general dissatisfaction with the show, saw Romina Gaetani's and Isabel Macedo's characters (Laura Posse/Mía Alberdi and Margarita "Marga" Molinari respectively) gain superior notability in contrast to her own.

title: Verano del '98
text: Verano del '98 ("Endless Summer") is an Argentine telenovela, produced by Cris Morena.

title: Verano del '98
text: It was broadcast on Telefe television in the period January 12, 1998 – November 17, 2000.

title: Verano del '98
text: The telenovela had three seasons, and changed its cast many times.

title: Verano del '98
text: Cris Morena also composed songs for "Verano del '98" soundtrack.

title: Niní
text: Niní was an Argentine children's telenovela broadcast on Telefe from 2009 onwards, starring Florencia Bertotti and Federico Amador, written by Gabriela Fiore and Jorge Chernov.

title: Niní
text: It was produced by Bertotti and her former husband, TV host Guido Kaczka, in conjunction with Endemol.

title: Niní
text: It also starred Maida Andrenacci and Paula Morales as the main antagonist.

title: Niní
text: At its debut the show achieved 19.1 rating points, according to the Argentinian TV popularity measuring system (IBOPE), 13 points ahead of the competition at the time.

title: Niní
text: "Niní" received consistently high ratings throughout its run, making it one of Telefe's most popular shows in the afternoon time slot.

title: Niní
text: However, after the first two weeks, the show started to lose some of its momentum and it ended up with a 10-point average

title: List of songs recorded by Lali Espósito
text: Lali Espósito is an Argentine singer and actress.

title: List of songs recorded by Lali Espósito
text: Her music career started in 2003 when she contributed vocals to the soundtrack album for the Argentine telenovela, Rincón de Luz.

title: List of songs recorded by Lali Espósito
text: From 2007 to 2012, the singer was part of the pop-group Teen Angels, derived from the television series "Casi Ángeles" in which she also starred from the same from 2007 to 2010.

title: List of songs recorded by Lali Espósito
text: In 2013 Espósito also began to work as an independent artist outside of Teen Angels.

title: List of songs recorded by Lali Espósito
text: Later that year, the singer released four songs for the Argentine telenovela Solamente Vos in which she starred.

title: List of songs recorded by Lali Espósito
text: Her debut single "A Bailar" was released the same year.

title: Guapas
text: Guapas (Spanish: "Brave ones" ) is a 2014 Argentine telenovela.

title: Guapas
text: It is produced by Pol-ka, and aired by El Trece.

title: Guapas
text: It is starred by Araceli Gonzalez, Isabel Macedo, Mercedes Morán, Carla Peterson and Florencia Bertotti.

title: Patricia Longo
text: Patricia Longo, also known as Jimena Benìtez, is a fictional character in the 2012 Argentine telenovela "Graduados".

title: Patricia Longo
text: She is played by Isabel Macedo, both as an adult and, in flashbacks, as a teenager.

title: Montecristo (Argentine telenovela)
text: Montecristo: Un Amor, Una Venganza (Monte Cristo: Love and Revenge) is an Argentine telenovela which premiered April 25, 2006 on Telefe.

title: Montecristo (Argentine telenovela)
text: Loosely based on the 1844 Alexandre Dumas novel, "The Count of Monte Cristo", "Montecristo" is Telefe's most popular novela and was called "the hottest telenovela in Argentina" by "Variety" in 2007.

title: Alma Pirata
text: Alma Pirata is an Argentine 2006 telenovela, created and produced by Cris Morena.

title: Alma Pirata
text: In this telenovela, lead roles were portrayed by Benjamín Rojas, Fabián Mazzei, Luisana Lopilato, Mariano Martinez, Nicolás Vázquez, Isabel Macedo, Elsa Pinilla and Julia Calvo.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: Sarah Ferguson wore a dress made from ivory duchesse satin and featuring heavy beadingfor her wedding to Prince Andrew, Duke of York on 23 July 1986 at Westminster Abbey.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: Designed by Lindka Cierach, the beadwork incorporated various symbols including hearts representing romance, anchors and waves representing Prince Andrew's sailing background and bumblebees and thistles, which were taken from Sarah Ferguson's family crest.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: Copies of the dress, including the motifs specific to the royal family, went on sale in stores just hours after the end of the wedding.Influenced by the wedding dress of Lady Diana Spencer, a notable feature of Sarah Ferguson's 17 foot long train was the intertwined initials A and S sewn in silver beads.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: The head-dress and bouquet, fabric rosettes or artificial silk flowers were used to adorn the gown itself.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: Ferguson was pleased with the dress, describing it in her 1997 memoir, "My Story", as "an exquisite creation I'd lost twenty-six pounds to fit into.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: Lindka was a genius; I knew she could make the most flattering gown ever, and she had.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: It was amazingly boned, like a corset.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: "Hair stylist Denise McAdam and make-up artist Teresa Fairminer attended to the bride, while florist Jane Packer designed the bouquet.

title: Wedding dress of Sarah Ferguson
text: The ivory silk wedding dress became the season's most sought-after style.

title: Prince Andrew, Duke of York
text: Prince Andrew, Duke of York, {'1': ", '2': ", '3': ", '4': "} (Andrew Albert Christian Edward, born 19 February 1960), is the second son and third child of Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh.

title: Prince Andrew, Duke of York
text: At the time of his birth, he was second in the line of succession to the British throne; as of 2017 he is sixth in line.

title: Royal Marriages Act 1772
text: The Royal Marriages Act 1772 was an act of the Parliament of Great Britain, which prescribed the conditions under which members of the British Royal Family could contract a valid marriage, in order to guard against marriages that could diminish the status of the royal house.

title: Royal Marriages Act 1772
text: The right of veto vested in the sovereign by this act provoked severe adverse criticism at the time of its passage.

title: Royal Marriages Act 1772
text: It was repealed on 26 March 2015 as a result of the 2011 Perth Agreement.

title: Royal Marriages Act 1772
text: Its provisions were replaced by more limited restrictions that apply only to the first six people in the line of succession (currently Prince Charles, Prince William, Prince George, Princess Charlotte, Prince Harry, and Prince Andrew).

title: List of royal tours of Canada (21st century)
text: Canadian royal tours in the 21st century carry on the tradition of the previous 300 years, either as an official tour, a working tour, a vacation, or a period of military service by a member of the Royal Family.

title: List of royal tours of Canada (21st century)
text: Originally, official tours were events predominantly for Canadians to see and possibly meet members of their royal family, with the associated patriotic pomp and spectacle.

title: List of royal tours of Canada (21st century)
text: However, nearing the end of the 20th century, such occasions took on the added dimension of a theme; for instance, the 2005 tour of Saskatchewan and Alberta by Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, was deemed to be a vehicle for Her Majesty and all other Canadians to honour "The Spirit of Nation Builders".

title: List of royal tours of Canada (21st century)
text: Also, junior members of the Royal Family began to undertake unofficial "working" tours of Canada as well; in this method, royal figures are invited by provinces, municipalities, and other organizations to events which the latter fund without assistance from the federal government.

title: List of royal tours of Canada (21st century)
text: Charles, Prince of Wales; Anne, Princess Royal; Prince Andrew, Duke of York; and Prince Edward, Earl of Wessex, and Sophie, Countess of Wessex, have all made several small tours in this fashion.

title: Joe Gilmore
text: Joe Gilmore (19 May 1922 – 18 December 2015) was one of the longest running Head Barmen at The Savoy Hotel's American Bar.

title: Joe Gilmore
text: He was born in Belfast and moved to London in 1938.

title: Joe Gilmore
text: Gilmore started as a trainee barman at The American Bar in 1940 and was appointed Head Barman in 1955, a position he held until he retired in 1976.

title: Joe Gilmore
text: Over his years as Head Barman, Gilmore invented numerous cocktails to mark special events and important guests, a longstanding tradition at the American Bar.

title: Joe Gilmore
text: Gilmore has invented cocktails in honor of a number of royalty, politicians and celebrities including The Prince of Wales, Prince William, The Princess Anne, Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother, The Prince Andrew, Sir Winston Churchill, and American Presidents Harry S. Truman and Richard Nixon.

title: Joe Gilmore
text: He also invented cocktails to commemorate the first walk on the moon in 1969 by Neil Armstrong, and the American and Russian link-up in space in 1975.

title: Princess Henriette of Nassau-Weilburg
text: Princess Henriëtte van Nassau-Weilburg, then van Nassau (22 April 1780, in Kirchheimbolanden – 2 January 1857, in Kirchheim unter Teck) was a daughter of Prince Charles Christian, Duke of Nassau-Weilburg and Carolina of Orange-Nassau, daughter of William IV, Prince of Orange.

title: Princess Henriette of Nassau-Weilburg
text: Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom is her descendant through Francis, Duke of Teck, Henriette's grandson.

title: Princess Henriette of Nassau-Weilburg
text: Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh is her descendant through her granddaughter Princess Alexandra of Saxe-Altenburg, who is the grandmother of Prince Andrew of Greece and Denmark.

title: Princess Henriette of Nassau-Weilburg
text: Juan Carlos I of Spain is a descendant of her granddaughter Archduchess Elisabeth Franziska of Austria, the grandmother of Alfonso XIII of Spain.

title: Krajmir
text: Krajmir (; d. 15 June 1389) was a Serbian nobleman who served Prince Lazar (r. 1373–89), with the title of "vojvoda" (general).

title: Krajmir
text: He was mentioned in Konstantin Mihailović's memoirs (1490–1501) regarding the Battle of Kosovo (1389), where he was captured and killed together with Lazar by the Ottomans, in front of Bayezid.

title: Krajmir
text: He was described as being from Toplica.

title: Krajmir
text: His person has been connected with Krajko, the son of magnate Jovan Oliver (1310–1356).

title: Krajmir
text: It is likely that he is the same as Milan Toplica from folk tradition.

title: Princess Sophie of Greece and Denmark
text: Princess Sophie of Greece and Denmark (Greek: Πριγκίπισσα Σοφία της Ελλάδας και Δανίας ) (26 June 1914 – 3 November 2001) was the fourth child and youngest daughter of Prince Andrew of Greece and Denmark and Princess Alice of Battenberg.

title: Princess Sophie of Greece and Denmark
text: The Duke of Edinburgh is her younger brother.

title: Princess Sophie of Greece and Denmark
text: Sophie was born at Villa Mon Repos on the island of Corfu in Greece.

title: Armie Hammer
text: Armand Douglas "Armie" Hammer (born August 28, 1986) is an American actor.

title: Armie Hammer
text: He is known for his portrayal of the Winklevoss twins in the film "The Social Network" (2010), Prince Andrew Alcott in "Mirror Mirror" (2012), the title character in the adventure film "The Lone Ranger" (2013), Mike in "Mine" (2016), and the voice role of Jackson Storm in 2017's Disney-Pixar Film "Cars 3".

title: Armie Hammer
text: He played the role of Illya Kuryakin in "The Man from U.N.C.L.E." (2015), and stars as Oliver in the 2017 romance drama "Call Me by Your Name".

title: Armie Hammer
text: For his portrayal of Clyde Tolson in "J. Edgar" (2011), he was nominated for a Screen Actors Guild Award.

title: John Hartmann
text: John Hartmann (born Auleben October 24, 1830, died Liverpool, England 1897) was a Prussian brass composer.

title: John Hartmann
text: He is notable for having served Prince George, Duke of Cambridge as bandmaster in the British 4th Regiment, 12th Lancers.

title: Carlos Rendón Zipagauta
text: Carlos Rendón Zipagauta (Cali, 29 September 1955) is a Colombian-Belgian documentary filmmaker.

title: Carlos Rendón Zipagauta
text: Rendón Zipagauta studied film and screenwriting in Belgium, where he lived for 16 years.

title: Carlos Rendón Zipagauta
text: He began as assistant then co-director to Jean Christophe Lamy.

title: Carlos Rendón Zipagauta
text: He returned to Colombia to shoot documentaries.

title: Carlos Rendón Zipagauta
text: His 1993 film "Nukak Makú", about the indigenous Nukak peoples, won festival prizes in France and Belgium enabling also EU grants to make further documentaries.

title: Marcel Trillat
text: Marcel Trillat (born 4 April 1940) is a French journalist and documentary filmmaker.

title: Marcel Trillat
text: A communist, he directed many documentaries about the living conditions of workers, women and immigrants in France.

title: Marcel Trillat
text: He also did documentaries about French government's response to the Algerian War and the Gulf War and, more recently, religious cults and public hospitals.

title: Marcel Trillat
text: He co-directed three documentaries with Maurice Failevic, one of which is about the history of communism in France.

title: Marcel Trillat
text: He was a director of France Télévisions, France's public television broadcaster, for five years.

title: Year of the Elephant
text: The ʿĀmu l-Fīl (Arabic: عام الفيل‎ ‎ , Year of the Elephant) is the name in Islamic history for the year approximately equating to 570 CE.

title: Year of the Elephant
text: According to Islamic tradition, it was in this year that Muhammad (Arabic: مُـحَـمَّـد‎ ‎ , consonant letters: m-ħ-m-d) was born.

title: Year of the Elephant
text: The name is derived from an event said to have occurred at Mecca: Abraha, the Abyssinian, Christian ruler of Yemen, which was subject to the Kingdom of Aksum of Ethiopia, marched upon the Ka‘bah in Mecca with a large army, which included one or more war elephants, intending to demolish it.

title: Year of the Elephant
text: However, the lead elephant, known as 'Mahmud' (Arabic: مَـحْـمُـوْد‎ ‎ , consonant letters: m-ħ-m-w-d), is said to have stopped at the boundary around Mecca, and refused to enter.

title: Year of the Elephant
text: It has been theorized that an epidemic such as by smallpox could have caused such a failed invasion of Mecca.

title: Year of the Elephant
text: The year came to be known as the Year of the Elephant, beginning a trend for reckoning the years in the Arabian Peninsula used, until it was replaced with the Islamic calendar during the rule of ‘Umar.

title: Surus
text: Surus ("the Syrian") was believed to be the last war elephant of Carthaginian general Hannibal Barca's army in Italy.

title: Surus
text: Several Roman writers give accounts of Surus, which was probably a large Asian elephant with one tusk.

title: Surus
text: Although a Carthaginian coin struck in the time of Hannibal depicts an African elephant, historians believe Surus was an Indian elephant descended from those seized by Ptolemies of Egypt, Alexander's successors, in their campaigns in Syria.

title: Surus
text: According to some accounts, the animal was the last of the 37 war elephants Hannibal took with him on his 218 B.C. crossing of the Alps, during the Second Punic War.

title: Hannibal Brooks
text: Hannibal Brooks is a 1969 British war comedy film directed by Michael Winner and written by Ian La Frenais and Dick Clement based on a story by Winner and Tom Wright.

title: Hannibal Brooks
text: The film follows a prisoner of war attempt's to escape from Nazi Germany to Switzerland during World War II, accompanied by an Asian elephant.

title: Hannibal Brooks
text: It stars Oliver Reed, Michael J. Pollard and Wolfgang Preiss.

title: Hannibal Brooks
text: The beginning is based on the experiences of the writer Tom Wright who, while a prisoner of war, worked at Munich Zoo to care for their elephant "Lucy".

title: Hannibal Brooks
text: It has also been attributed to the true story of Olga the elephant rescued from Vienna Zoo in 1944.

title: Hannibal Brooks
text: The title is a reference to the Carthaginian military commander Hannibal who led an army of war elephants over the Alps.

title: Khan Kluay
text: Khan Kluay (Thai: ก้านกล้วย) is a 2006 Thai 3D computer-animated Action adventure comedy family feature film set during Ayutthaya-era Siam about a Thai elephant who wanders away from his mother and eventually becomes the war elephant for King Naresuan.

title: Khan Kluay
text: It is based on "Chao Praya Prab Hongsawadee" by Ariya Jintapanichkarn.

title: Khan Kluay
text: It was officially released as Jumbo in India and The Blue Elephant in the United States.

title: Khan Kluay
text: There is a sequel to this movie, known as "Khan Kluay 2".

title: Khan Kluay
text: This movie is about Khan Kluay's two elephant children, another attack by the Hongsawadi (Burmese), and struggling whether to live with his wife or fight the Burmese.

title: To Shoot an Elephant
text: To Shoot an Elephant is a 2009 documentary film about the 2008-2009 Gaza War directed by Alberto Arce and Mohammad Rujailahk.

title: James Howard Williams
text: James Howard Williams, also known as Elephant Bill (15 November 1897 – 30 July 1958), was a British soldier and elephant expert in Burma, known for his work with the Fourteenth Army during the Burma Campaign of World War II, and for his 1950 book "Elephant Bill".

title: James Howard Williams
text: He was made a Lieutenant-Colonel, mentioned in dispatches three times, and was awarded the OBE in 1945.

title: North African elephant
text: The North African elephant ("Loxodonta africana pharaoensis") was the subspecies of the African bush elephant ("Loxodonta africana"), or possibly a separate elephant species, that existed in North Africa north of the Sahara until becoming extinct in Roman times.

title: North African elephant
text: These were the famous war elephants used by Carthage in the Punic Wars, their conflict with the Roman Republic.

title: North African elephant
text: Although the subspecies has been formally described, it has not been widely recognized by taxonomists.

title: North African elephant
text: Other names for this animal include the North African forest elephant, Carthaginian elephant, and Atlas elephant.

title: North African elephant
text: Originally, its natural range probably extended across North Africa and down to the present Sudanese and Eritrean coasts.

title: Elephant Pass railway station
text: Elephant Pass railway station (Tamil: ஆனையிறவு தொடருந்து நிலையம் "Āṉaiyiṟavu toṭaruntu nilaiyam") is a railway station at Elephant Pass in northern Sri Lanka.

title: Elephant Pass railway station
text: Owned by Sri Lanka Railways, the state-owned railway operator, the station is part of the Northern Line which links the north with the capital Colombo.

title: Elephant Pass railway station
text: The popular Yarl Devi service calls at the station.

title: Elephant Pass railway station
text: The station was not functioning between 1990 and 2014 due to the civil war.

title: Elephant Pass railway station
text: The Northern Line between Kilinochchi and Pallai, which includes Elephant Pass, was re-opened on 4 March 2014.

title: Keith County, Nebraska
text: Keith County is a county located in the U.S. state of Nebraska.

title: Keith County, Nebraska
text: As of the 2010 census, the population was 8,368.

title: Keith County, Nebraska
text: Its county seat is Ogallala.

title: Kingsley Dam
text: Kingsley Dam is located on the east side of Lake McConaughy in central Keith County, Nebraska, and is the second largest hydraulic fill dam in the world.

title: Kingsley Dam
text: It was built as part of the New Deal project.

title: Kingsley Dam
text: The dam is 162 ft tall, 3.1 mi long, and 1100 ft wide at its base.

title: Kingsley Dam
text: On the east side of the dam is Lake Ogallala and on the south side is the Kingsley Hydroelectricity Plant.

title: Kingsley Dam
text: The Nebraska Game and Parks Commission and Central Nebraska Public Power and Irrigation District are also located in this area.

title: Kingsley Dam
text: Kingsley Dam, the Kingsley Hydroelectricity Plant, the Morning Glory Spillway, and the Outlet Tower – a large structure near the dam used to release water from the lake – are main visual icons of Lake McConaughy.

title: Ingram–Schipper Farm
text: Ingram–Schipper Farm is a historic farm complex located near Boonsboro, Washington County, Maryland, United States.

title: Ingram–Schipper Farm
text: It is a two-story, four-bay Flemish bond brick dwelling with white trim and water table.

title: Ingram–Schipper Farm
text: The house features a Victorian period flat-roofed one-story porch and a slate roof.

title: Ingram–Schipper Farm
text: The property includes a number of early outbuildings, including a brick kitchen and wash house, three log buildings, one of which has a fireplace and appears to have been a dwelling, and a large stone barn.

title: Souris Beach Provincial Park
text: Souris Beach Provincial Park is a day-use provincial park located near the town of Souris in eastern Prince Edward Island, Canada.

title: Souris Beach Provincial Park
text: The beach is very shallow, allowing visitors to walk several hundred feet from shore on an all sand bottom.

title: Souris Beach Provincial Park
text: The shallow water also results in the waters at this beach being warmer, as a result of warming by the sun, than other Island beaches where depths increase more quickly.

title: Keystone, Nebraska
text: Keystone is an unincorporated community and census-designated place in central Keith County, Nebraska, United States.

title: Keystone, Nebraska
text: It lies along local roads near the North Platte River, northeast of the city of Ogallala, the county seat of Keith County.

title: Keystone, Nebraska
text: Its elevation is 3,100 feet (945 m).

title: Keystone, Nebraska
text: Although Keystone is unincorporated, it has a post office, with the ZIP code of 69144.

title: Lemoyne, Nebraska
text: Lemoyne is an unincorporated community and census-designated place in northern Keith County, Nebraska, United States.

title: Lemoyne, Nebraska
text: It lies along Nebraska Highway 92 on the northern shore of Lake C.W. McConaughy, north of the city of Ogallala, the county seat of Keith County.

title: Lemoyne, Nebraska
text: Its elevation is 3,333 feet (1,016 m).

title: Lemoyne, Nebraska
text: Although Lemoyne is unincorporated, it has a post office, with the ZIP code of 69146.

title: Ogallala Aquifer
text: The Ogallala Aquifer is a shallow water table aquifer surrounded by sand, silt, clay and gravel located beneath the Great Plains in the United States.

title: Ogallala Aquifer
text: One of the world's largest aquifers, it underlies an area of approximately 174000 sqmi in portions of eight states (South Dakota, Nebraska, Wyoming, Colorado, Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, and Texas).

title: Ogallala Aquifer
text: It was named in 1898 by geologist N. H. Darton from its type locality near the town of Ogallala, Nebraska.

title: Ogallala Aquifer
text: The aquifer is part of the High Plains Aquifer System, and rests on the Ogallala Formation, which is the principal geologic unit underlying 80% of the High Plains.

title: Flatwood
text: Flatwood is a soil series with impaired drainage that occurs in the southeastern United States.

title: Flatwood
text: Flatwood soils are upland soils formed from marine sediments.

title: Flatwood
text: A shallow water table plays a role in soil formation, typically the water table is only a few feet deep and fluctuates during the year.

title: Flatwood
text: Flatwood soils are classified in USDA soil taxonomy as fine, mixed, semiactive, mesic Aquic Hapludults.

title: Ogallala, Nebraska
text: Ogallala is a city in Keith County, Nebraska, United States.

title: Ogallala, Nebraska
text: The population was 4,737 at the 2010 census.

title: Ogallala, Nebraska
text: It is the county seat of Keith County.

title: Ogallala, Nebraska
text: In the days of the Nebraska Territory, the city was a stop on the Pony Express and later along the transcontinental railroad.

title: Ogallala, Nebraska
text: The Ogallala Aquifer was named after the city.

title: Dune Dam
text: Dune Dam is a long sand dune that lies at the western end of Chaco Canyon, New Mexico, near the confluence of the Chaco and Escavada Washs.

title: Dune Dam
text: The dune was created by winds that brought sand up the Chaco River.

title: Dune Dam
text: When the dune was large enough, it dammed the Chaco Wash and created a small and shallow lake near the Ancestral Puebloan great house, Penasco Blanco.

title: Dune Dam
text: Archeological evidence suggests that the dune was breached around 900 CE.

title: Dune Dam
text: Chacoans filled the breach with masonry sometime in the early 11th century, and built an accompanying reservoir lined with stones that was visible until 1920.

title: Dune Dam
text: The dam stopped Chaco Wash from further deepening, which helped raise the water table in the canyon, aiding Chacoan farming.

title: Dune Dam
text: The absence of a lacustrine plain behind the dam led geologist Stephen A. Hall to question this interpretation.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari (Urdu: سید علی شاہ بُخاری‎ ) (born 30 November 1914 – 30 March 1979) commonly known as Ali Shah,Sir Syed Sani, Molvi Saeeb, Sir Syed Kashmir, Chirag-i-Beerwah, or Musleh-Millat, was a 20th-century Kashmiri Muslim pragmatist, Islamic modernist, philosopher, Islamic jurist, social activist and educator in the Budgam district of Indian administered Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: He founded Mazhar Ul Haq High School Beerwah in 1934 and Anjuman Mazhar Ul Haq in 1951.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: He also reconstructed and expanded the Grand Jamia Masjid Beerwah.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: He was the khateeb (Orator), Imam and Mirwaiz of the Grand Jamia Masjid Beerwah whose foundation stone was laid by his elder brother, Syed Syeed Shah Bukhari, in 1928.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: Syed Shah Bukhari was the Imam/Mirwaiz of historical Jamia Masjid, Srinagar after Mirwaiz Yousef Sahib until he left the Kashmir Valley.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: He is known as an early pioneer who recognized the critical role of education in the empowerment of the poor and disenfranchised in the Muslim community.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: In more than one way, Bukhari was a social reformer and a national builder of Jammu and Kashmir, particularly Allaqa Beerwah, which forms a major part of central and north Kashmir.

title: Sir Syed Sani Syed Ali Shah Bukhari
text: He commanded respect from Sikhs, Hindus and Muslims for his views and dedication to the cause of education.

title: Journal of Human Development and Capabilities
text: The Journal of Human Development and Capabilities is a peer-reviewed academic journal in the field of people-centered human development and capabilities.

title: Journal of Human Development and Capabilities
text: It is published by Routledge on behalf of the Human Development and Capability Association.

title: Journal of Human Development and Capabilities
text: It was established in 2000 as the "Journal of Human Development", obtaining its current title in 2009.

title: Journal of Human Development and Capabilities
text: Its founding editors-in-chief were Khadija Haq (Mahbub ul Haq Human Development Center), Richard Jolly (Institute of Development Studies), and Sakiko Fukuda-Parr (United Nations Development Programme).

title: Akbariyya
text: Akbariyya is a branch of Sufi metaphysics based on Andalusian Sufi gnostic and philosopher Ibn Arabi's teaching.

title: Akbariyya
text: The word is derived from the nickname of Ibn Arabi (1165–1240), who was known as Shaykh al-Akbar, meaning "the greatest shaykh".

title: Akbariyya
text: "Al Akbariyya" has never been used to indicate a Sufi group or society in history; nowadays it may refer to all historical or contemporary Sufi metaphysicians and Sufis influenced by Ibn Arabi's Sufi doctrine Wahdat al-Wujud.

title: Akbariyya
text: In this regard it is different from Al Akbariyya, a secret Sufi society founded by a Swedish Sufi 'Abdu l-Hadi Aguéli.

title: Idrees Ul Haq
text: Idrees Ul Haq, full name Mirza Mohammad Idrees ul Haq Beigh, is a Kashmiri innovator and activist He is best known for innovations , social work and was honoured in 2005 by the Governor of Jammu and Kashmir in recognition of his social work; however, he renounced his award in July 201 in protest at the Ramban firing incident.

title: Idrees Ul Haq
text: He was the first youth from Jammu and Kashmir to be invited for the Technology Transfer program at Israel

title: Human Development Index
text: The Human Development Index (HDI) is a composite statistic (composite index) of life expectancy, education, and per capita income indicators, which are used to rank countries into four tiers of human development.

title: Human Development Index
text: A country scores higher HDI when the lifespan is higher, the education level is higher, and the GDP per capita is higher.

title: Human Development Index
text: The HDI was developed by Indian Economist Amartya Sen and Pakistani economist Mahbub ul Haq, often framed in terms of whether people are able to "be" and "do" desirable things in their life, and was published by the United Nations Development Programme.

title: Inge Kaul
text: Inge Kaul is adjunct professor at the Hertie School of Governance, Berlin, Germany and advisor to various governmental, multilateral and non-profit organizations on policy options to meet global challenges.

title: Inge Kaul
text: She specializes in Global public goods, with much of her work looking at international cooperation financing, public-private partnerships, global governance, global issue diplomacy and UN system reform.

title: Inge Kaul
text: She was the first director of UNDP's Human Development Report Office, a position which she held from 1989 to 1994, where with Mahbub ul Haq she led the team working on the Human Development Report.

title: Inge Kaul
text: She was then director of UNDP's Office of Development Studies from 1995 to 2005.

title: Inge Kaul
text: She is the author of numerous publications on international public economics and finance and was the lead editor of the books "Providing Global Public Goods: Managing Globalization" and "The New Public Finance: Responding to Global Challenges."

title: Sami ul Haq
text: Maulana Sami ul Haq (Urdu: ‎ , "Samī'u’l-Ḥaq"; born 18 December 1937) is a Pakistani religious scholar and a politician.

title: Sami ul Haq
text: He is regarded as the "Father of the Taliban" and had close ties to Taliban leader Mullah Mohammed Omar.

title: Sami ul Haq
text: Sami ul Haq is currently the chancellor of Darul Uloom Haqqania, a Deobandi Islamic seminary which is the alma mater of many prominent Taliban members.

title: Sami ul Haq
text: Haq serves as chairman of the Difa-e-Pakistan Council and is the leader of his own faction of the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam political party, known as JUI-S.

title: Sami ul Haq
text: Sami ul-Haq is also a founding member of Muttahida Majlis-e-Amal.

title: Mahbub ul Haq
text: Mahbub ul Haq (Urdu: ‎ ; 24 February 1934 – 16 July 1998) was a Pakistani game theorist, economist and an international development theorist who served as the 13th Finance Minister of Pakistan from 10 April 1985 until 28 January 1988.

title: Fazle Hasan Abed
text: Sir Fazle Hasan Abed, KCMG (Bengali: ফজলে হাসান আবেদ ; born 27 April 1936) is a Bangladeshi social worker, the founder and chairman of BRAC, the world's largest non-governmental organization with over 120,000 employees.

title: Fazle Hasan Abed
text: For his contributions to social improvement, he has received the Ramon Magsaysay Award, the UNDP Mahbub Ul Haq Award, the inaugural Clinton Global Citizen Award and the inaugural WISE Prize for Education.

title: Fazle Hasan Abed
text: In 2015, he received World Food Prize for his “unparalleled” work on reducing poverty in Bangladesh and 10 other countries.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: Chak 86/6.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: R is situated in the main Sahiwal city.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: Its actual name is "Rasool Abad".

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: It is one of the largest populated village among all the villages in the Punjab, Pakistan.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: It was a well-planned village developed approximately before year 1900 during British rule.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: Now it has grown into an urban area with all facilities.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: 86/6-R is famous for its biggest "Wood Market" of Asia known as "Lakkar Mandi" and it is also famous due to well-known religious personality of Sahiwal "Syed Mureed Hussain" commonly known as "Baba Mast(بابا مست)".

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: Doctor Fazal Din Sehgal was the prominent personality of Chak and owner of 86/6R and 87/6R.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: This village was handed over to Maher Khar din (Lumber-dar) in 1930s by British local government.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: After that he invited families to live in this village and supported them as administrator.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: In the very beginning of the 1930s this village was divided into four blocks, and rest of the land was used for agriculture.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: His son Mehar Amir U Din (Lumber-dar)took over in 1958 helped to developed the area what it is at present.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: Now this area is well populated and has different sub areas known as main village 86, Shad-man Town, Baba Must Colony and Bashir Colony.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: This village was upgraded first time as union council(UC) in General Pervez Musharraf's regime and Mehar Riaz Ul Haq was elected as first Nazim along with Mazhar Javaid as his Naib Nazim of UC 86/6.

title: Chak 86/6.R Sahiwal
text: R after first election.Furthermore, Mehar Riaz Ul Haq recognized as only person who was elected Nazim three times in the history of Pakistan.

title: Odin
text: In Germanic mythology, Odin (from Old Norse Óðinn) is a widely revered god.

title: Odin
text: In Norse mythology, from which stems most of the information about the god, Odin is associated with healing, death, royalty, the gallows, knowledge, battle, sorcery, poetry, frenzy, and the runic alphabet, and is the husband of the goddess Frigg.

title: Odin
text: In wider Germanic mythology and paganism, Odin was known in Old English as Wōden, in Old Saxon as Wōdan, and in Old High German as Wuotan or Wōtan, all stemming from the reconstructed Proto-Germanic theonym wōđanaz.

title: Fensalir
text: In Norse mythology, Fensalir (Old Norse "Fen Halls") is a location where the goddess Frigg dwells.

title: Fensalir
text: Fensalir is attested in the "Poetic Edda", compiled in the 13th century from earlier traditional sources, and the "Prose Edda", written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson.

title: Fensalir
text: Scholars have proposed theories about the implications of the location, including that the location may have some connection to religious practices involving springs, bogs, or swamps in Norse paganism, and that it may be connected to the goddess Sága's watery location Sökkvabekkr.

title: Sága and Sökkvabekkr
text: In Norse mythology, Sága (] , possibly meaning "seeress") is a goddess associated with the wisdom Sökkvabekkr (] ; "sunken bank", "sunken bench", or "treasure bank").

title: Sága and Sökkvabekkr
text: At Sökkvabekkr, Sága and the god Odin merrily drink as cool waves flow.

title: Sága and Sökkvabekkr
text: Both Sága and Sökkvabekkr are attested in the "Poetic Edda", compiled in the 13th century from earlier traditional sources, and in the "Prose Edda", written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson.

title: Sága and Sökkvabekkr
text: Scholars have proposed theories about the implications of the goddess and her associated location, including that the location may be connected to the goddess Frigg's fen residence Fensalir and that Sága may be another name for "Frigg".

title: Marzanna
text: Marzanna (in Polish), Марена (in Russian), Morė (in Lithuanian), Morana (in Czech, Bulgarian, Slovene, Serbian, Bosnian, and Croatian), or Morena (in Slovak and Macedonian), Maslenitsa (in Russia) and also Mara (in Belarusian and Ukrainian), Maržena, Moréna, Mora or Marmora is a Baltic and Slavic goddess associated with seasonal rites based on the idea of death and rebirth of nature.

title: Marzanna
text: She is an ancient goddess associated with winter's death and rebirth and dreams.

title: Marzanna
text: In Slavic rites the death of the Goddess Marzanna at the end winter, becomes the rebirth of Spring of the Goddess Kostroma (Russian), Lada, Vesna representing the coming of Spring.

title: Frigg gas field
text: Frigg gas field is a natural gas field on Norwegian block 25/1 in the North Sea, on the boundary between the United Kingdom and Norway.

title: Frigg gas field
text: The field is named after the goddess Frigg.

title: Frigg gas field
text: King Olav V of Norway officially opened production on 8 May 1978.

title: Frigg gas field
text: Production was closed on 26 October 2004.

title: Frigg gas field
text: The field is situated 230 km northwest of Stavanger.

title: Frigg gas field
text: Operator for the field was the French oil company Elf Aquitaine, which merged and changed name to Total S.A.

title: Hlín
text: In Norse mythology, Hlín (Old Norse "protectress") is a goddess associated with the goddess Frigg.

title: Hlín
text: Hlín appears in a poem in the "Poetic Edda", compiled in the 13th century from earlier traditional sources, the "Prose Edda", written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson, and in kennings found in skaldic poetry.

title: Hlín
text: Hlín has been theorized as possibly another name for Frigg.

title: Fulla
text: In Germanic mythology, Fulla (Old Norse, possibly "bountiful") or Volla (Old High German) is a goddess.

title: Fulla
text: In Norse mythology, Fulla is described as wearing a golden band and as tending to the ashen box and the footwear owned by the goddess Frigg, and, in addition, Frigg confides in Fulla her secrets.

title: Fulla
text: Fulla is attested in the "Poetic Edda", compiled in the 13th century from earlier traditional sources; the "Prose Edda", written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson; and in skaldic poetry.

title: Fulla
text: Volla is attested in the "Horse Cure" Merseburg Incantation, recorded anonymously in the 10th century in Old High German, in which she assists in healing the wounded foal of Phol and is referred to as Frigg's sister.

title: Fulla
text: Scholars have proposed theories about the implications of the goddess.

title: Eir
text: In Norse mythology, Eir (Old Norse "help, mercy") is a goddess and/or valkyrie associated with medical skill.

title: Eir
text: Eir is attested in the "Poetic Edda", compiled in the 13th century from earlier traditional sources; the "Prose Edda", written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson; and in skaldic poetry, including a runic inscription from Bergen, Norway from around 1300.

title: Eir
