text: Scholars have theorized about whether these three sources refer to the same figure, and debate whether Eir may have been originally a healing goddess and/or a valkyrie.

title: Eir
text: In addition, Eir has been theorized as a form of the goddess Frigg and has been compared to the Greek goddess Hygieia.

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: In Norse mythology, Nanna Nepsdóttir or simply Nanna is a goddess associated with the god Baldr.

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: Accounts of Nanna vary greatly by source.

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: In the "Prose Edda", written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson, Nanna is the wife of Baldr and the couple produced a son, the god Forseti.

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: After Baldr's death, Nanna dies of grief.

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: Nanna is placed on Baldr's ship with his corpse and the two are set aflame and pushed out to sea.

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: In Hel, Baldr and Nanna are united again.

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: In an attempt to bring back Baldr from the dead, the god Hermóðr rides to Hel and, upon receiving the hope of resurrection from the being Hel, Nanna gives Hermóðr gifts to give to the goddess Frigg (a robe of linen), the goddess Fulla (a finger-ring), and others (unspecified).

title: Nanna (Norse deity)
text: Nanna is frequently mentioned in the poetry of skalds and a Nanna, who may or may not be the same figure, is mentioned once in the "Poetic Edda", compiled in the 13th century from earlier traditional sources.

title: Gná and Hófvarpnir
text: In Norse mythology, Gná is a goddess who runs errands in other worlds for the goddess Frigg and rides the flying, sea-treading horse Hófvarpnir (Old Norse "he who throws his hoofs about", "hoof-thrower" or "hoof kicker").

title: Gná and Hófvarpnir
text: Gná and Hófvarpnir are attested in the "Prose Edda", written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson.

title: Gná and Hófvarpnir
text: Scholarly theories have been proposed about Gná as a "goddess of fullness" and as potentially cognate to Fama from Roman mythology.

title: Gná and Hófvarpnir
text: Hófvarpnir and the eight-legged steed Sleipnir have been cited examples of transcendent horses in Norse mythology.

title: Mr. Nepal
text: The Mr Nepal competition is a male beauty pageant sponsored by the Expose Nepal.

title: Mr. Nepal
text: It was founded in 2002.

title: Mr. Nepal
text: The entrants compete in various activities including swimming, mountain climbing, and marathon running.

title: Mr. Nepal
text: The current Mr Nepal is Sandeep Pokharel of Morang who was crowned on 5 April 2015 in Kathmandu, Nepal.

title: Mr. Nepal
text: Traditionally, Mr Nepal lives in Kathmandu during his reign.

title: Miss Nepal 2014
text: Hidden Treasures Fanta Miss Nepal 2014, the 19th Miss Nepal beauty pageant was held on 2 May 2014 at the Nepal Academy Hall in Kathmandu.

title: Miss Nepal 2014
text: Miss Nepal 2013 Ishani Shrestha crowned her successor as Miss Nepal World 2014, who will represent Nepal at Miss World 2014 with 1st runner up as Miss Nepal Earth 2014 sent to Miss Earth 2014 and 2nd runner up as Miss Nepal International 2014 to Miss International 2014.

title: Julian Bolling
text: Julian Bolling (June 19, 1966) is a Sri Lankan medal winning swimmer who has represented his country at numerous international competitions.

title: Julian Bolling
text: He has won 15 gold medals for Sri Lanka at South Asian Games between 1984 to 1991.

title: Julian Bolling
text: He also represented Sri Lanka at the three Olympic games, firstly at Los Angeles (USA) in 1984, then at Seoul (South Korea) in 1988, and finally at Barcelona (Spain) in 1992.

title: Julian Bolling
text: He is the son of Tara Bolling and cousin of Dipika Chanmugam, both of whom have represented Sri Lanka internationally.

title: Julian Bolling
text: Bolling's best performance at an international meet was at the Colombo South Asian Games where he won six Gold medals.

title: Julian Bolling
text: His record was unbeaten until 2016 when Mathew Abeysinghe broke the record by winning 7 Golds in India.

title: Miss Nepal 2011
text: Hidden Treasures Miss Nepal 2011, the 17th Miss Nepal beauty pageant was held on the August 30, 2011, at the Tribhuvan Army Club in Kathmandu.

title: Miss Nepal 2011
text: The new main sponsor for the event Dabur Nepal was Lux.

title: Miss Nepal 2011
text: This year, 19 young women aged 19 years and above, had been shortlisted for the final from across the country.

title: Miss Nepal 2011
text: Sadichha Shrestha Miss Nepal 2010 winner, crowned her successor in the finale event at Tribhuvan Army Club.

title: Miss Nepal 2011
text: The winner, Malina Joshi, represented Nepal in the international pageants of Miss World 2011.

title: Miss Nepal 2011
text: First Runner Up Anupama Aura Gurung represented Nepal at Miss Earth 2011, and Sarina Maskey went to the Miss International 2011.

title: 2015 Nepal Premier League
text: The 2015 Nepal Premier League (Everest Premier League) was supposed to be the second edition of the Nepal Premier League.

title: 2015 Nepal Premier League
text: Also known as Wai Wai Nepal Premier League, the Twenty20 format was supposed to be held in 2015 in Kathmandu.

title: 2015 Nepal Premier League
text: Initially it was scheduled to be held from 26 March to 4 April 2015 but Cricket Association of Nepal insisted that it will not support NPL unless its name is changed.

title: 2015 Nepal Premier League
text: Later the board decided to support NPL and provided the ground for the competition.

title: 2015 Nepal Premier League
text: The name has been changed into Everest Premier League and is re-scheduled from 24 September to 3 October 2016.

title: Miss Nepal 2012
text: Hidden Treasures Miss Nepal 2012, the 18th Miss Nepal beauty pageant, was held on May 6, 2012 at the Hotel Del Annapurna in Kathmandu.

title: Miss Nepal 2012
text: Miss Nepal 2011 Malina Joshi crowned Shristi Shrestha as Miss Nepal World 2012, who represented Nepal at Miss World 2012 with Nagma Shrestha and Subekshya Khadka crowned as Miss Nepal Earth 2012 and Miss Nepal International 2012 who went to Miss Earth 2012 and Miss International 2012 respectively.

title: Miss Nepal 2013
text: Hidden Treasures Fanta Miss Nepal 2013, the 18th Miss Nepal beauty pageant, was held on March 20, 2013 at the Nepal Academy Hall in Kathmandu.

title: Miss Nepal 2013
text: Miss Nepal 2012 Shristi Shrestha crowned her successor Ishani Shrestha as Miss Nepal World 2013, who represented Nepal at Miss World 2013 with Rojisha Shahi as Miss Nepal Earth 2013 and was sent to Miss Earth 2013, and Shritima Shah as Miss Nepal International 2013 to Miss International 2013.

title: Miss Nepal 2010
text: Hidden Treasures Miss Nepal 2010, the 16th Miss Nepal pageant was held on September 1, 2010, at the Tribhuvan Army Club in Kathmandu.

title: Miss Nepal 2010
text: There wer e 18 women, aged 19 years and above, who had been shortlisted for the final.

title: Miss Nepal 2010
text: Miss Nepal 2009 winner Zenisha Moktan crowned her successor Sadichha Shrestha in the finale event at Tribhuvan Army Club.

title: Miss Nepal 2010
text: The winner, Sadichha Shrestha, represented Nepal at Miss World 2010, 1st Runner Up Sahana Bajracharya represented Nepal at Miss Earth 2010, and 2nd Runner Up Sanyukta Timsina represented Nepal at Miss International 2010.

title: Miss Nepal 2015
text: Hidden Treasures Fanta Miss Nepal 2015, the 20th annual Miss Nepal beauty pageant was held on April 18 at the Hotel Annapurna in Kathmandu.

title: Miss Nepal 2015
text: Miss Nepal 2014 Subin Limbu crowned her successor Evana Manandhar as Miss Nepal World 2015, who represented Nepal at the Miss World 2015.

title: Miss Nepal 2015
text: Similarly, Dibyata Vaidya was declared the 1st runner up as Miss Nepal Earth 2015 sent to Miss Earth 2015 and Medha Koirala was the 2nd runner up as Miss Nepal International 2015 sent to Miss International 2015.

title: Bhadrabas
text: Bhadrabas is a village development committee in Kathmandu District in the Bagmati Zone of central Nepal, located approximately 15 km northeast of Kathmandu.

title: Bhadrabas
text: At the time of the 2011 Nepal census it had a population of 2,388 and had 503 houses in it.

title: Bhadrabas
text: The oldest high school in the eastern Kathmandu Valley, Adarsh Uchha Madhayamik Vidhalaya is located in Bhadrabas.

title: Bhadrabas
text: The Nepal Red Cross Society is active in Bhadrabas and it has notable health centre.

title: Bhadrabas
text: In 1984, a tobacco smoking World Health Organization questionnaire was given to the inhabitants of Bhadrabas to survey smoking trends in the country.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: Earl of Aylesford, in the County of Kent, is a title in the Peerage of Great Britain.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: It was created in 1714 for the lawyer and politician Heneage Finch, 1st Baron Guernsey.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: He had already been created Baron Guernsey in the Peerage of England in 1703.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: Finch was the younger son of Heneage Finch, 1st Earl of Nottingham and the great-grandson of Elizabeth Heneage, 1st Countess of Winchilsea.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: Lord Aylesford's eldest son, the second Earl, represented Maidstone and Surrey in Parliament.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: In 1712, he married Mary Fisher, daughter of Sir Clement Fisher, 3rd Baronet.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: Through this marriage Packington Hall in Warwickshire came into the Finch family.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: Their son, the third Earl, sat as a Member of Parliament for Leicestershire and Maidstone.

title: Earl of Aylesford
text: His eldest son, the fourth Earl, represented Castle Rising and Maidstone in the House of Commons, and after entering the House of Lords on his father's death, served as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard from 1783 to 1804 and as Lord Steward of the Household from 1804 to 1812.

title: Yeomen of the Guard
text: The Queen's Body Guard of the Yeomen of the Guard are a bodyguard of the British Monarch.

title: Yeomen of the Guard
text: The oldest British military corps still in existence, it was created by King Henry VII in 1485 at the Battle of Bosworth.

title: Yeomen of the Guard
text: As a token of this venerability, the Yeomen still wear red and gold uniforms of Tudor style.

title: Yeomen of the Guard
text: There are 60 Yeomen of the Guard (plus six officers), drawn from retired members of the British Army, Royal Marines and Royal Air Force, but traditionally not the Royal Navy.

title: Yeomen of the Guard
text: This ban on Royal Navy Personnel was lifted in 2011 and two sailors joined the ranks of the Yeomen of the Guard.

title: Yeomen of the Guard
text: However, the role of the Captain of the Queen's Body Guard of the Yeomen of the Guard is a political appointment — the captain is always the government Deputy Chief Whip in the House of Lords.

title: George Percy, 5th Duke of Northumberland
text: George Percy, 5th Duke of Northumberland PC (22 June 1778 – 22 August 1867), styled Lord Lovaine between 1790 and 1830 and known as The Earl of Beverley between 1830 and 1865, was a British Tory politician.

title: George Percy, 5th Duke of Northumberland
text: He served as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard under Sir Robert Peel between 1842 and 1846.

title: George Percy, 5th Duke of Northumberland
text: He succeeded to the title on 12 February 1865, after the death of Algernon Percy, 4th Duke of Northumberland whose wife Eleanor Percy, Duchess of Northumberland had borne no children.

title: John Kerr, 7th Marquess of Lothian
text: John William Robert Kerr, 7th Marquess of Lothian {'1': ", '2': ", '3': ", '4': "} (1 February 1794 – 14 November 1841), styled Lord Newbottle until 1815 and Earl of Ancram from 1815 to 1824, was a Scottish Tory politician.

title: John Kerr, 7th Marquess of Lothian
text: He served briefly as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard under Sir Robert Peel between September and November 1841.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: Baron Berkeley of Stratton, in the County of Cornwall, was a title in the Peerage of England.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: It was created in 1658 for John Berkeley, 1st Baron Berkeley of Stratton, a Royalist supporter during the English Civil War, of the Bruton branch of the Berkeley family.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was a descendant of Sir Maurice de Berkeley (14th century), younger son of Maurice de Berkeley, 2nd Baron Berkeley (see Baron Berkeley).

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: Charles Berkeley, 2nd Viscount Fitzhardinge, was his brother and Charles Berkeley, 1st Earl of Falmouth, his nephew.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: Lord Berkeley of Stratton's second son, the third Baron (who succeeded his elder brother), was an Admiral in the Royal Navy.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He died without surviving children and was succeeded by his younger brother, the fourth Baron.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was a politician and served as First Lord of Trade between 1714 and 1715.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: On his death the title passed to his eldest son, the fifth Baron.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was also a politician and held office as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard and Captain of the Honourable Corps of Gentlemen-Pensioners.

title: Baron Berkeley of Stratton
text: He was childless and the title became extinct on his death in 1775.

title: Henry Cadogan, 4th Earl Cadogan
text: Henry Charles Cadogan, 4th Earl Cadogan PC (15 February 1812 – 8 June 1873), styled Viscount Chelsea between 1820 and 1864, was a British diplomat and Conservative politician.

title: Henry Cadogan, 4th Earl Cadogan
text: He served as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard between 1866 and 1868.

title: William Pery, 3rd Earl of Limerick
text: William Hale John Charles Pery, 3rd Earl of Limerick KP, PC, DL, JP (17 January 1840 – 8 August 1896), styled Viscount Glentworth until 1866, was an Irish peer and Conservative politician.

title: William Pery, 3rd Earl of Limerick
text: He served as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard under Lord Salisbury between 1889 and 1892 and again between 1895 and his death in 1896.

title: William Pery, 3rd Earl of Limerick
text: In 1892 he was made a Knight of the Order of St Patrick.

title: William Street, Limerick
text: William Street (Irish: "Sráid Liam" ) is one of the main thoroughfares of central Limerick City, Ireland.

title: William Street, Limerick
text: The street starts at a junction with O'Connell Street (Limerick's main thoroughfare) and continues in a south-east direction.

title: William Street, Limerick
text: The street is named after William Pery, 1st Baron Glentworth a relation of Edmund Sexton Pery who is credited with the development of the present day Limerick City Centre area known as Newtown Pery.

title: William Monson, 1st Viscount Oxenbridge
text: William John Monson, 1st Viscount Oxenbridge PC (18 February 1829 – 16 April 1898), known as The Lord Monson between 1862 and 1886, was a British Liberal politician.

title: William Monson, 1st Viscount Oxenbridge
text: He served as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard between 1880 and 1885 and in 1886 under William Ewart Gladstone.

title: Henry Fox-Strangways, 3rd Earl of Ilchester
text: Henry Stephen Fox-Strangways, 3rd Earl of Ilchester PC (21 February 1787 – 8 January 1858), styled Lord Stavordale from birth until 1802, was a British peer and Whig politician.

title: Henry Fox-Strangways, 3rd Earl of Ilchester
text: He served as Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard under Lord Melbourne from 1835 to 1841.

title: Salvatore La Barbera
text: Salvatore La Barbera (Palermo, April 20, 1922 – January 17, 1963) was a Sicilian mafioso.

title: Salvatore La Barbera
text: Together with his brother Angelo La Barbera he ruled the Mafia family of Palermo Centro.

title: Salvatore La Barbera
text: Salvatore La Barbera sat on the first Sicilian Mafia Commission that was set up in 1958 as the capo mandamento for Mafia families of Borgo Vecchio, Porta Nuova and Palermo Centro.

title: Salvatore La Barbera
text: La Barbera disappeared during the First Mafia War, a victim of the "lupara bianca", never to be seen again.

title: Greco Mafia clan
text: The Greco Mafia family is a historic and one of the most influential Mafia clans in Sicily and Calabria, from the late 19th century.

title: Greco Mafia clan
text: The extended family ruled both in Ciaculli and Croceverde Giardini, two south-eastern outskirts of Palermo in the citrus growing area and also rural areas of Calabria where they controlled the olive oil market .

title: Greco Mafia clan
text: Members of the family were important figures in the Sicilian Cosa Nostra and Calabrian 'Ndrangheta.

title: Greco Mafia clan
text: Salvatore "Ciaschiteddu" Greco was the first ‘secretary’ of the Sicilian Mafia Commission, while Michele Greco, also known as The Pope, was one of his successors.

title: Mariano Agate
text: Mariano Agate (May 19, 1939 in Mazara del Vallo – April 3, 2013 in Mazara del Vallo) was a member of the Sicilian Mafia.

title: Mariano Agate
text: He was the boss of Mazara del Vallo Mafia family since the 1970s when he replaced the old boss Mariano Licari.

title: Mariano Agate
text: He also was the boss of the mandamento of Mazara, including the Mafia families of Marsala, Salemi and Vita.

title: Mariano Agate
text: Agate was a member of "Iside", one of the most powerful local Masonic lodges.

title: Antonio Cottone
text: Antonio Cottone (1904/1905 – August 22, 1956) was a member of the Sicilian Mafia in his hometown Villabate in the province of Palermo, Sicily.

title: Antonio Cottone
text: He was known as "U Patre Nostru" (Our Heavenly Father) due to his generosity.

title: Antonio Cottone
text: The Cottone clan was a historical Mafia family.

title: Antonio Cottone
text: They were mentioned in 1937 as the Mafia bosses of Villabate by Melchiorre Allegra, a mafioso physician who became an informant when he was arrested.

title: Calcedonio Di Pisa
text: Calcedonio Di Pisa (October 11, 1931 in Palermo – December 26, 1962 in Palermo), also known as Doruccio, was a member of the Sicilian Mafia.

title: Calcedonio Di Pisa
text: He was the boss of the Mafia family in the Noce neighbourhood in Palermo and sat on the first Sicilian Mafia Commission, the coordinating body of Cosa Nostra in Sicily.

title: Rosario Naimo
text: Rosario Naimo (born August 18, 1945 in Palermo) is a member of the Sicilian Mafia, also known as Saro or Saruzzo.

title: Rosario Naimo
text: He was seen as an important go-between for the Sicilian and American Mafia, closely related with the Gambino crime family.

title: Rosario Naimo
text: He is a man of honour from the Tommaso Natale-Cardillo Mafia family that later became part of San Lorenzo family.

title: Pietro Torretta
text: Pietro Torretta (ca. 1912 – October 3, 1975) was a member of the Sicilian Mafia.

title: Pietro Torretta
text: He was the boss of the Mafia family in the Uditore district in Palermo and one of the protagonists in the First Mafia War.

title: Pietro Torretta
text: He was initially considered to be the man behind the Ciaculli massacre.

title: Gaspare Spatuzza
text: Gaspare Spatuzza (Palermo, April 8, 1964), is a Sicilian mafioso from the Brancaccio quarter in Palermo.

title: Gaspare Spatuzza
text: He was a killer for the brothers Filippo and Giuseppe Graviano who headed the Mafia family of Brancaccio.

title: Gaspare Spatuzza
text: After the arrest of the Gravianos in January 1994, he apparently succeeded them as the regent of the Mafia family.

title: Gaspare Spatuzza
text: He was arrested in 1997 and started to cooperate with the judicial authorities in 2008.

title: Gaspare Spatuzza
text: In his testimony he claimed that media tycoon and prime minister Silvio Berlusconi made a deal with the Sicilian Mafia in 1993 that put the country "in the hands" of Cosa Nostra.

title: Antonio Rotolo
text: Antonino "Nino" Rotolo (born January 3, 1946) is an Italian Mafia boss from the Pagliarelli area in Palermo that traditionally was under the control of the Motisi Mafia family.

title: Antonio Rotolo
text: Rotolo was the underboss of Matteo Motisi, but according to some pentiti he was the "de facto" leader representing the mandamento on the Sicilian Mafia Commission.

title: Antonio Rotolo
text: In 2006, the police deduced that Rotolo - number 25 in the numbered code of Mafia boss Bernardo Provenzano - had become a key figure in Cosa Nostra's hierarchy.

title: Angelo La Barbera
text: Angelo La Barbera (July 3, 1924 – October 28, 1975) was a powerful member of the Sicilian Mafia.

title: Angelo La Barbera
text: Together with his brother Salvatore La Barbera (Palermo, April 20, 1922 – January 17, 1963) he ruled the Mafia family of Palermo Centro.

title: Angelo La Barbera
text: Salvatore La Barbera sat on the first Sicilian Mafia Commission that was set up in 1958 as the capo mandamento for Mafia families of Borgo Vecchio, Porta Nuova and Palermo Centro.

title: 1969 Golden Fleece Cup
text: The 1969 VFL Golden Fleece Night Premiership was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in September of the 1969 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1969 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1969 VFL finals series.

title: 1969 Golden Fleece Cup
text: It was the 14th VFL Night Series competition.

title: 1969 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1969 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Hawthorn won its second night series cup in a row defeating Melbourne in the final by 5 points.

title: 1961 Night Series Cup
text: The 1961 VFL Night Premiership Cup was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in August and September of the 1961 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1961 Night Series Cup
text: This was the sixth season of the VFL Night Series.

title: 1961 Night Series Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1961 VFL finals series.

title: 1961 Night Series Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1961 Night Series Cup
text: Geelong won its first night series cup defeating North Melbourne in the final by 12 points.

title: 1971 Heinz Cup
text: The 1971 VFL H.J. Heinz Night Premiership was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in September of the 1971 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1971 Heinz Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1971 VFL finals series.

title: 1971 Heinz Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1971 Heinz Cup
text: It was the 16th and last VFL Night Series competition, with the series disbanded the following year due to waning interest and the introduction of the final five in the premiership competition.

title: 1971 Heinz Cup
text: Melbourne won its first night series cup defeating Fitzroy in the final by 16 points.

title: 1958 Night Series Cup
text: The 1958 VFL Night Premiership Cup was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in August and September of the 1958 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1958 Night Series Cup
text: This was the third year the VFL Night Series had existed.

title: 1958 Night Series Cup
text: In last years competition, each of the day finalists were duly defeated upon entry and their addition to the competition resulted in a drawn-out and complicated fixture of matches.

title: 1958 Night Series Cup
text: The VFL thus elected to return to the original format for this year's competition as previously used in the 1956 Night Series Cup.

title: 1958 Night Series Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1958 VFL finals series.

title: 1958 Night Series Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1958 Night Series Cup
text: St Kilda went on to win the night series cup, defeating Carlton in the final by 8 points.

title: 1957 Night Series Cup
text: The 1957 VFL Night Premiership Cup was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in August, September and October of the 1957 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1957 Night Series Cup
text: This was the second year the VFL Night Series had existed.

title: 1957 Night Series Cup
text: Run as a four-round knock-out tournament, it was contested by all twelve VFL teams.

title: 1957 Night Series Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1957 Night Series Cup
text: South Melbourne went on to win its second night series cup, defeating Geelong in the final by 51 points.

title: 1970 Radiant Cup
text: The 1970 VFL Radiant Night Premiership was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in September of the 1970 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1970 Radiant Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1970 VFL finals series.

title: 1970 Radiant Cup
text: It was the 15th VFL Night Series competition.

title: 1970 Radiant Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1970 Radiant Cup
text: Footscray won its fourth night series cup defeating Melbourne in the final by 2 points.

title: 1966 Golden Fleece Cup
text: The 1966 VFL Golden Fleece Night Premiership was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in September of the 1966 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1966 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1966 VFL finals series.

title: 1966 Golden Fleece Cup
text: It was the eleventh VFL Night Series competition.

title: 1966 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1966 Golden Fleece Cup
text: North Melbourne won its second night series cup in a row defeating Hawthorn in the final by 53 points.

title: 1967 Golden Fleece Cup
text: The 1967 VFL Golden Fleece Night Premiership was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in August and September of the 1967 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1967 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1967 VFL finals series.

title: 1967 Golden Fleece Cup
text: It was the twelfth VFL Night Series competition.

title: 1967 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1967 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Footscray won its third night series cup defeating South Melbourne in the final by 45 points.

title: 1960 Night Series Cup
text: The 1960 VFL Night Premiership Cup was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in September of the 1960 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1960 Night Series Cup
text: This was the fifth season of the VFL Night Series.

title: 1960 Night Series Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1960 VFL finals series.

title: 1960 Night Series Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1960 Night Series Cup
text: South Melbourne went on to win the night series cup for the third time, defeating Hawthorn in the final by 13 points.

title: 1965 Golden Fleece Cup
text: The 1965 VFL Golden Fleece Night Premiership was the Victorian Football League end of season cup competition played in September of the 1965 VFL Premiership Season.

title: 1965 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Run as a knock-out tournament, it was contested by the eight VFL teams that failed to make the 1965 VFL finals series.

title: 1965 Golden Fleece Cup
text: It was the tenth VFL Night Series competition.

title: 1965 Golden Fleece Cup
text: Games were played at the Lake Oval, Albert Park, then the home ground of South Melbourne, as it was the only ground equipped to host night games.

title: 1965 Golden Fleece Cup
text: This was the first time the Night Series cup had a naming rights sponsor in Golden Fleece petroleum products.

title: 1965 Golden Fleece Cup
text: North Melbourne won its first night series cup defeating Carlton in the final by 40 points.

title: Fruit Bowl
text: The Fruit Bowl was a post-season college football bowl game held in December at Kezar Stadium in San Francisco, California.

title: Fruit Bowl
text: The game was held three times, following the 1947-1949 seasons.

title: Fruit Bowl
text: The first two games featured college teams and the last involved club teams.

title: 6 Hours of Mexico
text: The 6 Hours of Mexico is a sports car race held at Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez in Mexico City, Mexico.

title: 6 Hours of Mexico
text: The race was first held in 1974 as part of the IMSA GT Championship.

title: 6 Hours of Mexico
text: Fifteen years later, in 1989, the World Sportscar Championship reintroduced it as a 480 km event, and was held three times before the championship's demise.

title: 6 Hours of Mexico
text: It was again revived in 2016 as a part of the FIA World Endurance Championship.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: The Toronto Marathon, held annually in May, is a race from Mel Lastman Square, in the north end of Toronto, to Ontario Place.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: The race was initially called the Canadian International Marathon, and was first held in 1995 under its current organizer.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: The origins of the event trace back to 1977.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: In 2003, its name was changed to the Toronto Marathon.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: In 2008, it was again renamed for a new primary sponsor, GoodLife Fitness.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: It was held previously on the third Sunday in October, the first Sunday after Canadian Thanksgiving, for 16 consecutive years.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: Because of concerns that the Toronto Waterfront Marathon was being held three weeks prior lead to too many road closures, the Toronto Marathon is now run in May, beginning in 2011.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: The event was temporarily held mid-May in 2011, due to other events in the City of Toronto that year.

title: Toronto Marathon
text: The event is now held on the first Sunday in May, beginning in 2012.

title: Moonpark
text: Moonpark is an Argentine music festival, held three times annually since 2003.

title: Moonpark
text: It is held in the Northeast of Buenos Aires city.

title: Moonpark
text: It is considered one of the most important dance and electronic music festivals in the country.

title: Australian Correspondence Chess Championship
text: The Australian Correspondence Chess Championship is organised by the Correspondence Chess League of Australia (CCLA).

title: Australian Correspondence Chess Championship
text: The event was held three times before 1937, with O Ludlow winning once and F M Hallman winning twice.

title: Australian Correspondence Chess Championship
text: Regular championships have been held since 1937 with a break from 1939 to 1945 due to World War II.

title: Pete Wilson (wrestler)
text: Peter Minnema better known by his ring name Pete Wilson (born December 15, 1985) is a Canadian professional wrestler.

title: Pete Wilson (wrestler)
text: He is best known for his time in Stampede Wrestling where he held several titles, including the Stampede International Tag Team Championship which he held three times.

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: EAFF E-1 Football Championship, known as the East Asian Football Championship from 2003 to 2010, and the EAFF East Asian Cup for the 2013 and 2015 editions, is a men's international football competition in East Asia for member nations of the East Asian Football Federation (EAFF).

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: Before the EAFF was founded in 2002, the Dynasty Cup was held between the East Asian top four teams, and was regarded as the unofficial East Asian Championship.

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: There is a separate competition for both men (first held in 2003) and women (first held in 2005).

title: EAFF E-1 Football Championship
text: There was also a combined points competition in 2005, where the results of the men's and women's teams are added together (not including qualifiers).

title: International Teen Princess
text: • The International Teen Princess was a contest that began in 1966 in Chicago, Illinois, where it was held for four years.

title: International Teen Princess
text: In 1970 its name was changed to "World Teen Princess" and held three times in European locations.

title: International Teen Princess
text: In 1973 it was changed to two contest; one "Teen Princess" that was continued for two times and apparently was discontinued after the 1974 pageant in Venezuela.

title: International Teen Princess
text: other "Miss Teenage Peace International" in Oranjestad, Aruba that in 1974 its name was changed to "Miss Teenage Intercontinental".

title: Memorabilia (event)
text: Memorabilia is a fan convention event held in the United Kingdom since 1994 for fans and collectors of movie, television and sporting memorabilia.

title: Memorabilia (event)
text: The event takes place twice a year (usually March and November) at the NEC Birmingham, attracting over 30,000 visitors and about 250 traders.

title: Memorabilia (event)
text: It has in previous years been held three times a year, and with additional events in other locations (notably London, Manchester, and Glasgow).

title: ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 17/WG 1
text: ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 17/WG 1 is a working group within ISO/IEC JTC1 of the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC), that facilitates standards development within the field of cards and personal identification.

title: ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 17/WG 1
text: A national delegation of experts from various countries meet in person at WG1 to discuss and debate items detailed in a meeting agenda until a consensus is reached.

title: ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 17/WG 1
text: These items include: draft standards, draft test methods, questions from the industry, proposals for new work items or other aspects relating to the Standards and Test Methods that WG1 bears responsibility for.

title: ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 17/WG 1
text: WG1 meetings are usually held three times a year, typically at the beginning of March, the end of June, and at the beginning of October for a period of 2–3 days.

title: ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 17/WG 1
text: The October meeting is typically held in the days just prior to the SC17 Plenary and at the same location.

title: The Whole Nine Yards (film)
text: The Whole Nine Yards is a 2000 American-Canadian crime comedy film directed by Jonathan Lynn and starring Bruce Willis, Matthew Perry, Amanda Peet, Michael Clarke Duncan and Natasha Henstridge.

title: The Whole Nine Yards (film)
text: The title derives from a popular expression of uncertain origin.

title: The Whole Nine Yards (film)
text: A sequel, "The Whole Ten Yards", was released in 2004.

title: Lay the Favorite
text: Lay the Favorite (promoted as Lay the Favourite in the UK) is a 2012 American comedy-drama film starring Bruce Willis, Rebecca Hall, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Joshua Jackson.

title: Lay the Favorite
text: Based on Beth Raymer's memoir of the same title, the film follows a young, free-spirited woman as she journeys through the legal and illegal world of sports gambling.

title: Lay the Favorite
text: The film was directed by Stephen Frears.

title: Striking Distance
text: Striking Distance is a 1993 American action thriller film starring Bruce Willis as Pittsburgh Police homicide detective Thomas Hardy.

title: Striking Distance
text: The film co-stars Sarah Jessica Parker, Dennis Farina, and Tom Sizemore.

title: Striking Distance
text: It was directed by Rowdy Herrington and written by Herrington and Marty Kaplan.

title: Striking Distance
text: The film was shot on location throughout Pittsburgh; its early title was "Three Rivers".

title: Last Man Standing (1996 film)
text: Last Man Standing is a 1996 American action thriller film written and directed by Walter Hill and starring Bruce Willis, Christopher Walken and Bruce Dern.

title: Last Man Standing (1996 film)
text: It is a credited remake of Akira Kurosawa's "Yojimbo".

title: Unbreakable (film)
text: Unbreakable is a 2000 American superhero thriller film written, produced, and directed by M. Night Shyamalan, and starring Bruce Willis and Samuel L. Jackson, alongside Robin Wright and Spencer Treat Clark.

title: Unbreakable (film)
text: The movie is the first installment in a trilogy.

title: Unbreakable (film)
text: In "Unbreakable", a security guard named David Dunn survives a horrific train crash.

title: Unbreakable (film)
text: After the incident, with the help of a manipulative disabled comic book shop owner named Elijah Price, he learns that he possesses superhuman powers.

title: Unbreakable (film)
text: As Dunn explores and reluctantly confronts his powers while trying to navigate a difficult family life, he begins to fight crime and learns the true nature of Elijah Price.

title: Signs (film)
text: Signs is a 2002 American science fiction horror film written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan and executive produced by Shyamalan, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy and Sam Mercer.

title: Signs (film)
text: A joint collective effort to commit to the film's production was made by Blinding Edge Pictures and The Kennedy/Marshall Company.

title: Signs (film)
text: It was commercially distributed by Touchstone Pictures theatrically, and by Touchstone Home Entertainment in home media format.

title: Signs (film)
text: Its story focuses on a former Episcopal priest named Graham Hess, played by Mel Gibson, who discovers a series of crop circles in his cornfield.

title: Signs (film)
text: Hess slowly discovers that the phenomena are a result of extraterrestrial life.

title: Signs (film)
text: It also stars Joaquin Phoenix, Rory Culkin, and Abigail Breslin.

title: Signs (film)
text: "Signs" explores faith, kinship, and extraterrestrials.

title: Mercury Rising
text: Mercury Rising is a 1998 American political action thriller film starring Bruce Willis and Alec Baldwin.

title: Mercury Rising
text: Directed by Harold Becker, the movie is based on Ryne Douglas Pearson's 1996 novel originally published as "Simple Simon".

title: Mercury Rising
text: Willis plays Art Jeffries, an undercover FBI agent who protects a 9-year-old boy with autism who is targeted by government assassins after he cracks a top secret government code.

title: Cop Out (2010 film)
text: Cop Out is a 2010 American buddy cop action-comedy film directed and edited by Kevin Smith, written by Mark and Robb Cullen and starring Bruce Willis, Tracy Morgan, Kevin Pollak and Seann William Scott.

title: Cop Out (2010 film)
text: The plot revolves around two veteran NYPD partners (Willis and Morgan) on the trail of a stolen, rare, mint-condition baseball card who find themselves up against a relentless, memorabilia-obsessed bloodthirsty gangster.

title: Cop Out (2010 film)
text: This is the first film that Smith directed that he did not also write.

title: Cop Out (2010 film)
text: Upon its release, the film was met with negative reviews by critics and underperformed at the box office.

title: Cop Out (2010 film)
text: It is nevertheless Kevin Smith's highest grossing film.

title: Blinding Edge Pictures
text: Blinding Edge Pictures is an American film production company, founded in 2000 by M. Night Shyamalan, which is known for producing films written and directed by Shyamalan like "Unbreakable" (2000), "Signs" (2002), "The Village" (2004), "The Happening" (2008), "After Earth" (2013), "The Visit" (2015) and "Split" (2017).

title: Blinding Edge Pictures
text: In 2015, the company released its first television series "Wayward Pines".

title: In Country
text: In Country is a 1989 American drama film produced and directed by Norman Jewison, starring Bruce Willis and Emily Lloyd.

title: In Country
text: The screenplay by Frank Pierson and Cynthia Cidre was based on the novel by Bobbie Ann Mason.

title: In Country
text: The original music score was composed by James Horner.

title: In Country
text: Willis earned a best supporting actor Golden Globe nomination for his role.

title: Richard Kind
text: Richard Bruce Kind (born November 22, 1956) is an American actor and voice actor known for his roles in the sitcoms "Mad About You" (as Dr. Mark Devanow) and "Spin City" (as Paul Lassiter).

title: Richard Kind
text: In 2015, he provided the voice of Bing Bong in the Pixar film "Inside Out".

title: Richard Kind
text: He also voices Harvey Timbers in an animated Nickelodeon show that premiered in 2017 called "Welcome to the Wayne".

title: Adrian Molina
text: Adrian Molina (born August 23, 1985) is an American screenwriter and storyboard artist.

title: Adrian Molina
text: He has been at Pixar since 2007, where he started as a 2D animator on "Ratatouille".

title: Adrian Molina
text: He later moved on to be a storyboard artist, working on "Toy Story 3" and "Monsters University".

title: Adrian Molina
text: After writing for "The Good Dinosaur", Molina started his first gig as a screenplay writer for "Coco" and later went on to co-direct the film.

title: Adrian Molina
text: Molina also illustrated the Little Golden Book for "Toy Story 3".

title: Xtractaurs
text: Xtractaurs is a line of toys by Mattel.

title: Xtractaurs
text: Recently introduced in 2009, the brand is a fusion of regular action figures with an online game.

title: Xtractaurs
text: It involves taking a dinosaur (both well-known and lesser-known dinosaurs) and extracting "DNA" samples from the dinosaur and analyzing it on your computer, similar in a way to the book and film Jurassic Park.

title: Xtractaurs
text: If you own multiple dinosaurs and have extracted samples from all of them, you can create a genetically engineered hybrid on the computer to battle the "Megavores", ancient reawakened dinosaurs that share qualities with your dinosaur.

title: Xtractaurs
text: Each dinosaur you purchase has a special ability, and combining them makes a fierce fighting animal (your first dinosaur, "Tyrannosaurus Rex", has the Chomp ability).

title: Xtractaurs
text: This encourages the fusion of certain samples even more.

title: Sanjay's Super Team
text: Sanjay's Super Team is a computer-animated short film produced by Pixar Animation Studios.

title: Sanjay's Super Team
text: Written and directed by Sanjay Patel, and based on his childhood, it premiered on June 15, 2015 at the Annecy International Animated Film Festival in France, and accompanied the theatrical release of Pixar's "The Good Dinosaur" on November 25, 2015.

title: Harley Jessup
text: Harley Jessup (born 1954) is an American production designer and visual effects art director who has been nominated for two visual effects Academy Awards, and won once.

title: Harley Jessup
text: Currently working at Pixar Animation Studios, Jessup has served as production designer for "Monsters, Inc." (with Bob Pauley), "Ratatouille", "Cars 2", "Presto", "The Good Dinosaur" and an upcoming Pixar feature.

title: Harley Jessup
text: Before coming to Pixar, Jessup was production designer on Walt Disney Pictures' "James and the Giant Peach".

title: Enrico Casarosa
text: Enrico Casarosa is an Italian storyboard artist and director who works at Pixar.

title: Enrico Casarosa
text: In 2012, he was nominated for an Academy Award for the animated short film "La Luna".

title: Enrico Casarosa
text: Starting in 2011, he worked as a head of story on Bob Peterson's film, "The Good Dinosaur".

title: Raymond Ochoa
text: Raymond Ochoa (born October 12, 2001) is an American child actor and voice actor.

title: Raymond Ochoa
text: He has appeared in various commercials, television shows and movies including roles in "10 Items or Less", "Merry Christmas, Drake & Josh", and the lead character, Arlo, in the Pixar film "The Good Dinosaur".

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: Dinosaur behavior is difficult for paleontologists to study since much of paleontology is dependent solely on the physical remains of ancient life.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: However, trace fossils and paleopathology can give insight into dinosaur behavior.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: Interpretations of dinosaur behavior are generally based on the pose of body fossils and their habitat, computer simulations of their biomechanics, and comparisons with modern animals in similar ecological niches.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: As such, the current understanding of dinosaur behavior relies on speculation, and will likely remain controversial for the foreseeable future.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: However, there is general agreement that some behaviors which are common in crocodiles and birds, dinosaurs' closest living relatives, were also common among dinosaurs.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: Gregarious behavior was common in many dinosaur species.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: Dinosaurs may have congregated in herds for defense, for migratory purposes, or to provide protection for their young.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: There is evidence that many types of dinosaurs, including various theropods, sauropods, ankylosaurians, ornithopods, and ceratopsians, formed aggregations of immature individuals.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: Nests and eggs have been found for most major groups of dinosaurs, and it appears likely that dinosaurs communicated with their young, in a manner similar to modern birds and crocodiles.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: The crests and frills of some dinosaurs, like the marginocephalians, theropods and lambeosaurines, may have been too fragile to be used for active defense, and so they were likely used for sexual or aggressive displays, though little is known about dinosaur mating and territorialism.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: Most dinosaurs seem to have relied on land-based locomotion.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: A good understanding of how dinosaurs moved on the ground is key to models of dinosaur behavior; the science of biomechanics, in particular, has provided significant insight in this area.

title: Dinosaur behavior
text: For example, studies of the forces exerted by muscles and gravity on dinosaurs' skeletal structure have investigated how fast dinosaurs could run, whether diplodocids could create sonic booms via whip-like tail snapping, and whether sauropods could float.

title: The Good Dinosaur
text: The Good Dinosaur is a 2015 American 3D computer-animated comedy-drama adventure film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures.

title: The Good Dinosaur
text: The film is directed by Peter Sohn in his directorial debut from a screenplay by Meg LeFauve from an original idea by Bob Peterson.

title: The Good Dinosaur
text: Set on a fictional Earth in which dinosaurs never became extinct, the film follows a young "Apatosaurus" named Arlo, who meets an unlikely human friend while traveling through a harsh and mysterious landscape.

title: The Good Dinosaur
text: The film features the voices of Raymond Ochoa, Jack Bright, Sam Elliott, Anna Paquin, A.J. Buckley, Steve Zahn, Jeffrey Wright, and Frances McDormand.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film was awarded for the first time at the 64th Golden Globe Awards in 2007.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: It was the first time that the Golden Globe Awards had created a separate category for animated films since its establishment.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The nominations are announced in January and an awards ceremony is held later in the month.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: Initially, only three films are nominated for best animated film, in contrast to five nominations for the majority of other awards.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The Pixar film "Cars" was the first recipient of the award.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The award for best animated film has subsequently been presented to six other Pixar films: "Ratatouille" received the award in 2008, "WALL-E" was the recipient in 2009, "Up" received the award in 2010, "Toy Story 3" won in 2011, "Brave" won in 2013, and "Inside Out" won in 2016.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: In 2012, "Cars 2" lost to "The Adventures of Tintin", in 2014, "Monsters University" was the first not to be nominated and also in 2016, "The Good Dinosaur" lost to "Inside Out".

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: In 2017, "Finding Dory" was also not nominated.

title: Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film
text: The Hollywood Foreign Press Association has been awarding Golden Globe Awards since 1944.

title: Monster Force
text: Monster Force is a 13-episode animated television series created in 1994 by Universal Cartoon Studios and Canadian studio Lacewood Productions.

title: Monster Force
text: The story is set in approx. 2020 and centers on a group of teenagers who, with help of high tech weaponry, fight off against classic Universal Monsters and spiritual beings threatening humanity.

title: Monster Force
text: Some of the crew have personal vendettas (e.g., one has the ""curse of the Wolfman"" that has been handed down through generations and another had a family member taken away from her by Dracula), while others fight for Mankind out of a sense of altruism.

title: Monster Force
text: The series aired in syndication alongside another Universal animated series, "Exosquad".

title: Monster Force
text: Universal Studios Home Entertainment released the first seven episodes to DVD on September 15, 2009.

title: Celebrity Home Entertainment
text: Celebrity Home Entertainment (also known as simply "Celebrity Video"), founded by Noel C. Bloom in 1985, was a home video distributor specializing in mostly obscure material from around the world, as well as B-grade action films and soft-core adult fare, although they also released some material that was very famous at the time of its original release (such as "BraveStarr", "Filmation's Ghostbusters", "C.O.P.S." and the ).

title: The Fairies
text: The Fairies is a live action Australian television show based on two fairies: Harmony and Rainbow Rhapsody (known in later series as just Rhapsody) .

title: The Fairies
text: They also have friends, including Elf, the Fairycake maker, Barnaby, the Bizzy Buzzy Bee and Wizzy the Wizard.

title: The Fairies
text: Each episode would contain songs and dance routines.

title: The Fairies
text: Originally it was a direct to video Series released by Carlton Home Entertainment UK in 2000, before becoming a series in 2005.

title: The Fairies
text: Contender Home Entertainment released the later series on DVD in 2007, with merchandise releasing in Australian throughout the programme's run.

title: BraveStarr
text: BraveStarr is a 1980s American Space Western animated series.

title: BraveStarr
text: The original episodes aired from September 1987 to February 1988 in syndication.

title: BraveStarr
text: It was created simultaneously with a collection of action figures.

title: BraveStarr
text: "BraveStarr" was the last animated series produced by Filmation and Group W Productions to be broadcast before Filmation shut down in 1989.

title: BraveStarr
text: "Bravo!"

title: BraveStarr
text: , a spin-off series (originally called "Quest of the Prairie People") was in production along with "Bugzburg" when the studio closed down.

title: BraveStarr
text: Reruns of the show aired on Qubo Night Owl from 2010 to 2013, and on the Retro Television Network from 2010 to 2015.

title: COPS (animated TV series)
text: COPS (Central Organization of Police Specialists) is an American animated television series released by DIC Entertainment (distributed by Claster Television) and Celebrity Home Entertainment (some VHS tapes went through Golden Book Video, though).

title: COPS (animated TV series)
text: This cartoon, which ran from 1988 to 1989, used the tag line: "Fighting crime in a future time, protecting Empire City from Big Boss and his gang of crooks".

title: COPS (animated TV series)
text: In 1993, the series was shown in reruns on CBS Saturday mornings as "CyberCOPS", the name change due to the 1989 debut of the unrelated primetime reality show of the same name.

title: COPS (animated TV series)
text: The show was based on Hasbro's 1988 line of action figures called C.O.P.S 'N' Crooks.

title: Locke the Superman
text: Locke the Superman (超人ロック , Chōjin Rokku ) is a manga series by Yuki Hijiri which was later adapted into a movie and three OVA releases.

title: Locke the Superman
text: The movie was given an obscure video release in the United States by Celebrity Home Entertainment as "Locke the Superpower" which was rather heavily edited to 92 minutes, removing violence, nudity and any adult bits.

title: Locke the Superman
text: Both it and the OVAs were later licensed and released by Central Park Media under the original name.

title: Locke the Superman
text: Ten volumes were published in Poland under the title "Locke Superczłowiek".

title: Sterling Entertainment Group
text: Sterling Entertainment Group (formerly United American Video Corporation, and more commonly known as United American Video, UAV Corporation or UAV Entertainment), was an entertainment company founded in 1984 as a small local company originally located in Nashville, Tennessee, then Charlotte, North Carolina starting in 1991.

title: Sterling Entertainment Group
text: Its headquarters would later relocate to Fort Mill, South Carolina in 1996.

title: Sterling Entertainment Group
text: UAV was also the longtime competitor of GoodTimes Entertainment, Anchor Bay Entertainment and Celebrity Home Video and many other sell through home entertainment companies.

title: Magna Home Entertainment
text: Magna Home Entertainment was an independent home entertainment distributor headquartered in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia, operating within Australia and New Zealand.

title: Magna Home Entertainment
text: As of February 2009, Magna Home Entertainment became a fully owned subsidiary of Beyond International (ASX:BYI), an Australian television production and distribution company.

title: Magna Home Entertainment
text: Magna Home Entertainment is the sister company of Melbourne-based home entertainment distributor Beyond Home Entertainment, also a subsidiary of Beyond International.

title: Magna Home Entertainment
text: Magna Home Entertainment distributes television series, documentaries and feature films.

title: Tottoi
text: Tottoi (トトイ ) is a 1992 anime film.

title: Tottoi
text: It was dubbed into English and was distributed by Celebrity Home Entertainment in 1993 under the title of "The Secret of the Seal"

title: Noel C. Bloom
text: Noel Christopher Bloom Sr. (born November 5, 1942) is an American businessman from Los Angeles.

title: Noel C. Bloom
text: He is notable for founding the entertainment and home video companies Artisan Entertainment, Family Home Entertainment, Celebrity Home Entertainment, Live Entertainment, Caballero Home Video, and Monterey Home Video.

title: Noel C. Bloom
text: Three of those companies of which founded are now owned by Lionsgate.

title: Noel C. Bloom
text: Bloom is married and has a daughter, Nicole (born 1970) and a son, Noel Jr. (born 1977).

title: Battle of Yao (Japan)
text: The Battle of Yao (Japanese: 八尾の戦い , Hepburn: Yao no tatakai ) was a confrontation that took place in 1615 during the early Edo period in Japan.

title: Battle of Yao (Japan)
text: The battle occurred in 1615 during the Siege of Osaka, in which Tokugawa Ieyasu planned to destroy the Toyotomi clan.

title: Battle of Yao (Japan)
text: It was fought between the Tōdō clan and the Chosokabe clan.

title: Battle of Yao (Japan)
text: There is not much detail about the battle, but it is known that the Tõdõ clan was led by Tōdō Takatora, who won the battle, forcing the Chosokabe clan, led by Chōsokabe Morichika, to retreat to Osaka.

title: Battle of Yao (Japan)
text: Though Takatora won the battle, his two sons were died in combat.

title: Battle of Calabria
text: The Battle of Calabria, (known to the Italian Navy as the Battle of Punta Stilo) was a naval battle during the Battle of the Mediterranean in the Second World War.

title: Battle of Calabria
text: It was fought between the Italian Royal Navy ("Regia Marina") and the British Royal Navy and the Royal Australian Navy.

title: Battle of Calabria
text: The battle occurred 30 miles to the east of Punta Stilo, Calabria, on 9 July 1940.

title: Battle of Calabria
text: It was one of the few pitched battles of the Mediterranean campaign during the Second World War involving large numbers of ships on both sides.

title: Battle of Calabria
text: Both sides claimed victory, but in fact the battle was a draw and everyone returned to their bases as soon as possible.

title: Battle of Aspromonte
text: The Battle of Aspromonte, also known as The Day of Aspromonte (in Italian: "La Giornata dell'Aspromonte"), was a battle that took place on 29 August 1862, and was an inconclusive episode of the Italian unification process.

title: Battle of Aspromonte
text: The battle is named after the mountain Aspromonte in southern Italy, which is near the place where the battle occurred.

title: Battle of Aspromonte
text: In the battle, the Royal Italian Army defeated Giuseppe Garibaldi's army of volunteers, who were marching from Sicily towards Rome, with the intent of annexing it into the Kingdom of Italy.

title: Battle of Aspromonte
text: In the battle, which took place a few kilometers from Gambarie, Garibaldi was wounded and taken as prisoner.

title: Battle of Klushino
text: The Battle of Klushino, or the Battle of Kłuszyn, was fought on 4 July 1610, between forces of the Crown of the Kingdom of Poland and the Tsardom of Russia during the Polish–Muscovite War, part of Russia's Time of Troubles.

title: Battle of Klushino
text: The battle occurred near the village of Klushino (Polish: "Kłuszyn" ) near Smolensk (Polish: "Smoleńsk").

title: Battle of Klushino
text: In the battle the outnumbered Polish force secured a decisive victory over Russia, due to the tactical competence of hetman Stanisław Żółkiewski and the military prowess of Polish hussars, the elite of the army of the Crown of the Kingdom of Poland.

title: Battle of Klushino
text: The battle is remembered as one of the greatest triumphs of the Polish cavalry and an example of excellence and supremacy of the Polish military at the time.

title: Battle of Saumur (1940)
text: The Battle of Saumur occurred during the last stages of the Battle of France during World War II, when officer cadets from the Cavalry School at Saumur, led by superintendent Colonel Michon, made a defensive stand along the Loire River at Saumur and Gennes.

title: Battle of Saumur (1940)
text: For two days the Cavalry School, and other assorted units which had fallen back before the German Wehrmacht advance, held off a German attack.

title: Battle of Saumur (1940)
text: Since the battle occurred after the message by Marshal Pétain which called for an end to fighting (on 17 June 1940), the event is often considered one of the first acts of the French Resistance.

title: Battle of the Burbia River
text: The Battle of Río Burbia or the Battle of the Burbia River was a battle fought in the year 791 between the troops of the Kingdom of Asturias, commanded by King Bermudo I of Asturias, and the troops of the Emirate of Córdoba, led by Yusuf ibn Bujt.

title: Battle of the Burbia River
text: The battle occurred in the context of the Ghazws of Hisham I against the Christian rebels of the northern Iberian Peninsula.

title: Battle of the Burbia River
text: The battle took place near the Río Burbia, in the area which is today known as Villafranca del Bierzo.

title: Battle of the Burbia River
text: The battle resulted in Andalusian victory.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: The Battle of Manilla (1574) was a battle in the Manila area mainly in the location of what is now Parañaque between Chinese pirates, led by Limahong and the Spanish colonial forces and their native allies.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: The battle occurred on November 29, 1574 when Limahong's fleet landed in the town of Parañaque and from there, began to assault the fortifications of Intramuros.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: Initially, the inhabitants where disorganized and Limahong's forces routed them.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: Furthermore, the Chinese killed the Master-of-Camp of the Spanish, Martin De Goiti.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: This caused them to delay their assault on Manila as Martin de Goiti's house was an obstacle in their march.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: However, upon the arrival of a certain Filipino hero called, Galo, resistance started to organize.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: Under Galo's command, they were able to resist China-born Limahong until Mexico-born Juan de Salcedo arrived from Ilocos with 300 Ilocano Warriors and Limahong was defeated and eventually forced to retreat.

title: Battle of Manila (1574)
text: Thereafter Limahong abandoned his plans to invade Manila and instead, set up a temporary kingdom in Pangasinan.

title: Battle of Alhandic
text: The Battle of Alhandic (Spanish: "Batalla de Alhandic" ), also known as Zamora's trench Battle ("Batalla del Foso de Zamora"), was a battle that occurred on August 5, 939 in the city of Zamora, Spain.

title: Battle of Alhandic
text: The battle occurred when the troops of Abd-ar-Rahman III assaulted the walls of Zamora.

title: Battle of Alhandic
text: The defending troops were those loyal to Ramiro II of León, King of the Kingdom of Leon.

title: Battle of Alhandic
text: The fighting was so bloody that the tide of the battle did not turn until the ditch surrounding the city walls was entirely filled with corpses.

title: Battle of Alhandic
text: The troops of Aberraman III won the day and were able to seize the city of Zamora.

title: Battle of Alhandic
text: This battle should not be confused with the Day of Zamora ("Día de Zamora" or "Jornada del Foso de Zamora") which took place a few decades before in the year 901.

title: Battle of Silda
text: Battle of Silda ("Affæren ved Silden" or "Affæren ved Stadt") was a naval battle fought on 23 July 1810 between the United Kingdom and Denmark–Norway near the Norwegian island of Silda in Sogn og Fjordane county.

title: Battle of Silda
text: The battle occurred during the Gunboat War, itself part of the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Battle of Silda
text: In the battle, two British frigates captured or destroyed three or four Dano-Norwegian gunboats.

title: Battle of Silda
text: The Danish and British accounts of the battle differ.

title: Battle of Trout River
text: The Battle of Trout River was a military conflict that occurred on 27 May 1870.

title: Battle of Trout River
text: It was a part of the Fenian raids.

title: Battle of Trout River
text: This battle occurred outside of Huntingdon, Quebec near the international border about 20 km north of Malone, New York.

title: Battle of Trout River
text: The location of this battle should not be confused with Trout River in the Northwest Territories.

title: R-Point
text: R-Point () is a 2004 Korean horror film written and directed by Kong Su-chang.

title: R-Point
text: Set in 1972 Vietnam, during the Vietnam War, it stars Kam Woo-sung and Son Byong-ho as members of the South Korean military in Vietnam.

title: R-Point
text: Most of the movie was shot in Cambodia.

title: R-Point
text: Bokor Hill Station plays a prominent part of the movie, in this case doubling as a colonial French plantation.

title: Kam Heskin
text: Kam Heskin (born Kam Erika Heskin on May 8, 1973) is an American actress.

title: Kam Heskin
text: She began her career playing Caitlin Richards Deschanel on the NBC daytime soap opera "Sunset Beach" (1998–1999), before appearing in films "Planet of the Apes" (2001 and "Catch Me If You Can" (2002).

title: Kam Heskin
text: Heskin went to play Elizabeth Bennet in the 2003 independent film "", and Paige Morgan in the "The Prince and Me" film franchise (2006–2010).

title: True True Lie
text: True True Lie is 2006 thriller film directed by Eric Styles.

title: True True Lie
text: The film follows Dana, who, after 12 years in an asylum, is reunited with her family and childhood friends Nathalie and Paige.

title: True True Lie
text: Dana slowly begins to realize that the events that led to her stay there may not have been imaginary.

title: True True Lie
text: "True True Lie" stars Jaime King as Nathalie, Lydia Leonard as Dana and Annabelle Wallis as Paige.

title: Pride & Prejudice: A Latter-Day Comedy
text: Pride & Prejudice: A Latter-Day Comedy is a 2003 independent film adaptation of Jane Austen's novel set in modern-day Provo, Utah.

title: Pride & Prejudice: A Latter-Day Comedy
text: The film received mixed reviews, with more negative reviews than positive.

title: Pride & Prejudice: A Latter-Day Comedy
text: Critics accused the film of its poor editing and its rough application of the story to modern life.

title: Pride & Prejudice: A Latter-Day Comedy
text: Positive reviews praised Kam Heskin's performance as Elizabeth and enjoyed that the film was "cute".

title: Pride & Prejudice: A Latter-Day Comedy
text: Although the film included aspects of LDS culture, most critics agreed that the film's connection with LDS culture was trivial, making the film more universally accessible to viewers.

title: The Prince & Me 2: The Royal Wedding
text: The Prince and Me 2: The Royal Wedding is a 2006 romantic comedy film and the sequel to the 2004 film "The Prince and Me" and was released direct-to-video.

title: The Prince & Me 2: The Royal Wedding
text: Directed by Catherine Cyran, the film features Luke Mably reprising his role as King Edvard of Denmark, with Kam Heskin replacing Julia Stiles as Paige Morgan and Clemency Burton-Hill as newcomer Princess Kirsten of Norway.

title: The Prince and Me
text: The Prince and Me is a 2004 romantic comedy film directed by Martha Coolidge, and starring Julia Stiles, Luke Mably, and Ben Miller, with Miranda Richardson, James Fox, and Alberta Watson.

title: The Prince and Me
text: The film focuses on Paige Morgan, a pre-med college student in Wisconsin, who is pursued by a prince posing as a normal college student.

title: Sunset at Chaophraya (1996 film)
text: Sunset at Chaophraya (Thai: คู่กรรม , "Khu Kam") is a 1996 romantic-drama film directed by Euthana Mukdasanit.

title: Sunset at Chaophraya (1996 film)
text: Adapted from the novel "Khu Kam" by Thommayanti, the story is a love triangle, set in World War II-era Thailand, and depicts the star-crossed romance between an Imperial Japanese Navy officer and a Thai woman who is involved with the Free Thai resistance.

title: Sunset at Chaophraya (2013 film)
text: Sunset at Chaophraya (Thai: คู่กรรม , "Khu Kam") in 2013 romantic-war-drama film directed by Kittikorn Liasirikun.

title: Sunset at Chaophraya (2013 film)
text: Adapted from the novel "Khu Kam" by Thommayanti, the story is a love triangle, set in World War II-era Thailand, and depicts the star-crossed romance between an Imperial Japanese Navy officer and a Thai woman who is involved with the Free Thai resistance.

title: Sunset at Chaophraya (2013 film)
text: It was released on April 4, 2013, One of top five box office hits in (Thailand film) in 2013

title: Turning Paige
text: Turning Paige is a 2001 Canadian drama film directed by Robert Cuffley.

title: Turning Paige
text: The film focuses on the life of Paige (Katharine Isabelle) and her family a she comes to terms with tragedy in the family's past.

title: Turning Paige
text: The film's title refers to the phrase "turn the page" as the central character must come to terms with her past and put it behind her if she is to move on in life.

title: Super Size Me 2: Holy Chicken!
text: Super Size Me 2: Holy Chicken!

title: Super Size Me 2: Holy Chicken!
text: is a 2017 American documentary film directed by Morgan Spurlock.

title: Super Size Me 2: Holy Chicken!
text: A sequel to the 2004 film "Super Size Me", it explores the ways in which the fast food industry has rebranded itself as healthier since his original film through the process of Spurlock working to open his own fast food restaurant, thus exposing some of the ways in which that rebranding is more perception than reality.

title: Plush (film)
text: Plush is a 2013 American erotic thriller film directed by Catherine Hardwicke and co-written by Arty Nelson with music by Nick Launay & Ming Vauze.

title: Plush (film)
text: The film stars Emily Browning, Xavier Samuel, Cam Gigandet, Dawn Olivieri, Thomas Dekker, and Frances Fisher.

title: Healing (film)
text: Healing is a 2014 Australian drama film directed by Craig Monahan and co-written with Alison Nisselle.

title: Healing (film)
text: The film stars Hugo Weaving, Robert Taylor, Xavier Samuel, Justine Clarke, Laura Brent and Anthony Hayes.

title: Spin Out (2016 film)
text: Spin Out is an Australian romantic comedy film directed by Tim Ferguson and Marc Gracie.

title: Spin Out (2016 film)
text: The film stars Xavier Samuel and Morgan Griffin.

title: Vampire Academy
text: Vampire Academy is an American best-selling series of six young adult paranormal romance novels by author Richelle Mead.

title: Vampire Academy
text: It tells the story of Rosemarie "Rose" Hathaway, a seventeen/eighteen-year-old Dhampir girl, who is training to be a guardian of her Moroi best friend, Vasilisa "Lissa" Dragomir.

title: Vampire Academy
text: In the process of learning how to defeat Strigoi (the evil undead vampires) in St. Vladimir's Academy, Rose finds herself caught in a forbidden romance with her instructor, Dimitri Belikov, while having an unbreakable psychic bond with Lissa.

title: Frostbite (Mead novel)
text: Frostbite is a vampire novel written by Richelle Mead.

title: Frostbite (Mead novel)
text: It is the second novel in the #1 "New York Times" bestselling series, "Vampire Academy".

title: Frostbite (Mead novel)
text: "Frostbite" continues the story of the main character, Rose Hathaway including her bond with Princess Vasilisa "Lissa" Dragomir, her budding romance with her instructor Dimitri Belikov, and her education in becoming a Guardian.

title: Vampire Academy (film)
text: Vampire Academy (also known as Vampire Academy: Blood Sisters) is a 2014 American fantasy comedy film based on Richelle Mead's 2007 best-selling novel of the same name, directed by Mark Waters, and scripted by Daniel Waters.

title: Vampire Academy (film)
text: The film stars Zoey Deutch, Danila Kozlovsky, Lucy Fry, and Dominic Sherwood in lead roles.

title: Vampire Academy (film)
text: It was released in North America on February 7, 2014 and globally between March and July of the same year.

title: Vampire Academy (film)
text: It was distributed in the United States by The Weinstein Company.

title: Mr. Church
text: Mr. Church is a 2016 American dramedy film directed by Bruce Beresford and written by Susan McMartin.

title: Mr. Church
text: The film stars Eddie Murphy as the title character with Britt Robertson, Xavier Samuel, Lucy Fry, Christian Madsen and Natascha McElhone also starring.

title: Mr. Church
text: The film debuted on April 22, 2016, at the Tribeca Film Festival and was released on September 16, 2016, by Cinelou Releasing and Freestyle Releasing.

title: Love & Friendship
text: Love & Friendship is a 2016 period comedy film written and directed by Whit Stillman.

title: Love & Friendship
text: Based on Jane Austen's epistolary novel "Lady Susan", written ca. 1794, the film stars Kate Beckinsale, Chloë Sevigny, Xavier Samuel, and Stephen Fry.

title: Love & Friendship
text: The film follows recently widowed Lady Susan in her intrepid and calculating exploits to secure suitably wealthy husbands for her daughter and herself.

title: Love & Friendship
text: Although adapted from "Lady Susan", the film was produced under the borrowed title of Austen's juvenile story "Love and Freindship"  .

title: A Few Best Men
text: A Few Best Men is a 2011 Australian-British comedy film written by Dean Craig and directed by Stephan Elliott.

title: A Few Best Men
text: The film stars Xavier Samuel as a young groom heading to the Australian Blue Mountains with his three best men for his wedding.

title: Lucy Fry
text: Lucy Elizabeth Fry (born 13 March 1992) is an Australian actress.

title: Lucy Fry
text: She is known for portraying Zoey in "Lightning Point", Lyla in "", and Vasilisa Dragomir in the film "Vampire Academy".

title: Lucy Fry
text: Fry was also cast in Hulu's eight part miniseries "11.22.63" as Marina Oswald, wife of Lee Harvey Oswald, and played the lead in the 2016 Australian horror television series "Wolf Creek".

title: Palaivana Solai (1981 film)
text: Palaivana Solai is a 1981 Tamil drama film directed by the duo Robert — Rajasekhar.

title: Palaivana Solai (1981 film)
text: The film features Suhasini Maniratnam, Chandrasekhar, Janagaraj, Rajeev, Kailash Nath and Thyagu in lead roles.

title: Palaivana Solai (1981 film)
text: The film, produced by R. Vadivel, had musical score by Sankar Ganesh and was released on 17 October 1981.

title: Palaivana Solai (1981 film)
text: The film was declared blockbuster at the box-office and the film has grown a strong cult film.

title: Palaivana Solai (1981 film)
text: It was remade in Telugu as "Manchu Pallaki", in Malayalam as "Ithu Njangalude Katha" and it was remade in Tamil in 2009 under the same title.

title: Ithu Engal Neethi
text: Ithu Engal Neethi is a 1988 Indian Tamil film, directed by S. A. Chandrasekhar and produced by S. S. Neelakandan and Shoba Chandrasekhar.

title: Ithu Engal Neethi
text: The film stars Ramki, Radhika, Ramki and Vani Viswanath in lead roles.

title: Ithu Engal Neethi
text: The film had musical score by Ilayaraja.

title: Naalaiya Theerpu
text: Naalaiya Theerpu ("Tomorrow's Verdict") is a Tamil action-drama film directed by S. A. Chandrasekhar and produced and written by his wife Shoba Chandrasekhar which marked the debut of their son Vijay in the lead role alongside Keerthana and Easwari Rao.

title: Naalaiya Theerpu
text: The film which also featured Srividya, Radharavi and Sarath Babu, had music composed by newcomer Manimekalai, cinematography by R. P. Imayavaramban and editing by Gautham Raju.

title: Naalaiya Theerpu
text: The film released to mixed reviews on 4 December 1992 and ended as a box office failure.

title: Naalaiya Theerpu
text: It was later dubbed in Hindi as "Faisla Uparwale Ka".

title: Neethiyin Marupakkam
text: Neethiyin Marupakkam is a 1985 Indian Tamil film directed by S. A. Chandrasekhar and produced by Shoba Chandrasekhar.

title: Neethiyin Marupakkam
text: The film features Vijayakanth, Radhika, Vadivukkarasi and V. K. Ramasamy in lead roles.

title: Neethiyin Marupakkam
text: The film, had musical score by Ilaiyaraaja.

title: Pudhu Yugam
text: Pudhu Yugam (English: New Era) is a 1985 Indian Tamil film, directed by S A Chandrasekhar and produced by Shoba Chandrasekhar.

title: Pudhu Yugam
text: The film stars Sivakumar, Vijayakanth, K. R. Vijaya and Suresh in lead roles.

title: Pudhu Yugam
text: The film had musical score by Gangai Amaran.

title: Rajanadai
text: Rajanadai is a 1989 Tamil crime film directed by S. A. Chandrasekhar.

title: Rajanadai
text: The film features Vijayakanth, Gouthami, Vidhyashree and Seetha in lead roles.

title: Rajanadai
text: The film, produced by Shoba Chandrasekhar, had musical score by M. S. Viswanathan and was released on 28 October 1989.

title: Rajanadai
text: This movie did well in the box office at the time of its release.

title: Rajanadai
text: The film was later remade in Hindi as "Jeevan Ki Shatranj".

title: Neethikku Thandanai
text: Neethikku Thandanai (Tamil: நீதிக்கு தண்டனை / English : Punishment for Law) is a 1987 Indian Tamil film, directed by S. A. Chandrasekhar and produced by S. S. Neelakantan and Shoba Chandrasekhar.

title: Neethikku Thandanai
text: The film stars Raadhika, Nizhalgal Ravi, Charan Raj and Senthil in lead roles.

title: Neethikku Thandanai
text: The film had musical score by M. S. Viswanathan.

title: Neethikku Thandanai
text: The film was remade in Telugu as "Nyayaniki Siksha" and in Kannada as "Nyayakke Sikshe".

title: Sattam Oru Vilayaattu
text: Sattam Oru Vilaiyaattu is a 1987 Indian Tamil film, directed by S A Chandrasekhar and produced by Shoba Chandrasekhar.

title: Sattam Oru Vilayaattu
text: The film stars Vijayakanth, Radha, Ravichandran and S A Chandrasekhar in lead roles.

title: Sattam Oru Vilayaattu
text: The film had musical score by M S Viswanathan.

title: V. V. Creations
text: V. V. Creations is a Tamil film production company owned by S. A. Chandrasekhar's wife Shoba Chandrasekhar.

title: Shoba Chandrasekhar
text: Shoba Chandrasekhar is an Indian film playback singer, director, writer and producer.

title: Shoba Chandrasekhar
text: She is best known as the mother of Tamil Leading Star Vijay.

title: Peter Torry
text: Sir Peter James Torry (born 2 August 1948) was the UK Ambassador to Germany from 2003 until 30 September 2007.

title: Peter Torry
text: He is now a senior adviser to Cairn Capital and to STAR Capital Partners.

title: Peter Torry
text: He is on the Supervisory Board of Blohm and Voss AG.

title: Peter Torry
text: He is a member of the advisory board of Betfair plc and of the Kiel Global Economic Symposium and a policy fellow of the Institute on the Future of Employment in Bonn.

title: Peter Torry
text: He was a member of the advisory panel of Lloyds Pharmacy until April 2010 and a senior adviser to DAM Capital until December 2009, to Centrica plc until 2012 and to Celesio AG.

title: Peter Torry
text: He was educated at Dover College and New College, Oxford where he won a blue for Rugby.

title: Richard Socarides
text: Richard Socarides (born November 8, 1954) is an American Democratic political strategist, writer, commentator and a New York attorney.

title: Richard Socarides
text: Socarides was named Head of Public Affairs for Gerson Lehrman Group in August 2013.

title: Richard Socarides
