text: He was a White House adviser under United States President Bill Clinton from 1993 to 1999 in a variety of senior positions, including as Special Assistant to the President and Senior Adviser for Public Liaison.

title: Richard Socarides
text: He worked on legal, policy and political issues and served as principal adviser to Clinton on gay and lesbian civil rights issues.

title: Richard Socarides
text: Under Clinton, he was chief operating officer of the 50th Anniversary Summit of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).

title: Richard Socarides
text: Socarides also worked as special assistant to Senator Tom Harkin (D-Iowa).

title: Richard Socarides
text: From 2000 to 2006, Socarides held senior positions at Time Warner, including at its divisions New Line Cinema and AOL.

title: Thomas Shea
text: Thomas A. Shea is a Founding Partner of Confluence Partners, a boutique communications strategy firm and a senior adviser with New Partners, a Washington, D.C.-based political and corporate consulting firm.

title: Thomas Shea
text: He was previously a Managing Director of Teneo Strategy.

title: Thomas Shea
text: Before joining Teneo, he was a senior political adviser and Chief of Staff to New Jersey Governor Jon Corzine.

title: Thomas Shea
text: Shea took over the chief of staff position when Corzine took office in January 2006.

title: Thomas Shea
text: In June 2007, he was named the #6 most influential political personality in the state of New Jersey.

title: Thomas Shea
text: Shea held the position in Corzine's cabinet until his replacement by Brad Abelow as of September 1, 2007.

title: Lee Terry
text: Lee Raymond Terry (born January 29, 1962) is a former American politician and a senior law firm adviser.

title: Lee Terry
text: From 1999 to 2015, he served as a member of the U.S. House of Representatives for Nebraska 's 2 congressional district as a member of the Republican Party.

title: Lee Terry
text: Since 2015, Terry reactivated his law license and is a senior adviser to the government relations and public group for the international law firm Kelley Drye & Warren.

title: Palisades Hudson Financial Group
text: Palisades Hudson Financial Group LLC, was founded in 1993 by Larry M. Elkin.

title: Palisades Hudson Financial Group
text: The fee-only financial and tax-planning firm also has an affiliated Registered Investment Adviser arm, Palisades Hudson Asset Management, L.P., which began in 1997.

title: Palisades Hudson Financial Group
text: Palisades Hudson Asset Management had more than $1.1 billion in assets under management as of April 2013.

title: Palisades Hudson Financial Group
text: It offers services including personal financial planning, estate planning, tax planning and tax return preparation, and (through Palisades Hudson Asset Management, L.P.) investment management and asset allocation.

title: Michael Green (political expert)
text: Michael J. Green is the Japan Chair and a senior adviser at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), as well as an associate professor and Chair in Modern and Contemporary Japanese Politics and Foreign Policy at Georgetown University.

title: Michael Green (political expert)
text: He served as special assistant to the president for national security affairs and senior director for Asian affairs at the National Security Council (NSC) from January 2004 to December 2005 under George W. Bush.

title: Michael Green (political expert)
text: He joined the NSC in April 2001 as director of Asian affairs with responsibility for Japan, Korea, and Australia/New Zealand.

title: Michael Green (political expert)
text: From 1997 to 2000, he was senior fellow for Asian security at the Council on Foreign Relations, where he directed the Independent Task Force on Korea and study groups on Japan and security policy in Asia.

title: Michael Green (political expert)
text: He served as senior adviser to the Office of Asia Pacific Affairs at the Department of Defense in 1997 and as consultant to the same office until 2000.

title: Yousef Pashtun
text: Mohammad Yousef Pashtun (Pashto: یوسف پښتون ‎ ) is an Afghan Technocrat and Politician, serving as the Senior Adviser to the President of Afghanistan on Construction, Mines, Water & Energy.

title: Yousef Pashtun
text: He previously served as Minister of Urban Development and Housing for two terms (2002-2003, 2005-2010) and Governor of Kandahar province, in 2003 replacing Gul Agha Sherzai under President Hamid Karzai administration.

title: Yousef Pashtun
text: In 2010, he was appointed as Senior Adviser to President Karzai on Construction, Mines, Water & Energy.

title: Yousef Pashtun
text: Minister Pashtun continued to serve as Senior Adviser to newly elected President, Ashraf Ghani.

title: Yulchon
text: Yulchon LLC is a full-service international corporate law firm headquartered in Seoul, Korea that was founded in 1997 by five of Korea's leading attorneys at the time.

title: Yulchon
text: In 2007 the firm changed its name from Woo Yun Kang Jeong & Han to Yulchon.

title: Yulchon
text: Yulchon employs more than 360 lawyers, including more than 60 licensed in jurisdictions outside of Korea.

title: Yulchon
text: The firm is one of the six largest in Korea(6th largest by numbers of lawyer, and 4th largest by revenue) and was selected as the most innovative law firm in South Korea by the Financial Times in 2015 and 2016.

title: Yulchon
text: In addition, it was recognized as "South Korea Law Firm of the Year" by Chambers & Partners in 2017.

title: Yulchon
text: The firm offers services in the following practice areas: corporate & finance, tax, anti-trust, fair trade, dispute resolution, and intellectual property.

title: Yulchon
text: In particular, Yulchon is well-known for its strong tax practice.

title: Claudio Fernández-Aráoz
text: Claudio Fernández-Aráoz is an Argentinian author, international speaker and global expert on talent and leadership, ranked by "BusinessWeek" as one of the most influential executive search consultants in the world.

title: Claudio Fernández-Aráoz
text: He is currently a senior adviser of Egon Zehnder.

title: Claudio Fernández-Aráoz
text: Before joining Egon Zehnder in 1986, he worked at McKinsey & Company in Europe.

title: Claudio Fernández-Aráoz
text: He is a frequent lecturer at the Harvard Business School.

title: Shomwa Shamapande
text: Shomwa "Shom" Shamapande is a political and business consultant and strategist, who has worked in government affairs, media/communications and Democratic politics.

title: Shomwa Shamapande
text: In 1998, he served as an adviser to the South African Center for Human Rights in Pretoria.

title: Shomwa Shamapande
text: Shomwa was a Senior Adviser to Bill Lynch, former deputy mayor of New York City and Vice Chairman of the Democratic National Party and as a legislative fellow for Congressman Charles B. Rangel of Manhattan.

title: Shomwa Shamapande
text: Shomwa has also served as a senior communications and government affairs adviser for the Campaign for Better Schools, the corporate public relations firm of Robinson, Lerer & Montgomery, the Democratic National Committee, Former US Secretary of State Madeleine Albright's United Nations Commission for the Legal Empowerment of the Poor and several global corporations including MasterCard and Pfizer Pharmaceuticals.

title: Shomwa Shamapande
text: And in 2011, Shomwa was hired as Global Communications and Media Director for Africare, a major NGO ($60 million) focused on humanitarian and development assistance for Africa.

title: The Mask of Dimitrios
text: The Mask of Dimitrios is a 1944 American film noir directed by Jean Negulesco and written by Frank Gruber, based on the 1939 novel of the same name written by Eric Ambler (in the United States, it was published as "A Coffin for Dimitrios").

title: The Mask of Dimitrios
text: Ambler is known as a major influence on writers and a developer of the modern thriller genre.

title: Rough Shoot
text: Rough Shoot, also known as Shoot First, is a 1953 British thriller film starring Joel McCrea and Evelyn Keyes, and featuring Herbert Lom, Marius Goring and Roland Culver.

title: Rough Shoot
text: It was directed by Robert Parrish and written by Eric Ambler, based on the 1951 novel "A Rough Shoot" by Geoffrey Household.

title: Nicki Shields
text: Nicki Shields is a British television presenter best known as the Formula E pit lane reporter.

title: Nicki Shields
text: A biological sciences graduate of the University of Bristol, she got a job for UBS which she left after one year to found the social media company Starcount.com.

title: Nicki Shields
text: Shields began her presenting and reporting career in 2012 and her work has included the "BBC One" show "Escape to the Country" and "Supercharged" on "CNN International".

title: The New Lot
text: The New Lot is a 1943 British drama film directed by Carol Reed and starring Eric Ambler, Robert Donat, Kathleen Harrison, Bernard Lee, Raymond Huntley, John Laurie, Peter Ustinov and Austin Trevor, with music by Richard Addinsell.

title: The New Lot
text: The film follows five new recruits from different background and their experiences as they join the army.

title: The Cruel Sea (1953 film)
text: The Cruel Sea is a 1953 British war film starring Jack Hawkins, Donald Sinden, Denholm Elliott, Stanley Baker, Liam Redmond, Virginia McKenna and Moira Lister.

title: The Cruel Sea (1953 film)
text: The film, which was made by Ealing Studios seven years after the end of the Second World War, was directed by Charles Frend and produced by Leslie Norman.

title: The Cruel Sea (1953 film)
text: It is based on the best selling novel of the same name by former naval officer Nicholas Monsarrat, though the screenplay by Eric Ambler omits some of Monsarrat's grimmest moments.

title: David Coderre
text: David Coderre is the best known advocate of Computer Assisted Audit Tools and Techniques (CAATTs) in the world.

title: David Coderre
text: CAATTs are computer tools that assist auditors in their profession.

title: David Coderre
text: In three books, a package of prewritten scripts, and over 20 published articles David Coderre has garnered a reputation in a small but evolving field.

title: David Coderre
text: David Coderre is best known for his work with Audit Command Language (ACL.)

title: David Coderre
text: ACL is a computing language designed specifically for the audit profession.

title: David Coderre
text: Because of his contributions to the field of Internal Audit and CAATTS, David Coderre was awarded a lifetime achievement award by the Canadian body of the Institute of Internal Auditors.

title: The Card (1952 film)
text: The Card is a black-and-white film version of the novel by Arnold Bennett.

title: The Card (1952 film)
text: Entitled The Promoter for its American audience, it was adapted by Eric Ambler and directed by Ronald Neame.

title: The Card (1952 film)
text: It was released in 1952.

title: The Card (1952 film)
text: It starred Alec Guinness as Denry Machin, Petula Clark as Nellie Cotterill, Valerie Hobson as the Countess, and Glynis Johns as Ruth Earp.

title: The Card (1952 film)
text: The film was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Sound.

title: Carol Shields
text: Carol Ann Shields, {'1': ", '2': ", '3': ", '4': "} (née Warner; June 2, 1935 – July 16, 2003) was an American-born Canadian novelist and short story writer.

title: Carol Shields
text: She is best known for her 1993 novel "The Stone Diaries", which won the U.S. Pulitzer Prize for Fiction as well as the Governor General's Award in Canada.

title: Kevin Shields
text: Kevin Patrick Shields (born 21 May 1963) is an American-born Irish musician, singer-songwriter, composer and producer, best known as the vocalist and guitarist of the alternative rock band My Bloody Valentine.

title: Kevin Shields
text: Shields performed in a number of small unsuccessful bands in Dublin, Ireland, as a teenager, before forming My Bloody Valentine with drummer Colm Ó Cíosóig in 1983.

title: Kevin Shields
text: Although initially experiencing limited success, the band would later become extremely influential on the evolution of alternative rock with their two original studio albums "Isn't Anything" (1988) and "Loveless" (1991), both of which pioneered a subgenre known as shoegazing.

title: Kevin Shields
text: Shields' texturised guitar sound and his experimentation with his guitars' tremolo systems resulted in the creation of the "glide guitar" technique, which became a recognisable aspect of My Bloody Valentine's sound, along with his meticulous production techniques.

title: W. F. Morris
text: Walter Frederick Morris (31 May 1892–1975) was an English novelist, best known for his mystery novel, "" (1929), set in World War I.

title: W. F. Morris
text: Critic A.C. Ward praised this as "an adventure-mystery war-novel with an admirably ingenious and leak-proof plot.

title: W. F. Morris
text: This book combines a brilliant exercise of creative imagination with a remarkable ability to reproduce, vividly, first-hand experiences, and there is one brief battle-scene...which is memorable.”

title: W. F. Morris
text: ("The Nineteen-Twenties, Literature and Ideas in the Post-War Decade", 1930, pp 163–4).

title: W. F. Morris
text: Spy novelist Eric Ambler named the book as one of his top five spy stories (in the Afterword to the 1952 edition of his "Epitaph for a Spy").

title: Solway Group
text: The Solway Investment Group Limited, Solway Group, or Solway Investment Group, The Solway Investment Group, GmbH, is a private international mining and metals group located in Switzerland.

title: Solway Group
text: Main areas of expertise are industrial project development, relaunching production assets, and developing new projects.

title: Solway Group
text: With 100% EU capital and operational offices in Luxembourg, Switzerland and Estonia.

title: Solway Group
text: The Group comprises a number of core investments and operations focused primarily on the metals and mining sector - particularly nickel mining and production.

title: Solway Group
text: Solway also manages its own direct investment fund with main interests in commercial real estate and information technologies.

title: Solway Group
text: The Group conducts operations in Macedonia, Ukraine, Indonesia and Guatemala.

title: Solway Group
text: Solway is an investment firm established in 1992 with assets in mining, iron, steel, IT, and property.

title: Solway Group
text: The firm has assets in Central and Eastern Europe, Latin America, and the Asia Pacific region.

title: Lord Howe Island
text: Lord Howe Island ( ; formerly Lord Howe's Island) is an irregularly crescent-shaped volcanic remnant in the Tasman Sea between Australia and New Zealand, directly east of mainland Port Macquarie, and about southwest of Norfolk Island.

title: Lord Howe Island
text: It is about long and between wide with an area of , though just of that comprises the low-lying developed part of the island.

title: Lord Howe Island
text: Along the west coast there is a sandy semi-enclosed sheltered coral reef lagoon.

title: Lord Howe Island
text: Most of the population lives in the north, while the south is dominated by forested hills rising to the highest point on the island, Mount Gower (875 m ).

title: Lord Howe Island
text: The Lord Howe Island Group comprises 28 islands, islets and rocks.

title: Lord Howe Island
text: Apart from Lord Howe Island itself the most notable of these is the volcanic and uninhabited Ball's Pyramid about to the southeast of Howe.

title: Lord Howe Island
text: To the North lies a cluster of seven small uninhabited islands called the Admiralty Group.

title: Catholic Church in Ireland
text: The Catholic Church in Ireland (Irish: "Eaglais Chaitliceach na hÉireann" ) is part of the worldwide Catholic Church in communion with the Pope.

title: Catholic Church in Ireland
text: With 3.7 million members, it is the most populous Christian denomination in Ireland, comprising 78.3% of the population.

title: Catholic Church in Ireland
text: The Primate of All Ireland is the Archishop of Armagh and the Church ministers to Catholics on an All-Ireland basis; covering both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland.

title: Catholic Church in Ireland
text: The Irish Catholic Bishops' Conference is a consultative body for ordinaries in Ireland.

title: Young People's Socialist League
text: The Young People's Socialist League (YPSL), founded in 1989, is the official youth arm of the Socialist Party USA.

title: Young People's Socialist League
text: The group comprises party members under the age of 30.

title: Official Ireland
text: "Official Ireland" (Irish: "Éire Oifigiúil" ) is a term widely used in the Republic of Ireland to denote The Establishment.

title: Official Ireland
text: It refers to the most powerful figures in the media, the Catholic Church, and the political parties, who control the national debate.

title: Mangsee Islands
text: The Mangsee Islands are a group of two small islands in the far south west portion of the Philippines.

title: Mangsee Islands
text: The group comprises North Mangsee Island and South Mangsee Island.

title: Mangsee Islands
text: Together they form a barangay within the Balabac, a municipality of the province of Palawan.

title: Mangsee Islands
text: As at the time of the 2010 Census the population of the Mangsee Islands was 8,433.

title: 2017 Rugby League World Cup Group C
text: 2017 Rugby League World Cup Group C is one of four groups in the 2017 Rugby League World Cup.

title: 2017 Rugby League World Cup Group C
text: The group comprises Papua New Guinea, Wales and Ireland

title: Booty Luv
text: Booty Luv (originally called Booty Luv and Cherise & Nadia), were a British dance group formed in June 2006 via the Hed Kandi label.

title: Booty Luv
text: The group comprises two R&B vocalists, Cherise Roberts and Nadia Shepherd, both of whom were in the original line-up of the hip hop and R&B group Big Brovaz.

title: Booty Luv
text: To date, they have released one BPI Silver-certified studio solo album as a twosome, and have had five top twenty hits in the UK.

title: Booty Luv
text: They have also achieved international success, gaining hits in Ireland, Poland, the Netherlands and Germany.

title: Arbuthnott-Garvock Group
text: The Arbuthnott-Garvock Group (or Arbuthnot-Garvock Group) is a Devonian lithostratigraphic group (a sequence of rock strata) in central Scotland.

title: Arbuthnott-Garvock Group
text: The name is derived from the village of Arbuthnott in Aberdeenshire and the Hill of Garvock near Laurencekirk.

title: Arbuthnott-Garvock Group
text: The group comprises the previously separate overlying Garvock Group and the underlying Arbuthnott Group.

title: 2013 Rugby League World Cup Group A
text: 2013 Rugby League World Cup Group A is one of the four groups in the 2013 Rugby League World Cup.

title: 2013 Rugby League World Cup Group A
text: The group comprises Australia, England, Fiji and Ireland.

title: Rebels of the Heavenly Kingdom
text: Rebels of the Heavenly Kingdom is a 1983 children's book written by American novelist Katherine Paterson.

title: Rebels of the Heavenly Kingdom
text: Set during the Taiping Rebellion in China, it focuses on Wang Lee, a 15-year-old peasant boy who is abducted into a secret rebel organization.

title: Rebels of the Heavenly Kingdom
text: Mei Lin, a female soldier, teaches Wang Lee to read and instructs him in the movement’s dogma.

title: Rebels of the Heavenly Kingdom
text: Wang Lee’s transition into being a soldier is marked with acts of violence and betrayal, and he is forced through difficult circumstance to learn humility as part of his training.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (novel)
text: Bridge to Terabithia is a work of children's literature about two lonely children who create a magical forest kingdom.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (novel)
text: It was written by Katherine Paterson and was published in 1977 by Thomas Crowell.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (novel)
text: In 1978, it won the Newbery Medal.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (novel)
text: Paterson drew inspiration for the novel from a real event that occurred in August 1974 when a friend of her son was struck by lightning.

title: Bread and Roses, Too
text: Bread and Roses, Too is a 2006 children's historical novel written by American novelist Katherine Paterson.

title: Bread and Roses, Too
text: Set in Lawrence, Massachusetts in 1912 in the aftermath of the Lawrence Textile Strike (also known as the Bread and Roses Strike), the book focuses on the Italian-born daughter of mill workers who finds herself becoming the protector of a boy who is afraid to return home to his abusive father.

title: The Great Gilly Hopkins (film)
text: The Great Gilly Hopkins is a 2015 American comedy-drama film directed by Stephen Herek and written by David L. Paterson.

title: The Great Gilly Hopkins (film)
text: It is based on Katherine Paterson's 1978 children's book of the same name.

title: The Great Gilly Hopkins (film)
text: The film stars Sophie Nélisse, Julia Stiles, Glenn Close, Kathy Bates, Octavia Spencer, Bill Cobbs, and Billy Magnussen.

title: The Great Gilly Hopkins (film)
text: The film was released on October 7, 2016, by Lionsgate Premiere.

title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
text: The Great Gilly Hopkins is a realistic children's novel by Katherine Paterson.

title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
text: It was published by Crowell in 1978 and it won the U.S. National Book Award next year.

title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
text: In 2012 it was ranked number 63 among all-time children's novels in a survey published by "School Library Journal" – the third of three books by Paterson in the top 100.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (2007 film)
text: Bridge to Terabithia is a 2007 American drama film directed by Gábor Csupó and adapted for film by David L. Paterson and Jeff Stockwell.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (2007 film)
text: The film is based on the Katherine Paterson novel of the same name, and released by Walt Disney Pictures.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (2007 film)
text: The film stars Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Robert Patrick, Bailee Madison and Zooey Deschanel.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (2007 film)
text: "Bridge to Terabithia" tells the story of Jesse Aarons and Leslie Burke, 12-year-old neighbors who create a fantasy world called Terabithia and spend their free time together in an abandoned tree house.

title: Come Sing, Jimmy Jo
text: Come Sing, Jimmy Jo is a 1985 children's novel written by American novelist Katherine Paterson.

title: Come Sing, Jimmy Jo
text: The book focuses on a West Virginia boy named James Johnson, whose parents are bluegrass music performers.

title: Come Sing, Jimmy Jo
text: When it is discovered that James has previously unrecognized musical talent, his parents force him to take the stage name "Jimmy Jo" and perform with them.

title: Come Sing, Jimmy Jo
text: But problems arise when it becomes evident that the child’s talents are greater than those of his parents, which creates strain for both the adults (particularly the jealous mother) and the emotionally conflicted boy.

title: Sligo Creek
text: Sligo Creek is a free-flowing tributary of the Northwest Branch of the Anacostia River in Maryland.

title: Sligo Creek
text: (The Anacostia, in turn, feeds into the Potomac River and eventually empties into the Atlantic Ocean via Chesapeake Bay.)

title: Sligo Creek
text: The creek is approximately 9.1 mi long, with a drainage area of about 11.6 sqmi .

title: Sligo Creek
text: It also inspired Katherine Paterson to write the Newbery Medal award-winning book Bridge to Terabithia.

title: The Master Puppeteer
text: The Master Puppeteer (1975) is a historical novel for children by Katherine Paterson.

title: The Master Puppeteer
text: It won the 1977 U.S. National Book Award in category Children’s Literature.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (1985 film)
text: Bridge to Terabithia was the name of a telefilm for PBS in 1985, starring Annette O'Toole, Julian Coutts, and Julie Beaulieu.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (1985 film)
text: It was shot in Edmonton, Alberta.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (1985 film)
text: The film is based on the children's novel of the same name by Katherine Paterson.

title: Spectrum News Buffalo
text: Spectrum News Buffalo (formerly Time Warner Cable News Buffalo) is an American cable news television channel that is owned by Charter Communications, as an affiliate of its Spectrum News slate of regional news channels.

title: Spectrum News Buffalo
text: The channel provides 24-hour rolling news coverage focused primarily on the Buffalo metropolitan area and Western New York.

title: Spectrum News Buffalo
text: The channel is carried on Time Warner Cable systems throughout Western New York on channel 9; it is also carried on TWC's Rochester system on digital channel 1277.

title: Spectrum News Buffalo
text: A modified feed of the channel, "Cable 8 News" (C8N), is available on Spectrum's Jamestown system, featuring a mix of local news content and content from Spectrum News Buffalo.

title: Joe Scarborough
text: Charles Joseph Scarborough ( ; born April 9, 1963) is an American cable news and talk radio host.

title: Joe Scarborough
text: He is currently the co-host of "Morning Joe" on MSNBC, and previously hosted "Scarborough Country" on the same channel.

title: Joe Scarborough
text: Scarborough was previously a lawyer and a politician, and served in the United States House of Representatives from 1995 to 2001 as a Republican from the 1st district of Florida.

title: David Gold (talk radio host)
text: David Gold is an American conservative talk radio host.

title: David Gold (talk radio host)
text: Gold, who has been a talk radio host since the mid-1970s, one of the first U.S. conservative talk radio hosts.

title: David Gold (talk radio host)
text: His philosophy has been characterized as in the conservative/libertarian vein.

title: Mike Hogan (sportscaster)
text: Mike Hogan (born 1963 in Kingston, Ontario) is a Canadian sportscaster who is a sports talk radio host on TSN Radio 1050 in Toronto.

title: Mike Hogan (sportscaster)
text: He also serves as the play-by-play voice for the Toronto Argonauts of the Canadian Football League for that station's gameday broadcasts.

title: Mike Hogan (sportscaster)
text: Hogan was formerly a long time sports talk radio host on Toronto station CJCL (AM), branded "The Fan 590", until he was relieved of those duties on June 24, 2010.

title: Mike Hogan (sportscaster)
text: On 2017 Oscar Vanity fair party 1st live broadcast Mike Hogan was the podcast hosts.

title: Morning Joe
text: Morning Joe is a weekday NBC News morning news and talk show, airing from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. Eastern Time on the network's cable news channel MSNBC.

title: Morning Joe
text: It features former GOP representative Joe Scarborough providing both enterprise reporting and discussion on the news of the day in a panel format with co-hosts Mika Brzezinski and Willie Geist.

title: Morning Joe
text: It was created as the replacement for "Imus in the Morning," which was cancelled in April 2007 after simulcasting on MSNBC since 1996.

title: Ronn Owens
text: Ronn Owens (born Ronald Lowenstein on October 17, 1945, in New York City), is an American talk radio host.

title: Ronn Owens
text: Owens was the sole remaining weekday talk radio host on KGO in San Francisco after KGO was reorganized as an all-news station in December 2011.

title: Steve Malzberg
text: Stephen D. Malzberg (born April 20, 1959) is an American television and radio host, syndicated columnist, and political commentator.

title: Steve Malzberg
text: He is the host of "The Steve Malzberg Show", a cable news and opinion show on Newsmax TV.

title: Steve Malzberg
text: He has also hosted "The Steve Malzberg Show" on various talk radio outlets.

title: Spectrum News Rochester
text: Spectrum News Rochester (formerly Time Warner Cable News Rochester) is an American cable news television channel that is owned by Charter Communications through its acquisition of Time Warner Cable in May 2016, as an affiliate of its Spectrum News slate of regional news channels.

title: Spectrum News Rochester
text: The channel provides 24-hour rolling news coverage focused primarily on Rochester, New York and the nearby Genesee River and Finger Lakes regions.

title: Sean Hannity
text: Sean Patrick Hannity (born December 30, 1961) is an American talk show host, author, and conservative political commentator.

title: Sean Hannity
text: Hannity is the host of "The Sean Hannity Show", a nationally syndicated talk radio show.

title: Sean Hannity
text: He also hosts a cable news show, "Hannity", on Fox News Channel.

title: Talk radio
text: Talk radio is a radio format containing discussion about topical issues and consisting entirely or almost entirely of original spoken word content rather than outside music.

title: Talk radio
text: Jason Culpepper is highly recognized as the father of talk radio.

title: Talk radio
text: Jason a Jacksonville native rose to social prominence during the World War utilizing talk radio to warn french and american troops of German U boats.

title: Talk radio
text: Most shows are regularly hosted by a single individual, and often feature interviews with a number of different guests.

title: Talk radio
text: Talk radio typically includes an element of listener participation, usually by broadcasting live conversations between the host and listeners who "call in" (usually via telephone) to the show.

title: Talk radio
text: Listener contributions are usually screened by a show's producers in order to maximize audience interest and, in the case of commercial talk radio, attract advertisers.

title: Talk radio
text: Generally, the shows are organized into segments, each separated by a pause for advertisements; however, in public or non-commercial radio, music is sometimes played in place of commercials to separate the program segments.

title: Talk radio
text: Variations of talk radio include conservative talk, hot talk, liberal talk (increasingly known as progressive talk) and sports talk.

title: 2006 Alabama Crimson Tide football team
text: The 2006 Alabama Crimson Tide football team represented the University of Alabama for the 2006 NCAA Division I FBS football season trying to improve from a 10–2 record in the 2005 season.

title: 2006 Alabama Crimson Tide football team
text: The Tide was led by head coach Mike Shula entering his fourth year at Alabama.

title: 2006 Alabama Crimson Tide football team
text: Despite a strong 5–2 start, they finished out the season by losing four of their final five games.

title: 2006 Alabama Crimson Tide football team
text: The team closed the regular season at 6–6 (4–4, SEC) and lost for a fifth-straight time to rival Auburn.

title: 2006 Alabama Crimson Tide football team
text: Following the loss Shula was fired as head coach and defensive coordinator Joe Kines served as interim head coach for the bowl game.

title: Larry Coker
text: Larry Edward Coker (born June 23, 1948) is an American football coach and former player.

title: Larry Coker
text: From 2001 to 2006, Coker served as the head coach at the University of Miami.

title: Larry Coker
text: His 2001 Miami team was named the consensus national champion after an undefeated season that culminated with a victory in the Rose Bowl over Nebraska.

title: Larry Coker
text: In the process of winning the championship, Coker became the 2nd head coach since 1948 to win the national championship in his first season.

title: Larry Coker
text: (Bennie Oosterbaan from the University of Michigan and Dennis Erickson of Miami were the last 2 head coaches to accomplish this feat.)

title: Larry Coker
text: Coker was fired by Miami on November 24, 2006 following his sixth loss that season.

title: Larry Coker
text: After a stint as a television analyst for ESPNU, Coker was announced as the head coach for UTSA, whose Roadrunners football team began play in 2011.

title: Larry Coker
text: Coker resigned as UTSA coach on January 5, 2016.

title: Bruce Pearl
text: Bruce Allan Pearl (born March 18, 1960) is an American college basketball coach, and the head coach of the Auburn Tigers men's basketball program.

title: Bruce Pearl
text: He previously served as the head coach at Tennessee, Milwaukee, and Southern Indiana.

title: Bruce Pearl
text: Pearl led Southern Indiana to a Division II national championship in 1995 and was named Division II Coach of the Year by the National Association of Basketball Coaches.

title: Bruce Pearl
text: He has won three conference championships and two conference tournament championships as a Division I head coach, and has made eight NCAA Tournament appearances.

title: Bruce Pearl
text: Pearl was named Coach of the Year by Sporting News in 2006 and was awarded the Adolph Rupp Cup in 2008.

title: Bruce Pearl
text: He also served as the head coach for the Maccabi USA men's basketball team that won the gold medal at the 2009 Maccabiah Games.

title: Richard Jacob
text: Richard L. Jacob Ph.D. (born September 24, 1958, in Niagara Falls, New York), is a sports coach and educator.

title: Richard Jacob
text: He was head coach of Buffalo's Professional Basketball Team Buffalo Rapids from 2005 through 2006.

title: Richard Jacob
text: He left the position in November 2006 to become the interim Chairman of the Business Department Medaille College.

title: Richard Jacob
text: He currently is an associate professor of Sport and Business at Medaille and is the head of the college's Sport Management program.

title: Richard Jacob
text: He was named the General Manager and Head Coach of the new Buffalo Sharks team in 2008, before that team closed and moved to the Premier Basketball League.

title: Richard Jacob
text: Jacob was then named the head coach for the Buffalo Stampede, but soon resigned for personal reasons.

title: Richard Jacob
text: He formerly coached at Niagara University, Niagara County Community College, the University at Buffalo, Villa Maria College, Daemen College, Buffalo State College, and Medaille.

title: Brian Knorr
text: Brian Knorr (born December 20, 1963) is a college football coach.

title: Brian Knorr
text: He was most recently the defensive coordinator for the Indiana Hoosiers football team.

title: Brian Knorr
text: He graduated from the Air Force Academy and played quarterback.

title: Brian Knorr
text: He also was an assistant at the Air Force Academy when he went to Ohio University with Jim Grobe.

title: Brian Knorr
text: He was the head coach of the Ohio Bobcats program from 2001 to 2004.

title: Brian Knorr
text: He was fired on November 18, 2004, after he compiled an 11–35 (.239) record in four seasons.

title: Brian Knorr
text: He was replaced by the more successful Frank Solich.

title: Brian Knorr
text: He previously served as a defensive coordinator under the previous head coach, Grobe.

title: Brian Knorr
text: His best season came in 2004, when his team went 4–7, including 2–6 in conference play.

title: Brian Knorr
text: Until February 2008 he served as an assistant head coach at the Air Force Academy under head coach Troy Calhoun.

title: Brian Knorr
text: In 2008, he accepted a position that will reunite him with Grobe at Wake Forest University.

title: Brian Knorr
text: In January, 2016, Knorr did not have his contract renewed by Indiana.

title: Maggie Dixon Award
text: The Maggie Dixon Division I Rookie Coach of the Year Award is an award given annually since 2007 to thehead coach in women's college basketball in the NCAA Division I competition who achieves great success in their first year as a Division I head coach.

title: Maggie Dixon Award
text: Given by the Women's Basketball Coaches Association (WBCA), the award is named for former women's head coach Maggie Dixon, who coached at Army for the 2005–06 season before suddenly dying due to valve complications from an enlarged heart.

title: Maggie Dixon Award
text: Dixon had been named head coach just 11 days before the start of the season but led the Black Knights to a 20–11 record and won the Patriot League tournament championship.

title: Maggie Dixon Award
text: It was Army's first basketball team, men or women, to play in the NCAA Tournament.

title: Maggie Dixon Award
text: Although Army would lose in the first round to Tennessee, Dixon was named the Patriot League Coach of the Year and received much praise from the college basketball community for her coaching job in just her first season.

title: Maggie Dixon Award
text: On April 6, 2006, Dixon died at the age of 28 to what her brother, Pitt men's head coach Jamie Dixon, described as an "arrhythmic episode to her heart."

title: Holly Bruder
text: Holly Bruder is an American college softball coach.

title: Holly Bruder
text: She currently serves as head coach of NCAA Division I Lamar University softball team.

title: Holly Bruder
text: She has been head coach as Lamar since the program was restarted in 2012.

title: Holly Bruder
text: From 2008 to 2011, she served as head coach at NCAA Division I Morehead State.

title: Holly Bruder
text: Prior to the seasons at Morehead State, she served as head coach at NCAA Division III Denison University for six years (2002–2007).

title: Holly Bruder
text: Before her head coaching assignments, Bruder was assistant coach at Bluffton College in 2001 after beginning her college coaching career as an assistant coach at Albion College (1999–2000).

title: 2009 Virginia Cavaliers football team
text: The 2009 Virginia Cavaliers football team represented the University of Virginia in the 2009 NCAA Division I FBS football season as a member of the Coastal Division of the Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC).

title: 2009 Virginia Cavaliers football team
text: The Cavaliers were led by ninth-year head coach Al Groh.

title: 2009 Virginia Cavaliers football team
text: The previous season, Groh fired his offensive coordinator, his son Mike Groh, and replaced him with Gregg Brandon, who had himself been fired as the head coach at Bowling Green.

title: 2009 Virginia Cavaliers football team
text: Brandon installed the spread offense at Virginia.

title: 2009 Virginia Cavaliers football team
text: The Cavaliers finished the season 3–9, 2–6 in conference play and failed to qualify for a bowl game.

title: 2009 Virginia Cavaliers football team
text: Following the conclusion of the season Virginia dismissed Al Groh as head coach and hired Mike London as his replacement.

title: Buzz Peterson
text: Robert Bower "Buzz" Peterson, Jr. (born May 17, 1963) is an American college basketball coach.

title: Buzz Peterson
text: Most recently, Peterson was the head coach of the UNC Wilmington Seahawks men's basketball team.

title: Buzz Peterson
text: He was fired by UNC Wilmington at the conclusion of the 2014 season.

title: Buzz Peterson
text: Peterson was the head coach of the Tennessee Volunteers basketball team for four years before being fired in 2005.

title: Buzz Peterson
text: He previously coached a second stint at Appalachian State—he coached the 2009–10 Mountaineers, as well as the 1996 to 2000 squads.

title: Buzz Peterson
text: Previously, he was the men's basketball head coach at the University of Tulsa and at Coastal Carolina University, a position he held until mid-2007, when he left the program to be executive (Director of Player Personnel) with the Charlotte Bobcats of the NBA.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: Phillip Reginald "Reggie" Witherspoon (born February 21, 1961) is the head coach of the Canisius College men's basketball team and the former head coach of the University at Buffalo men's college basketball team.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: He was fired after the 2012-13 season.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: He was the head coach at Erie Community College, and head coach and assistant coach at Sweet Home High School before he was hired as the interim head coach at Buffalo in December 1999.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: Witherspoon was named full-time head coach on March 10, 2000.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: He was the first African American named head coach of a varsity sports team in any Western New York suburban school district.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: Witherspoon served one season as an assistant at Alabama under head coach Anthony Grant.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: In 2015, Witherspoon was let go by Alabama when Grant was replaced by Avery Johnson.

title: Reggie Witherspoon (basketball)
text: He was subsequently named as an assistant on Matt McCall's staff at UT-Chattanooga.

title: Hänt Extra
text: Hänt Extra is a Swedish language weekly celebrity and youth magazine published by Aller Media in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Nikola Mladenov
text: Nikola Mladenov (Macedonian: Никола Младенов ; 10 March 1964 – 26 March 2013) was a Macedonian journalist, actor, founder and managing editor of the weekly newspaper "Fokus", widely regarded as one of the most reputable journalists in Macedonia, who along with his colleagues from the newspaper "Mlad borec" is considered to have laid the basis for the pluralistic principles in the Macedonian journalism.

title: Nikola Mladenov
text: The "Award for best research story of the year – Nikola Mladenov", which is awarded by the Macedonian Institute for Media, is named after him.

title: Tea Moderna (magazine)
text: Tea Moderna (Macedonian: Теа Модерна ) is a Macedonian woman's weekly magazine women.

title: Makedonsko Sonce
text: Makedonsko Sonce (Macedonian: ; English: Macedonian Sun ) is a weekly magazine published in the Republic of Macedonia.

title: Makedonsko Sonce
text: The title means "Macedonian Sun", referring to the Vergina Sun, which is used in the logo of the magazine.

title: Makedonsko Sonce
text: It was established by Gjorgija (George) Atanasoski and the first edition was published on June 24, 1994.

title: Makedonsko Sonce
text: It describes its own political stance as affirming "Macedonian national values, not only on territory of Macedonia but also in the other parts of ethnic Macedonia".

title: Orange Field Tea Factory
text: Orange Field Tea Factory is engaged in the manufacture of Black tea catering to the Middle - Eastern market and the C-I-S Countries (Commonwealth of Independent States).

title: Orange Field Tea Factory
text: The factory is situated in Panwilatenne, a very small hamlet in Kandy District, Sri Lanka and located within close proximity to Loolecondera Estate where tea was planted for the first time in the Island by James Taylor (Ceylon).

title: Orange Field Tea Factory
text: Established in the year 1950 the factory produces Black Tea from leaves grown by about 750 small plantation holders in the westen medium elevational category, at an altitude of between 650 meters to 1000 meters above sea level.

title: Orange Field Tea Factory
text: Orange Field Tea Factory is registered with The Sri Lanka Tea Board and also is a member of the Ethical Tea Partnership.

title: Orange Field Tea Factory
text: The average annual production for the past few years has been 500,000 kg.

title: Orange Field Tea Factory
text: The produce is sold weekly at the Colombo tea auctions conducted by the Colombo Brokers' Association, monitored by the Colombo Tea Traders Association.

title: Hänt Bild
text: Hänt Bild is a celebrity magazine published in Sweden.

title: Hänt Bild
text: The magazine was started in 2003.

title: Hänt Bild
text: It is part of Aller Media AB.

title: Hänt Bild
text: It is published on a weekly basis.

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: Per "Henrik" Dorsin (born 20 November 1977) is a Swedish actor, comedian, singer and revue-artist.

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: Dorsin started his career as an extra in the 1995 film Vinterviken.

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: He started his television career in the satire-show Detta har hänt in 1998.

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: He then worked as a revue-artist and dramatist, he produced the revue Slängar av sleven, and has participated in shows with the theater group Stockholms blodbad.

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: He also worked with the SVT entertainment show Säpop, and he has been part of the TV4 comedy show "Parlamentet".

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: In 2007 he won the Karamelodiktstipendiet by Povel Ramel.

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: In 2014 Dorsin toured with the comedy play "Henrik Dorsin - näktergalen från Holavedsvägen".

title: Henrik Dorsin
text: And since 2014 Dorsin runs the theater Scalateatern in Stockholm.

title: Football Weekly
text: Football Weekly is a podcast about football, hosted by "The Guardian" newspaper in the United Kingdom.

title: Football Weekly
text: Originally provided weekly (as its name suggests), its popularity led to a mid-weekly spinoff, "Football Weekly Extra".

title: Football Weekly
text: "Football Weekly" airs on Mondays during the European football season, after the weekend's fixtures, while "Football Weekly Extra" airs on Thursdays.

title: Football Weekly
text: During the Euro 2008, World Cup 2010, Euro 2012, World Cup 2014 and Euro 2016 tournaments the podcast aired daily.

title: Den Za Nas
text: Den Za Nas (in Macedonian: Ден за нас ) is the title of the fourth Macedonian language album by the Macedonian superstar Toše Proeski released in 2004.

title: Den Za Nas
text: It is a 2-CD set which contains all of the songs performed on the National final in order to select a song for the Eurovision Song Contest 2004 with which Proeski would represent Macedonia in the contest.

title: Den Za Nas
text: The winning song was "Life" which qualified for the final and finished on the 14th place in the final.

title: Den Za Nas
text: Some extra songs such as "Dzvezdo Severnice", "Me Sakaš So Zborovi", "Ima Li Den Za Nas" and others were recorded especially for the album.

title: 2015 Macedonian Football Supercup
text: The 2015 Macedonian Supercup was the 3rd Macedonian Football Supercup, an annual Macedonian football match played between the winners of the previous season's First League and Macedonian Cup.

title: 2015 Macedonian Football Supercup
text: The game will be played between Rabotnički, who beat Teteks to win the 2015 Macedonian Cup Final, and Vardar, champions of the 2014–15 First League.

title: 2015 Macedonian Football Supercup
text: It was played at Philip II Arena, Skopje and was won by Vardar by 4–3 on penalties after the match was ended 1–1 after the regular and extra time.

title: Interamerican Scout Jamboree
text: The Interamerican Scout Jamboree is the biggest event of the Interamerican Scout Region.

title: Interamerican Scout Jamboree
text: It is held every four years in a different country of the region.

title: Interamerican Scout Jamboree
text: The host country is elected during the Interamerican Scout Conference.

title: Interamerican Scout Jamboree
text: Ecuador was announced as the host of the 15th Interamerican Scout Jamboree at the XXV Interamerican Scout Conference in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on 21 September 2013.

title: Indian Scout (motorcycle)
text: The Indian Scout is a motorcycle built by the Indian Motocycle Company from 1920 to 1949.

title: Indian Scout (motorcycle)
text: It rivaled the Chief as Indian's most important model.

title: Indian Scout (motorcycle)
text: The 101 Scout, made from 1928 to 1931, has been called the best motorcycle Indian ever made.

title: Indian Scout (motorcycle)
text: A second line of Scouts, with lighter frames and reduced engine displacement, was introduced in 1932 alongside the Standard Scout, which replaced the 101 Scout and shared its frame with the Chief and the Four.

title: Indian Scout (motorcycle)
text: The small-displacement Scout and the Sport Scout, introduced in 1934, were continued until the end of civilian production in 1942.

title: Indian Scout (motorcycle)
text: Military versions of both models were used by US and other Allied forces during World War II.

title: Destinations
text: Girl Scout Destinations, formerly Wider Opportunities or Wider Ops, are events for individual Girl Scouts (ages 11 – 18) hosted by GSUSA or individual Girl Scout councils.

title: Destinations
text: Most Destinations are held within the United States, though each year there are trips abroad, such as to allow participants to be part of the US delegation to another country's national jamboree, or a World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts (WAGGGS) World Centre.

title: Destinations
text: They can range from two days to three weeks long.

title: Destinations
text: Most events are geared toward specified grade levels: Girl Scout Cadettes (6th - 8th grade), Girl Scout Seniors (9th and 10th grade), or Girl Scout Ambassadors (11th and 12th grade).

title: Destinations
text: Girls must go through an application process and sometimes an interview process before being chosen for a Destination.

title: Original Sound
text: Original Sound is a Los Angeles, California-based record label.

title: Original Sound
text: It was founded in the early 1950s by KPOP deejay Art Laboe.

title: Original Sound
text: It began as a small label that specialized in compiling and re-releasing "oldies" R&B and rock 'n' roll songs.

title: KOKO-FM
text: KOKO-FM is a classic hits radio station broadcasting from Kerman, California, for the Fresno area with studio and office located in Los Angeles, California.

title: KOKO-FM
text: KOKO 94 is the home for the Art Laboe Connection, and The Art Laboe Sunday Night Special.

title: KOKO-FM
text: Laboe, by the way, is the station's owner.

title: KOKO-FM
text: Its transmitter is in Kerman.

title: Scout Tufankjian
text: Scout Tufankjian is an Armenian-American photojournalist and author based in Brooklyn, New York.

title: Scout Tufankjian
text: She is well known for her photos of American President Barack Obama during his campaign leading up to his presidency.

title: Scout Tufankjian
text: She is also known for her photojournalism work on the Armenian diaspora.

title: Art Laboe
text: Art Laboe (born Arthur Egnoian on August 7, 1925) is an Armenian American disc jockey, songwriter, record producer, and radio station owner, generally credited with coining the term "Oldies But Goodies".

title: Arabs in India
text: A small but recognizable people with Arab origins have over time settled in the India.

title: Arabs in India
text: Genealogically they are grouped as "Indo-Arabs" or "Indians with Arab ancestry".

title: Arabs in India
text: Those who arrived in Kerala and Gujarat for trading goods were later recruited to the army.

title: Arabs in India
text: Most Arabs were traders, and businessmen who sold or traded silk, diamonds and other valuables resulting in wealthy business men.

title: Arabs in India
text: The city of Surat and villages within the city are known for Arab settlements.

title: Arabs in India
text: Variav and Randev are the few villages that Arabs started their lives in.

title: Arabs in India
text: In Hyderabad, Chaush are Arab community of Hadhrami descent whose ancestors were recruited as soldier by Nizam of Hyderabad.

title: Arabs in India
text: In coastal Karnataka, Iraqis arrived during the reign of Tipu Sultan.

title: Arabs in India
text: They claim their ancestry from Banu Assad.

title: Arabs in India
text: These population migrations may have been favored by both the Nizam of Hyderabad and Tipu Sultan of Mysore because both had their ancestral linkages to these populations.The Asaf Jahi Dynasty claimed Arab ancestry from Asir Province and Tipu Sultan from the Bani Hashim of Hijaz Province in Arabia.

title: Arabs in India
text: Many Arabs having Adnani ancestry such as Quraishi, Ansari, Sayyid tribes and other descendants of the Sahaba were employed by the Princely States in their military as they were found efficient during warfare.

title: Arabs in India
text: In Kerala, Syed Thangals of Hadhrami descent settled around 17th century as missionaries to propagate Islam.

title: Arabs in India
text: There are also Shia Sayyids in Northern region of country who claim descent from Wasit, Iraq like Zaidis although many Arab genealogists dispute this fact.

title: Arabs in India
text: Sunni Sayyid of the country also claim Arab descent from Sufi missionaries.

title: Arabs in India
text: Most of the Sufis migrated from Persia.

title: Arabs in India
text: Sunni Sayyids claim their Arab ancestry through Imam Hassan or Imam Hussain in which case their names may be Hassani, Hussaini or Hashmi.

title: Arabs in India
text: Some also claim descent from both and are termed ""Najeeb AlTarfayn"" or "Noble on both sides".

title: Arabs in India
text: Many Sufi Saints such as Abdul-Qadir Gilani and Moinuddin Chishti and their descendants claim themselves as "Najeeb AlTarfayn" although many genealogists dispute this fact.

title: Arabs in India
text: Sunni Sheikhs also claim Arab descent from Sufis or migrants.

title: Arabs in India
text: They don't know their tribe but trace lineage from Umar - Farooqi, Abu Bakr- Siddiqui, Uthman - Usmani and Ali - Alawi or Mir, who established the Rashidun Caliphate.

title: Arabs in India
text: Many who can vaguely trace their lineage to the Quraish tribe call themselves QuraishiMany having the name Ansari claim their lineage to the Ansar tribes of Madina Munawwara and the companions of the Prophet Muhammad such as Abu Ayyub al-Ansari.

title: Arabs in India
text: Many of the present Sheikhs converted from Hindu castes such as Kayasth and Rajput.

title: Chinese Australians
text: Chinese Australians () are Australian citizens of Chinese ancestry.

title: Chinese Australians
text: Chinese Australians are one of the largest groups of Overseas Chinese people, forming the largest Overseas Chinese community in Oceania.

title: Chinese Australians
text: Per capita, Australia has more people of Chinese ancestry than any country outside of Asia.

title: Chinese Australians
text: Many Chinese Australians are immigrants from Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan, and other countries such as Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore and the Philippines, while many are descendants of such immigrants.

title: Chinese Australians
text: Chinese Australians are also a subgroup of Asian Australians and East Asian Australians and represent the single largest minority ethnicity in the country.

title: Chinese Australians
text: As a whole, Australian residents identifying themselves as having Chinese ancestry made up 5.6% of those nominating their ancestry at the 2016 census and numbered 1,213,903.

title: Scout Promise
text: Since the publication of "Scouting for Boys" in 1908, all Scouts and Girl Guides around the world have taken a Scout (or Guide) promise or oath to live up to ideals of the movement, and subscribed to a Scout Law.

title: Scout Promise
text: The wording of the Scout Promise (or Oath) and Scout Law have varied slightly over time and from country to country.

title: Scout Promise
text: Some national organization promises are given below.

title: Scout Promise
text: Although most Scouting and Guiding organizations use the word "promise", a few such as the Boy Scouts of America tend to use "oath" instead.

title: Scout Promise
text: Typically, Scouts and Guides will make the three-fingered Scout Sign when reciting the promise.

title: Vancouver Whitecaps FC U-23
text: Vancouver Whitecaps FC U-23, formerly known as Whitecaps FC Reserves, was a Canadian soccer team based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

title: Vancouver Whitecaps FC U-23
text: Although founded in 2005 as part of the development system for the Vancouver Whitecaps USL First Division franchise, beginning in 2011 they became part of the development system for Major League Soccer's Vancouver Whitecaps FC.

title: Vancouver Whitecaps FC U-23
text: The team played in the Premier Development League (PDL), the fourth tier of the American Soccer Pyramid, in the Northwest Division of the Western Conference.

title: New York City Employment and Training Coalition
text: The New York City Employment and Training Coalition is an organization of workforce development and training providers based in New York City.

title: New York City Employment and Training Coalition
text: Members include community-based organizations, community colleges, unions and government agencies.

title: New York City Employment and Training Coalition
text: Seeking to serve as the primary connection point for a fragmented workforce development system, it advocates for effective workforce development policies, adequate program funding and effective use of federal stimulus dollars.

title: New York City Employment and Training Coalition
text: NYCETC also works to sustain an environment that supports a high quality workforce development system to meet the changing needs of New Yorkers.

title: New York City Employment and Training Coalition
text: NYCETC connects its members to policy makers, employers, best practices, and more through its forums, conferences and other outreach efforts.

title: New York City Employment and Training Coalition
text: NYCETC is also a key resource for news, analysis, and information through its flagship publication, "NYC Workforce Weekly", read by nearly 4,000 people a week.

title: Star Ship
text: Star Ship is a video game programmed by Bob Whitehead and published by Atari, Inc. for its Video Computer System (later known as the Atari 2600).

title: Star Ship
text: The game was one of the nine launch titles offered when the Atari 2600 launched on September 11,1977.

title: Star Ship
text: Based on the Atari arcade game "Starship 1", it was the first space-related game developed for the Atari VCS.

title: Star Ship
text: The re-branded Sears TeleGames version is titled Outer Space.

title: Portland Timbers U23s
text: Portland Timbers U23 is an American soccer team based in Salem, Oregon, United States.

title: Portland Timbers U23s
text: Although founded in 2008 as part of the development system for the Portland Timbers USSF D2 organization, beginning in 2011 they are part of the development system for the Major League Soccer franchise of the same name.

title: Portland Timbers U23s
text: The team plays in the USL Premier Development League (PDL), the fourth tier of the American Soccer Pyramid, in the Northwest Division of the Western Conference.

title: Manned Orbital Development System
text: The Manned Orbital Development System was created by the US Air Force Space System Division (SSD) in June 1962.

title: Manned Orbital Development System
text: It was to begin working on plans to use Gemini hardware as the first step in a new US Air Force man-in-space program called MODS (Manned Orbital Development System), a type of military space station that used Gemini spacecraft as ferry vehicles.

title: Manned Orbital Development System
text: The term Blue Gemini first showed up in August 1962 as part of a more specific proposal to fly six Gemini missions with Air Force pilots in a preliminary orientation and training phase of MODS.

title: Manned Orbital Development System
text: MODS was effectively superseded when the Manned Orbital Laboratory was announced in December 1963.

title: Shepardson Microsystems
text: Shepardson Microsystems, Inc. (SMI) was a small company producing operating systems and programming languages for the Atari 8-bit and Apple II computer families.

title: Shepardson Microsystems
text: SMI is most noted for authoring Atari's BASIC and Disk Operating System (DOS) products.

title: Surround (video game)
text: Surround is a video game programmed by Alan Miller and published by Atari, Inc. for the Atari Video Computer System (later known as the Atari 2600).

title: Surround (video game)
text: It was one of the nine Atari VCS launch titles released in September 1977.

title: Surround (video game)
text: "Surround" is an unofficial port of the arcade game "Blockade", released the previous year by Gremlin.

title: Surround (video game)
text: As such, it is the first home console version of the game that would become widely known across many platforms as "Snake".

title: Surround (video game)
text: As with other early Atari games, it was licensed to Sears, which released it under the name "Chase".

title: HP 64000
text: The HP 64000, introduced circa 1980, is a tool for developing hardware and software for products based on commercial microcomputers.

title: HP 64000
text: The earliest commercial 64000 development systems contain from one to six 64100A Development Stations sharing a hard drive and line printer.

title: HP 64000
text: This arrangement allowed up to six designers and engineers to use their workstations together, sharing the HPIB instrumentation bus and a hard drive and a line printer.

title: HP 64000
text: This was an innovative feature of the 64000 development system since other systems of the era used a timesharing system with a single system processor and memory, making for a more expensive and less flexible development system.

title: Atari Assembler Editor
text: The Atari Assembler Editor is a cartridge-based development system used to edit, assemble, and debug 6502 programs for the Atari 8-bit family of home computers.

title: Atari Assembler Editor
text: It was programmed by Kathleen O'Brien of Shepardson Microsystems.

title: Atari Assembler Editor
text: It was the first commercially available assembler for the Atari 8-bit computers.

title: Atari XEGS
text: The Atari XE Video Game System (Atari XEGS) is a home video game console released by Atari Corporation in 1987.

title: Atari XEGS
text: Based on Atari's 8-bit 65XE computer, the XEGS is compatible with the existing Atari 8-bit computer software library.

title: Atari XEGS
text: Additionally, it is able to operate as either a stand-alone console or full computer with the addition of its specially designed keyboard.

title: Atari XEGS
text: In computer mode, it may utilize the majority of peripherals released for Atari's 8-bit computer line.

title: Atari XEGS
text: Atari packaged the XEGS as a basic set consisting of only the console and joystick, and as a deluxe set consisting of the console, keyboard, joystick and light gun.

title: I've Been Working
text: "I've Been Working" is a song written by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison appearing on the album "His Band and the Street Choir", released in 1970.

title: I've Been Working
text: The song was first an outtake from Morrison's well received album "Astral Weeks" of 1968.

title: I've Been Working
text: Other versions of "I've Been Working" were recorded for Morrison's next album "Moondance", of which, three were released on the 2013 deluxe edition.

title: Domino (Van Morrison song)
text: "Domino" is a hit song written by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison.

title: Domino (Van Morrison song)
text: It is the opening track of his fourth studio album, "His Band and the Street Choir".

title: Domino (Van Morrison song)
text: This song is Morrison's personal musical tribute to New Orleans R&B singer and pianist Fats Domino.

title: His Band and the Street Choir
text: His Band and the Street Choir (also referred to as "Street Choir") is the fourth studio album by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison.

title: His Band and the Street Choir
text: It was released on 15 November 1970 by Warner Bros.

title: His Band and the Street Choir
text: Records.

title: His Band and the Street Choir
text: Originally titled "Virgo's Fool", "Street Choir" was renamed by Warner Bros. without Morrison's consent.

title: His Band and the Street Choir
text: Recording began in early 1970 with a demo session in a small church in Woodstock, New York.

title: His Band and the Street Choir
text: Morrison booked the A&R Studios on 46th Street in New York City in the second quarter of 1970 to produce two sessions of songs that were released on "His Band and the Street Choir".

title: The Caledonia Soul Orchestra
text: The Caledonia Soul Orchestra was the band created by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison in 1973.

title: The Caledonia Soul Orchestra
text: The band is often considered one of the tightest performing backup groups of the 1970s.

title: The Caledonia Soul Orchestra
text: The band was named after an eighteen-minute instrumental outtake on the "His Band and the Street Choir" album.

title: No Prima Donna: The Songs of Van Morrison
text: No Prima Donna: The Songs of Van Morrison released in October 1994 is the first tribute album for the songs of singer-songwriter Van Morrison.

title: No Prima Donna: The Songs of Van Morrison
text: The album was produced by Van Morrison and his friend for many years, Phil Coulter.

title: No Prima Donna: The Songs of Van Morrison
text: Morrison's longtime girlfriend, Michelle Rocca was the model on the cover of the album.

title: No Prima Donna: The Songs of Van Morrison
text: Morrison was actively involved in choosing the songs and the artists who performed them, which is unusual for most tribute albums.

title: Blue Money
text: "Blue Money" is a song written by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison.

title: Blue Money
text: It was the second of two Top Forty hits from his 1970 album, "His Band and the Street Choir" (the other being "Domino"), reaching #23 on the US charts.

title: Blue Money
text: The US single featured "Sweet Thing", from the album "Astral Weeks", as the B-side.

title: Blue Money
text: It was released as a single in the UK in June 1971 with a different B-side, "Call Me Up in Dreamland".

title: Blue Money
text: The song became Morrison's third best selling single of the 1970s, remaining on the charts for three months.

title: Duets: Re-working the Catalogue
text: Duets: Re-working the Catalogue is the 35th studio album recorded by Northern Irish singer/songwriter Van Morrison.

title: Duets: Re-working the Catalogue
text: It was released on 13 March 2015 on RCA Records.

title: Duets: Re-working the Catalogue
text: Produced by Van Morrison along with Don Was and Bob Rock, it consists of songs previously recorded by Morrison this time recorded as duets.

title: Duets: Re-working the Catalogue
text: Performances include the artists Bobby Womack, Steve Winwood, Mark Knopfler, Taj Mahal, Mavis Staples, Michael Bublé, Natalie Cole, George Benson, Gregory Porter, Clare Teal, P.J. Proby, Joss Stone, Georgie Fame, Mick Hucknall, Chris Farlowe, and Morrison’s daughter Shana Morrison.

title: I'll Be Your Lover, Too
text: "I'll Be Your Lover, Too" is a song written by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison.

title: I'll Be Your Lover, Too
text: It appears on the album "His Band and the Street Choir", released in 1970.

title: Call Me Up in Dreamland
text: "Call Me Up in Dreamland" is a song that was written by Northern Irish singer-songwriter, Van Morrison and included on his 1970 album, "His Band and the Street Choir".

title: Call Me Up in Dreamland
text: Brian Hinton describes the song as "life on the road, with 'radio' as a verb and laughing sax."

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3 is a compilation album by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison, that was released on 11 June 2007 in the UK with a digital version released in the U.S. on iTunes Store, on 12 June 2007.

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: Manhattan/EMI Music Catalog Marketing released the CD version of the album on 19 June 2007 in the United States.

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: This new two-disc collection of 31 tracks has been compiled by Morrison himself.

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: It offers an overview of his large volume of material since the release of "The Best of Van Morrison Volume Two" in 1993.

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: The album's thirty-one tracks include previously unreleased collaborations with Tom Jones ("Cry For Home") and Bobby Bland ("Tupelo Honey") as well as duets with John Lee Hooker, B.B. King and Ray Charles.

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: The 2003 duet with Ray Charles is "Crazy Love" a song originally recorded on Morrison's 1970 album "Moondance".

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: "Blue and Green" was previously donated to be used on the charity album "", which raised money for relief efforts intended for Gulf Coast victims devastated by hurricane Katrina.

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: The duet with Tom Jones, "Cry For Home" was taken from the same recording sessions that produced the "Sometimes We Cry" duet between the two artists, which featured on Jones' successful album "Reload".

title: The Best of Van Morrison Volume 3
text: "Cry for Home" was released as a single on 4 June 2007 in the UK, and was followed by "Blue and Green" on 27 August.

title: Lonestar discography
text: Lonestar is an American country music band founded in 1992 by Richie McDonald, John Rich, Keech Rainwater, Michael Britt and Dean Sams.

title: Lonestar discography
text: The band has released 12 studio albums (counting two Christmas albums), seven greatest hits packages, and 37 singles. Lonestar's first five releases for BNA Records are all certified gold or higher by the RIAA, and their greatest hits album is certified platinum.

title: Lonestar discography
text: The band's highest-certified album is 1999's "Lonely Grill" at 3× Platinum.

title: Lonestar discography
text: A ninth album, "Party Heard Around the World", was released in April 2010.

title: Lonestar discography
text: This was also the first album to feature lead singer Cody Collins, who replaced McDonald in 2007.

title: Osc-Dis
text: Osc-Dis or Oscillator in Distortion is the ninth album by Japanese band The Mad Capsule Markets.

title: Osc-Dis
text: It was released in Japan in 1999 and released outside Japan in 2001.

title: Osc-Dis
text: "Osc-Dis" was the band's breakthrough album and finally got them recognized overseas, with the single "Pulse".

title: Osc-Dis
text: The album mixes industrial metal, industrial rock and punk rock with various kinds of electronic music.

title: Osc-Dis
text: It was more melodic than their previous album and included elements of pop punk.

title: Osc-Dis
text: There are vocal contributions from Hirosuke from Balzac, Yamada from Geronimo, and Katsya from NND.

title: Osc-Dis
text: This album also saw the birth of the band's mascots The White Crusher and The Cyborn.

title: Hate Them
text: In 2012, the album was reissued by Peaceville Records, including a bonus CD with audio commentary by the band.

title: Still Restless

text: Released in 2004, it was considered the band's reunion album, as it was their first release since 1998's "Greatest Hits", as well as the first album since "Fast Movin' Train" (1990) to feature all five original band members.

title: Still Restless
text: Their first and only album for Koch Records Nashville, it produced the single "Feel My Way to You", which peaked at #29 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles & Tracks (now Hot Country Songs) charts in late 2004.

text: Liquid Acrobat as Regards the Air is the ninth album by the Incredible String Band.

title: Liquid Acrobat as Regards the Air

title: Scraper (band)
text: Scraper was a hardcore punk band from the West Midlands of the United Kingdom.

title: Scraper (band)
text: Influenced by a variety of Punk rock and Hardcore punk bands, Scraper were likened to Snuff, Leatherface, China Drum, Hüsker Dü and even Fast Eddie period Motörhead.

title: Scraper (band)
text: Scraper became popular throughout the latter half of the 1990s with strong followings around Birmingham, London and Cardiff.

title: Scraper (band)
text: Towards the end of the 1990s Scraper renamed themselves "Turnbull ACs".

title: Scraper (band)
